Definitely no swimming at this beach bc of the waves but we had tons of fun playing in the water and letting the surf push and pull you along. We ate at Popeyes, which was very good, I recommend the fish tacos, although I swear they were pork. Delicious. Lastly, we took a can from zihua and it cost us 100 pesos, and since we sat for the sunset on the beach we caught a passenger truck (across from the convenient store) down the road we came in on to the freeway, then caught a combi bus to el Centro. All in all, great day at a beautiful beach.

307104662.name: Wild Waves
307104662.author: a TripAdvisor user
307104662.reviewBody: This is the Zihua that people remember from The Shawshank Redemption.  Still quiet, remote and wild. Although they did not use Zihua for the filming in the movie, this is still an area for now that you can feel alone and as though you are seeing an area that is yourvdiscovery.  Pleasant Beach  Empanadas line the beach.  The sea is wild and pools are in each restaurant as the waves are fierce here. Relax, the Restaurant staff will watch your things while you explore.  Then order a great seafood lunch and ponder the power of the waves. This is an easy day trip from Zihua.

305475990.name: Solitude Just Out Of Town
305475990.author: a TripAdvisor user
305475990.reviewBody: First time I was here we were alone on the 7 mile beach. We saw lots of birds, plus dolphins and even a whale. In the morning the waves were perfect for bodysurfing. By the end of the day they were 15 feet tall and we just bobbed around in them. One of the beachside restaurants was open and we had simple fish lunch.

295352016.name: Playa Larga 10 - Ixtapa 0.
295352016.author: a TripAdvisor user
295352016.reviewBody: Ixtapa and Zihuatanego are full of the wrong crowds I want to see when I travel.  I want my experience to be as local as possible and as far away from my neighbors from Los Angeles! :)  When you go there you will appreciate and understand what I mean. You will fall in love again and again, several times a night on this wonderful beacn.

282745009.name: Wonderful Beach
282745009.author: a TripAdvisor user
282745009.reviewBody: Only about 20 minutes by car from downtown Zih and not far from Ixtapa/Zih airport. Traveling with a local friend started our exploration on the north end of the beach. Then went to explore the near by archeological dig of the Tomil/Cuitateco/Tepozteca Culture. That area still being expored and unearthed.  And then had lunch at a local spot near the south end of the beach. Large waves and decided undertow at north end of beach less so at the south end of the beach. Not many people around except at lunch spot.

263226018.name: Great place to spend a day.
263226018.author: a TripAdvisor user
263226018.reviewBody: Four of us went to Playa Larga while staying in Zihuatanejo. We took a cab and it was very reasonable, like $12 US.  We found a place called "Popeye" which had beach front tables under the palapa and lounge chairs to sit in the sun.  The food was outstanding and also quite reasonable.  The drinks were ice cold and the view of the ocean was gorgeous!  I walked down the beach and didn\'t see a soul for miles.  Later in the day, we went across the small road and found a great pool with covered seating near.  I definitely will be returning to that beach next year!

262812601.name: Endless Beautiful Beach
262812601.author: a TripAdvisor user
262812601.reviewBody: Playa Larga is found just off the highway to the ZIH airport, about 15 minutes south of Zihuatanejo proper.  Other reviews for this beach area seem spot-on; it\'s a quiet spot with a very long beach, spectacular to watch the waves pounding away on shore... Several visits but still the surf has been too powerful for us to brave the waves... but great to watch.  There are a number of small hotel-restaurants along this part of the beach, a few seem to do a brisk business on the weekends.  We recommend \'Agua Azul\', run by a great family, a fellow named Miguel is the owner.  It\'s not often you hear a local resident of a tiny coastal town in this region tell you "Oh yeah, I used to live in Winnipeg" when he hears you are from Manitoba, Canada.  Shows what a small world this is!  You\'ll find Agua Azul about 100 metres south (turn left) of the main road that enters this town.  Their meals are simple and inexpensive, and the service is excellent.  If you have small children, they will enjoy their own private \'jumpy castle\' on the premises; quite a bonus!

257538949.name: hardly a soul
257538949.author: a TripAdvisor user
257538949.reviewBody: couple mile long soft sand ,clean beach.  literally walked for 30 minutes and didn\'t pass anyone.  Moderate surf, didn\'t try it but suspect possible undertoe.  Couple of beachfront restaraunts with chairs and shade, very good food.  200 peso cab ride from Zihuatanejo.

256280491.name: Quiet but worth an afternoon
256280491.author: a TripAdvisor user
256280491.reviewBody: Come to this beach if you want solitude with a few restaurants offering good fare for reasonble rate.  The beach is long (ergo the name) but the surf is formidable at best.  Take a small bus to the highway, walk or pay a guy to drive the rest of the way.  Many firms from Zihua use this place for "team-building" afternoons so expect some fun a few tables away at the few selected restaurants.

255451199.name: Amazing Long Beach
255451199.author: a TripAdvisor user
255451199.reviewBody: Playa Larga is the area at the north end of this beach. Very few people. The day I was there the waves were way to big for swimming and I was told that the rip tides are really strong. I just enjoyed peacefully walking as far as I could. Make sure to bring some type of footwear as the sand is very hot. I had to run through the dry sand to the restaurant because my feet were burning!

255118131.name: Fantastic Beach experience
255118131.author: a TripAdvisor user
255118131.reviewBody:
It would have been 5 star but the ocean in that area has some nasty rip tides and was recommended not to swim or body surf.  

Walked the beach and had drinks and lunch at one of the beach side stops.  Fantastic service, food and prices.

Hard to believe that a beach like that might of had 20 people within yelling distance.  A must see and plan the whole day there for a very relaxing time.

252443064.name: Zihua\'s Best Kept Secret
252443064.author: a TripAdvisor user
252443064.reviewBody: Off the beaten path, away from the Mexican/Canadian/US tourists, sits a sparsely covered stretch of beach to the South. If you can find the smoothly paved back road, notice the beach front property, and quiet little hotels as you drive to the extreme south of the beach. A lagoon blocks your journey, but you have arrived, A number of little restaurants cluster around the view to the ocean and the the backwaters of the lagoon. Take a boat ride around the inside and discover many of it\'s hidden secrets. Dine and enjoy more of the sea food, and mexican fare. You;ll want to come back at any time of the year. Fantastic spot to wile away the hours.  ZZZZzzzzz.......

249650940.name: Quatro Hermanos
249650940.author: a TripAdvisor user
249650940.reviewBody: We have been going here for 5 years and usually go once a week, and we are here for 10 weeks.\nOur trip to Quatro Hermanos was very disappointing.  There was no usual greeting, happy to see you, please come with me and we will seat you where you want, which was not a problem because there was no one there.  Lounge chairs were covered in sand and placed hilter skilter.\nYoung nervous waiter, that did not understand separate checks .  The wading pools were dirty and usually they are pristine.  Love love this beach, But no one seemed to be in charge in this usually welcoming restaurant.  On the plus side the food is fabulous.  Hope as the season progresses they will improve.

246381197.name: Great Experience
246381197.author: a TripAdvisor user
246381197.reviewBody: Cold beer and fantastic food.  We stopped at several spots along the ocean and all were comparable with the food and drinks.  Friendly and welcoming.  My favorite beach to walk,

223723321.name: endless wide beach.......
223723321.author: a TripAdvisor user
223723321.reviewBody: Wow what a great beach with many local restaurants and luxurious beach clubs, something for everyone......wild and exotic, quiet and relaxing....however one wants it.

211769587.name: Horseback riding on playa larga
211769587.author: a TripAdvisor user
211769587.reviewBody: I discovered that horseback riding is not my cup of tea. If it were, this activity would have been perfect. It was very romantic and felt like we had the beach all to ourselves, plus the guide of course... Very few people in sight.

193993116.name: No Mas Tequila
193993116.author: a TripAdvisor user
193993116.reviewBody: We had a wonderful Sunday with our family we choose at 4 Brothers the view was amazing the food was great My only regret was they ran out of tequila ;)

192851581.name: Great beach
192851581.author: a TripAdvisor user
192851581.reviewBody: We walked the long pristine beach and watched three dolphins play in the surf. Hardly anyone there so you felt like you were far away from civilization. Stopped at a little cafe for a drink and snack.  A unique beach experience.

185281978.name: 2 different beaches
185281978.author: a TripAdvisor user
185281978.reviewBody: We first went to Barra de Potosi there are several beach restaurants it has a lagoon and boat tours the food and beer is real inexpensive and very good it seems the wide beach is gone since the last storm. It is allot farther then Playa Larga we then stopped at playa Larga it is very wide beach but pretty desolate there are a few beach bar restaurants and 1 hotel that we saw

175516749.name: the snail
175516749.author: a TripAdvisor user
175516749.reviewBody: great food, a fantastic beach, real coconuts, no one around, the best grilled fish for a fraction of what we paid elsewhere

161946560.name: Nice beach!!
161946560.author: a TripAdvisor user
161946560.reviewBody: Beautiful beach. Volleyball nets, nice sand, a huge selection of restaurants and bars!! Nice place to spend a quiet day. Not as busy as the other beaches.

157369813.name: Amazing Beach, Wonderful Food
157369813.author: a TripAdvisor user
157369813.reviewBody: We visit this beach every time we vacation in Ixtapa...just a short 20 minute ride by taxi.  Spending the day on this unspoiled amazingly clean beach is a must.  The beach goes for miles, the dolphin sitings are numerous and the food amazing.  We choose Popeyes Restaurant every visit.  Relax on hammocks that surround the open air restaurant, or enjoy dining around colorfully set tables under shaded palapas.  The food is amazing.  We always order the freshly caught red snapper which is grilled with wonderful seasonings served on a platter with rice.  There are a variety of items on the menu, and everything is delicious.  \n\nIt\'s a day the whole family can enjoy as the restaurant offers a great pool for the children or cross the dirt road and enjoy a swim in a larger pool.  Either way, it\'s a beautiful beach with amazing views of dolphin pods and some good body or boogie boarding waves....you should be a good swimmer as the undertow is quite strong in this area.

153804369.name: Sun & Surf
153804369.author: a TripAdvisor user
153804369.reviewBody: Not a beach for swimming but great for walking, horseback riding, atv rentals or just sitting and enjoying the view.  Huge waves at times! And, If you are lucky - you\'ll see whales or dolphins.  :)

153413928.name: Beautiful!
153413928.author: a TripAdvisor user
153413928.reviewBody: Gorgeous beach to walk or ride horses on.  Long and beautifully white.  Waves are a bit high for swimming.  Lots of good places to eat along the beach.  Great for a day trip from Zihua or Ixtapa.

152903152.name: The most unpopulated beach in Mexico
152903152.author: a TripAdvisor user
152903152.reviewBody: Casa Kau Kan is on Playa Larga.  It\'s a beautiful beach with a pounding surf.  Whales and dolphins put on a daily show.  A must go to place.

150428572.name: Serentity at it\'s best
150428572.author: a TripAdvisor user
150428572.reviewBody: 12 miles of unspoiled beach.  Pull up to one of the few restruants, where lounge chairs are provided and enjoy cold beer, marguarita or whatever is your pleasure.  Food is always avaible, cooked fresh upon your request.  Sit back and watch the roaring waves, you can see the dolphins swimming by and the whales playing.\nA day of total relaxation and enjoyment.

133902069.name: Take the most right restaurant
133902069.author: a TripAdvisor user
133902069.reviewBody: Take the road to Barra Potosi, go to the fisher village located nearly below the green mountain andthen take themost nothern restaurant of the village. You will have a free look over the bay and the seafood is delicous. do not go near to the river, the mosquitos will eat you in the evening

125263282.name: Large waves
125263282.author: a TripAdvisor user
125263282.reviewBody: Great place to watch the waves and have a great meeal

123920659.name: 14km of Paradise
123920659.author: a TripAdvisor user
123920659.reviewBody: Long sandy beach, with very few tourists. We saw two pods of dolphins just beyond the surf. Lots of wildlife. Excellent location for horseback riding.\n\nAccessible by taxi or local transportation

122776811.name: Solo
122776811.author: a TripAdvisor user
122776811.reviewBody: It is very nice and you will be alone on the beach, you really have 2 hour of walking on the beach.  The waves are similars to Ixtapas..

121256455.name: Best kept secret, this beach is huge and less traveled.
121256455.author: a TripAdvisor user
121256455.reviewBody: Stayed in Zihua for a week and the second to last day I decided to see if there were any other local beaches to check out as I had my fill of the three major ones inside the bay. I read up on Playa Larga and at first I was tentative about going as a cab fare was 36 US. Fortunately I found out you could walk into town and catch a small mini bus every few minutes that would drop you off at the road that goes down to the beach. From there you can take a short ride in the back of a small truck with bench seat to the beach. Total for both rides was 13 Peso\'s! The beach itself has some of the nicest waves that curl in at 6 or 7 feet in an almost perfect crest. If you go for a walk good luck trying to get from one side of the beach to the other its a huge area to cover! We walked for 1 1/2 hours and didn\'t come close. A few good places to eat on the beach but far less amenities than the beaches inside the bay. That said my girl friend and I found a small spa where they had beds to lounge on and a pool, a bartender who made a mean Margarita and some decent fish taco\'s so we were set. If you looking for a more rugged beach that is less traveled you should make it a point to stop here.

6056459.name: Long Lovely Beach
6056459.author: a TripAdvisor user
6056459.reviewBody: This actually is only a small part of a 91/2 mile beach the charges to Playa Blanca & finally Barra de Potosi a small native fishing village that also has a large Lagoon filled with wildlife & Kayaks for rent. The beach its  self has the occasional restaurants & small Inns scattered about but mostly it\'s wide open spaces. I often see Dolphins playing a short distance off the shore. Once you arrive at Barra there is a number of Inns & caf\u00e9s to enjoy.\n

665710641.name: Complete!
665710641.author: a TripAdvisor user
665710641.reviewBody: This superb waterfront walkway runs from Playa Principal to Playa Madiera. The City has done a complete rebuild, and it is now complete! Smooth surface, benches, rest spots, solar powered lighting ... just a real asset!

663329757.name: Wonderful walk
663329757.author: a TripAdvisor user
663329757.reviewBody: The fisherman walk is the best way to experience the Pacific Ocean, Zihuatanejo has been working on the walk, adding lights, new cement and rope rails.\nGreat bars and restuarants along the walk, very safe.\nTo the North end is where fisherman bring in their catch every morning to sell great to to see.

660840651.name: Running Route
660840651.author: a TripAdvisor user
660840651.reviewBody: Busy, fun area of shoppes and restaurants.  Lots of people.  Fishermen bring in catches early and market is bustling.  Always busy with vendors.

656831742.name: Great shopping
656831742.author: a TripAdvisor user
656831742.reviewBody: So many cute little shops. Ponchos and Alberto\u2019s are wonderful jewelry stores. The Artistisen market is good for souvenirs. The Merchant market and weaving shop just off the basketball court are worth a trip in town by themselves!

651260814.name: A "must see" if you want to experience the real Mexican town
651260814.author: a TripAdvisor user
651260814.reviewBody: It\'s important to be here early shortly after dawn, as the fishing boats come in to display and sell their catch.  It\'s quite beautiful as well as informative, if you are interested in what kind of fish you are eating. Pick a table at La Marina Cafe and order a fabulous breakfast and a great cup of coffee while the scene unfolds, or wander around with your camera to get a perfect slice of Mexican life. The area is also really active at night with community life with families coming to walk or young people participating in a ball game.  If you are into shopping, there are several tiendas with upscale beachwear.

649990786.name: A small malecon on the bay
649990786.author: a TripAdvisor user
649990786.reviewBody: This beautiful area has shops, restaurants, a working fish market early in the morning and just watching the fisherman bring in the catch is an expeience. Portenas has amazing pizza or go to Valeria II and ask Angelo for mummy wrapped shrimps. The coconut shrimp is some of the best I have had.  Breakfast with your toes in the sand watching the pelicans catch their morning meal. The fresh squeezed orange or pineapple juice cant be beat.

648363090.name: Toursity but worth a walk
648363090.author: a TripAdvisor user
648363090.reviewBody: Great little fish street with lots of vendors selling fish in the morning and toursity items in the afternoon. It is nice and breezy during the day. If you are downtown waiting for a table, this would be a great place to go.

646642382.name: Good leisurely stroll
646642382.author: a TripAdvisor user
646642382.reviewBody: Good area between fish market and the pier. You have restaurants and shops on 1 side interesting little shops on the other time. Just take your time and look at both sides.

640607764.name: Heart of the Original Zihuatanejo
640607764.author: a TripAdvisor user
640607764.reviewBody:
This shoreline pedestrian passage fronts the core of downtown Zihua. It's anchored on one end by the town's original church; the daily fisherman's market and the municipal pier (also where the cruise liners dock) and at the other end by community museum, the town's original school and the beginning of the Malecon to Playa Madera and beyond.
In the middle is the town basket ball court and a small bandstand, which serves as the plaza or zocolo found in most Mexican towns. One guide told me that before the tourism boom of the 1970's Zihua was too small to have developed a plaza-so they created one later. It's a lively spot on weekend evenings.
The Paseo (passage) is the town's the most scenic tourist area, with its view of the other beaches along the bay, the surrounding hills and the harbour acivity. So that means it contains many tourist oriented shops and restaurants with tourist prices. The restaurants we tried were good, mind you, it's just you can get as good or better food at lower prices, a few blocks inland. You pay for the view and the ambiance. The prices are still very reasonable by Gringo standards.
There are street vendors, of course but most of them are very low key and leave you be when you indicate you're not interested. We only encountered one beggar in 3 visits , a grizzled old coot who shoved a plastic cup at us and chanted "Money. money, money."He went away after I dropped a one peso coin (the only one I had) in his cup. He went away muttering, but he went away. Nothing threatening or scary about it, just life in Mexico. There are a couple of upscale handicrafts shops near the fisherman's market and the Cafe Marina, one sells weaving, the other pottery figures and masks. Pricey but nice.

639213704.name: Great walk
639213704.author: a TripAdvisor user
639213704.reviewBody: We walked along the beach here on several occasions.  Very nice and it\'s free.  Lots to see.  I would go a few blocks inland to buy things since definitely more expensive items along the water front.  Pick an outdoor restaurant to stop and have a drink and people watch.  On Sundays there is music at the basketball court.

636318377.name: Great!
636318377.author: a TripAdvisor user
636318377.reviewBody: Maybe I\'m somewhat confused between what is the Malecon and what is the Paseo de Pescador?  They both kind of run together.  Part of the Malecon was under construction while we were there, which was very disappointing.  From the bball courts to the fishermen selling their daily catch and over to the pier is awesome!   A must see early in the morning when they first come in from fishing.

588676090.name: A Sight Worth Seeing in Ixtapa
588676090.author: a TripAdvisor user
588676090.reviewBody: All members of our group enjoyed walking through the fish market and shops.  In fact, we enjoyed it so much we went back.  Don\'t miss the various statues around the fish market and town of Zihuatanejo.  The ground was flat which was key for the over 70 members in our group.  Not sure it would be great for young children, but our teens didn\'t complain.  A sure sign they liked it.

572534926.name: Fish market, restaurants, gift shops all along this boardwalk in front of Playa Principal!
572534926.author: a TripAdvisor user
572534926.reviewBody: Basically it\u2019s a boardwalk that connects the pier, to the Canal, which is right next to the water.. In the morning, people come down to buy fresh fish, right off the fishing boats. Always lots activity, with restaurants to have your coffee/breakfast at. Lots of restaurants, from one end to the other, all looking out onto the bay. All restaurants will just sell beer, etc. if you just wish to sit, and relax. Great area to meet friends, and have a few drinks, or dinner. It\u2019s maybe a 1/2 mile long, then you walk over the canal, and walk the Malacon all along Playa Madeira. Again, restaurants and places to stop for drinks all along that walk too!

566908675.name: Cool place
566908675.author: a TripAdvisor user
566908675.reviewBody: Pretty cool place to walk around and do some shopping.  You will find some "authentic" Mexico here, but mostly it is just tourist stuff.  Remember to haggle when buying stuff, it\'s party of the game.

566727126.name: fun place to stroll and people watch
566727126.author: a TripAdvisor user
566727126.reviewBody: Many great restaurants with varied menus one after the other.  I highly recommend eating at La Serena Gorda (the fat mermaid).  Also great pasta place and another has great filet mignon (sorry I can\'t remember the names).  Also a market with various trinkets and handicrafts.  In addition there is an area with bleachers you can watch local kids playing basketball and soccer.\nJust off the Paseo, across the street, for several blocks down, there are nice shops, ice cream, bakeries, etc

560951686.name: Interesting place
560951686.author: a TripAdvisor user
560951686.reviewBody: This part of Zihua resembles fishing villages of olden days and at the same time is very touristy with all the gift stores and various shops and restaurants. The fishermen have their boats lined up along the beach ready to go out and bring their catch early in the mornings for locals to purchase. It\'s kept pretty clean and walking is easy along the waterfront and streets. The scenery is pretty and makes for very interesting pictures.

557768218.name: Local fishermen selling what they caught overnight
557768218.author: a TripAdvisor user
557768218.reviewBody: You should go 6-8Am and watch the fishermen selling their catches .  You can eat nearby.  Each fisherman has a tarp with his catch laid out, people come to buy them.  All different kinds from small like snapper to big - like swordfish and tuna.  Then they repair their nets and put their stuff away in their boxes until it\'s time to go out again.

547944699.name: Plenty to see and do but beware.
547944699.author: a TripAdvisor user
547944699.reviewBody:
Heaps and heaps of shops offering traditional textiles and weaves to jewellery and clothing and other trinkets. Some decent some not. 
Alot of shop fronts will have a salesperson wooing you into something. If your from a European background they WILL sound you out for attention. My advice to travellers if you do not want this type of attention would be,  to suggest you are short on time and have to be somewhere. Do it politely and you'll be ok. 
Get to the promenade early if you want to book a day trip like deep sea fishing or day tours thst way, you won't be harrassed.
All in all though it is certainly worth a trip. 
Easy to get to by taxi or even walking if your up for it. No need to carry $$$ if you don't feel safe most shop's have credit and tap and go facilities now. 
It is a safe area but try to avoid going it alone at night. There has been incidences of tourists being confronted.
Enjoy

539427806.name: Just average
539427806.author: a TripAdvisor user
539427806.reviewBody: The place has a lot of souvenir shops and traditional art crafts. The restaurants vary in quality and cleanliness.

538511054.name: As close to indigenous Mexico as you\'ll get in this area.
538511054.author: a TripAdvisor user
538511054.reviewBody: Shady coco palms, gentle breeze, lapping waves and soft-sell vendors highlight this strolling walkway. Nice little restaurants and bars and shops along the way. This is also the location of the original, as well as current fish market, where small operators bring their catch early every morning and sell to fishmongers, who sell to the public. Laid-back, historic and cultural.........this is as close to real Mexico as you\'ll get in Zihua-Ixtapa tourist area.

483852638.name: Souvenirs !
483852638.author: a TripAdvisor user
483852638.reviewBody: We had a day trip to Zihuatanejo from Ixtapa.  Nice lunch and swim at the beach.  Great food at Coc Loco.  Worth the ride from Ixtapa.  Fun to haggle over prices.  Excellent place to get souvenirs.

482137053.name: great shopping
482137053.author: a TripAdvisor user
482137053.reviewBody: dozens and dozens of Little shops , we bought tshirts and tons of souveniers for the children, a few very decent restaurants nearby

469514770.name: lovely way to spend an afternoon or evening
469514770.author: a TripAdvisor user
469514770.reviewBody: mexican food and good drinkd in s fabulous location on Zihus bsy.  Relax and enjoy the breezes and service\n

467409111.name: Shopping
467409111.author: a TripAdvisor user
467409111.reviewBody: This area of shopping was just like the others we\'d seen.  Just trinkets..not really anything "Mexican" if you are looking for handmade items and such.

466779877.name: The perfect morning walk
466779877.author: a TripAdvisor user
466779877.reviewBody: While in Zihuatanejo we start every day with a walk along Paseo de Pescador. It runs from the pier to the end of Playa la Madera and it\'s a great place to watch the boats, people and fish jumping in the bay. This year they have made some much needed repairs - replaced pillars and ropes and fixed the lighting so it\'s safer to walk at night.

465586042.name: Saturday morning fish market
465586042.author: a TripAdvisor user
465586042.reviewBody: You can buy an entire mahi-mahi or tuna here for a great price, or have the amiga cut a few chunks off for you.  It\'s a great spot to sit and watch the pangas come in at top speed and beach their boats

462385207.name: Fine place to watch the fishermen at work
462385207.author: a TripAdvisor user
462385207.reviewBody: At some point during your Zihua stay spend some time here. Just grab a drink at a nearby cafe and watch the fishermen haul their boats, or sell their fresh catch on the sand, or play checkers with each other.  If you play checkers and speak Spanish you can probably get a game!

459407220.name: I terrsting
459407220.author: a TripAdvisor user
459407220.reviewBody: Beautiful views of the ocean, tons of little shops and street vendors. Open market and plenty of watering holes. I recommend a stroll through here.

452841982.name: much to see, shop and eat here....
452841982.author: a TripAdvisor user
452841982.reviewBody: Even of you are in Ixtapa or in town for just one day, take the time to stroll this classic paseo along the original Playa Central and fisherman\'s walk.  Many good restaurants and classic stores, as well as SPA - ZIHUA, the local animal rescue league, which welcomes visitors and support for all its non-profit work in the community.

450767511.name: Fishes galore!!!
450767511.author: a TripAdvisor user
450767511.reviewBody: take a wal through the paseo del pescador early in the morning and for a few pesos you will find the freshest, delicious and colorful fishes, shrimp and crabs you will find,,,they have everything there and if not int he mood for fish, you can take wonderful pictures, meet the locals and be a part of the busy morning. Locals get up early and arrive around 8 am with their loads of fishes and seafood and you can hear the bartering and deals being made as the locals try to sell their morning catch,,it is a very popular place and where fishermen\'s dreams are made...try it! you will not be disappointed.

449908761.name: nice walk through the village downtown area
449908761.author: a TripAdvisor user
449908761.reviewBody: great places to eat, shop and stroll.  Look for the tequila and mescal shop called Tequila Por Favor.  You can taste before you buy and it\'s a selection you won\'t find at BevMo!

428935954.name: Mexican shopping
428935954.author: a TripAdvisor user
428935954.reviewBody: This place has a lot of shops but all exactly the same and nothing of much quality.  I was very surprised, not better items to choose from.

377353142.name: And when you\'re tired strolling....
377353142.author: a TripAdvisor user
377353142.reviewBody: Have a seat at the outdoor cafe/coffee shop, El Cafecito. Perfect place for both people watching and checking out the fishing boats as they come or go. Open til 10 p.m., I think Their photos on TripAdvisor don\'t do the place justice. It\'s all about the outside seating. One of the best locations for sipping coffee that you\'ll ever find.

374081745.name: Great Strolling & Shopping, Quaint & Friendly, Everything Nearby
374081745.author: a TripAdvisor user
374081745.reviewBody: Great place to be a tourist or, venture a little further into the back streets and join into the vibrant, colourful community vibe.  Safest place I\'ve experienced in just about any "south-of-the-border" location.

368800918.name: Visit in the morning
368800918.author: a TripAdvisor user
368800918.reviewBody: It is great to see all the fisherman displaying their catch for people to buy.  Also, stop at the basketball court on Sunday night for entertainment and great eating off the food carts!

367356922.name: A little of everything along the pescador walkway.
367356922.author: a TripAdvisor user
367356922.reviewBody: Our favorite time of day on Paseo de Pescador is early in the morning when the fishermen bring in their catch.  You can watch the magnificent sunrise and select your fresh just caught fish for dinner.  Take a leisurely stroll from the museum to the pier.  You\'ll find a dozen restaurants, can shop for coffee, vanilla, jewelry, trinkets and more.  Many nights La Concha (the basketball court on Peseo de Pescador) has entertainment, musicians, dancing, for food booths.  Always a special time to watch the local families & children with their big happy smiles.

363936641.name: Excellent Restaurant Beside Zihu Peer
363936641.author: a TripAdvisor user
363936641.reviewBody: This small restaurant is a great place for lunch or dinner. Excellent service, environment and food at reasonable prices. Highly recommended..

360224974.name: Great for watching the locals
360224974.author: a TripAdvisor user
360224974.reviewBody: Great restaurants, the best fish tacos and cold beer.  Very colourful collection of local crafts and local fresh fish.  Lots of families.  This is the place where tourists and locals mingle in a friendly way. Overheard lots of recipes.

360211390.name: Favorite area
360211390.author: a TripAdvisor user
360211390.reviewBody: We loved the shops and the restaurants. It was a beautiful area to visit and find treasures to take home.

357178929.name: people watching paradise
357178929.author: a TripAdvisor user
357178929.reviewBody: Wonderful walk along the shore of Playa Principal in Zihuatanejo. The fish boats come in and sell their catch on the shore. Lined with restaurants from casual to fine dining it is is a wonderful place to have dinner, lunch, breakfast, a cup of gourmet coffee, or a drink. A constant flow of people to watch, go there you won\'t regret it!

351187979.name: Authentic Mexican Fishing Village
351187979.author: a TripAdvisor user
351187979.reviewBody: Get here early in the morning.  Extremely authentic...its mostly locals.  It is a fun, cultural experience.  Huge fish, small fish, all kinds of fish.  All kinds of people.  All kinds of everything.  It\'s a happening

345384100.name: Walked here everyday
345384100.author: a TripAdvisor user
345384100.reviewBody: Watching the fish market at dawn, walking along in the evenings - some of our favourite things to do in Zuhuatanejo. Great place to people watch.

344964942.name: Beautiful walk
344964942.author: a TripAdvisor user
344964942.reviewBody: Great little walk lined with beachside restaurants. Mostly shaded. Great to go early in the morning and watch the fishermen (Pescadors) head out to the ocean

341302693.name: Fishing!
341302693.author: a TripAdvisor user
341302693.reviewBody: Our fishing boat docked here and we unloaded the fish, strung them up and had them prepared at the restaurant.

338791961.name: We start our day with a walk down this boardwalk often!
338791961.author: a TripAdvisor user
338791961.reviewBody: This is a people path that starts at one end of Playa Madeira, and goes all the way down to the pier, at the other end. Great way to start your day, with the restaurants open early, and the fish market about 1/2 way down, where the local fishermen sell their fish to the restaurants and individuals alike. Relaxed, casual and always some conversations going on. Walk it a little later on and stop in for lunch, a snack, or just a few drinks, with beach/ bay views, basically from any of the paseo restaurants. Shops, and restaurants extend back multiple streets, to keep you exploring for a few days at the very least. At the pier end, is when you can catch the water taxi to Playa Las Gatas. 40 pesos for round trip. Every one is down there at some time or other.

337850183.name: Touristy?  Not to me!
337850183.author: a TripAdvisor user
337850183.reviewBody: Picture the main tourist area on a beach...been to Puerto Vallarta?  Well this is a different picture.  No crowds, no high rises.  Eat breakfast with the fishermen pulling in their daily catch at your feet. Run into or meet everyone in town.  Relax on the porch at Casa Marina pretty much all day.  Have breakfast at Marina Cafe, afternoon coffee and homemade pastry at El Caffecito, dinner at Cafe Marina and an ice cream drink that evening after music on the beach. If you are not charmed and mellowed out completely, you need serious therapy.  For me this is it.  We love Vallarta, but this is the place to chill and get restored.  Probably similar to Vallarta 40 years ago.\nSo go already!

333376928.name: Local Delight
333376928.author: a TripAdvisor user
333376928.reviewBody: Lovely walkway along the beach and bay. Scenic views of the local scene. Fishermen with their catch of the day. Merchant selling his fruit out of a cart. Lined with nice shops and restaurants.

324576517.name: Great for people watching
324576517.author: a TripAdvisor user
324576517.reviewBody: Another nice area in Zihua with some great restaurants, boutiques and cafe...Awesome place for people watching while sipping a great espresso at El Cafecito or checking out the daily fish catches coming in mid-afternoon right on the beach...

321049412.name: Lovely small fishing town with great people & great hotels
321049412.author: a TripAdvisor user
321049412.reviewBody: Zijatanejo is one of Mexico\'s best kept secrets!  Locals are very nice and accommodating, restaurants we went to were fantastic food (and reasonably priced) and our hotel was a 15 out of 10!  We also checked out a couple of other mid to high end hotels and they are well worth the price..if they were in Hawaii they would cost twice as much!\nPlenty to do and see, but not for those who are looking for heavy metal or disco nightlife.  More of a gracious, down to earth tropical Mexico experience.  We also felt safe driving here, although our hotel was so great we never wanted to leave except to walk half a block to the beach:)  The older downtown is charming with some good craft shopping, and small active fish market every day.

277646036.name: Our favorite place
277646036.author: a TripAdvisor user
277646036.reviewBody: This is where the locals and the tourists mix.  Great restaurants on the ocean, views of the bay, fishermen selling their catch, nice shops, close to El Centro.  It has it all.  Not to be missed.

252741550.name: Nice morning walk
252741550.author: a TripAdvisor user
252741550.reviewBody: We enjoyed multiple cups of cappuccino and crepes while people watching at the fish market. Multiple places to eat for any time of the day.

248090553.name: Fun!
248090553.author: a TripAdvisor user
248090553.reviewBody: Right in the center of town, this central walk way with a fish market on one side and restaurants on the other is quintessential Zihua.

247675260.name: This feels like the quaint little fishing village!
247675260.author: a TripAdvisor user
247675260.reviewBody: I absolutely loved walking around here. It just feels like the quaint Mexican village that we had heard about.  Nice restaurants, shops, market and of course beach.

241402499.name: Great fresh fish and photos to take
241402499.author: a TripAdvisor user
241402499.reviewBody: Get there early in the morning to buy fish right from the boat and take incredible pictures of the setting

239406180.name: An easy stroll down a quiet, tree-lined little street...
239406180.author: a TripAdvisor user
239406180.reviewBody: I like everything about this "Passage of the Fishermen." The shops run the gamut from souvenir stalls to low-cost clothing to finer quality masks, clothes, jewelry and hand-crafts (many of these latter stores are owned by the Krebs family... super-nice folks who also operate an animal rescue in Zihua - NOT at this same location). Fun touristy restaurants can be found. Our favorites are Elvira and especially Sirena Gorda (The Fat Mermaid). The municipal dock is here as is the fisherman\'s market where you can see the catch of the day. A fun few hours can be spent here.

237472712.name: Great place to people watch
237472712.author: a TripAdvisor user
237472712.reviewBody: Loved seeing all the boats come in with the catch of the day. Great area to mingle with the locals..............

231802052.name: Th Heart of Zihua
231802052.author: a TripAdvisor user
231802052.reviewBody: This stroll along the waterfront is a constantly changing view into life in ZIH? Go there early in the morning to see the sport fishing boats depart and the fish market on the beach. Visit one of the many local restaurants and shops. Stop in the evening to see local entertainment or a basketball game.

227695192.name: Board walk
227695192.author: a TripAdvisor user
227695192.reviewBody: A wonderful boardwalk with many boutiques and cafes. You can take a stroll to the three marvelous beaches all giving a different flavor from the fisherman\'s wharf to the hotels nestled in the hills.

217249689.name: Zihua personified
217249689.author: a TripAdvisor user
217249689.reviewBody: There is nothing but food for the soul in the walkway on the bay where the fishermen are bringing in your dinner each day.  Forget your troubles and just get happy with a stroll along the Paseo del Pescador.

197961437.name: Must Do
197961437.author: a TripAdvisor user
197961437.reviewBody: Las Gatas is a gem on the south side of Zihua bay. Best way to get there is to take a taxi to the pier then buy a 40 peso ticket to ride  the panga over to Las Gatas. There are many good restaurants lining the beach so choose one,  settle in on a lounger, have a refreshment and enjoy the day. Swimming is safe. Snorkelling along the offshore reef is safe but the  reef is not up to Caribbean standards so have reasonable expectations.   First ferry across is about 10 amd and lost one back to Zihua is at 5pm. Can be verfy b usy at weekends so midweek is a better bet.

196575719.name: just a stroll
196575719.author: a TripAdvisor user
196575719.reviewBody: You start off from the main warf and turn right. Souvenir shops to the left and small Navy base to the right, then you are there La Sarrena Gorda! The Fat Mermaid, don\'t go onfor one you have reached heaven . THE SEAFOOD TACOS ARE TO DIE FOR, The music musIc is quirky and the decorating is.........

187688556.name: The way of the fishermen
187688556.author: a TripAdvisor user
187688556.reviewBody: Yes, we can still say that Zihuatanejo is truly a fishing village. There is nothing more real than seeing the local fishermen, in the early mornings, displaying their fresh fish caught from the night before. Without this, the soul of Zihuatanejo will be lost.\nLet\'s hope they will never disappear.\n

155368663.name: Best Part of Zihua
155368663.author: a TripAdvisor user
155368663.reviewBody: Go to the Zocolo  on Tuesday or Thursday evenings to watch  basketball games  or local talent shows. If you are lucky guitarfest will have a show. Lots of restaurants line the paseo most as very good. Enjoy the 2 for 1 margaritas. Great area for breakfast - watch the fisherman  deal with the catch. We would buy  our fish and take  home for supper - cannit get any more fresh than that

155265383.name: A nice walk at any time...
155265383.author: a TripAdvisor user
155265383.reviewBody: This is a nice place for a stroll at any time of day, we\'ve been to this spot many, many times and enjoy the shopping, people-watching, and ocean view...and if you want you can have an enjoyable meal and sometimes catch live music out front of one of the restaurants. I\'ve especially enjoyed mornings when the fishermen are selling their early morning hauls to local restauranters and families. A very relaxing spot enjoyed by travelers and locals alike...

671654204.name: Great day!
671654204.author: a TripAdvisor user
671654204.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, great walking and just an all around wonderful place to take the family for a day trip.  You can bring a picnic lunch or eat in an establishment on the beach - great suppers and great lunch!

645060330.name: Long virtually empty beach.
645060330.author: a TripAdvisor user
645060330.reviewBody: The lack of crowds on the beach was wonderful.   Walked most days without running into anyone.  Stop at OLA! for incredible food.\n\n

642320349.name: Not sure about the cover photo, but great secluded long beach
642320349.author: a TripAdvisor user
642320349.reviewBody: This beach is 11k long and I"m not sure where the green comes from, but much of the greenery is pretty sparse. Hotels and restaurants are scattered. Easy drive if you have a car but a $15 taxi ride. Not easy to find restaurants because they are scattered alone the road and bring MX$ because they don\'t take credit cards. food at all of them are generally excellent.

637701550.name: my favorite beach
637701550.author: a TripAdvisor user
637701550.reviewBody: 10 miles of yellow white sand beach with mountains  on the background, stunning, empty...and its only 15 minutes easy drive from the international airport

593828264.name: Beautiful Punta Blanca Hotel & Villas
593828264.author: a TripAdvisor user
593828264.reviewBody: This brand new hotel is absolutely gorgeous, right on the beach with beautifullly decorated suites for honeymooners with private pools & outdoor kitchens. There are also rooms & suites for couples & families. There is a large pool & covered out door terrace. This property is magnificent.

585207932.name: This is a good beach to go if you want to be alone.
585207932.author: a TripAdvisor user
585207932.reviewBody: This is a good beach to go if you want to be alone. Clean and with almost nobody ever there. Don\u00b4t stay there thoguh, and definately do not buy a house there- there is no water. It has to be trucked in to supply the houses. This is a big problem for this beach and accounts for th fact there is no developement.

579492664.name: 10 miles of beauty
579492664.author: a TripAdvisor user
579492664.reviewBody: You can wander forever on this beautiful beach. There are no crowds. Scattered along the beach are a few great seafood restaurants. This is the place to enjoy a very private beach experience.

555231936.name: Marea beach villas ..... great location
555231936.author: a TripAdvisor user
555231936.reviewBody:
We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of of stay in Zihua ,  nature at is best , wild uninterrupted 16 km long beach , waves thundering up the wide beach , not ideal for swimming unless you are an experienced swimmer , the waves are huge and powerful !!!
For long walks , wild life , whales , sea birds, snakes , and the odd vulture .
Beautiful sunsets to end the day , fresh sea air can be quite intoxicating .
The pool at Marea beach club is fabulous , lots of deck lounges , free towel`s and attentive service , lunch menu excellent variety of local cuisine .... 
For a day out it is worthwhile , if just to swim in the pool , and a walk along the beach .
lunch and a drink at happy hour ......
I Recommend this highly .....

553265316.name: gorgeous beach
553265316.author: a TripAdvisor user
553265316.reviewBody: we were lucky to stay here before the holidays and we had the whole 10 miles beach to ourselves , we walked, jogged, snorled and boogy boarded. Our hosts, la Rusa and Mike have all the equipment we needed , inlcuded beach chairs, umbrellas, snorkles, masks, etc

541627915.name: Beautiful condo on beach
541627915.author: a TripAdvisor user
541627915.reviewBody: I went with my 3 high school friends for our 55th birthday and stayed at Villa Playa Blanca. It was wonderful. The infinity pool was clean and warm and we saw dolphins playing in the surf near the waters edge. Snorkeling is great and the restaurants nearby are fantastic. Marlin\'s restaurant had fresh fish and friendly staff.

538510685.name: Remote, yet close.
538510685.author: a TripAdvisor user
538510685.reviewBody: Largely undeveloped and close to the airport, Playa Blanca offers yet another option to the vacationer to Zihua-Ixtapa. From bungalows for rent to the upscale Marea and Hotel Las Palmas, this area is for the discerning traveler who prefers the unbeaten path.\nFor day trips, La Barra de Potosi is a must. It\'s indigenous Mexico in a quaint little fishing village with no paved roads and great palapa bars and seafood. The setting here is spectacular where water from the mountains meets the sea. As a gringo, you\'ll be a minority of the clientele........how nice is that!   Be friendly, be kind and be charmed.\nAlso, day passes at Marea and Las Palmas beach clubs are available for higher end pool/beach/bars/eats.

482411133.name: our winter destination
482411133.author: a TripAdvisor user
482411133.reviewBody: miles and miles of unspoiled beautiful beach on the pacific side of mexico, dotted with palms, a few restaurants and a couple of hotels and b&b

466940034.name: Outstanding and very secluded.
466940034.author: a TripAdvisor user
466940034.reviewBody: We stayed at Las Palmas Beachfront VIllas on Playa Blanca and we loved it.  Beach in either way for MILES!

465586913.name: Long long long beach
465586913.author: a TripAdvisor user
465586913.reviewBody: Great sand.  Rough water.  Very few beach bars along its length.  Lagoon at south end has all the restaurants and bars.

451340047.name: Amazing unspoilt beach
451340047.author: a TripAdvisor user
451340047.reviewBody: This is a 9 mile stretch of beautiful beach with very limited development thus far. You can walk for miles without seeing anyone. The sea is beautiful but quite rough as it is such a long open beach. Incredible sunsets. There isn\'t a huge amount of activity, so mainly for relaxation.

446944412.name: 16 KMS (9 miles) of unspoiled, virgin white beach!!!!
446944412.author: a TripAdvisor user
446944412.reviewBody: Amazing day trip! Started in a small hotel called Las Palmas where they took us on a kayak trip on a private lagoon, 5 minutes from the airport. There is a development starting there with new condos and a beach club being built, it is called MAREA.  They have open house to see what they are building, the condos where amazing and very well priced.. After the tour of the new development we ended the afternoon eating and sipping on margaritas at hotel Las Palmas Beach Club a must do!!!

440079372.name: one of the most beautiful beaches
440079372.author: a TripAdvisor user
440079372.reviewBody: we took our time to plan this vacation and were happy to find playa blanca , long secluded beach with dozens of beach front restaurants, great place to do yoga and meditate.

436462154.name: you will not regret
436462154.author: a TripAdvisor user
436462154.reviewBody: beautiful 10 miles sandy beach stretching from Barra de Potosi to playa Larga, mostly empty, great for walking

425900692.name: Spectacular 9-mile beach | All to yourself
425900692.author: a TripAdvisor user
425900692.reviewBody: Perfect beach if you value privacy and being secluded.  Other great attributes of Playa Blanca include super soft sand, ocean waters you can safely swim in and a beachfront that is clean.  I just enjoyed 5 days on this beach with not one person trying to sell me random things.

411500999.name: Amazing beach!
411500999.author: a TripAdvisor user
411500999.reviewBody: I\'ve visited  here for 15 years and visit for 3 or more months a year. Peaceful,  serene, and beautiful.  I have an unobstructed view of the beach and ocean. Great whale and dolphin watching.

390447290.name: my favorite place on earth
390447290.author: a TripAdvisor user
390447290.reviewBody: if I could i would stay here for ever, may be one day, for now, we are happy to come here every now and then

381742211.name: Beautiful long beach
381742211.author: a TripAdvisor user
381742211.reviewBody: We visited in May-June so off season and the beach is fairly empty. We recommend King Fish Restaurant\'s coconut shrimp. The best we\'ve tried anywhere and clearly surpasses a similar well known dish in another Zihua restaurant! Can\'t wait to eat them again!

369617902.name: Wished we stayed here
369617902.author: a TripAdvisor user
369617902.reviewBody: Went for one day to Barra de Potosi and walked along the beach.  We were the only people on it!  Absolutely incredible!  Sand looks like it is sprinkled with gold!  Nice that it is an untouched beach.

365782472.name: Great location
365782472.author: a TripAdvisor user
365782472.reviewBody: Private and serene while still only being minutes from town. A rental car is a must. The staff was amazing, friendly, and helpful.

350598804.name: Beautiful
350598804.author: a TripAdvisor user
350598804.reviewBody: If you have a car, bring a cooler and some lunch and get here. This was a lovely place. The hotel Las Palmas is a good spot to get lunch if you didn\'t bring your own. There is just miles of beautiful white sand and peaceful beach.

349661243.name: Untouched Beach!!!!
349661243.author: a TripAdvisor user
349661243.reviewBody: Must go to Las Palmas Hotel Beach Club, great service and location. They have access to a private fresh water lagoon for kayaking.

348325486.name: 10 miles of pure happiness
348325486.author: a TripAdvisor user
348325486.reviewBody: Long secluded beach Playa Blanca located between Barra de Potosi and Playa Larga. You can walk for hours and meet only a few residents walking their furry friends.

343528822.name: Pristine beach, with miles of shore to walk, and enjoy.
343528822.author: a TripAdvisor user
343528822.reviewBody: Went to Barra De Potosi, and walked for miles down the pristine sand and ocean views. Waves were pounding the shore line on the day we were there, but in some spots people were in swimming, or fishing. Not much for restaurants here, except at the Lagoon end by Barra De Potosi. Lots of private homes, small boutique hotels, and miles of open beach! One thing we did notice was if you are sensitive to bug bites, you should bring bug spray. We had quite a few bites by the time we got back from our walk, and lunch on the beach. Nice way to spend a day away from the bustle of Zihua.

328108020.name: Solitude but not agreat swimming beach
328108020.author: a TripAdvisor user
328108020.reviewBody: We stayed at a hotel on playa blanca & although the hotel was awesome the beach itself is dangerous with rips & strong currants. It is a very quite, non touristy beach. Some local food bars on the northern end where the locals gather.

314302240.name: I miss this beach
314302240.author: a TripAdvisor user
314302240.reviewBody: The most beautiful beach in the whole wide world and my favorite place to hang out. It was empty when we visited and we had the whole 10 miles to ourselves. Swimming is good on barra de potosi side.

312021223.name: 3 fantastic days
312021223.author: a TripAdvisor user
312021223.reviewBody: We loved the beach and the village of Barra de Potosi. Great place to relax, unwind , meditate and learn about local culture.

288696488.name: Beautiful beach
288696488.author: a TripAdvisor user
288696488.reviewBody: We rode horses down this beautiful beach with high end houses and condos and huge waves.  We also had lunch at the very end of the beach at small local place. Our kids enjoyed boogie boarding and trying to out run the huge waves

278109340.name: Unspoilt beach
278109340.author: a TripAdvisor user
278109340.reviewBody: If you like quiet unspoilt beaches where you can walk for miles without seeing another human being, this is the place for you!

265743657.name: Beautiful
265743657.author: a TripAdvisor user
265743657.reviewBody: Playa Blanca is a beautiful white sand beach and perfect for long walks and swimming.  If you are looking for night life this isn\'t the beach but if you are looking for a great place for a family vacation or  a romantic getaway then it is perfect

260973282.name: Beautiful sandy quiet beach
260973282.author: a TripAdvisor user
260973282.reviewBody: we loved this beach, no people, no commercial stores, just a great sandy beach and wonderful rolling waves, great for body surfing

260240544.name: Now this is a beach!!!
260240544.author: a TripAdvisor user
260240544.reviewBody: By far the best beach I have ever been on . Big waves , surfing , boarding , swimming . It has it all. If your lucky you will sea whales , dolphins , rays.  And right at the end you have Barra de Potossi. This beach has it all

257514433.name: Very peaceful quiet and beautiful
257514433.author: a TripAdvisor user
257514433.reviewBody: Saw the "green flash!" and dolphins playing in the surf on the same evening.  Beautiful sunsets and several miles of almost deserted beach.

255261335.name: perfect restful day
255261335.author: a TripAdvisor user
255261335.reviewBody: So peaceful and beautiful, go if you want to chill for the day, drink pina coladas and get away from the crowds. Be prepared for people selling things. Just buy a few then say no thanks. Stuff is so cheap. Guacamole bowl anyone?

252680852.name: Last best beach
252680852.author: a TripAdvisor user
252680852.reviewBody: After dinner at Las Palmas, my wife and I relaxed on the big adult swinging bed on the beach, drinking a vodka tonic, watched the sun set into the pacific and BOTH of us saw the Green Flash! Wow!

252163853.name: Miles of beautiful beach!
252163853.author: a TripAdvisor user
252163853.reviewBody: Everything is quiet & calm on this beach .... except for the waves! This isn\'t a swimming beach but if you want miles of lovely sand beach to walk; watch dolphins & whales play; see baby turtles being released; & watch fishermen with their nets ... this is the beach to spend time at. Caution tho .... restaurants are limited & you will hear the planes taking off. We really enjoyed our stay at this beach at Bungalows Tree Top.

248533253.name: Excellent Beach Camping
248533253.author: a TripAdvisor user
248533253.reviewBody: 17km of deserted beach!  Soft, soft white sand! We camped at the Marlin Seafood Restaurant - about 20 mins from downtown Zihuatanejo...Waves were a bit high for swimming sometimes, but the views and sunsets are spectacular

248487100.name: Playa Blanca
248487100.author: a TripAdvisor user
248487100.reviewBody: Great beach to walk for miles along with Barra de Potsie Beach  which is about 5 miles of beautiful beach walking and great body surfing fun.

247781672.name: Awesome beach
247781672.author: a TripAdvisor user
247781672.reviewBody: Long stretch of white sand and thundering surf. \nSome simple  rustic restaurants along the shore. \nHave a beer or lemonade with your feet in the sand.

246379723.name: Quiet
246379723.author: a TripAdvisor user
246379723.reviewBody: Great ocean to play in and walk.  We walked about 2.5 miles out.  Quiet.  Private.  Bring water to drink while you are walking.  Not any places to stop at.  We saw several dolphins one day and another day we say whales.  Cool experience!!

244885579.name: Friendly Charming Authentic Safe Paradise
244885579.author: a TripAdvisor user
244885579.reviewBody: I almost don\'t want to write about this place, because it is so special and it would be a shame if it were to be"discovered"   Playa Blanca/Barra de Potosi. really is a Paradise, authentic, safe  unspoiled -miles of white sand beach warm Pacific waters, fabulous  views and  enramadas (beachfront seafood restaurants) in the village of Barra de Potosi. So easy to get to it is only 15 minutes but from Zihuatanejo International Airport but somehow in an entirely different world.    We hope to return many more times.

210579812.name: Rustic Charm!
210579812.author: a TripAdvisor user
210579812.reviewBody:
We drove out here one day for lunch, there are some really fantastic family run restaurants on the beach. We had lunch at Euramada Teresita Desde which was amazing.
The beach its self is out of this world, with its tranquil setting, just miles of white sand in this very quiet place.
It’s wonderful that’s its not overrun with great big hotels, but instead, has private villas, condos and a few small exquisite hotels. The roads are a little bumpy to get here which adds to its charm and at the same time keeps it unspoilt.

We had a really long walk after a very lazy lunch and rounded the day off drinking cocktails whilst watching the beautiful sun set over the beach.

Well worth a visit
.

202705092.name: Simple and Delighful
202705092.author: a TripAdvisor user
202705092.reviewBody: Recently back (early April) from a return visit to Playa Blanca/Barra de Potosi.  "Slice of Paradise" may be an overused phrase but certainly not to describe this incredible, unspoiled 10-mile stretch of white sand beach with its warm, swimmable water, breathtaking views and delightful enramadas (beachfront seafood restaurants) in the village of Barra de Potosi.  Most difficult to believe is that this totally laid back vacation paradise is located just 15 minutes and a world away from Zihuatanejo International Airport.  Enchanting not too strong a word to describe this entire virtually hidden gem of a vacation spot. A must visit for all who enjoy a relaxed, peaceful break from the hectic everyday world.

200942069.name: Playa Blanca , as each beach should be
200942069.author: a TripAdvisor user
200942069.reviewBody: Clean and low profile . Authentic and original . Walkable and swimmable . Talk about swimming and walking : a swim at sunrise in this protected bay is as close a heavenly dip as anyone can imagine . Floating in a perfect temperature water ,birds flying over head with their bellies pink from the rising sun ,cocooned by the hills around the bay , is an experience that I never fail to savour every time I visit . Long late afternoon walks on the 6 miles long beach ,flat and with more birds than people . Nice homes and B&Bs along the way . The walk back timed with the sunset and looking forward to a simple but delicious dinner of tacos in the village or a more fancy fare in the restaurants open at night along Playa Blanca. Shouldn\'t forget to mention lunches at the enrammadas , feet in the sand and fresh fish on the table. Great hospitality from the people of the village makes Playa Blanca and Barra de Potosi the beach of my dreams.

200862231.name: The Last Best Beach
200862231.author: a TripAdvisor user
200862231.reviewBody: Ten miles of unspoiled white sand beach just ten minutes from an international airport.  I didn\'t believe it was still possible to find a place like this. I found this site that has good directions on how to get there by bus- http://barradepotosidirectionsto.jimdo.com/.  The enramada restaurants in the village at he south end sit right on the sand and have amazing views.  The rocky point seems to block the big waves so the swimming was great; 81 degrees and sandy bottom.  Next trip I want to stay there and explore the lagoon.  Apparently is is swarming with interesting birds.  Definitely a top attraction.

189076310.name: Unexpected Treasure
189076310.author: a TripAdvisor user
189076310.reviewBody: We went to Petatlan in the morning, following directions from a Trip Advisor suggestion, which turned out to be interesting - nothing too great. Then, we took a Barra la Petosi and ate there - interesting but a bit overrun! Then, we walked down the beach, for about an hour, thinking that we might be able to find something in Playa Larga, but not really knowing. As it was getting hot, we$% came across Chula Vida - small restaurant right on the beach. We spent about four hours there - probably the nicest time of our 9 days in the area! The food was great, service wonderful, setting priceless. At the end of the day, around 6:30 for us, the owner gave us a free shot of tequila, called a cab for us, and presented us with a reasonable bill of about $35 US! We then took a cab back - a wonderful day overall! We highly recommend a visit there!

188155706.name: Lunch on the sand
188155706.author: a TripAdvisor user
188155706.reviewBody: Our group of 8 spent the day at Playa Blanca and had lunch at \na condo complex. Playa Blanca is a beautiful stretch of beach. The water doesn\'t seem swimmable though, rip currents.

185883676.name: Playa Blanca
185883676.author: a TripAdvisor user
185883676.reviewBody: Las Palmas Beach \nClub is a must go, great service, fabulous location , beach is amazing and no one is on it.

178869276.name: Las palmas playa blanco
178869276.author: a TripAdvisor user
178869276.reviewBody: We have been there many times and with different people.  It is a little hidden paradise.\n\nWe love going there on Sunday for lunch.  The place is amazing.  The service is excellent, the food is great and the service is great and friendly.  It is worth the trip.  It used to be a beautiful hotel but they are building condos now.  We even took our little coco Chanel with us and she got along very well ewith  the owners dog. You could sit at the bar near the beach or at a table on the beach. You even have beach beds if you want to have a little fiesta.

163503100.name: Like your own deserted island
163503100.author: a TripAdvisor user
163503100.reviewBody: We were 5 days on Playa Blanca in mid April.  It was low season and also the dry season just before the rains come so we had all 15 miles of Playa Blanca pretty much to ourselves.  The weather was fabulous - high 80\'s, strong sun, slight haze from the brush fires in the hills.  A great time to visit if you don\'t like crowds.

163121491.name: Probably better later in the year
163121491.author: a TripAdvisor user
163121491.reviewBody: We visited early in June and the water level at the lagoon was very low - they were playing soccer where the lagoon normally is!  LOL!  Nothing wrong with that, but it would probably be more fun for the average tourist when there is water in the lagoon and you can use the kayaks, et al.  \n\nWe did take a panga out fishing, which was an enjoyable two hours.  Though we didn\'t catch anything, we were treated to dolphins swimming with our boat, a sea turtle and a couple of sting rays jumping out of the water.  All in all, it was a great visit.  I would go back, but like I said before, more likely in Oct - Jan.

156555116.name: Great Beach
156555116.author: a TripAdvisor user
156555116.reviewBody: Since we didn\'t want to swim at the beaches in Zihuatanejo because of extremely high levels of enterococci, we decided to head a bit south. The beach here is lovely and clean. \n\nHighly recommended.

155368151.name: Barra di Potosi
155368151.author: a TripAdvisor user
155368151.reviewBody: If you are thinking of PLaya Blanca head to Barra. It is a bit more sheltered and swimming is much easier than further north on PLaya Blanca.  2 " bus" rides will get you there. The lagoon is a great place to birdwatch. Cafes are great  and I would recommend La Condesa. Loungers, tables and hammocks. Excellent food. Far fewer people trying to seel things on the beach than at La Ropa  or Ixtapa.  Visit the wildlife refuge on the way to Potosi.   Playa  Blanca has a few cafes and upper end hotels but  for shopping and entertainment head for Zihua

154194570.name: Beautiful
154194570.author: a TripAdvisor user
154194570.reviewBody: Nice long walkable beach from one end to the other.  While walking you will see all types of animals, especially birds ( pelicans, sandpipers,egrets and occasional vultures-they clean up the beach). There are a number of restaurants along the way to grab a drink of your choice or something to eat.  Don\'t be surprised if you don\'t come across another person while you are walking...it\'s that deserted.

152632046.name: Awesome
152632046.author: a TripAdvisor user
152632046.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach.  Kilometers of beach front with average to large waves pounding the shore.  Observed dolphines wave surfing. Very clean and great view!  Not many people except walkers along the beach.  I give this beach a 5 star for sooooo clean and beautiful..Way to go Zihua.

146090450.name: Great location-close to airport
146090450.author: a TripAdvisor user
146090450.reviewBody: Very large clean beach.  Wonderful waves. The most uncrowded i\'ve seen in a very long time.  I plan to stay on this beach next time in Mexico

145613243.name: Las Palmas
145613243.author: a TripAdvisor user
145613243.reviewBody: We arranged a day trip to Las Palmas resort located on Playa Blanca.The sand is light but not white,but is a nice long stretch of beach with palm trees.The resort is awesome and welcomes daily visitors for prior reservations and the cost of drinks and food.\nWe would not suggest a day trip to Barra de Potesi...it was recommended to us but we found it to be quite depressing. Maybe in high season,things are different.

143626024.name: Turtle Release
143626024.author: a TripAdvisor user
143626024.reviewBody: It was a delight to participate in a turtle release on Playa Blanca.  The efforts by the locals to conserve and protect the turtle population is to be congratulated and supported.

127838659.name: a wonderful beach
127838659.author: a TripAdvisor user
127838659.reviewBody: Its very quiet with miles of unspoiled sand and waves

126923438.name: Over-rated
126923438.author: a TripAdvisor user
126923438.reviewBody: We were advised that if we wanted a really long beach to walk, as well as swim, we should go to Playa Blanca.  It definitely is a gorgeous long beach to walk and the swimming was great, but we had difficulty finding out if there were restaurants at the far end where we could get lunch and then walk back.  We discovered that in March at least, only the big Hotel seemed to be occupied a long with a few condominium units further along where the occupants didn\'t know if there were any facilities further down the beach.  We ended up back at the very crowded Barra de Potosi restaurants that were full to overflowing and hard to find a table let alone get service.  This is a gorgeous beach with some lovely private developments and homes but facilities are few for the general public.

124235879.name: Perfect beach
124235879.author: a TripAdvisor user
124235879.reviewBody: Great beach to relax and get away.  The beach is nice and the waves were great!!!

122629053.name: Barra de Potosi, Playa Blanca, Playa Larga
122629053.author: a TripAdvisor user
122629053.reviewBody:
While in Zihua, we set out one morning the four of us to Barra de Potosi.
We went to Zihua's market to find the collectivo to Petatlan that would drop us at San Geronimito. Once dropped on the side of the road we immediately saw our ride to cover the next 10 km: the back of a pick-up truck.
The ride went well and we were left at Barra de Potosi. We walked to the beach: wow!  The beach went on north for ever...8 km with no big hotels in sight and the surf from the Pacific.
Barra de Potosi has a small group of fishermen and local surfers on the ocean side and a laguna where guides will take you for around to see birds.
On the beach side, there are a dozen restaurants under the coconut grove serving the catch of the day. They definitely seem to cater mainly to Mexicans.WE had a great swim in the surf, a very good meal on the beach, a few cervesas and a tour of the Laguna.
Overall it was a very interesting adventure, a fantastic day away from the crowds of Playa La Ropa and its blue green algaes.

122379867.name: Beautiful vacation.
122379867.author: a TripAdvisor user
122379867.reviewBody: Spent a glorious week here for my sister\'s wedding.  Fabulous, fresh food offered in the beachfront restaurants.  There weren\'t many other vacationers during the time of year we visited, but one of the restauranteurs would open for us & cook whatever we wanted, on or off the menu.  Clean condo\'s with ocean views.  Fabulous snorkeling (sea turtles, dophins surfing, exotic fish) & breathtaking beaches, we would watch the fishermen net our dinner daily.  We felt the locals took very good care of us (ocean-front massages for the ladies; took my brother-in-law & friends out for a bachelor\'s night on the town.)   Not your typical vacation, and I mean that in the best way possible.  Cabs are accessable, but it\'s quite a drive from Zihuatanejo so you may want to have a rental car available, and the roads to get to the area are dirt and quite bumpy.  All part of the charm, I say.....

122375595.name: Beautiful, unspoiled beach
122375595.author: a TripAdvisor user
122375595.reviewBody: If you like warm water and like to walk in an unspoiled, beautiful setting - go anywhere from Barra de Potosi to Playa Larga to Play Blanca. It\'s wonderful. The restaurants - at least all the seafood we ate - were great and very inexpensive.

121578736.name: Great Food on the Beach
121578736.author: a TripAdvisor user
121578736.reviewBody: I was staying in Barra de Potosi for four days and spent afternoons at Playa Blanca. The grilled fish at the beach enramada "La Condesa" was excellent. I enjoyed watching the fishermen throwing their nets and the diving of the brown pelicans to catch fish. Waves were moderate closer to the entrance of the Barra de Potosi lagoon because of the protection of the hill south of the bay. There were mostly Mexican families with a smattering of gringos. I enjoyed this beach after the business of La Ropa in Zihuatanejo. The beach is very long, so there is ample opportunity to get a good walk in. Sunsets were beautiful.

94495959.name: Found Paradise
94495959.author: a TripAdvisor user
94495959.reviewBody:
Playa Blanca is comprised of approximately 5 miles of unspoiled white sandy beach lined with palm trees.  Together with Playa Larga, the bay offers about 10 miles of beach.  You won't find jet skis, parasailers, vendors and such on this beach, but what you will find is white sand, surf to play in, dolphins playing and, on occasion, whales spouting.  You will also find smaller family run restaurants dotting the beachline and serving up the freshest seafood available at the cheapest prices.

It is a boutique area with beautiful properties and villas built along the coast.

Playa Blanca is for vacationers that are looking for a slower pace.  If you are someone who loves the buzz of Ixtapa, then Playa Blanca may not be for you, but in my opinion, if you visit the Ixtapa/Zihuatanejo area and don't take a trip to Playa Blanca, you are missing out.

Recommendation - Drive or cab to one of the beach restaurants (many have pools for their patron's use).  Have lunch, stay for the afternoon, play on the beach and in the surf and enjoy the undisturbed tranquility of what Playa Blanca has to offer.  Stay a bit longer and treat yourself to the sunset of your life (typically around 6:30 pm)

908864.name: This is a great beach that almost never has people on it
908864.author: a TripAdvisor user
908864.reviewBody: It is a great beach that has no people on it is still a virgin beach. it is clean and has a lot of hidden beauty. you will love it and the sun set that is always breath taking.

666505933.name: Newly upgraded
666505933.author: a TripAdvisor user
666505933.reviewBody: They finished working on the Malecon during the 6 weeks we were there.  The work is now complete and it is wonderful to walk on. This truly is a wonderfully finished project.

663332165.name: Best part of the city!!
663332165.author: a TripAdvisor user
663332165.reviewBody:
The Malecon or Fishermans Walk is fantastic, the best relaxing walk.
Bars, restuarants,  massage huts at 10 dollars US.
Beaches to set at or swim all day.
We spent alot of our time on the Malecon.
They have worked on it adding cement, rails, great lighting.

662500279.name: Worth the walk
662500279.author: a TripAdvisor user
662500279.reviewBody: We walked the new male on, with parts still under construction but walkable anyhow. The views are amazing and when completed there will be nice sitting areas along the way and you can walk across the short  beach area and then start back on the paved walkway heading around the other side of the bay. A great enhancement to the beach area!

658641416.name: Being redone
658641416.author: a TripAdvisor user
658641416.reviewBody: The malecon was being replaced while we were there. Our hotel is near the end and it was fascinating to watch the process. It\'s all done by hand.

657931254.name: Beautiful walk and view
657931254.author: a TripAdvisor user
657931254.reviewBody: They are fixing the malecon up presently. Almost complete. New store to stop at and grab a beer. You can spot fish in a couple of spots. Big lights in some places and more going up will light the walk at night. Love the walk along here.

656832047.name: Nice for walking
656832047.author: a TripAdvisor user
656832047.reviewBody: Nice way to get to town from the hotels. Also several restaurants along the way. Good views. Still being constructed but will be beautiful when done.

655040527.name: Nice walkway
655040527.author: a TripAdvisor user
655040527.reviewBody: It is currently being re done and there are only posts in the edge of the concrete. It is not blocked off. Be aware and do not fall off or trip. \n\nIt was a quick way to hop around the rocks from town to the next beach. There is even more being worked on but that was currently off limits.

653085534.name: Vast improvement on getting from town to the other beaches by foot
653085534.author: a TripAdvisor user
653085534.reviewBody: A great place to walk in the morning... starts just at the edge of town at the bridge over the canal.  I wish it continued all the way to La Ropa, but I guess the private property issues will never allow that. (I don\'t know this for sure and hope I am surprised!)  Unfortunately, this time, they were repairing it, so had to go around anyway.  Still, I say "Gracias!" to the folks who built it and maintain it.

651725065.name: New and Improved
651725065.author: a TripAdvisor user
651725065.reviewBody: Having enjoyed the walk from Principal to Madera for years I was pleasantly surprised to see all the new work being done on the Malecon this year.  These are improvements that most every visitor will see and it says a lot about the good feelings in Zihuatenejo.  The views of the bay and the boats at anchor promote the calm layed back atmosphere of this section of beach front.  Like minded people on the walkway are all smiles and felicitous greetings.

650733866.name: Fabulous!
650733866.author: a TripAdvisor user
650733866.reviewBody: The city is doing a wonderful job of restoring and continuing to build this walkway along the seafront. It\'s in constant use and a lovely way to get from A to B. It\'s going to be beautiful when it\'s finished!

646107719.name: Construcion coming along.
646107719.author: a TripAdvisor user
646107719.reviewBody: Beautiful walk way from the small bridge across the canal along the water. When we were here last year they had not started on it. They were in the process of installing solar lights along the rock side. The new walkway is wider it seams than the old one. Beautiful view of the bay as you walk by the rocks.

638847963.name: Should Be Great When It\'s Finished
638847963.author: a TripAdvisor user
638847963.reviewBody: As previously noted, as of December 2018, much of the path was closed for construction.\nUsing various detours you can get as far as the edge of Play Madera. From there its a trudge across the sand and up the hill to Play La Ropa. Still this is a fine attraction for the area and I applaud the efforts to maintain it, despite the temporary inconvenience.

636317003.name: How do you rate something that is under construction?
636317003.author: a TripAdvisor user
636317003.reviewBody: One of our favorite morning things to do in Mexico is walk the Malecon (Paseo del Pescador).  Walked a little way beginning at Playa Madera and then it was closed for construction at the rocks.  HUGE bummer.  Painful hike up the stairs and onto the street and the long way around till the construction ended.  Disappointed.

627059652.name: Nice walk
627059652.author: a TripAdvisor user
627059652.reviewBody: Easy walk around one side of the bay. Felt safe and fairly clean. Nothing spectacular about it but a good 1 hour stroll if you\'re looking to walk off lunch.

616306855.name: Work in progress
616306855.author: a TripAdvisor user
