616306855.reviewBody: When we went there was still construction happening in certain sections. It\'s a fairly narrow path compared to other big malecons in Mexico. The waves smash up against the seawall and splashes onto the path. May not be suited for those in wheelchairs.

579493310.name: Great way to get a feel for Zihua
579493310.author: a TripAdvisor user
579493310.reviewBody: Start at the river/pier and wander the path past the fishermen, restaurants, basketball court, and coastline. Lots of great people viewing. Great path that lets you get the feel of the city.

566728549.name: Fun place to walk along the sea.
566728549.author: a TripAdvisor user
566728549.reviewBody: While not as action packed and busy as the Malecon in Puerto Vallarta,  the quietness and lack of heavy foot traffic makes for a serene walk.  From Paseo Del Pescador it winds around and ends near the Hotel Irma.  Anyone who enjoys being able to do some thinking while walking should visit the Malecon.

564405898.name: A nice easy walk
564405898.author: a TripAdvisor user
564405898.reviewBody: Hey if your in town and just looking for something to do then why not An easy walk along the side of the ocean I do not recomend doing this late at night though This is a day time event I suspect it a little dangerous after dark

559079112.name: The Malecon is in need of some major repair
559079112.author: a TripAdvisor user
559079112.reviewBody: Like the title says, the male on could use a make over! Nice view all along the bay hoverever. We were told to not walk it at night. We didn\u2019t so can\u2019t say anything more then that.

558132059.name: Love walking it a few times a day, BUT it needs a facelift
558132059.author: a TripAdvisor user
558132059.reviewBody: It\'s in bad need of a facelift. \nIt needs some more lighting and the railings need to be rebuilt.\nBut we still enjoy walking it a few times a day!

556703986.name: Needs a work over
556703986.author: a TripAdvisor user
556703986.reviewBody: The malec\u00f3n (beach promenade) seriously needs a work-over, it has got a lot of potential. Lacks good lighting and police presence after dark, needed because it is a nice place to stroll in the evening time

547946934.name: Nice way to experience the coastline
547946934.author: a TripAdvisor user
547946934.reviewBody:
Decent walkway along the shoreline. Good way to soak up the salt air and sunshine. Easy walking and usually pretty quiet. Try to avoid the middle of the day as there is no respite from the sun if your tan is not up to date. 
Plenty of restaurants and cafe's a stones throw away if you want to take a break. 
Some sections of the walk have suffered from king tide erosion so be wary where you step. Some sections in need of some maintenance.
All in all a nice walk.

471179260.name: The views!
471179260.author: a TripAdvisor user
471179260.reviewBody: It is a short little walkway joining the downtown beach to the next beach Madera. It is kept very clean and local students have put in signs to use the trash cans please.

468409585.name: Great beach walk
468409585.author: a TripAdvisor user
468409585.reviewBody:
This walk is a nice one that allows you plenty of space to walk with a walking partner.  It is so close to the waves that you can feel the mist.

It is a rather short walk for getting in your miles.  But for a casual walk you will find it nice.  Benches located in nice areas to sit and enjoy the view.

At the end of the walk be sure to look at the rocks closely for the crabs that inhabit the rocks.

463904986.name: Ok walk around the beaxh
463904986.author: a TripAdvisor user
463904986.reviewBody: We walked this area.  It is uneven.  Smelled of urine in spots. Nice view of the beach. You can get on and off in spots. It leads to a shopping area.  Take water with you for the walk as there is no shade. \n

460739593.name: A short walk on the bay of Zihuataneo
460739593.author: a TripAdvisor user
460739593.reviewBody: Located nearby the marina, this malecon is the shortest one we have been on in Mexico. It\'s a nice walk and there are a couple of restaurants on the beach you can stop at to have some beer and Tiritas (the local ceviche dish favorite)

440778488.name: Pleasant walk
440778488.author: a TripAdvisor user
440778488.reviewBody: I enjoyed the walk to go into the village but usually we went over one street as we got closer to the center to avoid the waiters trying to pull you in. Never buy the 2 for 1 drink special unless it is beer.

437071413.name: Nice Walk with No Stores
437071413.author: a TripAdvisor user
437071413.reviewBody: Pretty walk along the water of the bay. I\'ve walked it many times. I would avoid it during the night. There are no escape routes if confronted, there is no one to help you unless you try to jump into the bay over the rocks. \n\nDuring the day is it perfectly fine.

387839264.name: Lovely walk
387839264.author: a TripAdvisor user
387839264.reviewBody: This is a nice walk to and from our hotel to town.  It is along the beach and we always feel safe using it.  My husband has also fished from it, just don\'t fish during high tide as told to my husband by a local.

372925484.name: Beautifull walk along the bay.
372925484.author: a TripAdvisor user
372925484.reviewBody: This is a very nice way to enjoy the beach along Playa Municipal and Playa Maderas, may eateries located along it, impressive.

367234356.name: Walking the Malecon
367234356.author: a TripAdvisor user
367234356.reviewBody: Pretty little walk along the water. no shops no traffic, just a walking path along the beach. Very pretty and serene.

360212365.name: A must do!
360212365.author: a TripAdvisor user
360212365.reviewBody: Everyone walks the Malecon. You meet lots of people, pass lots of small hotels and restaurants, and see locals fishing from the rocks. A good walk!

358300800.name: Great during the day - walk with a group at night
358300800.author: a TripAdvisor user
358300800.reviewBody: Walked from Hotel IRMA to town, nice walk and great views of the bay and beaches. Lots of fishermen and families on the walls and walkways. At night or early in the morning walk with a group or avoid.

356678707.name: Rustic seaside walkway
356678707.author: a TripAdvisor user
356678707.reviewBody: The small concrete walkway follows the shore from the beach at the edge of town south toward a strip of hotels. The path runs on the beach for a short way, and you\'ll likely be accosted by restaurateurs for the beach restaurants and bars, but if you say "No thanks, not right now" they usually just say "Maybe later". Haven\'t stopped at any of them, but they seem well regarded by American and Canadian visitors.

345386460.name: Used this every morning
345386460.author: a TripAdvisor user
345386460.reviewBody: An enjoyable walk to get back to our hotel in Colonia Madera from Zihuatanejo centro. A lot of people hand fishing off the rocks - saw them catch several fish on our morning walks.

338793502.name: Walkway that basically is considered Paseo de Pescador a little farther on.
338793502.author: a TripAdvisor user
338793502.reviewBody: This is the path, that seamlessly joins up to Paseo de Pescador, about 1/2 way down Playa Madeira. Great way to see the whole beach, there are restaurants available, on this end, and the massage tables are on this end, right on the beach. Unfortunately you do need to be carefull, as the guard rails are now nonexistent, do to decay. Still fairly safe anyhow.

335216859.name: lover\'s lane
335216859.author: a TripAdvisor user
335216859.reviewBody: this is a great experience right after sunset.  we always went to and from town on this route.  Lovers are on every bench and remarkably, the light next to the bench is \'out\'.

332733079.name: Walked Everyday
332733079.author: a TripAdvisor user
332733079.reviewBody: This was our favorite way to go to town from our hotel. Just a nice strolling area with some fun views. Do it at least once while you are in Zihua.

326393617.name: A nice surprise!
326393617.author: a TripAdvisor user
326393617.reviewBody: We were shopping at the Mercado de Artesan\u00edas downtown and thinking of heading back to our hotel which is at Playa La Madera when somebody suggested we take the Malecon all along the coast towards our Hotel Aura del Mar.  We found people fishing along the way and we got to see a cute statue of a mermaid perched on a rock.  Sure enough, we got to our hotel after not too long a walk. Take the walk when the sea is not choppy, though.

324576858.name: Nice walk but need some repairs
324576858.author: a TripAdvisor user
324576858.reviewBody: This is a nice spot for sightseeing and a nice walk at sunset but be careful as some of the posts are broken so the rope may not be elevated to protect you from walking off the pathway so you need to be careful, even more so for those walking there in the evening....

258279569.name: Stay at Hotel Irma, use the sea walk to walk to town
258279569.author: a TripAdvisor user
258279569.reviewBody: Great walk, especially in the AM, before the day heats up. Many couples have been returning for years.  I highly recommend the area

252150415.name: Real Fish Market still in Mexico
252150415.author: a TripAdvisor user
252150415.reviewBody: The malecon here is newly paved & attractive for tourists.  In the middle is the fish market where the daily catch is put out for sale.  All seems very civilized & organized.  Several restaurants face the beach & some have chairs & tables set out in the sand. There are a few craft type shops as well as a small "flea market".  Basketball court is at the center & used most nights by local mens teams - very entertaining!

243757280.name: nice place to stroll
243757280.author: a TripAdvisor user
243757280.reviewBody: Easy to find beach food, drinks, even music. Proprietors invite you in. Not too aggressively though. Very relaxed. Good people watching.

226536555.name: Beach Walkway
226536555.author: a TripAdvisor user
226536555.reviewBody: This is a nice walkway along the beach. Many wonderful restaurants   can be found and also the infamous "basketball courts". Any evening, you will find basketball games going on and many families out to watch then. Food vendors are prevalent. Sundays is family day, and this area is FULL of people, food, entertainment, and fun!

211769933.name: Awesome souvenirs, there\'s a tour just for shopping
211769933.author: a TripAdvisor user
211769933.reviewBody: Everything seams very fairly priced. If you\'re looking for something specific, the shopping tour would be ideal. We didn\'t do it thinking how hard can it be to shop for souvenirs, but after a while of looking around it would have been better.

200270999.name: Pleasant stroll
200270999.author: a TripAdvisor user
200270999.reviewBody: The Malecon is lined with shops and cafes, shaded by palm trees.  Be sure to get a fresh coconut drink made from green coconut while you watch.  The Malecon goes all the way to the city pier where you can catch a shuttle boat to Playa Las Gatas.

195798050.name: Malecon Oceanwall walk...Very impressive and an awesome stroll!
195798050.author: a TripAdvisor user
195798050.reviewBody: This is an very impressive ocean sea wall walk with an awesome view the whole way!  The  only unfortunate thing is that it\'s not wheelchair accessible and there should be a vendor with drinks available especially on hot days, which is almost every day in Zihjuatenajo!, this is a must to do here and awesome tourist attraction!

152633920.name: Lots of activity
152633920.author: a TripAdvisor user
152633920.reviewBody: There is a sea wall long this shore.  This also is extremely clean and tranquillo.  Mexico sure got it right when they offered Zihuatanejo to the public.  Lots of restaurants, fishing, pier, vendors and views.

655908001.name: A day at the beach with no commercials
655908001.author: a TripAdvisor user
655908001.reviewBody: If you want to get away from the commercial enterprises like para sailing, jetskis, floaty toys and the plastic trappings this is your place! Laid back restaurant with hammocks for an afternoon nap with plenty of shade. Prefer a long walk along a deserted beach? Literally miles of clean soft sand for you. Or rent a kayak and explore the mangrove back channels. All there and super cheap. Take a Petatlan bus from Zihua and get off at Los Achotes. 1/2 a block down are trucks waiting to transport you to Barre de Potosi for 15 pesos. A great experience if you want to get away for the day from the resort or the town.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

650959996.name: What a great little town!!
650959996.author: a TripAdvisor user
650959996.reviewBody: What a wonderful place, where fresh water meets salt water.  Where you can walk down the beach and here Mariachi bands.  Where a lot of the little cafes on the beach have a lot of English speaking waiters.  This is a must go to place - especially if you have kids.  Absolutely stunning beach.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

649991421.name: An amazing little town
649991421.author: a TripAdvisor user
649991421.reviewBody: This amazing little town can be found by taking a bus then a pick up truck/taxi. Getting there is quite an experience. The people are so kind and grateful for your business. Theres a beach thats about 8 miles long that you can just sit for hours with no one to bother you. Occasionally off shore the humpback whales might be seen feeding in the distance. The lagoon is a wildlife paradise. In the Barra you feel like you are stepping back in time

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

648365392.name: Great environmental place
648365392.author: a TripAdvisor user
648365392.reviewBody: Their mission is to Increase awareness and appreciation of the life cycle of the tropical dry forest and of native species in the region of Barra de Potos\u00ed, Guerrero, Mexico, through preservation, exhibition, reproduction, education and research.they are not always open but you should check the website. Bring sunscreen and insect repellent.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

648048255.name: Kudos to this woman\'s personal quest to save wildlife and habitat
648048255.author: a TripAdvisor user
648048255.reviewBody: So, I am confused by the photo, which seems to be Teresita\'s at the mouth of the lagoon?  The refuge is a few minutes away, and yes, it is not accessible to everybody.  Laurel, the owner, rehabilitates injured animals and participates in regional events to preserve species and habitat.  She has created a beautiful, small refuge, and has a stunning articulated 60 ft. sperm whale on the grounds, as well as a 50 ft? tower that gives on a spectacular view of the watery surrounds.  If you are not interested in wildlife and conservation, skip it.  If you are, and you are able to take a tour there, it is phenomenal.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

642898985.name: Beautiful beach and estuary.
642898985.author: a TripAdvisor user
642898985.reviewBody: Definitly a must go to beach.  The community  is friendly and ever so inviting.  Thebeach is dotted with a few beach front restaurants and boutique hotels.  I recommend renting a kayak ot take a boat tour thru the estuary.  So much to see.  Great place for bird watching.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

465070913.name: This facility is not open to the public on our last trip, but check it out as it is worth a trip.
465070913.author: a TripAdvisor user
465070913.reviewBody: This is an amazing place.  You will see a lot of the local animals that you will not get an opportunity to see anywhere else in the area.  It is a great place for kids, as you get to get up close to the animals.  This is NOT like your normal zoo, but is much more user friendly, and most of the animal enclosures are very large and animal friendly.  There is a viewing tower that has the same view of the surrounding area as you saw just before your airplane landed, but it is a 360 degree view, and you can stay on the tower long enough to really appreciate the view.   Plus, for those a little more adventuresome, experience having a tarantula walk up you arm!  This is a half day trip, and bring your sun hat and walking shoes.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

461781954.name: An educational day
461781954.author: a TripAdvisor user
461781954.reviewBody:
El Refugio de Potosi is an interesting refuge founded by an American lady. It primarily is housing iguanas and some other animals needing rescue. When I was there, remodeling was in progress, so we didn't have access to all areas. Only certain tours were allowed during this process. It's well kept, and there is a tower you can climb up to in order to get a great view over the surrounding area. It's worth doing, if you are up to it physically. The view is fantastic.
Next was Barrio de Potosi. We took a boat tour around the lagoon and watched various seabirds including a lot of frigate birds surrounding local fishing boats. It was peaceful and quiet, only with a few fishing boats anchored within the mangroves. The tour was about 30 minutes.
Lunch was included, and I had shrimp in garlic and a great guacamole dip. It was a very good day with our excellent guide Luis H. De la Maza. The tour was booked via Viator. Money well spent.

The only drawback was the constant hassle from vendors while eating, even after you already bought something. Having lived in Mexico part time, I know it's the norm, however still annoying while eating and trying to have a conversation.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

348325867.name: Amazing place amazing owner
348325867.author: a TripAdvisor user
348325867.reviewBody: Our lovely hostess La Rusa and Mike took us to El Refugio on a private tour. All I can say - wow and thank you! This place is amazing and beyond wonderful. I hope it will get to shine in all its glory again and opens its doors for the public.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

340196227.name: Been going to La Barra for 28 years! This is a review of the beach area.
340196227.author: a TripAdvisor user
340196227.reviewBody: As long as you don\'t go during the Christmas/NewYear\'s weeks, this is a beautiful, natural, peaceful escape. Now that they\'ve paved the road all the way down from Highway 200, it\'s about 40 minutes from Ixtapa. You can even take a taxi; negotiate the price and tell them when to come back for you. We choose a restaurant (Neto\'s recently), plunk our stuff down, and order an incredible lunch. Hang in the hammocks; walk the beach; take a little boat ride to the laguna or rent kayaks. The water is open ocean so the currents can be dangerous. Only swim where the Mexicans are, if at all; I follow their lead \'cause they know. The brackish laguna is fine to swim in. Food is amazing: cheap, fresh. We only drink bottled drinks; no one\'s ever gotten sick. We love to spend the day (get there about 11, leave around 5), and enjoy the birds, the water, the mountains. Gorgeous escape; as one of my friends said, it\'s the Mexico most Americans don\'t see.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

332517305.name: Cool spot, a little crowded this time of year...
332517305.author: a TripAdvisor user
332517305.reviewBody: This was our first time visiting Barro de Potosi. It has a natural lagoon that meets the ocean. We took a boat tour around the lagoon, and saw some cranes, and other birds. There are lots of small fishing boats catching shrimp. The beach was crowded since the tour buses were dropping tourists off by the busload. Get here early during the busy season.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

331397226.name: Great place for kids.
331397226.author: a TripAdvisor user
331397226.reviewBody: I love this place.  We hope it reopens for the public.  If so, it\'s definitely a destination to take children to.  It encourages love and awareness of the animals and plants in the area.  Even spiders and snakes!!!!!  And they have a large turtle pond. They also have a whale carcass, bleached bones.  It\'s a great place.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

314303051.name: Interesting place
314303051.author: a TripAdvisor user
314303051.reviewBody: Amazing place to visit, its closed for general public now, but talk to the owner, sometimes she can give a group a private tour

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

284631565.name: So worth the trip
284631565.author: a TripAdvisor user
284631565.reviewBody: Delightful rustic eco park with butterflies and rescue animals. It was an adventure getting here, and we absolutely thought it was worth it! (Actually memories from 2011 trip)

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

268983593.name: Happy staff member
268983593.author: a TripAdvisor user
268983593.reviewBody: A super place to learn. I used to work there for a year. Nice place to visit. The owner and founder has an authentic love for nature and the region. Visiting the place its a pleasure. And you are helping for sure to a great cause, the conservation of the region as it is. Beatiful and perfect.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

255741533.name: CLOSED!!!
255741533.author: a TripAdvisor user
255741533.reviewBody: PLEASE NOTE:  El Refugio is now CLOSED!!!  Actually, from what I understand, they are still open in the sense that they are caring for some of the animals from when they were previously open.  HOWEVER, they are now closed to the public.  From what I heard, because of funding.  Hope this saves you an unnecessary trip, esp seeing that\'s its quite a trek from Zihuatenejo.  Was surprised to still see this on Trip Advisor!

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

253350588.name: Quaint little village with lots of canadian tourists
253350588.author: a TripAdvisor user
253350588.reviewBody: Drove & walked the village. Had lunch on the beach near the lagoon. Beautiful beach with very few tourists on it

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

190298990.name: Hours?
190298990.author: a TripAdvisor user
190298990.reviewBody: Unfortunately, we didn\'t get to visit. We drove there yesterday around noon and it was closed. There were no hours posted, so hard to know when it is open. Driving tip: If coming from the beach (Barre de Potosi) it is easy to miss as there were no signs coming from that direction and the large stone entrance faces the road coming from Hwy 200.\n\nI gave it 5 stars because I had to put something there in order to post this.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

186744458.name: Interesting with excellent educational outreach
186744458.author: a TripAdvisor user
186744458.reviewBody: Our visit here was very interesting - we learned about local animals and insects with a number of opportunities to touch and hold the animals. The view from the tower was excellent. I think the key thing we felt good about was supporting an organization that is doing educational outreach to local schools. They are closed for ~4 months a year during which time staff visits the schools. We negotiated a day rate w/ our taxi driver. We went to nearby ruins which was OK - the museum was closed and the local "guide" did not speak much english and knew only some basic info, but it was interesting to see the pyramid (in the process of being rebuilt and being worked on) along w/ a restored ball game court and to hear about his village. We also went to barra de Potosi and enjoyed lunch at a small place on the river and then took a scenic back roads to get back to Zihua. Overall a nice day trip.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

163203231.name: Fascinating exotic animals, high quality animal care, great educational outreach programs
163203231.author: a TripAdvisor user
163203231.reviewBody: El Refugio de Potosi is truly amazing.  They\'ve carved out a little niche in the jungle where they take in, care for, rehabilitate (where possible), and educate the public about wild animals in the region.  Staff are extremely knowledgeable and passionate about their work.  We had the opportunity to snuggle a kinkajou, pet young coatamundi, hold a baby crocodile, and learn a great deal about the animals of the Guerrero region.  Kudos to El Refugio for their great work and their neverending crusade to help secure the future of Mexico\'s wildlife.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

157735935.name: Great day trip with kids, very welcoming and a worthy mission.
157735935.author: a TripAdvisor user
157735935.reviewBody: We spent Sunday morning at the refuge and could not have been happier with our experience.  You see the animals close up and learn about the important mission of this refuge on a fun guided tour.  Our daughter (who loves animals) became ill on the tour and they could not have been nicer or more accommodating (finding her shade, drinks, etc.) She was happy after the kindness she received and seeing the animals she loves.  We hired a driver for the day and I would highly recommend this approach (Jr. Sanchez, fluent in English and very friendly and helpful zihuacab@yahoo.com.  After the refuge we went to Barra de Potosi and had lunch at La Condensa, great time as kids played in the surf.  After lunch Jr. took us to stores in Zihua and really made the whole day fun and worthwhile.  My daughter rallied and was in great health and spirits by the time we got back to our hotel.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

157503194.name: Off the beaten track but WEll Worth the Visit: Don\'t miss it
157503194.author: a TripAdvisor user
157503194.reviewBody: Our local friends took us to this wonderful place. Laurel Patrick, the founder and inspiration behind this  little jewel has put together a refuge for lost animals and a place to teach the locals the importance of the environment.  She has several animals, carefully maintained and cared for, which are donated.  Now she has a kinkajou, coatis, injured hawks and parrots, snakes and some fabulous insects.  Her hummingbird feeders are visited by up to 15 species a year.  An additional attraction is the high tower which gives a wonderful 360 degree view of the area and a great view of the nearby lagoon, which hosts many birds; including roseate spoonbills, storks and many species of ducks.  This is definitely worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

155752060.name: Great day trip!
155752060.author: a TripAdvisor user
155752060.reviewBody:
My son and I had a wonderful visit at El Refugio del Potosi.  We took the bus from Zihua, getting off in Los Achotes and then jumped on the back of a flat bed truck for the last couple of miles.  Thankfully the truck had a canvas top.   The trip there was an adventure in itself.

This is a pretty impressive place with an admirable mission.  My son and I enjoyed learned about the animals and touching and holding them whenever possible.  We spent about an hour or so at the refugio.  The admission price is quite small, but donations are certainly appreciated.  The guide was very knowledgeable and answered lots of questions.  The tour felt very personal, not canned.  This is a great visit for both kids and adults.

After leaving the refugio we traveled on to Barra del Potosi and had a pleasant lunch at La Contessa.  The beach was beautiful and far less crowded than La Ropa or Las Gatas.  We opted to take a taxi back (300 pesos).  The trip back was a different, more scenic route, which we enjoyed.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

154467708.name: Wonderful facility for animal rehab and refuge and human education!
154467708.author: a TripAdvisor user
154467708.reviewBody: At the time of our visit, this Refugio was open Sundays, Mondays and Thursdays from 10-5.  This is an amazing project and we spent a very enjoyable couple of hours here.  We saw turtles, huge and multiple iguanas, coatamundi, snakes large and small, the gorgeous macaws, the porcupine, spiders, insects, and many other birds of prey.  They have constructed an amazing panoramic tower which affords wonderful 360 views of the surrounding estuary, lagoons, and nearby ocean beach at Barra de Potosi.  This project is truly educating tourists and locals alike, attracting buses of school children who will benefit from the things they see and learn here, as well as people who have brought injured wild animals here for medical help.  Whenever the Refugio can rehab and release a bird or animal, they will.  If the animal or bird is unable to fend for itself in the wild, it will remain at the Refugio as an "ambassador".  Volunteers staff the walking tours and I imagine you could hear different stories and impressions from various volunteers each time, so I\'d definitely return here again.  And I found some cute gifts in the gift shop!  A woman named Laurel Patrick is the director of this refuge, and we had the opportunity to meet her and learn more about the creation of the refuge and its work.  I\'ll be excited to see the skeleton of the large sperm whale once it\'s reconstructed.  We could see the work being done on this mammoth whale...quite impressive.  I think the 60 peso admission (approx. $4.75 USD) is extremely reasonable.  I will note, we rented a car, and had the freedom to visit nearby Petatlan with its amazing Church of Miracles, gold market and great BBQ chicken eateries; the La Chole museum near the Soliedad de Maciel ruin; and after visiting the Refugio, we had time for a snack and a dip in the ocean at Barra de Potosi\'s La Contesa Enramada (a lovely beach cafe with tables, chairs and hammocks for your siesta!)  We\'re very familiar with this area, as we\'ve been visiting for over 20 years, so I\'ll suggest to readers that these are all worthwhile activities, but are probably better done over two days instead of one, if you\'re venturing outside Zihuatanejo for the first time.  I\'d pair Petatlan and the ruins/museum for one day, and the Refugio and Barra de Potosi beach day for the other.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

153790061.name: Worth the visit to help support them.
153790061.author: a TripAdvisor user
153790061.reviewBody:
We got a lift to the refugio again this year and was able to spend some more time there.  This was mostly spent in front of the hummingbird feeders again.

Cost is $6 US and will include a tour with a knowledgable, English-speaking tour guide.  Only open certain days of the week - check their website.

Lots of different parrots and iguanas, hummingbirds, insects, snakes, a couple of porcupines, and some Military Macaws.  
You'll have a chance to hold a porcupine (they're different than what you'd think), a boa constrictor, and a scorpion.

Also visit the gift store - their t-shirt logo is great. (But they need more XLs!)

We had a chance to watch them exercise one of the Military Macaws while there - that was fun to see.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

153499447.name: Hummingbird Heaven!!!
153499447.author: a TripAdvisor user
153499447.reviewBody: There are many special creatures at El Refugio de Potosi but this post is meant for hummingbird lovers like myself.  Oh my goodness...to be surrounded by dozens of hummingbirds hovering so close by you are nearly deafened by their whirring wings...I was blissfully mesmerized by the swarm of hummingbirds all aflutter around me in just a little corner of this animal refuge.  I could have stayed all day,  unmoving, just basking in the miraculous sight of the hummingbirds jostling at the feeders, sipping nectar nonchalantly, unmindful of my \'groupie\' gawking stares and oohs and aahs!   Mind you, I am the type of person who goes gaga over the solitary hummingbird who visits my fuschias occasionally, so to see so many hummingbirds all at once...what an ecstatic  experience indeed!

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

150660042.name: Nice place to visit
150660042.author: a TripAdvisor user
150660042.reviewBody: Our visit to Potosi was part of a day-long trip to several attractions in the area. 60 pesos per person admission and a staff member accompanied us to answer questions and show us the animals (for a tip just like everywhere else in Mexico). Personally, I\'m not a big fan of looking at animals and birds in cages although my wife enjoyed holing the Mexican Porcupine and the snake. The butterfly exhibit was a bit underwhelming as well but I gather from the other reviews that this place is relatively new and getting better all of the time. I was hard pressed to spend an hour there so if this is the only destination on your day trip to the area, consider going to the archealogical museum down the highway which was excellent, look at the dig site of the Aztec pyramid and also go down the road from Potosi to see the wonderful wild birds in the Mangrove lagoon at Potosi beach. Better than El Refugio in my opinion.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

150436019.name: Informative and Enjoyable
150436019.author: a TripAdvisor user
150436019.reviewBody: We took a day trip that included a stop here.  We really loved everything about it.  The displays were well set up and easily accessible.  The guides were passionate and interested in answering all of our questions.  We had the opportunity for a close up experience with the Military Macaws, hummingbirds and the porcupine.  This is truly an opportunity to learn about these unique and beautiful animals.  The iguana display was unprecedented. It was truly a memorable day.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

150427960.name: Plan to spend the day
150427960.author: a TripAdvisor user
150427960.reviewBody: Beautiful area, plants, birds, animals, reptiles.  One couldn\'t ask for more.\nA guided tour is offered by very educated and English speading guides that explain all about the Refugio and it\'s occupants.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

150221036.name: Great day trip!
150221036.author: a TripAdvisor user
150221036.reviewBody: I went to El Refugio with my husband & 3 year old. It was an excellent day trip, we all enjoyed it. Our guide was very knowledgeable. There were some interesting creatures & birds they are rehabilitating. The porcupine & snakes were my favorite & we even got to hold them. We took the bus from La Ropa, took us about an hour or so and cost only 60 pesos. Took a taxi back for 300 but well worth it to experience something different while here.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

150069032.name: A nice day day trip
150069032.author: a TripAdvisor user
150069032.reviewBody: We took a taxi from Zihuatanejo to Potosi. It was 15-20 minute trip. There was one english speaking guide working when we were there and had to wait about 15minutes for him to complete a tour. This was fine,we spent the time climbing the lookout tower. The view was amazing. The guide was very knowledgeable and able to answer all our questions about the indigineous animals that were rescued and being rehabilitated there.  The tour was all outdoors and took probably 1/2 an hour. My two oldest sons were able to handle some of the animals, such as snakes and pocupines. The grounds are quite beautiful and the animals are well cared for. Admission is pretty inexpensive, maybe 5 or 6 usd. While you are there, visit the beautiful beach in Potosi. You may also want to rent a kayak and paddle in the lagoon, but we did not get a chance.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

149980285.name: What a gem!
149980285.author: a TripAdvisor user
149980285.reviewBody: Beautiful, peaceful place where people really care about the animals they accommodate. Lovely views from lookout tower.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

149813570.name: a first class attraction
149813570.author: a TripAdvisor user
149813570.reviewBody: We have been in Zihua for almost 3 years and never visited this site until our daughter came for Christmas. We decided to make the 30 minute drive and were rewarded with a clean, beautiful and well run refuge for coastal jungle animals and birds. The docents are well educated and present the guided tour around the park in either English or Spanish. The grounds are beautifully maintained and there is even a look-out tower (safe and secure) from which to view the surrounding jungle, farmlands and ocean.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

149304593.name: a unique spot
149304593.author: a TripAdvisor user
149304593.reviewBody: The refugio is a unique opportunity to visit the local wildlife and see how they are cared for, as well as observing the eco systems of the area....more than a zoo for sure!  If you have children, they may enjoy seeing up close the snakes, iguanas and other jungle creatures!  Very well done.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

149286609.name: Off the beaten path
149286609.author: a TripAdvisor user
149286609.reviewBody:
I decided to visit 'El Refugio' while staying in Potosi.

Although the place is not open every day of the week I was able to get to it on the Thursday before my flight home.

During my visit to the site I learned about the folklore of the area and the importance of educating the local public so that wildlife was not needlessly destroyed.

I also had the opportunity to see the scorpions, poisonous spiders, and venomous snakes in captivity. These are very rarely seen even in the local wild, something I was greatful to find out.

They have some beautiful parrots that are kept there because people just didn't want to look after them anymore. Thankfully this place is available for them, other animals, and reptiles.

They offer tours in English and Spanish and possibly other languages.

The iguana compound has many iguanas and is quite large.

The entrance fee in minimum and I know that I will go back more than once when I get back down there at the end of this year. It is a beautiful site.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

147786524.name: Great Visit
147786524.author: a TripAdvisor user
147786524.reviewBody: El Refugio de Potosi was a great place to visit during our Zihua vacation.  The work they do there is phenomenal and it was great to see the animals up close and personal.  The guide was worried about his English but he did an excellent job. The grounds and enclosures are well-built and well maintained and there is no doubt that passion for preservation is what motivates the refuge.  It is well worth the trip if you are in the area.  Keep up the good work and hello to Lala!

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

147634324.name: Interesting tour
147634324.author: a TripAdvisor user
147634324.reviewBody: Liked visiting Barra de Potosi....imagine this is what Zihautanejo looked like back in the day.  The refugio is fairly new and still have some exhibits to build.  The tour guide Javier was excellent.  There wasn\'t a question he was not able to answer.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

146977761.name: Up Close and Personal with the Critters of Guerrero
146977761.author: a TripAdvisor user
146977761.reviewBody: I enjoy supporting small eco tourism efforts like the Refugio. I take a tour yearly at the Refugio--they provide tour leaders who speak English as well as Spanish. From Lala, the cuddly (really!) little Mexican porcupine to the iguanas (the Zen Masters of the refuge) the experience is an enjoyable and  surprising window into the lives of the nonhuman resident critters of Guerrero. I also remembered this year to save my travel money and buy Christmas gifts at the charming Refugio gift shop, featuring local crafts.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

146829155.name: great place!
146829155.author: a TripAdvisor user
146829155.reviewBody: Cool place to see !!! Barde postsi is a beautiful beach Too. Laurel Patrick has done a wonderful thing there !! Its great education for the kids and just a cool thing !!

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

146253233.name: Day trip from Ixtapa
146253233.author: a TripAdvisor user
146253233.reviewBody: If you enjoy the animal life of the locality... make it an early morning trip for active animal life. Parrots, Iguanas, hawks, dwarf owl... others. Has a HIGH viewing scaffold. Very cool and a must do.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

146044044.name: Interesting Wildlife Preserve 30 Minutes from Town
146044044.author: a TripAdvisor user
146044044.reviewBody: Interesting collection of plants, animals birds and butterflies.\nKnowledgable guides provide a one hour tour that is surprisingly enteraining and filled with an eclectic an very interesting collection of things to see and learn. \nIdeal for kids and families.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

144647858.name: This is a must see!
144647858.author: a TripAdvisor user
144647858.reviewBody: First, this is not a zoo!  This is a true wildlife refuge with the mission of rehabilitating wildlife and returning animals to their natural habitats.  Our guide taught himself enough English to provide an excellent tour of the grounds.  I learned much about the animals being cared for at the refuge.  Housed there currently:  macaws, hawks, iguanas, a coatimundi, two porcupines, a baby alligator, a very tame chachalaca, the cutest tiny owl in the world, and some giant insects I didn\'t get close to. They\'re in the process of preserving a sperm whale skeleton and clearing an area to display it.\nGetting there can be tricky.  We could\'ve taken the Petatlan-bound bus from Zihuatanejo, gotten off at the turnoff to the refuge, then completed the journey via a covered truck that\'s parked there.  Instead, we hired a taxi driver.  Worth every peso and every moment!  \nThank you to everyone at El Refugio de Potosi-- for your passionate care for the environment, for educating visitors, for nurturing a variety of creatures back to health and freedom!

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

139858280.name: Don\'t miss it!!!
139858280.author: a TripAdvisor user
139858280.reviewBody: This is my idea of what a zoo should be: merely a temporary home for the injured, a nursery for the motherless, the eyeless, the wingless and for confiscated former pets. A place where they relearn how to hunt and how to survive for themselves before being released into the wild again; or a home for those who would never survive if they were set free again.  The Refugio also conducts guided tours for local schools where they teach children why and how to take care of the local fauna and of all the species.  There are guided tours in English and there\'s a panoramic tower not to miss.    You may want to leave a donation for this amazing place in the piggy bank they have at the souvenir shop.\n\nWarning: mosquitoes here are wild, unbearable at times ( during the rainy season )  so bring your favorite repellent and cover up as much skin as possible.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

135577791.name: Worth the time away from the beach
135577791.author: a TripAdvisor user
135577791.reviewBody: We visited the refuge mainly for my 11-year-old daughter, but all the adults enjoyed it just as much. I speak some Spanish so I was able to translate our guide\'s information. We took the Petatlan-bound bus from downtown Zihuatanejo (13 pesos each) to Los Achotes, then the covered truck from Los Achotes to the refuge (12 pesos each). Definitely wear strong repellent during the rainy (summer) season.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

134739467.name: Don\'t miss this Zihuatanejo gem, it is a must do for all!
134739467.author: a TripAdvisor user
134739467.reviewBody: Our visit to El Refugio De Potosi was one of the highlights of our trip to Zihuatanejo. This animal refuge is filled with creatures with stories to tell and the staff does a fantastic job of telling the stories. We had a hands on experience and had the opportunity to hold, pet and interact with many of the animals. We also learned a great deal about local domestic and wildlife. This is an important organization to visit and support.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

134004426.name: A must see while in Zihuatanejo
134004426.author: a TripAdvisor user
134004426.reviewBody: I\'ve been to Zih 4 times now and wish I\'d come here sooner.  It\'s good to see that there is an organization dedicated to taking care of animals who need it.  We added this on to a "combo tour" by asking the guide to stop.  Sadly the english tour guide is no longer there, but our guide was able to translate excellently.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

131493529.name: wild life refuge
131493529.author: a TripAdvisor user
131493529.reviewBody: This people are doing a great job at keeping local wild injured animals safe and healthy and returning them back to nature

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

131269391.name: Great place to visit
131269391.author: a TripAdvisor user
131269391.reviewBody: This was a nice getaway from the beach and to see how special the wildlife is around this area.  The staff are very knowledgeable and seem passionate about their jobs.  Please donate so this great little gem can keep educating others!

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

130975410.name: Such a great example of wildlife conservation!
130975410.author: a TripAdvisor user
130975410.reviewBody: Out of our week long stay in Zihua this was one of my most favorite activities we did! I wasn\'t expecting much to the place, but its really amazing. First go up the lookout tower to see a 360 degree view of ocean, lagoon and mountains. Then take the guided tour. All of the animals are either rescues or for mating purposes and they all have large clean habitats. The guides are very knowledgeable and will take the time to answer any questions or to just let you sit and observe the animals. The animals we saw were iguanas, porcupine (so cute!), armadillo, humming birds, parrots, spiders, snakes, turtles, etc. I wish them all the luck in their efforts!

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

129068766.name: Must see, best place to experience the local wildlife
129068766.author: a TripAdvisor user
129068766.reviewBody: We went to the Refugio as part of our Ixtapa Adventours tour to Barra de Potosi\'.  We had an excellent guide (Javier) who walked us through Refugio and told us alot about all the animals. The exhibits were spacious and clean for the animals, which is of outmost importance.  Many of the animals were injured or former pets that wouldn\'t be able to adapt back in the wild so they now had a caring environment. So this wasn\'t a zoo, which I have mixed feelings about. Rather, a true refuge for animals needing it. The staff was helpful and knowledgeable.  Don\'t miss the Mexican dwarf porcupine, Lala, the sweetest little animal. And the baby amardillo.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

128528217.name: Up close and personal
128528217.author: a TripAdvisor user
128528217.reviewBody: We went to the refuge as part of Adventours\' Adventure in Potosi. I was most surprised by the variety of birds they were caring for: parrots, hawks, eagles, and a pigmy owl. This wasn\'t like a zoo where you were blocked off from really experiencing the animals up-close.  But it was safe and obvious that the animals were treated with respect and care. At only 3 years old, this refuge will obviously grow to be a substantial sanctuary for the wildlife of Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

128329539.name: Paseo por el  refugio potosi
128329539.author: a TripAdvisor user
128329539.reviewBody: this is the best place for enjoy your vacation on this area is very natural expereince  whit animal and birds

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

128284319.name: amazing wildlife refuge
128284319.author: a TripAdvisor user
128284319.reviewBody: Near the beach at Barra is an awesome wildlife refuge that features animals from the region, such as coatimundi.  My 8-year old son loved to learn about and handle some of these creatures, including baby crocodile and armadillo, boa constrictor, and porcupine.  You\'ll want to bring a sun hat, binoculars, camera, and walking shoes.  We were staying in the area for about 3 months and my son wanted to go every week- the staff is friendly and knowledgable.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

126773255.name: Eco center refuge
126773255.author: a TripAdvisor user
126773255.reviewBody: It is small but very interesting, we saw some unusual native animals there.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

126504583.name: Great place to visit and support!
126504583.author: a TripAdvisor user
126504583.reviewBody:
I'd been planning a visit via the bus + "chicken truck" route from Zihua, but then ended up taking a tour (with Luis at ixtapatoursluis.com) that included the refuge, a mangrove boat ride, and lunch in Barra de Potosi. 
Our group really enjoyed this small refuge visit - the guide was very knowledgable.  They have several endangered Military Macaws that they are trying to help breed.  They've also got some really cute mammals - a porcupine you can pet, and a wonderful armadillo.

I was glued in front of the feeders which were teeming with hummingbirds. I could have stayed for hours, but in a short time there were Cinnamon, Black-chinned, and Doubleday's Hummingbirds visiting. I was told several more were frequently seen.
I'll definitely visit again - nice that this group is trying to preserve the wildlife of the area.

A few details:  There is a $6 USD fee (which was included in our tour) to enter. Also they are only open maybe 3 days a week when we visited. This was not on their website - but they responded to email questions very quickly - so check with them.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

126186874.name: El Refugio is a Must-See
126186874.author: a TripAdvisor user
126186874.reviewBody: We thoroughly enjoyed our excursion to El Refugio de Potosi.  It was a great way to learn more about the coast of Mexico and the animals who are indigenous to the area.  Our English-speaking guide was enthusiastic and informative.  I encourage all visitors to Zihuatanejo-Ixtapa to take a short ride to El Refugio to learn more about this beautiful part of the world.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

125963570.name: loved the rufugio
125963570.author: a TripAdvisor user
125963570.reviewBody: Laurel who runs the Rufugio is wonderful as are the guides who are very knowledgeable -  pretty pace - tower to climb for a view of the surrounding area. Snacks/cold drinks on site. And some wounderful local things in the small gift shop. \ndo check hours/ day open

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

125418233.name: Educational and fun
125418233.author: a TripAdvisor user
125418233.reviewBody: This is a great day trip (or half day trip) from Zihua or Ixtapa. The guides are very knowledgeable and friendly. My daughter got to hold a baby croc, pet a porcupine and more! Check website before you go, they\'re only open three days a week. We took at a taxi from Zihua rather than brave the bus, and you can easily get a taxi from the refuge to the beach in Potosi for lunch or swimming and catch a taxi back to town. Highly recommend!

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

125304731.name: Really educational for kids and adults.
125304731.author: a TripAdvisor user
125304731.reviewBody: We love to go to the Refugio to see the work that they are doing with endangered, abandoned and rescued animals.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

125047713.name: tarantulas are our friends
125047713.author: a TripAdvisor user
125047713.reviewBody: Our guide was amazing.  Spoke english fluently and answered all our questions.  We all walked away knowing a little more and some even experienced holding spiders, snakes and alligators. at 60 pesos each worth the visit.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

125005987.name: Worth the trip!
125005987.author: a TripAdvisor user
125005987.reviewBody: Great little refuge with birds, iguanas, bugs, aligators and a very knowledgeable staff.  They have water and a small gift shop there.  Very interesting.  They also have binoculars you can borrow and climb the observation tower.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

124457363.name: Do not miss!
124457363.author: a TripAdvisor user
124457363.reviewBody: A unique experience to see and learn about the plants and animals of Guerrero Mexico.  El refugio is professionally run, perfect attention to detail and I guarantee you will come away in awe having met some of the most unique characters (being the animals!)

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

124154192.name: A Must See When in Zihua
124154192.author: a TripAdvisor user
124154192.reviewBody: We\'ve been taking our guests  there since it opened. It\'s a beautiful facility, staffed by a wonderful group of volunteers. The tours are given by knowledgeable guides, leisurely paced and full of interesting and useful information. The star of the tour is Lala. Where else can you get to pet a cute little porcupine? The baby crocodile is also interesting. Laurel is doing great things here and deserves our support. Buy a whale bone while you\'re there. Or just make a donation. It\'s very worthwhile!

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

123521329.name: Local fauna!
123521329.author: a TripAdvisor user
123521329.reviewBody: We got a wonderful tour of the refuge from Anita. She was very knowledgeable and engaging. I am usually much happier wandering around than receiving a tour, but this was enough to make me rethink that. They have a number of animals on the premises that are there because they were raised as pets and abandoned or injured. Some of the injured animals will never be released into the wild, but that is the goal with most of the animals there. We saw a porcupine, a coatimundi, a jaguar undi, a number of iguanas and different hawks and parrots. I may have most enjoyed the baby crocodile and the baby armadillo...but then I think about that charming porcupine again...

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

123472085.name: Fantastic.
123472085.author: a TripAdvisor user
123472085.reviewBody: This is a must-see. It\'s very educational and entertaining.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

123446273.name: great day trip from Ixtapa/Zihuatenejo
123446273.author: a TripAdvisor user
123446273.reviewBody: We had a wonderful time touring this wildlife refuge with Anita. Many interesting animals in a friendly environment. Be sure to check it out if you are in the area.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

123354619.name: Great tour - we did the countryside tour - out of Club Med Ixtapa/Zihuatanejo
123354619.author: a TripAdvisor user
123354619.reviewBody: We really enjoyed this tour and had Francisco as our tour guide, we went to a coconut planation, El Refugio de Potosi (was great and even the teenagers stayed interested) and to family business where they make clay roof titles and the tour ended when at a bakery in a backyard (great bread).

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

123353709.name: Wonderful Work
123353709.author: a TripAdvisor user
123353709.reviewBody: A most interesting place run by a true nature lover. Not to be missed are the Opossum Mice.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

123325315.name: Budding Eco-park
123325315.author: a TripAdvisor user
123325315.reviewBody: The volunteers are doing a wonderful job of improving and expanding their facility.  They have flora/fauna you amy not know existed in the area and they are very enthusiastic about their park.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

123127080.name: A small scale Noah\'s Ark
123127080.author: a TripAdvisor user
123127080.reviewBody: Not a zoo, but a refuge and a place where indigenous animls are respected and cared for.  You can learn much about the fauna of the area

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

123125296.name: Only the beginning!
123125296.author: a TripAdvisor user
123125296.reviewBody: Small, hopefully in time and donations, it will be a destination!

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

122154716.name: Must see in Zhihua
122154716.author: a TripAdvisor user
122154716.reviewBody: El Refugio is a great place to experience the wildlife of Mexico. It is south of the Airport but not to be missed.  The ecopark is NOT a tourist scam. The park is a place for rehabilitation and education. The staff are knowledgeable of the animals that they take care of.\nGo see it,\nDave

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

122124574.name: Kayaking Trip
122124574.author: a TripAdvisor user
122124574.reviewBody: Very beautiful mangroves, reserve is much bigger than I thought it would be (but very shallow).  Saw a number of birds, but I think other times of the year would be better for birding.  Overall a very nice 1.5 hr trip in the stillness of the morning.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

121642476.name: WONDERFUL PLACE TO VISIT AND YOU CAN HELP SAVE ANIMALS TOO!!
121642476.author: a TripAdvisor user
121642476.reviewBody: Went here to see what this was all about and was surprised to find an organization that had taken the trouble to help SAVE the local wild life!! I am so happy that people have taken the time to start this and the visitors that are helping support this. A wonderful way to spend the afternoon with friends, family, children and loved ones.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

121578650.name: Learn about the Plants and Animals of Guerrero
121578650.author: a TripAdvisor user
121578650.reviewBody: This was my third visit to the Refugio over three years. I had a knowledgeable guide who spoke English. I learn something new every time I go--this time it was the fact that the newly hatched ocean turtles only have two days worth of stored food to be able to get to the ocean. There are always new animals. There was a little armadillo and I also saw the jaguarundi that had been shy the previous two visits. I should have waited to buy gifts at the Refugio gift shop instead of at Zihuatanejo--a great selection of local goods.I fed the friendly small parrots  near the refugio entrance peanuts, which they loved. I like supporting this kind of grass roots undertaking. The only drawback was it was only open three days a week--Sun, Mon and Thurs. This is definitely a must see for people interested in learning about the local flora and fauna who want to support eco tourism.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

121327651.name: Great way to spend a couple hours.
121327651.author: a TripAdvisor user
121327651.reviewBody: It can be time-consuming and confusing to get here by bus, so we took taxi. Loved the tour. Beautiful animals, very informative guide. Highly recommend! Eat in Potosi afterward.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

120921810.name: Great!
120921810.author: a TripAdvisor user
120921810.reviewBody: El Refugio was very interesting and well run. The kids loved interacting with some of the animals/bugs.  Highly recommend it!

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

119535726.name: .Educational
119535726.author: a TripAdvisor user
119535726.reviewBody: Great samples and information on the native insects and animals. The tour guides were very infromative and educated. You could actually handle some of the animals. xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

117994979.name: wonderful
117994979.author: a TripAdvisor user
117994979.reviewBody: although i bit out of town, a taxi or bus can get you to this wonderful place. you will  see the biggest iguanas ever and beautiful birds in a very natural habitat. the snakes and other creepy things are kept in cages. don\'t miss this!

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

116536561.name: Quintessential local gem
116536561.author: a TripAdvisor user
116536561.reviewBody: A great beach with a very local flavor. We visited during Easter week while staying in Zihuatanejo. Take the bus and the pick up trucks to get the real experience.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

114264581.name: Parrots, humming birds, butterflies, and more
114264581.author: a TripAdvisor user
114264581.reviewBody: El Refugio de Potosi is great way to see the local wildlife up close. It was interesting to see the birds the Refugio wants to breed, reptiles, butterfly house, coatimundi, wild cat, and young porcupine here. Most important, the effort seems to be centered around education and improving the local area, not just development of a tourist attraction. \nNice change from beach activities, guide and staff friendly and enthusiastic. Many of the animals are in large cages in forested setting. Guides  lead you through the paths to the various exhibits and  identify the animals explain how they fit into the goals of the refuge. The tower gives you a view of the surrounding area.  Very kid friendly.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

113270978.name: Fantastic One Stop Nature Tour
113270978.author: a TripAdvisor user
113270978.reviewBody: When you climb the observation tower, you get an idea of how this place is in the middle of a vast ,almost untouched piece of Mexican coast.  You see meandering lagoons, off shore islands, miles of beach, flocks of birds cruising by.  It is an amazing area and on the ground level, they have loads of cute approachable animals.  It is obviously a labor of love and that feeling is infectious. Don\'t miss it.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

113071288.name: A Must Do!
113071288.author: a TripAdvisor user
113071288.reviewBody: This is a great place to spend a few hours and enjoy the local wildlife.  Excellent, knowledgeable guides are very helpful.  You can take a taxi or for more fun take the local bus from Zihua.  You\'ll see the countryside and enjoy the local people.  Get off at Los Achotes and then take the "truck taxi" to the refuge and then on to Barra de Potosi for lunch.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

112880014.name: This is a must !!!!!
112880014.author: a TripAdvisor user
112880014.reviewBody: There is so much to see ...a great learning experience for all ages...Everyone was so helpful. I would recommend any and all take a trip out to see this refuge on their way to La Barra.  There is a small cover charge  but well worth it.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

112814742.name: A gem - perfect stop to or from Barra de la Potosi
112814742.author: a TripAdvisor user
112814742.reviewBody: We learned about the Refuge on the internet, and planned our tip to Barra de la Potosi (April 2011) to include a stop here.  The refuge is just that - a real refuge for animals of all kinds who either can not live in the wild due to injury or domestication, or who are being given a safe haven until they are ready to go back to the wild.   We had an informative guide who was not only knowledgeable but passionate about the work done at the Refuge. If you enjoy wildlife at all, El Refugio de Potosi is worth a  couple of hours.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

112747587.name: A don\'t miss experience
112747587.author: a TripAdvisor user
112747587.reviewBody: A wonderful experience for all ages,the staff have done an amazing job.It continues to improve each year.I highly reccomend a visit while you are in the Zihuatanejo area.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

112677302.name: El Refugio de Potosi: one of the best attractions of the Zihuatanejo area!
112677302.author: a TripAdvisor user
112677302.reviewBody: Laurel and the gang have done a wonderful job creating and running El Refugio. They take in injured and abandoned wild animals which are treated  and released or kept for breeding purposes if release is not possible.  We take 3 trips to Zihua per year and always visit the refuge.  Highly recommended!

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

112664111.name: Living Museum is a Real Treat
112664111.author: a TripAdvisor user
112664111.reviewBody: El Refugio de Potos\u00ed is everything a living museum hopes to be.  The animals and exhibits are local and fascinating.  They do extremely good preservation of artifacts like the world\u2019s largest sperm whale skeleton that washed up on the local beach at Playa Blanca.  With donations from numerous locals and many visitors the reconstructed skeleton is now preserved for posterity.  They are very good ecological stewards of the area and their mission of education is met with gusto and enthusiasm.\nEl Refugio is a local treasure that should not be missed en route to visit the ecological gem of the lagoon at La Barra. Unfortunately the lagoon is being threatened by land and by sea from greedy development interests.  You can be part of the solution by visiting El Refugio and finding out how to support this bastion and ode to biodiversity.

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

112656298.name: Even better this year!
112656298.author: a TripAdvisor user
112656298.reviewBody:
We first visited El Refugio in January of 2010. The Refugio was still a work in progress  (as it will be for some time) but we loved what they had done at that point. Climbed the lookout tower, spent time with the iguanas, spent over an hour just enjoying the parrots activity.
This year we took friends with us who were on their first trip to La Barra de Potosi. They were impessed to say the least and we were also very impressed with the work that had been done in the past year. More spaces for rescued animals..( fell in love with Lala the hairy Porcupine)  excellent tour guide, more rescued birds.. all in a very natural setting. Work was progressing on the whale skeleton which will be an interesting addition. The atmosphere of caring is evident from the moment you enter El Refugio. 
It's a great stop for a day trip to La Barra from Zihuatanejo and kids will love it ..especially the hands on aspects. 
Highly recommend.. you can ask the pasajero to stop on your way into la barra so it's easy to get to the Refugio..

address.streetAddress: Camino Los Achotes a Barra de Potosi

676332614.name: THERE ARE BETTER PLACES TO VISIT
676332614.author: a TripAdvisor user
676332614.reviewBody: The best part about Play Las Gatas was the boat ride over. Once there, it is extremely crowded, and there are no free places to just lay out your beach towel and relax. It was wall to wall people, and the food was over priced and mediocre at best. A good place to visit once, but no more.

669768794.name: Find Franco and you\u2019ll have a great day
669768794.author: a TripAdvisor user
669768794.reviewBody: We caught the water taxi over and took the advice from other travelers to walk the whole beach before deciding on a spot. We went with Otillia\u2019s (red umbrellas w/ turquoise lounge chairs and pink tables) because Franco was so friendly and the lounge chair/table situation was the best on the beach. It was a fabulous day. We rented a jet ski (700 pesos for 30 mins) and got amazing massages from Sophia (the spa area is right behind Otillia\u2019s so we could leave our stuff on our chairs). Definitely ask if Sophia is available. She is super kind and professional. The food at Otillia\u2019s was great, and the cocktails were even better. Franco was so much fun to chat with, too. \nThe water at Las Gatas was the most turquoise of any of the beaches we went to ( incl. Madera, La Ropa, Isla Ixtapa). It is rockier than the others so bring water shoes if you have sensitive feet. Definitely worth the trip, even if you just stay for a couple hours.

668328615.name: Restaurante sirena en el mar
668328615.author: a TripAdvisor user
668328615.reviewBody: Restaurant sirena en el mar was a great experience,the service was outstanding even do it was completely full,food excellent,the beach in front of our table was great.we recommend this place to families. thanks

663894854.name: One of the best beaches here
663894854.author: a TripAdvisor user
663894854.reviewBody:
You have to try this beach. You have to get there by boat which charges $50mx pesos (less than 5 bucks)well worth it. Take cash because no atms or plastic accepted on the beach. 

They have many restaurants at the beach, water activities like snorkeling, jet skies, banana ride, and more. 

Get there early to make the most of it. Last ride back to shore is 5:30pm you don’t want to get stuck there.

663324613.name: Great Beach
663324613.author: a TripAdvisor user
663324613.reviewBody: Wonderful Beach for snorkeling, drinking, eating and people watching.\nClean beach tables are close to water so no long walk.\nSnorkeled first time have mustache so should have brought my own full face shield, also waves come up and go over open top snorkel tube need a check valve, but fish are awesome to see.

662572159.name: Busy, warm water
662572159.author: a TripAdvisor user
662572159.reviewBody: We took a water taxi from Zihua to Las Gatas. The beach was VERY busy, but we walked to the far end and enjoyed more privacy.  It is very pretty and the water was incredibly warm.  There was an adorable dog that kept us company while we were there.  We did not stay long but are very happy we visited Playa Las Gatas.

660025207.name: Fun Excursion
660025207.author: a TripAdvisor user
660025207.reviewBody: Very enjoyable day spent at this beach! Beautiful water for swimming, pretty coral! Coconut shrimp was top notch! Good shopping at the pier!

659568723.name: Definitely a must do when in Zihua
659568723.author: a TripAdvisor user
659568723.reviewBody: We were in Zihua just few months ago but didn\'t venture to Las Gatas.  On this trip, we made a point of visiting.  We were not disappointed.  50pesos/pp covers your return boat trip to Las Gats.  Boat ride is less than 10min.  Once you are there, be sure to rent gear to snorkel.  We were approached by Gustavo who guided us to his shop/restaurant.  For 180 pesos/pp, you get the snorkle, mask, fins. life jacket AND a guide who will take you out to for one hour. He will take you to see the Jesus statue and also lets you feed small fish.  It was an amazing experience.  we highly recommend it.  Alternatively, you can rent all the gear for 60 pesos and no guide but you wouldn\'t see as much in the ocean by navigating on your own.\nThe one hour guide is just enough.

659367746.name: Relaxing
659367746.author: a TripAdvisor user
659367746.reviewBody:
A shorter walk from the south end of Playa L Ropa than expected.
Very relaxing morning/afternoon on the loungers at Otilia.
Water is warm, shallow and a little rocky on the feet.
Not nearly as busy as Playa La Ropa.
Very enjoyable!

659145819.name: SNORKELING
659145819.author: a TripAdvisor user
659145819.reviewBody: Playas Las Gatas is a 15 minute 50 pesos return water taxi from the Zihuatanejo pier  I chose Ofilias where Franco head waiter welcomes you and treats you to a great day relaxing with sun umbrellas loungers great drinks and food  Just put your chair in the clear water and enjoy the view. Known for the beautiful fish to behold while snorkeling this place rocks!  Former home of Owen Lee legendary resident and oceanographer

656760932.name: First time here
656760932.author: a TripAdvisor user
656760932.reviewBody: We have been to the Zihua/Ixtapa area the last three years but never ventured to Las Gatas so thought we would give it a try. The boat ride over is enjoyable and the day we visited it wasn\u2019t too busy so that part was enjoyable. We had been recommended the Otilia restaurant and the service and food were quite good. The waiter,David was very pleasant and not pushy at all. We had 8 beer,two margaritas and some soft drinks and four lunches and the bill was just over 1600 pesos. Entering the water without something on your feet is not easy! I could see where if it was crowded it would not be a great experience but is was good the day we were there. The worst part of the whole day was the \u201c helpers\u201d that hang out on the piers on both sides. They really don\u2019t do much besides MAYBE lending you their hand when you get on or off the boats,but they are pretty demanding when it comes to wanting a tip. I don\u2019t mind tipping at all but when people get rude about it I don\u2019t care for it. One fellow saw that I only had large bills and said he could make change. If he can change a 200/500 peso bill he doesn\u2019t need my 20 peso tip. He kept shoving his hat at me so I finally just ignored him. Coming back there were two helpers that really didn\u2019t do anything and when I tipped one20 pesos the other fellow wanted something also. For this reason alone I don\u2019t think I would go back,it just makes the whole experience not enjoyable. I can go to Playa Linda and not be hassled.

656438068.name: Great place to snorkel or swim in Zihua
656438068.author: a TripAdvisor user
656438068.reviewBody: If you are staying in Zihuatanejo, this is a lovely place to spend your day. The beach is beautiful, the water is warm and nice (turquoise color) and the locals offer different activities to enjoy. There are some restaurants with chairs and beach umbrellas that you are welcome to use if you buy something to eat or drink from them. We took an snorkel tour with a guide that took us to see the sunken Christ statue and taught us a little about the marine life of the area. In order to get there, we went to the dock on the other side of the bay and paid 50 pesos round trip per person. It is better if you arrive early, since everything closes around 6pm (also if you want to take the boat back, the last one is around 5:00pm). We had a lovely day there.

654427787.name: beach
654427787.author: a TripAdvisor user
654427787.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful beaches ever.  It is where the locals go regularly but the tourist are discovering.  The restaurants are authentic and the food and drinks are great, but its not too crowded.  Lots of fun if you like watching kids play an have fun too. Rental and water sport available.  Great tai service (water) to mainland or nearby beaches.

654408413.name: Relax, Snorkel, Eat
654408413.author: a TripAdvisor user
654408413.reviewBody: Great place to relax, snorkel and eat.  Amado\'s at the end of the beach has great lobster and shrimp tacos with a friendly staff.  it feels and sounds like you are in a Dos Equis commercial while there.

653992212.name: Wow, what\u2019s the hype about!
653992212.author: a TripAdvisor user
653992212.reviewBody: Maybe this is like going to Vegas.  You might want to see it once, but never return.  We took the water taxi from Zihua over - lovely ride.  It reminded us in Isla Ixtapa the minute we got off the boat.  Hawkers, crowded beach and way too many tourists swilling beer in the surf.  Fine for some, but not our idea of enjoying Mexico.  Having said that, the people watching was great!  We walked the length of the beach to Otilias and had a good lunch.  Franco was a fabulous server.  The breeze and view of Zihua is lovely.  Simply not our thing.

652972837.name: Take a water taxi, a tour or walk, a 20 minute trek from the far end of La Ropa
652972837.author: a TripAdvisor user
652972837.reviewBody: I was here a few years ago and it seems like there were a lot more fish. Be careful about getting pushed into a sea urchin, but basically, swimming seems safe and protected. Front row seats fill up quickly, but if you buy a meal at one of the restaurants, you can stay for hours, cooling off every once in a while in the water.  i recommend Gloria\'s for exceptional coconut shrimp... located in about the center of the beach. Even though the path to Las Gatas is short and partially on a road, a portion of it goes over some uneven rocks and should not be attempted by people with walking difficulties or balance issues.  A water taxi leaves from the dock in downtown Zihua, or a kayaking tour goes here as well. See Luis de la Maza\'s tours.

652790997.name: Nice family beach, great massage
652790997.author: a TripAdvisor user
652790997.reviewBody: Most folks get there by water taxi taking a small boat from the main pier but you can also walk on a rocky path going from the end of la rope beach. Fairly easy to do if you have any hiking abilities and takes about 15 minutes from the end of the beach. Las Gatas is a good beach for families with small children who like to hang in the first 1/2 of las gatas, with more adults going further down. Best massage I have ever had was behind the last restaurant on the beach. 300 pesos for more than and hour, very intuitive masseuse, ending with hot rocks. Very peaceful.

652539181.name: Playa Las Gatas
652539181.author: a TripAdvisor user
652539181.reviewBody: What an amazing day we had.  Luis was an exceptional host, who spent the day touring with us.  We where picked up at our villa and spent the rest of the day snorkeling and enjoying the sun.  Luis took care of everything, and is incredibly knowledgeable about the area.

651850340.name: Over rated Snorkelling
651850340.author: a TripAdvisor user
651850340.reviewBody:
Very shallow and minimal Fish
Rocky
Walked along the path which was not a problem, from La Ropa, and then went to the very end
Relaxed place but dont go for the snorkelling, but for the relaxed atmosphere

651594925.name: Relaxing day at the beach
651594925.author: a TripAdvisor user
651594925.reviewBody:
We rented a house in the Cerra del Vigia neighborhood about 1 mile from (and about 40p feet above) Playa Las Gatas, so we accessed the beach by simply walking down the Paseo de La Bahía Street and then down a steep dirt road to the beach. This access route may be a little challenging for some, but the beach is, more usually, very easily reached by a small flotilla of boats leaving nearly continuously from the main boat dock in Zihuatanejo. For 50 pesos per person round trip, you can have a 10 minute fun ride across the bay to reach this beach favored heavily by locals. As you walk from the Playa Las Gatas docks along the beach, you will pass many restaurants, each of which will have lounge chairs, cushions, and shading umbrellas freely available - with the promise of buying drinks and a meal sometime during the day.
