The iced drinks, we were told, were all made from purified water, and the ice  brought to this beach, so we enjoyed some very flavorful pina coladas. Most days we arrived in the late morning, and except on holiday weekends, were easily able to get “front row” beach seating. We enjoyed late lunches at both the Restaurant 3 Palms and Restaurante Oliverio, and found the bacon wrapped shrimp to be a treat, but also enjoyed the seafood stuffed fish. Beers were 30 pesos, cold, and served with a plate of lime slices. We were very pleased with the prices, particularly given that not only were the lounge chairs free, but also a large table adjacent to the chairs was made available for the day for eating and holding our bags and beach items off the sand. 

I also rented snorkeling gear and paddled out beyond the break water a few times to enjoy observing the plentiful and brightly colored fish. I was taken with the variety and quantity of fish, but some of my friends observed that the visibility is limited to 20 or 30 feet due to sand picked up by the wave action. Another way to snorkel is to join one of the entrepreneurs who have large boards an inflatables available for groups to hold on to and be escorted out beyond the breakwater. The bay was relatively tranquil on the days I visited, and the swim was short, so I “self-guided” my own experience. 

The one downside of the beach is that the sand yields to a more rocky bottom about 10 feet out from the shoreline, so wading needs to be done in waist deep water - or one needs to transition to swimming (or snorkeling) to be more fully submerged.

651139310.name: Snorkling, swimming and lots of Restaurants.
651139310.author: a TripAdvisor user
651139310.reviewBody: We went to Las Gatas after a big catch while fishing. It\'s accessible by foot however I would recommend the water Taxi.\nIt was Saturday and many local families were enjoying the swimming and snorkeling.  Our fish was prepared by Chris and his team. It was delicious. We have been to all the beaches in the area and this one was good but did not have the same sand. It was a great experience overall.

650732810.name: Pretty and Quiet Beach
650732810.author: a TripAdvisor user
650732810.reviewBody: It\'s fun to take the ferry to this little beach. Make sure you walk to the far end of the beach before deciding which beach chairs to sit in. As the sun moves during the day, you\'ll find that the beach near the pier gets full sun, but the far end has lots of shade. We like Ottilio\'s, the one with red umbrellas and pink tablecloths. David is our favourite waiter there. He\'s lots of fun and very attentive. Oh, and you don\'t have to pay for the chairs if you eat and drink at Otilios!

650608792.name: snorkelling at Las Gatas
650608792.author: a TripAdvisor user
650608792.reviewBody: We took a boat from Zihua pier to Las Gatas to go snorkeling.  Upon arriving, there is a long, skinny stretch of beach, that has lots of restaurant/bars, rentals,  shopping huts & vendors. We sat in front of Tres Palmeras, where we got a table, and some lounge chairs to enjoy the day. You  walk in from the beach on a sandy bottom to snorkel around a man made rock break, which has pretty good snorkeling. Also a very nice, gradual beach to swim at. We enjoyed a few buckets of beer, which were 120 pesos for 6 beer, and had lunch there. I enjoyed Las Gatas more than Ixtapa Island, simply because it is a nice sandy beach to  swim or snorkel. It was a relaxing, enjoyable afternoon.

650330733.name: A must see while in Zihuatenejo
650330733.author: a TripAdvisor user
650330733.reviewBody: If you have good foot ware you can walk from Playa La Ropa, but catching a boat from the pier is a nice experience.  The beach is narrow and you are pretty much forced to pay for shade and seating.  Nice clear water and different from any of the other beachs on the bay.  Go on a week day to avoid the masses.

649818767.name: We had a wonderful time.
649818767.author: a TripAdvisor user
649818767.reviewBody: Found a water taxi that would take us and pick us up- a party of 10. We left from La Ropa close to Rossy at 10 and he was right on time at 3. My only complaint was we ordered a seafood assortment and did not get our money\'s worth. We had a wonderful day together for most were going home on Saturday(this was Thursday). A perfect place to end our weeks together. There is no lack of assortment of restaurants to choose from.

649366756.name: AUTHENTIC!
649366756.author: a TripAdvisor user
649366756.reviewBody: This was an absolutely beautiful beach. Not alot of tourists there. There is a ferry that goes from the Zihua pier to Las Gatas. A good price is $50 pesos return per person. Some rich person built a rock water break so that there are no waves and kids could swim in the water. We were told Arnoldo\u2019s is the best restaurant. There is a Hotel California resort ruin if you continue walking through the beach along the shore. It was apparently the place to be in the 60\u2019s & 70\u2019s. A Frenchmen built it but because of the lawlessness in Mexico it was taken from him and no one knows what happened to the Frenchman.

648409438.name: Different beaches to choose from
648409438.author: a TripAdvisor user
648409438.reviewBody:
You can walk from Zihua, but it is rocky & you need good shoes. You can take a taxi to the boat shuttle, or you can take the local bus to the boat shuttle (cheap but not that frequent). The short ride, 50 pesos return, takes you to the small landing dock where you are asked to tip just for the ride or just for the hand, I'm not sure which. I ignored them.  Then you choose your beach: the first one is flat, sandy, and many people just stay here.  If you walk through the restaurant passageways to the other side, you find more seating, & a rocky beach.  This is where the snorkel reef is.  You can rent equipment, or even a guide, & get life vests & a board to hold.  We did this, & I'm glad because it was a windy day & the water wasn't very clear, so the guide knew where to go & brought some sea specimens up to us to see.  I'm told that it's less windy, therefore better visibility in the early part of the day. 
Winter storms affect the amount of sand on the other side, so that's why some people comment about the lack of sandy beach.  Food on the beach was beach food - lots of fried things. It was okay.  What you're paying for is the table with the umbrella.
It got windier, therefore more waves as the day went on.
The bathrooms we used were cleaned after every use - very impressive for a beach. Left a tip, which is expected.

648029776.name: Beautiful beach.
648029776.author: a TripAdvisor user
648029776.reviewBody: Several good restaurants at far side of the beach. Clear and calm water to swim. One of the restaurant is OTILIA, clean, good service and foods.

647868058.name: Great for an afternoon lunch and beach
647868058.author: a TripAdvisor user
647868058.reviewBody: Great place to visit during the day, several places to eat on the beach. Enjoy a beverage and the sandy beach\nYou can snorkel, but limited number of fish when we went.

647693078.name: Saw a sea snake!
647693078.author: a TripAdvisor user
647693078.reviewBody: Visibility was very poor beyond the reef so we did to go out to the Jesus statue, but saw a pair of Moorish Idols, a very large box fish and a sea snake. Snorkelling best closest to the pier though water is shallow.

646943183.name: Nice day trip
646943183.author: a TripAdvisor user
646943183.reviewBody: Really enjoyed our trip to this beach. The boat ride was quick and inexpensive. It was also a nice walk from our accommodations in Playa La Madera to the pier. We took our own snorkeling equipment but it could be easily rented when you arrive. We snorkelled on both sides of the pier at Las Gatas. Next time we will allow more time to make it out to the reef. We also enjoyed a wonderful lunch at one of the many restaurants on the beach. Be sure to take cash as not many (if any) can do electronic transactions. Would go again!

646814871.name: 5*...if you walk to the end!
646814871.author: a TripAdvisor user
646814871.reviewBody: At the farthest end, past all the beach restaurants , is a small crescent of sand lined with palm trees!  This spot is usually a great spot for a quiet nap, or a great snorkel! Bring water socks as bottom is rocky/coral and hard on your feet.  Water is clear and shallow!

646572935.name: Nice beach
646572935.author: a TripAdvisor user
646572935.reviewBody: Nice beach. Lots of rock and broken coral underfoot in the water. Apparently great place to snorkel. Did not try it. Plenty of bars and restaurants. Seems to be a beach popular with locals. Bring calloused feet or waterproof footwear. A few places have a good selection of \u201cwater shoes\u201d for sale.

646397551.name: Great for Snorkeling and food was excellent
646397551.author: a TripAdvisor user
646397551.reviewBody: We selected a restaurant along the beach and a table was provided for as long as we wanted.  We went snorkeling and when we can back the food and drinks were ready for us.  They provided a room for us to shower after our beach activities.  We\'re definitely going back.

646198872.name: Great beach day trip from Zihuatanejo
646198872.author: a TripAdvisor user
646198872.reviewBody: We spent 6 great days on the Playa la Ropa in Zihuatanejo. For something different we organized a boat with the carnciarge at our hotel for an afternoon on the beach at Playa Las Gatas. The beach was great and filled with locals enjoying a beautiful Sunday at the beach. We grabbed a water front table at Chez Arnoldo and we\u2019re treated to an excellent lunch of grilled fish and coconut shrimp. The tables were covered and offered protection from the sun but were just a few steps from the water. With an occasional drink spread over a few hours the restaurant was fine with us just spending the day. \nThe water was clear,the sand was perfect and the beach was well protected providing a nice snorkeling location.\nPlaya Las Gatas offers another option for a fun outing while enjoying time in Zihuatanejo!

645962709.name: Such a shame
645962709.author: a TripAdvisor user
645962709.reviewBody: Had seen many people going to Las Gates and heard from a few locals it was nice.\nThe water taxi was easy to get. Upon disbarking from the boat there are wooden planks to get up to walk way one was loose and slid my ankle and foot went through. It could of caused real damage I was lucky. The beach was full of shells and difficult to walk on. Attempt into the water where difficult because of all the big hard shells etc. I will not be returning or suggesting to others to go there much nicer beaches

643112009.name: Great beach
643112009.author: a TripAdvisor user
643112009.reviewBody: Amazing place. Food is great.  service is amazing. Water is calm and easy to swim in. Prices are good 120pesos for 6 beer.  Will be more than happy to go there again and again.

641223449.name: Waste of time
641223449.author: a TripAdvisor user
641223449.reviewBody: Everybody tries to sell tickets to this place, presumably because it needs all the help it can get.\n\nIt is extremely crowded; it is impossible to swim; agony awaits the feet of the paddler.

640784615.name: Isolated and lovely
640784615.author: a TripAdvisor user
640784615.reviewBody: Las Gatos is easiest to get to by water taxi, otherwise expect a 20 minute walk (No Roads). It is just delightful, what a beach in Mexico should be. A very small village, with multiple generations of families. Everyone is friendly, honest, fun loving, and pleasant to be around. A must place to visit!!

639211912.name: Great beach
639211912.author: a TripAdvisor user
639211912.reviewBody: We took the water taxi on our own then picked a restaurant to hang out on at the far end.  It was great and very relaxing.  If you buy drinks and/or food you can pretty much hang out at the restaurant all day.  Good but not excellent snorkeling.  The beach is a little rocky but beautiful.

638047504.name: Beautiful kayak destination as well as land
638047504.author: a TripAdvisor user
638047504.reviewBody: White sand beach with good restaurants.  If you kayak be sure to ask about the coral reef as you approach.  Many snorkelers on the north part of the beach.  Enter along the south shore to avoid the reef.

636317569.name: Many good things a few bad things
636317569.author: a TripAdvisor user
636317569.reviewBody: The view is stellar!  The food, drink and service was excellent.  The beach is rough and in the water is jagged and needed water shoes to truly enjoy.  Best beach view in Zihua though...

632529044.name: Out favorite beach in Zihuatanejo
632529044.author: a TripAdvisor user
632529044.reviewBody: We love to walk to this beach from our resort. Caution it is very rocky best in tennis shoes not flip flops. We always go to Ottilias and see Franco, they have the pink umbrellas 2 nd from end. He has our 12 man Seahawks flag flying. He always happy to see his returning customers. Immediately gets us a beverage and my favorite chair in the water. The water is calm and pretty shallow the waves break on a reef so it\u2019s perfect.

631509141.name: Best stretch of beach in Zihua
631509141.author: a TripAdvisor user
631509141.reviewBody: Idyllic spot. Clear and calm blue water, white sand beach with a nice selection of palapas serving good quality food and drink. What more can you ask for?!

627058670.name: Okay. Not great
627058670.author: a TripAdvisor user
627058670.reviewBody: You\'re hounded by salespeople and shysters from the minute you buy a water taxi ticket. The beach was good otherwise.

623538594.name: Playa Los Gatos
623538594.author: a TripAdvisor user
623538594.reviewBody: Booked a trip to Playa Los Gatos beach through our resort with tour guide named Luis. He was amazingly attentive, professional,  personal,  and had much knowledge of the local area to share. We felt so welcomed, and secure with Luis as our guide. He took complete charge of all the arrangements for our day at the beach. Had great grilled fish lunch under a shaded palapa, drinks, all with great service from Miguel our food server. Luis arranged for snorkeling equipment,  and guided us into the water to see the coral reef marine life. All great fun! Luis is absolutely the best. We will not hesitate to book more tours with Luis.

614729721.name: So beautiful but too many restaurants!
614729721.author: a TripAdvisor user
614729721.reviewBody: It was hard to find with all the growth but.... So happy to see the restaurant we visited over 3 different visits about 20 years ago still exists: Franco at the Otilian Restaurant offers stories, jokes, food, drinks, relaxation, clean bathrooms, hospitality like no other!\n\nBeautiful ... truly!!! Warm waters, coral reefs. What\u2019s not to love!!?

614149239.name: Beautiful beach, Not to spend all the day in
614149239.author: a TripAdvisor user
614149239.reviewBody: You can go there for a couple of hours, just go to Zihuatanejo and take a little boat by your self, you can arrive to the restaurant you want and eat anything you want.\nIf you take the tour, the force you to say there for more than 4 hours, eat in the restaurant they choose and pay a lot of money for that.\nWe take a tour with our little daughter and our guide was just running from one place to another, and we almost fall out of the boat, he was not helpful.

609717591.name: Don\u2019t bother
609717591.author: a TripAdvisor user
609717591.reviewBody: This day trip is a waste of time. We took the small boat over and upon arrival, found a sliver of a beach where you are forced to take  a seat at one of the restaurants. There is no other option. Beach was overcrowded. Water was extremely difficult to enter unless you are wearing water shoes because of the many many rocks. Only good part was the lunch at Otilios was excellent. I would head to La Ropa beach instead. Our first and last time at this place.

600481531.name: A perfect beach for family members.
600481531.author: a TripAdvisor user
600481531.reviewBody: This place is one of my favorite places at Earth. I just love that there is a wave breaker level. An archaic stone barrier was laid centuries ago by the native people. Nowadays, this construction houses an ecosystem for aquatic flora and fauna. The water waves are gentle, so parents need not to worry about the children. And there is no need to rent diving equipment to enjoy a reef view. I will absolutely will return to this place.

599345375.name: Great Beach, Great Food
599345375.author: a TripAdvisor user
599345375.reviewBody: We always visit Las Gatas while in Zihuatanejo.  The boat ride over is really nice (rustic but nice).  The beach is great for kids as the water is calm and transparent.  There are several restaurants to chose from, we always go to the 3rd one from the dock - they have amazing food!\nYou can also bring your own food to Las Gatas and have a picnic.

591996893.name: Hike Over and Taxi Back
591996893.author: a TripAdvisor user
591996893.reviewBody: Enjoyed a great 3.5 mile walk to las Gatas (go early to avoid heat) and even followed trails & rocks to the Pacific:-) Wear shoes, not flip flops. Had a chilled time with great food at Otilia\u2019s (ask for Franco). Shared a delicious plate of shrimp tacos! Plan on spending 4-5 hours there and catch a boat taxi (50 pesos/person) back.

589066783.name: Beautiful Beach
589066783.author: a TripAdvisor user
589066783.reviewBody: Everyone in our family gave this Beach either four or five stars.  There are plenty of places to have good food, great drinks an amazing view and awesome time!

588880045.name: Dated tourist trap
588880045.author: a TripAdvisor user
588880045.reviewBody: Lounge chairs, lined up like a sardines in a can are old, torn and dirty. Greasy chips and watery salsa returned\u2014inedible. Give this beach a miss!

588361691.name: Nice, but be ready
588361691.author: a TripAdvisor user
588361691.reviewBody:
Las Gatas was nice, and the boat ride there was nice as well. There are some "friendly locals" there to help you off the boat whether you need them or not. We did not need them, but they still asked for a tip from us (very tacky). Then the hassling starts....
There are a number of restaurants with umbrellas and lounge chairs all along the beach and each one has at least one "hype man" trying to get you to eat at their restaurant. Some guys even were there as soon as you left the dock (for the restaurants at the far end of the beach.
Speaking of the beach, there was very (and I mean VERY) little actually useable space as the waves would come right up to and through the lounge chairs.
The scenery was nice and the water was also nice, so I say just ok.

584150629.name: Beautiful playa
584150629.author: a TripAdvisor user
584150629.reviewBody: The best place to snorkel in Zihua.  Rentals available- snorkel, jet ski, banana boat, etc. Multiple places to eat, sit on the beach, and enjoy the sun. Somewhat of a hike over rocks from Playa la Ropa, or best water taxi from the marina.

583492914.name: Good food
583492914.author: a TripAdvisor user
583492914.reviewBody: We relaxed after eating and feasting on seafood.  We spent the afternoon bathing and sunbathing. Will recommended it to everyone.

580466492.name: Awesome experience!!
580466492.author: a TripAdvisor user
580466492.reviewBody: Great beach,great food, awesome hosts!!  Short boat taxi ride across. Great place to swim and snorkel!! Been there 4 years running!! : )

575274892.name: Las Gatas Otilia Restaurant
575274892.author: a TripAdvisor user
575274892.reviewBody: Had a wonderful day at Las Gatas at Otilias restaurant.  Franco greeted us literally with open arms!  Had chairs, table, umbrella and a bucket of beer within 5 minutes.  We walked from La Ropa and got there fairly early which I would recommend.  You can also take the water taxis to get there.  We were up for the adventure of walking the rocky trail. Not recommended for the older folks.  You need to wear aqua socks or sandals as the beach is a little rocky but the water is very clear.  We were visiting during the Mexican Holiday so it was very, very busy but fun and the people watching was fantastic.  The food at Otilias was wonderful and the beer was cold.  We spent most of the day there for about $45 US. I had payed attention to how many beers and checked the menu for prices.  When Franco brought us the bill it was exactly right!  He got a good tip!  We had been to Ixtapa Island earlier in the week and had a great time but they really messed up our bill and had overcharged us.  They corrected it but still....Highly recommend Otilias and we will be returning in 46 weeks!  See you then Franco!

574379953.name: Good swimming spot
574379953.author: a TripAdvisor user
574379953.reviewBody:
I came over with a tour, which is totally not necessary.  It would be super easy (and cheap) to do yourself.
The snorkeling was just ok.  A ton of different fish, but the reef is pretty much dead.
Water clarity in the morning was great, but as the day went on it got murky.  The actual reef is a bit small, especially with a ton of people in the water.
To swim and float around it is lovely.  Water is calm and warm.
We parked our stuff at the restaurant called Gloria en El Mar.  The owner was super nice and attentive.  You can rent snorkel gear in the back.  I just rented the mask (70 pesos).
Your bags and what not are safe to sit there on the chairs unattended.  
If you get bored of the water and suntanning, you can walk around the point through an old Jacques Cousteau outpost, and then on to a lighthouse.  You will need something on your feet.
If you are staying in Zihua, you probably do not need to come here, but for us folk staying in Ixtapa where the water is more lively, this is a nice calm beach/water.

573945470.name: Crowded Place!
573945470.author: a TripAdvisor user
573945470.reviewBody: Walked down to this beach to see what all the hype is about. If you want space and nice sand don\'t go here. It is a small beach area crowded with bars and chairs. And lots of rocks!

570295354.name: Nice beach with snorkel
570295354.author: a TripAdvisor user
570295354.reviewBody: Nice beach where you can snorkel, you can take your own or rent one a set for $60 pesos (got to leave an ID) or you can take the tour for about $100 and they will take to see the under water Cristo. Did not eat at the beach so I cannot tell you about prices or what to eat - sorry! Overall it\u2019s really calm waters!

569713974.name: Not bad snorkeling
569713974.author: a TripAdvisor user
569713974.reviewBody: We took a tour boat to the beach. There will be someone there to help you out of the boat and look for a tip. The food in the restaurant that was chosen for us was good food and we sat in their lounger. The breakwater gave the fish a great place to hang out and if you go beyond it, you can find a bell and a statue.

568430043.name: Away from everything
568430043.author: a TripAdvisor user
568430043.reviewBody: There is only 2 ways to get there, by small boat from pier(need to keep you ticket for return) and walking the trail from La Ropa(we have done it a couple of times)- you have to be in good physical condition with the trail ending at the pier. Once you get there, there is no lack of choices where to eat and spend the day in the sun- have not had a bad meal there.

567570484.name: nice beach
567570484.author: a TripAdvisor user
567570484.reviewBody: Relly good place to go snorkling lunch was good and you can stay all day at your table in the shade good drinks

566924603.name: Meh
566924603.author: a TripAdvisor user
566924603.reviewBody: This is a picturesque spot on Zihuatanejo Bay, which is accessible only by boat (50 pesos, round trip). We went out there to snorkel and, while there are fish, there are not so many, and the reef is dead. There are some scraggly plants coming out of the seafloor which are eaten by the fish. Snorkeling is complicated there, as there are skiffs coming and going through the area where people snorkel. I normally do not recommend a group snorkel tour, but I can say that it would have been helpful in this case, as the group I saw was much easier for boats to see than one snorkeler on his own. Furthermore one of the snorkeling attractions there is the sunken statue of Christ. In a group with lifejackets, it\u2019s safer to go out and see it. Otherwise I do not recommend it, due to the number of speeding skiffs.

566721130.name: Great Day Trip
566721130.author: a TripAdvisor user
566721130.reviewBody: We enjoyed our day at las gatas even though La Ropa is just as nice. Great food, people and service. Neat experience for the kids to talk the water taxi, snorkel and play in the sand.

566592175.name: Loved it
566592175.author: a TripAdvisor user
566592175.reviewBody: The best part of las gatas was George and Israel. We went on a snorkeling trip and Israel bent backwards to please us. My friend doesn\u2019t swim and he made sure went in with her so she could enjoy the experience ( she had a life jacket but was terrified to put her head in water and relax) Israel put her on another life jacket and pulled her around in the water and taught her how to relax and use the snorkeling gear to see the fish. I\u2019ve never see such attentive crew. George was very informative and recommended some great and cheaper restaurants. Can\u2019t wait to go back.

566122368.name: Fun way to spend a day.
566122368.author: a TripAdvisor user
566122368.reviewBody: Grab a water taxi & zip over to Playa Las Gatas for the day. Some people say it\'s a waste of time, but it\'s a nice change. Don\'t go on a weekend, it\'s just too busy but during the week it\'s ok. Go down to the 2nd last restaurant, the one with the fake poinsettias, cheap cold beer and great coconut shrimp...just saying;)

565929587.name: Wonderful wonderful!
565929587.author: a TripAdvisor user
565929587.reviewBody: This is a great beach for snorkelling! You will find fish of every color shape and size! The only negative is you have to take a water taxi there and back, cost is reasonable, (50 peso per person) they have many beach restaraunt s, with loungers available if you eat and drink,  with great service! Most have clean bathrooms with showers,

565915055.name: Perfect brach for young kids
565915055.author: a TripAdvisor user
565915055.reviewBody: Long beach (but not so large) with tipical restaurants.\nPositive point is the stone barrier which cuts waves and allows you to let your young kids plays quietly in the sea while uou are at the restaurant.\nBeach almost accessible only by boat which create a small original cruise across the Zihua bay.

565316262.name: Good Hike
565316262.author: a TripAdvisor user
565316262.reviewBody: Hiked from Playa Ropa to Playa gatas as far as we could. Went in Back of restaurants to hike trail to lighthouse but it was blocked by construction. Lots of activities happen there. The surf is gentle and shallow which makes it quite inviting.

565081294.name: Pretty but rustic
565081294.author: a TripAdvisor user
565081294.reviewBody: We popped over on a Monday by way of the ferry. The ride over is nice and quick but you kind of get bombarded upon arrival with people plugging their restaurant. That\u2019s fine but when we did go with one guy who assured us of all it\u2019s qualities we found that much was lacking. I am not reviewing that particular restaurant because it was the case with all of them...limited beer choice, no wine, scaled back menus. Maybe because it was a Monday? Who knows? We stayed for about 45 minutes and took the path back to Playa la Ropa, which by the way is perfectly easy in flip flops.

564663892.name: Swim here, it is better than la Ropa
564663892.author: a TripAdvisor user
564663892.reviewBody: The water here is still clean and not polluted by run off from the city+s sewage plant. Go find Christian in the middle of the beach, he and his staff will take care of you. Safe beach for kids and accessable by boat from the main dock in Zihaut.

564068859.name: Nice place to soak up the sun.
564068859.author: a TripAdvisor user
564068859.reviewBody: We walked to this beach from our hotel.  It is easy to find a chair and a place to eat and get great drinks.  We found a place that had a huge plate of coconut shrimp and great quality Margaritas.  We went snorkeling and were able to see quite a few fish.  I would recommend going during the week and the weekends tend to be very busy.  The water is warm and very calm.

563933296.name: Las Gata.....my as....
563933296.author: a TripAdvisor user
563933296.reviewBody: I spend the whole winter a few minutes from Las Gatas. I look at it all day. I am here every year. What is there? Nothing. It is a big joke. A big hoax. There are seven beaches in our bay of Zihuatanejo. This one has sticky, grey sand, like river sand that would have been trucked in. There is no room on the beach to lay down a towel, it is bumper to bumper cafes and restaurants heckling, hey, my friend, come here....not very peaceful. But the worse is yet to come. You can\'t go in the water without shoes, it is all rocks, everywhere. For people who travel to it, one way or the other, there is a nice view of the rest of the bay, but it is really, as we say, a big joke.

563773503.name: Beach bars- skip the snorkeling
563773503.author: a TripAdvisor user
563773503.reviewBody: Many bars packed next to each other. Take your chair into the water to soak up the sun. Skip the offer to snorkel. There are NO FISH left because of their kill every fish no matter how small it is mentality.

562601920.name: Great Beach
562601920.author: a TripAdvisor user
562601920.reviewBody:
We had a few days of fun at Messiah's on Playa Las Gatas and would love to return here again. 
A quick 50 peso boat ride ( lots of fun ) from Zihua pier and there you are. 
There are many great beach front restaurants with food that will blow your mind and cold cervezas to make your day a happy one.
A nice small coral reef for snorkeling, banana boats and personal water craft rentals and family fun all around.

562515995.name: a small beach off the bay protected from large waves by the reef
562515995.author: a TripAdvisor user
562515995.reviewBody: Los Gatos is our absolute favorite. It is rocky so water shoes are a must. You can swim or snorkel or just pull a chair down to the water and soak in the sun. Lots of great places to eat and to visit with other travelers.

562154617.name: Total relaxation, with drinks
562154617.author: a TripAdvisor user
562154617.reviewBody: We walked there from the south end of Playa Ropa, but if you are in Zehuatinejo, you can take the pangas from there. go the the end to Armandos. Good food and drinks

561786525.name: Fernando\'s Beach restaraunt
561786525.author: a TripAdvisor user
561786525.reviewBody:
One of our favourite spots. Fernando cooks the fish of the day...excellent. The last restaurant on the beach so you have less traffic. You need beach shoes due to the sharp coral. 
Pink chairs that you sit on in the water, loungers and tables for a couple/ group of 4.

561730235.name: Stop in at Los Mangles
561730235.author: a TripAdvisor user
561730235.reviewBody: Great family owned place. The food is great and drinks are cold. Excellent margaritas! It\'s about half way down the beach. You can swim or just sit and enjoy the view.

561316530.name: Awesome Beach
561316530.author: a TripAdvisor user
561316530.reviewBody: What a great beach \nBeautiful clear calm water and great for swimming or snorkeling if you go farther out

561147314.name: Fun day on the beach
561147314.author: a TripAdvisor user
561147314.reviewBody: Just a quick lil boat ride from the Zihua pier. Only 50 pesos, without a tip. Beach bars closest to the dock, have a sandier beach, than the ones farther down.

560922386.name: Lovely Day, Not Many Fish
560922386.author: a TripAdvisor user
560922386.reviewBody:
The sound of this beach was great!  We were told it was calm due to a breakwater/reef and that there are stingrays and puffer fish to be seen at this location.  The beach attraction is quiet and relaxing. We are a family of four on a seven-day vacation.

On this particular day, the water was murky, wavy and there was very little fish to be seen. There were no stingray's or puffer fish to be found.  However, if you are interested in seeing the statue of Jesus under water then this is the place.

The beach itself was nice, although more pebbly/broken shells than I expected.  The restaurant we ate at was really good, the food was fresh and plentiful. In addition, to a beautiful view and warm day that was the highlight for us.  

We had been to Ixtapa Island a few days earlier and the kids were in the water most of the time, on this trip, they used their snorkel gear for about an hour and didn't head back into the water after lunch.  

I am sure there are other days when there are lots of fish to find, just not on this day, however, if you are looking for a more relaxing visit to a beach then this is a great location.

Tip: Don't rush into snorkeling ask questions first or wait a bit before heading out so you can see what the water is like yourself.

560921017.name: Nice family beach
560921017.author: a TripAdvisor user
560921017.reviewBody: Great beach for snorkeling in and around the reef. Lots of families and crowded on weekends. Calm swimming area inside the reef but water can be quite dirty on weekends when families with young kids are there. East to get to by boat from the dock at Zijuataneho, 50 pesos return. Lots of beach restaurants and vendors

560545258.name: Great beach day getaway
560545258.author: a TripAdvisor user
560545258.reviewBody: This is a great day trip...beautiful crystal clear water in a protected bay. Many restaurants along the water that offer free chairs if you eat and/or drink with them. For the more adventurous folks...you can trek over from Los Ropas beach on the \u201cgoat trail\u201d or take the water taxi from the pier.

560422915.name: CHEZ ARNOLDO
560422915.author: a TripAdvisor user
560422915.reviewBody: I would have to say this place is the only place to visit on the island. I have visited this restaurant for 27 years and never been disappointed.go there and Ask for Chay.

559078588.name: Tourist Trap
559078588.author: a TripAdvisor user
559078588.reviewBody: If you like crowds of people this is the place for you! We did have a good lunch at one of the restuarants that was good but slow service to cook the food.

558891994.name: Fun for a change but rocky in the ocean
558891994.author: a TripAdvisor user
558891994.reviewBody: It\'s fun to take a water taxi over here for the day. There are loads of restaurants clamoring for you to set up for the day with them. You can hang out in beach chairs in the water and get some tasty food. You do need to wear beach shoes though as the bottom is rocky.

558702858.name: Kayak, Hobie or Public Ferry ~ This is the sweetest spot for a family day of fun
558702858.author: a TripAdvisor user
558702858.reviewBody: Many great food vendors, shopping for all things local and the mode of transportation is your choice. We love to rent kayaks and paddle over from Playa La Ropa. Restaurant vendors will help you land and usher you to a lovely lounge for bevies and lunch. Many are good but Franco at Ottillas is one of our favorites.

557773938.name: Sand campers
557773938.author: a TripAdvisor user
557773938.reviewBody: Lots of folks go to the beach to swim or snorkel- we went to sit & drink. Well, we ate too!  Perfect spot to do nothing & people watch. Pick any restaurant along the shore guaranteed fresh sea food & cold beers.  We sat for about 4 hours whiling away time. There are vendors, but that\u2019s to be expected every where. I did look at some amazing jewellery. Go & enjoy your holiday

557767678.name: fun to take a water taxi to this beach and snorkel
557767678.author: a TripAdvisor user
557767678.reviewBody: bring water shoes.  The bottom is rocky - like sharp rocks.  \ngo out to the edge of the rocks to snorkel - it\'s not great snorkeling, but it\'s still fun.  LOTS of people there - it is not remote at all.  But it\'s fun - I would say do it.

556988430.name: The pink umbrellas
556988430.author: a TripAdvisor user
556988430.reviewBody: We always have to go over to Las Gatas either by water taxi or cool hike. Never have eaten anywhere except The Pink Umbrellas also know by it\'s name Otillos. Franco is the manager and everyday is the same for Franco. Everything is Okee Dokee!\nTry the coconut shrimp, lobster tacos, and of course Margaritas. You won\'t be sorry for spending an afternoon with Franco

556330932.name: Christmas Day 2017
556330932.author: a TripAdvisor user
556330932.reviewBody: Had a great visit Christmas Day. Buy the ticket at the window on the dock so you can use any taxi to go and return not have to wait for a specific one. Parked it at a great restaurant on the beach (forgot which one but had red table clothes and umbrellas) being Christmas Day it was a set menu with different levels it was about 80$ (us) for a huge banquet that fed all 9 of us with leftovers. I think we spend 50$ in drinks \ud83c\udf79 We snorkeled-you can rent equipment for 5$ but we had our own and even with all the traffic and chaos of people there were a lot of fish by the human built rock break(Angels, puffers and other cool stuff surprisingly) we swam out  to see the Jesus statue - you can pay for a tour but we are very comfortable in the water and strong swimmers so for us it was really easy. The bottom of the statue is maybe 30 feet down to the bottom about 15 feet to his head maybe depending upon tide. It\u2019s pretty funny to see Jesus just hanging out underwater:-) It was crowded but we truly enjoyed our Christmas Day. I would definitely go again.

556117081.name: Excursion with Luis kayaking and snorkeling
556117081.author: a TripAdvisor user
556117081.reviewBody: Perfect day kayaking to Los Gatos beach. Snorkeling-saw tons of beautiful Fisk. No coral just volcanic rock. Lunch at Jose\u2019s with tuna steak and fun drinks\ud83e\udd2a\ud83d\ude0e\u2600\ufe0f

554515460.name: Not Impressed, but good for kids
554515460.author: a TripAdvisor user
554515460.reviewBody: Touted as the \u201cgo-to\u201d place for snorkeling, we were frankly a bit disappointed.  First the restaurant hosts were pushier than the other beaches (and that takes a bit of doing) and the area gets a copious stream of visitors pouring off of the water taxis from Zihua. The snorkeling was mostly sandy bottom in the breakwater and transitioned to mostly boulders outside. There are enough fish to be entertained, but little coral or pretty much anything else. That said, this is a great beach to bring small children and for beginning snorkelers. It is sheltered from any large surf and the beach is mostly sandy and gentle. Little kids love it here.

554296437.name: Christmas Eve
554296437.author: a TripAdvisor user
554296437.reviewBody: We visited Playa Las Gatas during the day of Christmas Eve.  Earlier in the morning it was less crowded but still hopping.  By mid afternoon navigating was a challenge. \n\nBeach was beautiful, well protected and super kid friendly.  Tons of activities in and out of the water.  Some of the best Mexican beachfront restaurants ever can be found here.

552316715.name: Beech day
552316715.author: a TripAdvisor user
552316715.reviewBody: We went there for Carlos scuba, the beech is BUSY but lots of nice sand and clear water.\nLots of boat taxis to take you there and back.

551501431.name: Swarms of people, polluted
551501431.author: a TripAdvisor user
551501431.reviewBody:
We spent a day here expecting to have a quiet & tranquil experience snorkeling & relaxing. Sadly, we were disappointed. The beach is over-developed with restaurants side-by-side, with a minimum of 200 pesos/person to use their chairs to sit by the beach. 
For the snorkeling, there is no more coral here, as it’s all been trampled upon by the swarms of tourists & locals. What coral there is, is all bleached out & grey. As a result, there are no fish. 
However the beach is a party zone, loud music at each restaurant, tons of festive drinking and partying. If this is something you might want for an afternoon- this is the place to go. 
For ourselves- we will not return.

551501403.name: A sea of humanity, not fish!!
551501403.author: a TripAdvisor user
551501403.reviewBody: Unfortunately, humans have ruined this little paradise. With masses of people, bleached out coral, restaurants galore, hawkers and music the fish have taken off for higher, more hidden seas!  I am sure this bay was a snorkeling stunner years ago, however that is no longer the case. So don\u2019t go for the fish, go for the scene. You can get a beach table at a restaurant for 200 pesos each with the caveat you eat at least that amount at the Restaurant. We had a view of it all, with great ceviche, people watching and a family party atmosphere. Catch a boat from the pier for 50 pesos each and you are there. Go for the sea of humanity, not the fish!

551385575.name: Popular for snorkelling
551385575.author: a TripAdvisor user
551385575.reviewBody: Our hotel was on Playa la Ropa so we sailed over to Las Gatas to check out the snorkelling. There are many restaurants so you can go for lunch too. It is quite crowded, but snorkelling is good. You need water shoes!

551221663.name: A beautiful beach to spend quite a few hours enjoying and eating!
551221663.author: a TripAdvisor user
551221663.reviewBody: We always spend 3 to 6 hours every trip on Las Gatas.  We always go the the same vendor because we have become friends over the years with David at Ottilias which is almost at the end of the beach.   The food is delicious and the service could not be any better.  The bacon wrapped shrimp are my favorite!

550756904.name: Relaxing days on Playa Las Gatas
550756904.author: a TripAdvisor user
550756904.reviewBody: This is a beach that curves directly across Zihuatanejo Bay from the downtown area of the town. I loved the low key quality of the restaurants with their lounging beach chairs, where you can spend the entire day relaxing and swimming while ordering food and drinks as needed. The waiters are very friendly and professional and were easy to speak with on any subject. I sat under the awning, out of the sun the whole time and spread out on a table with my water colors and drawing tools. There was zero hassle from the waiters who were accommodating the whole day as I took over a table to paint. As usual, in Mexico, many people were curious about my painting, totally open and friendly, and easy to make friends with. The water is very swimmable and warm - totally relaxing days at Las Gatas.

550193198.name: Mangles Restaurant is the spot!!
550193198.author: a TripAdvisor user
550193198.reviewBody: You arrive to this beautiful destination via boat paying 50 pesos round trip. Once you get there everyone will tell you the lounge chairs are reserved. No one had room. It is a pretty crowded beach and no one has beach chairs available. Most restaurants o my have tables and reg chairs. If your looking to sun bathed then this is not the spot. After looking around we were approached by Misael who went above and beyond by placing a table and two chairs in the front of beach. To top it off he also placed a small lounge chair for my 2 year old. No one else had that courtesy. For this simple reason we decided to stay. Overall the beach is clean and def recommend it for little ones. The beach is extremely clean and shallow. If you have little kids this is the beach to be at.

548124550.name: Fun and crazy
548124550.author: a TripAdvisor user
548124550.reviewBody: Pick a restaurant, they will take care of you for the day...anything...sorkling, food, showers...just ask !

547942836.name: Idyllic but busy
547942836.author: a TripAdvisor user
547942836.reviewBody: Plenty busy on the weekends but still enough room to have an uncrowded swim. Dark firm sand. Clear water with a good visibility for snorkeling. No issues with stingers or blue bottles(Australians know what I mean). Once cooled off only a short walk to shops, cafe\'s and restaurants. Only a 10 minute walk from most resorts. It does get hilly once away from the beach so wear appropriate footwear. And pack suncreen. Even in December the sun still packs a punch.\nAa bit sad was seeing the smount of plastic pollution that has washed up on shore. I think council needs to address this with a sand skimming vehicle to pick up and remove the debris from the beach and walkways.

547923898.name: Hidden Gem!
547923898.author: a TripAdvisor user
547923898.reviewBody: Walk the distance of Playa La Ropa and then along the rocks to find Playa Las Gatas!  This is a small beach with vendors and spots to eat and relax.  You will love the local flavor and friendly people.

547065248.name: We took a water taxi from the pier cost 50 pesos PP round trip
547065248.author: a TripAdvisor user
547065248.reviewBody: Once we arrived we walked the beach and picked out some chairs sorry I do not know there name we had lunch and drinks and used the chairs all day the water is great for swimming and also for Snorkeling

546307547.name: Madhouse
546307547.author: a TripAdvisor user
546307547.reviewBody: Weekend in December. Basically standing room only. Water all churned so no snorkelling. Brutal. Rocky and corally- bring water shoes. Or, skip it. A metre of sand and twenty of restaurant tables. Nowhere to sit down, literally, unless you buy something.

546102472.name: Must visit
546102472.author: a TripAdvisor user
546102472.reviewBody:
Terrific location.

The views back at Zihuatanajo alone are worth the visit, but we also enjoyed some swimming in calm seas.  There are a few small tropical fish in the waters, and many pelicans on the rocks near by. 

We'll visit again.

544905921.name: Definitely worth the trip
544905921.author: a TripAdvisor user
544905921.reviewBody: We took the 7 minute water taxi to Playa Las Gatas and were not disappointed.  So close to Playa La Ropa yet so different!  We didn\'t snorkel, but we walked from one end to the other (10 minutes) then sat down for a cold beer and watched everyone having fun in the water. Great way to spend part of a day!

544514035.name: Beautiful beach, and some snorkeling!
544514035.author: a TripAdvisor user
544514035.reviewBody: A very small beach on the south end of Zihuatanejo Bay.  I always traveled here by walking the rocky path- others take the water taxi.  Once you are hear the waters are calm and the fish are plentiful when you dawdle along the rocky areas and check out the life here.

544066869.name: Best snorkeling of my life!
544066869.author: a TripAdvisor user
544066869.reviewBody: Walk all the way to the end to avoid crowds, grab a seat, order some drinks and snorkel your heart out! We decided to go out with a guide and we\'re glad we did! We never would\'ve found the giant Jesus statue without a guide, it\'s further out than you\'d expect. And the guide over turned rocks and handed us star fish and a puffed up blow fish, it was the most amazing snorkeling experience of our lives! Not to be missed!

543894472.name: Beach bar
543894472.author: a TripAdvisor user
543894472.reviewBody: Take the water taxi over and enjoy your day at the beach.  Reasonable food and drinks on a beautiful beach with great views back towards Zihuatanejo.

543381285.name: Beautiful Beach, but very busy and commercialized.
543381285.author: a TripAdvisor user
543381285.reviewBody: We made the trip, and glad we did just to see it.  We took a private water taxi cruise around the bay (350 Pesos) on the way, which was peaceful and gave us a nice view nice view of all of the resorts.  Las Gatas is a very pretty setting, but way too commercialized and busy for us.  We went on a Friday.  We walked the full length of the beach and back, had two beers, and called our ride to come pick us up an hour later. Be prepared to tip those helping you on and off the water taxis at the docks, as well as the "Captain" of the boat.  They have no problem harassing you if you don\'t.  Glad we went, once...

543232435.name: ...just a water taxi ride away and you\'re at restaurant row of the jungle.
543232435.author: a TripAdvisor user
543232435.reviewBody: For about 100-200 pesos (depending on where you start your ride...you can be transported to Las Gatas...where the beachfront is lined with restaurants with local flavors...each restauranteur is friendlier than the next.  We ended up stashing our day bag full of dive gear with the merchant and taking a hike around the point to the lighthouse, then returning to eat a fantastic warm seafood stew out of a grilled pineapple!\n(It was enough to share and DELICIOUS! This was the very last restaurant at the end of the beach)   The beach is littered with coral but safe to have kids and families swim and bathe.....OH, and the locals will call a water taxi to take you home....

542843061.name: Too crowded for us
542843061.author: a TripAdvisor user
542843061.reviewBody:
Unfortunately, we had a very different experience than many reviews. We must’ve picked the wrong day to visit Las Gatas because the day we arrived, it was packed! 
Per the recommendation of other reviews, we made our way to Otilia only to find every single table occupied and not a single staff person in site to assist. With nowhere to sit and, honestly, nowhere to swim (let alone snorkel) we walked the length of the beach before twice before returning to the water taxi and heading home. 
We also had a negative experience with the water taxi. Unlike some reviews, the men helping at both docks were very, very pushy about tips. On our return trip, we loaded onto the boat and started to pull away from the dock but then idled in the bay for at least 15 minutes, presumably waiting to pick up more passengers (there were 7 on the boat but room for up to 10). After picking up two more passengers (who were also heavily harassed for tips) we finally completed the return trip.
All in all, the most disappointing day of our week in Zihuatanejo

541628638.name: Super service at Otilia Restaurant.
541628638.author: a TripAdvisor user
541628638.reviewBody: My girlfriends and I lounged on beach loungers at Otilia restaurant (the one with Seahawks flag). Super service and great margs to drink. Water is turquoise and super warm.

541457826.name: Kick back and enjoy
541457826.author: a TripAdvisor user
541457826.reviewBody: Spent one afternoon there after fishing in the morning.  Set up at Amados they fixed our fish and we sat on the beach and soaked up the sun and drank some beer. Waiter was courteous and not pushy

540679333.name: Snorkeling and under water Christ statue!
540679333.author: a TripAdvisor user
540679333.reviewBody: Playa Las Gatas was absolutely beautiful, the water was so clear and there were so many fish of different colors all around.  We met a guy in town before the dock where you take a boat to Las Gatas and neighboring beaches, his boat was the Mercy I boat which we rented as a private boat just for us since it was our honeymoon. The driver took us out to Manzanillo snorkeled and fished and from there we went straight to Las Gatas where they cook the fish you just caught.  At Las Gatas I met a guy who took me snorkeling to see the underwater statue of Christ, a bell and the most beautiful colorful fish I have seen.  My guide took underwater photos of me holding a sea urchin both the black and pink kind, a starfish, and a snail this was definitely an experience. \nWe ate at the first restaurant called Coco Loco the very first restaurant you see when you come onto the beach the food is less expensive and we recommend the fish cooked a la brasa with shrimp al ajillo and shrimp a la diabla! I also recommend grabbing some fresh caught oysters from a man who sets up right on the rocks in front of the rocks, delish! Outstanding food and service here the food takes a while but definitely worth the way just take a dip while you wait. The water is very warm and the beach if filled with locals it\'s nice to be around locals for a change.

538505756.name: A good day at the beach
538505756.author: a TripAdvisor user
538505756.reviewBody: Accessible only by boat, Las Gatas is right in the main Zihua Bay, but you feel a little more remote and more in tune with typical Mexico. The little beach restaurants are all alike, but equally fun, accommodating and appreciative of your business. Eat and drink like you\'re on vacation! The water is calm and perfect for wading and splashing.

533750621.name: Beautiful beach only a water taxi away!
533750621.author: a TripAdvisor user
533750621.reviewBody: We visited multiple beaches while here in Zihuatanejo and this by far was our favorite beach.  It was less crowded, although less beach front to go along with that but worth the water taxi ride ($50 pesos included round trip), snorkel, paddle board, fish and best of all, drinks along the beach!  You will need to bring pesos as a lot of the vendors do not accept Visa or MasterCard!

533586879.name: gorgeous beach and the best sea food restaurants
533586879.author: a TripAdvisor user
533586879.reviewBody: We loved our aftrenoon on this beach. I have to say it is off season so ther were only about 5o tourists and can not imagine it to be crowded!\nWe had fantastic and cheap seafood at chez Arnoldo. And the best massage so far in mexico from Bertha (accually her daughter). Only 250 pesos for an hour incuding a facial mask!

532912710.name: Best beach in Zihua!
532912710.author: a TripAdvisor user
532912710.reviewBody: We loved loved loved this beach. Water taxi ride was fun over and cost one hundred pesos for two people. Sand is finer and the water clearer than the other beaches in Zihua. Reminds me of the Bahamas and has mangroves. We went and stayed at the restaurant at the very end where there were less people.

527433448.name: Z 2017
527433448.author: a TripAdvisor user
527433448.reviewBody: Walked the beach this morning, took the water taxi over to the marina downtown Z.  Will go back for a beach day before we leave!

517532628.name: wonderful spot
517532628.author: a TripAdvisor user
517532628.reviewBody: quiet, clean and beautiful beach. The water is crystal clear, you can snorkel or do other aquatic sports

501731574.name: LOVELY SNORKLING SPOT
501731574.author: a TripAdvisor user
501731574.reviewBody: A short ride from  the pier next to the PLAYA PRINCIPAL, there is a beautiful spot to go spend a day, SNORKLE, SWIM AND SNOOZE

495484782.name: Beautiful but crowded and very touristy even in low season
495484782.author: a TripAdvisor user
495484782.reviewBody:
Went during low season. A mixed bag. 

The water is warm and crystal clear. The views of the surrounding mountains are breathtaking. You can get good snorkling deals, we paid some agency at the beach 80 pesos for a 45 min tour, saw some fishes, coral and the Christ statue. Quite limited visibility and certainly not worth the 250 pesos we were quoted by others. 

Las Gatas is quite a small beach. However I'd say it is unusually touristy even for Mexico with insistent hawks constantly trying to get you to consume in their restaurants or sell you stuff/tours and ask for tips for any miniscule service in a rather aggressive way. 

Prices are OK, not too inflated, yet remember Americans customary tipping in Mexico is 10-15%, not more, unless of course the service is excellent.

Overall a great place to relax and even more so if you are tolerant with street vendors... find some calm restaurant not too close to the middle of the beach and you'll have a good time.

493076921.name: Interesting place to visit
493076921.author: a TripAdvisor user
493076921.reviewBody: Las Gatas is a strip of beach in Zihuatanejo Bay.  It is lined with a bunch a different restaurants that offer beachside service.  There are also vendors that walk along the beach selling goods.  I found it to be very difficult to walk into the water unless you had on flip flops or water shoes.  The coral and rocks are not for those with sensitive feet - although the locals come in and out of the water as if there were no rocks.  This girl nearly fell over in pain from the rough bottom.  There is also a sunken statue of Jesus in the water (marked with a milk carton) near where the water taxis dock.  Could be a very spiritual experience for those that believe.

490153072.name: Family
490153072.author: a TripAdvisor user
490153072.reviewBody: I went with my family, the place it\'s really nice and the water looks so clean. To get there any boat could take you with $600 pesos. Total recommend to visit!

489444265.name: Beautiful Beach
489444265.author: a TripAdvisor user
489444265.reviewBody: Great beach. Blue water. Snorkeling. Fun water taxi ride for $100 pesos round trip for two. We loved it.\ud83d\udc20

485111757.name: Something to do
485111757.author: a TripAdvisor user
485111757.reviewBody: It cost 50 pesos to go from the pier at the end of Zihua to this beach.... make sure you bring your water shoes, this beach is NOT sand.  ( I did not =( .   We went all the way to the end with endless offers to come drink and eat.  The beer was reasonable, having to transport it over and don\'t forget to bring your own water to drink.

483846519.name: Great Beach
483846519.author: a TripAdvisor user
483846519.reviewBody: We had a day trip to Zihuatanejo from Ixtapa.  Nice lunch and swim at the beach.  Great food at Coc Loco.  Worth the ride from Ixtapa.

483331799.name: Interesting busy beach
483331799.author: a TripAdvisor user
483331799.reviewBody: Busy beach filled with local and tourists.  Restaurants galore. Lots of water sports activities. Plenty of snorkel rentals. We tried snorkel, water was wild and not a lot of things to see underwater.

482781364.name: Walk to end of beach and spend the day at Otilia\'!
482781364.author: a TripAdvisor user
482781364.reviewBody: Spent the day at Otilia\'s and Franco took good care of us! Good food and Franco had a special vegetarian meal made for me served in a grilled pineapple. Hooked my husband up with local cigars too! Look for the red umbrellas at almost the furthest end of beach from the pier. Bring water sandels, some shells and stones in the water but the beach is pure sand.

479179435.name: You have to visit Las Gatos Beach just once it is Beautiful!!!!!
479179435.author: a TripAdvisor user
479179435.reviewBody: The beach and the food is wonderful at Las Gatos, you have to visit this beach just once to get the full effect of Zihuatanejo!!!!

477541999.name: Nice beaxh
477541999.author: a TripAdvisor user
477541999.reviewBody: Nice beach, but extremely busy. White sand with clear blue water. Not much to do besides snorkel or swim. Restaurants are fairly expensive.\nWater taxi is fun and cheap though! 50 pesos

477293629.name: Favorite :)
477293629.author: a TripAdvisor user
477293629.reviewBody: Best snorkeling beach in zihua! You can go see the Rey de Reyes the underwater statue! There is lots of great service up and down the beach! Only way to get to las gatas is by boat taxi though which is a small fair fee, margaritas and buckets of beer everywhere :)

476104871.name: lunch place
476104871.author: a TripAdvisor user
476104871.reviewBody: good place to go over for lunch - rocky walk but doable.  swimming over a good way to get there.  rather crowded and it\'s a small place but worth visiting

475808442.name: Nice place to snorkel
475808442.author: a TripAdvisor user
475808442.reviewBody: Great place to snorkel.  No need to book an excursion or have them do a tour for you...they will offer at the beach.  Took a water taxi from Zihuat.  100 pesos for two...plus the inevitable tips.  Rented the snorkel gear....another 100 pesos and went out to the reef.  We picked Otilias to put down our stuff and rent the gear.  Your things are safe there and the food and drink are good.  Go early, as it does get crowded.  Also, outside of snorkeling and lying in the sun, the beach there is very rocky and hard on the bare feet.  You really need swim shoes.  It is also very shallow and rocky for at least a hundred years out in the water.  Just for playing on the beach?  Go to Playa la Ropa.

475551472.name: Don\'t Miss Playa Las Gatas
475551472.author: a TripAdvisor user
475551472.reviewBody: Playa Las Gatas is a not to miss desitination for us when we visit Zihuatanejo. It\'s a 15 minute walk from the resorts on Playa La Ropa, or a five minute boat ride. The beach is sponsored by a collection of restaurants that have beach lounge chairs, tables umbrellas etc. You use their chairs and they keep you lubiurcated and fed throughout the day. Our favorite location is Otilia\'s which is at the far end of the beach as you hike in. There is a trail that runs from the south end of Playa la Ropa. I recommend that you wear sneakers and take your sandels or water shoes as the trail can be a little rough. A full day of drinking and eating for four adults will run you about $2,000 pesos ($110) for beers, cocktails and a hearty lunch. The boat ride back is about $200 pesos ($11) for a group of 4). The staff is friendly and very attentive. I recommend taking cash.\n\nTake note that the beach is sandy but walking out into the bay requires water shoes as the bottom is a combination or rocks, gravel and coral debris. Depending on water conditions, the snorkeling is decent, lot\'s of tropical on the inside of the breakwater. There are larger fish on the outside of the breakwater but the visibility can be hit or miss. There is a statue under water out near the boat moorings on the outside of the breakwater.

474839521.name: Midweek at Playa Las Gatas
474839521.author: a TripAdvisor user
474839521.reviewBody: Unbelievable experience in beach side service and food. My only regret is we did not have enough cash to fully compensate our host/waiter and owner of Gloria en la Mar.

474812251.name: Go for Jesus
474812251.author: a TripAdvisor user
474812251.reviewBody: Las Gatas is nice but frankly La Ropa is just as nice and more convenient.  It is fun to get out on the water to get to Las Gatas and everyone needs to dive down to see Jesus but frankly it is a small beach with lots of restaurants.  Great fresh seafood, clean but lots of "people".  Great for a day if you are staying off the beach in Ixtapa.

474267328.name: Lobster on the beach!!
474267328.author: a TripAdvisor user
474267328.reviewBody: We walked to Las Gatas from Medano beach. It was an energetic walk, up and down over the rocks, about 1/2 and hour.  It wasn\'t difficult, we did have tennis shoes on, which I\'d say is a requirement, but some climbing up and down.  When we got to the beach, we stopped at the 2nd or 3rd little restaurant on the beach.  I can\'t remember his name, but he was congenial and welcomed us in, sat us down at a covered table and got us reclining chairs to sit in the sun also for us.  We sat all day, eating and having a few cold beers. The best meal I have ever had, was his specialty for two, (although we had 4 people and more than enough food) of three fresh lobsters split and grilled, with rice, avocado, pico de gallo and tortillas.  It was amazing.

474138295.name: Great views
474138295.author: a TripAdvisor user
474138295.reviewBody: Went to Playa las Gatas during recent stay in Ixtapa.  Cheap drinks, beautiful views, and neat local flare.  Would definitely recommend.

473658710.name: Relaxing Day!
473658710.author: a TripAdvisor user
473658710.reviewBody:
Las Gatas was a enjoyable day at a great beach!  We took a bus from Ixtapa to La Ropa Beach then walked a trail along the ocean shore to Las Gatas.  The snorkeling was average but the beach and restaurants were wonderful.  Good pricing for food, drinks and the service was friendly.
I would recommend you go but not with a tour, you can catch a boat ride from the marina in Zihaut to and from the beach.  The bus back to Ixtapa is only 12 pesosor taxis are available for a reasonable cost. You can then be on your own time line.
Make sure to check this beach out, it is a must when on vacation in this area.
Have fun if you go  =)

473495890.name: Great day out with the family...water a bit murky.
473495890.author: a TripAdvisor user
473495890.reviewBody: Took the family to Ixtapa and we did our own day trip to Playa Las Gatas....on the advise of our hotel rep (who made our reservations for us) we went to Arnold\'s on the beach....plenty of great fond and drinks,,,beach chairs reserved for us. Food was delicious and we would definitely go back to this location again.

472487853.name: Not worth the trip unless you have little kids
472487853.author: a TripAdvisor user
472487853.reviewBody: Our kids are older and preferred the crashing surf of Playa La Madera and Playa La Rope beaches.  In addition, we snorkeled both at Playa Las Gatas and Ixtapa Island, and found Ixtapa Island\'s snorkeling to be far superior.

472250462.name: A mixture of travel and a great beach
472250462.author: a TripAdvisor user
472250462.reviewBody: Since it\'s only accessible by water taxi, you get a little sense of adventure while going to the beach. Water\'s calm, plenty of places to eat, a dive shop. All good

471922082.name: Small beach with crystal clear water
471922082.author: a TripAdvisor user
471922082.reviewBody: Lovely beach accessible either along a rocky path from la ropa beach or by little boat from the harbour in town .\n\nFull of locals, lots of activities , safe for kids , beds for hire & plenty of places to eat

471741129.name: Clean but busy
471741129.author: a TripAdvisor user
471741129.reviewBody: Beautiful beach and reef.  Busy! Lots of choices for food,  The dive store was expecially friendly! Snorkling was great you did not have to go far to see interesting sealife

471381945.name: meh
471381945.author: a TripAdvisor user
471381945.reviewBody: not horrible but not great either.  the food was mediocre.  we stayed at the viceroy across the bay, so if you\'re staying there hoping to find better, you wont.

471171408.name: Great snorkeling beach
471171408.author: a TripAdvisor user
471171408.reviewBody: Two of us had a great time snorkeling in warm water. Rock reef has beautiful fish in many colors. Very vibrant. We loved spending the day here. Took the boat over and back for 50 pesos per person. Lots of fun and very relaxing. We rented snorkeling mask and find for 70 pesos per person from person near Cabana restaurant. Great all day experience with warm ocean, sun and lots of umbrella shade!

470423035.name: Not worth the trip
470423035.author: a TripAdvisor user
470423035.reviewBody: Disappointed by our trip. The boat ride very crowded only to arrive at a very crowded rocky beach. We did go on a Saturday which was probably not wise. We walked the length of the beach and found a good bar/restaurant to sit at and they were attentive. I would not bother to go again.

470408801.name: Hike to Las Gatas
470408801.author: a TripAdvisor user
470408801.reviewBody: Great Hike to Las Gatas from  Playa La Ropa. Less than 30 minutes.\n\nForgot the restaurant where we were but Chai the owner was great, the food was great. He had a shower in back between the lavatories that felt great after the walk.

470192815.name: La Ropa is better
470192815.author: a TripAdvisor user
470192815.reviewBody:
As it was the other beach in the bay we decided to spend an afternoon there.
Pros- several restaurants to chose from all with beach lounges and a nice little 10-15 minute boat ride across the bay.
Cons- very little breeze as the point of land on the left side of the beach blocks most of it and a rocky bottom under the water. We bought some beach shoes there just to be able to wade out into the water.

It was very warm and humid when we went there (3/23/17) so the lack of any breeze cut our visit short. Might have been better in Dec/Jan when humidity is a bit lower.

470129279.name: Best beach
470129279.author: a TripAdvisor user
470129279.reviewBody: We walked here daily from Playa La Ropa.  This is the nicest beach I. Zihuatanejo!  Nice place to relax for an afternoon. Different vendors offer food.

469725112.name: A nice boat ride, but beach is rocky, hard to get in the water.
469725112.author: a TripAdvisor user
469725112.reviewBody: Worth a side trip as the boat is only about $5 round trip. Once there, not a lot to see. The restaurants a bit rundown, but the beer is cheap! Take water shoes as it\'s hard to get in the water. Not a lot to see if you\'re snorkelling.

469697413.name: Cool beach
469697413.author: a TripAdvisor user
469697413.reviewBody: This beach is accessible from La Ropa beach. It is a short walk (10 min) through a rocky terrain but well worth it! It is a smaller beach and the water seems much warmer than it\'s neighbor beach. The snorkling here is actually very good. Give it a try for a day. If you are challenged in making the treck by foot, you can cab into town and take a water taxi from the pier

468658729.name: Nice beach and beach restaurants, not much to see snorkeling, very rocky.
468658729.author: a TripAdvisor user
468658729.reviewBody: Nice beach and beach restaurants, not much to see snorkeling, very rocky. Crowded on weekends. Snorkeling at the jagged rocks a the very North end of La Ropa was much better.

468585678.name: Great snorkeling
468585678.author: a TripAdvisor user
468585678.reviewBody: Interesting variety of fish to see. Huge "forests" of sea urchins. Huge statue ofJesus sunken under water . You must wear surf shoes on this beach. There is lots of sharp Little Rock and coral on the ocean bed. A snorkel and mast is a must even in the shallows! There are so many interesting fish and things to sea. Las Gatas is an enchanting little place that is so much fun to spend the day at. Lots of vendors there have everything you need --swimsuits ,sunscreen, clothing, snacks. The beachside restaurants, La Gloria Del Mar has EXCELLENT food and service, a clean kitchen, a freshwater shower and bathrooms.

468078974.name: Don\'t spend a lot of time at this beach
468078974.author: a TripAdvisor user
468078974.reviewBody: 25 years ago Las Gatas was awesome, revisited March 2017. Way too many restaurants, all crammed into a small area. We were ripped off on the lunch, just too many people, the beach is rocky, But, I walked to the point, and around. There is  a decaying homestead built by an American writer, Louis Owen, who wrote "Prisoner in Paradise".a beautiful space, that is worth walking to. The trail wound around the point, and since I was alone, I chose not to wander farther. I have no need to ever return, too many more lovely places to spend time. I recommend, taking the ferry, walk to the point, the view is nice, have a drink, and return to Zihau.\n\n

467864250.name: Unfortunetly, is to rocky to swim...
467864250.author: a TripAdvisor user
467864250.reviewBody: Unfortunately, is to rocky to swim...Lots of rocks, not very pleasant to swim. Nice view and tons of restaurants, but too crowed sometimes.

467420209.name: Nice walk from Playa la Ropa
467420209.author: a TripAdvisor user
467420209.reviewBody: Spent the day here after a short (10 - 15 minute) hike over the rocks from Playa la Ropa.  Lots to do - snorkelling, kayaking, and swimming.  There are plenty of restaurants to choose from and even a dive shop.  Thoroughly enjoyed our day!!!

466544739.name: Great swimming and good little restaurants
466544739.author: a TripAdvisor user
466544739.reviewBody: Easy swimming, good little restaurants, nothing fancy or expensive. Fun place to go. Sunday is family day

466334348.name: Great beach day
466334348.author: a TripAdvisor user
466334348.reviewBody: From the main pier in Zihuatanejo you take a taxi (panga boat) to the pier in Las Gatis.  Easy on and off.  Stroll down the beach till you find some chairs that look comfy and set your self down.   There is one beach restaurant after the next, separated basically by the cushions or color of the chairs.   The waiters/owners are very accommodating and helpful....so don\'t stop at the first one you see.   Find your perfect \'spot\' and spend the day.   Easy access to the water.  Last Friday of the month crowded with local families that come for the day as there is no school.   Best fish tacos I have ever eaten in my life.  you can rent snorkel gear there if you wish.   Decent snorkeling, not only for experts.....good for beginners to get their sea legs.   Randomly a musician or two will come by and for a donation play some delightful music for you.

465900602.name: Relax in the sun and sand
465900602.author: a TripAdvisor user
465900602.reviewBody: Travel by small boat to the beach (Playa) at Las Gatas from Zihuatanejo to enjoy a day of relaxation and beach activities.\nGood food available from any of the many reataurants on the beach

465646301.name: Beautiful clear beach
465646301.author: a TripAdvisor user
465646301.reviewBody: Spend a couple days at the beach.  You can take a water taxi form the pier.  Great restaurants along the beach.  You can rent snorkeling gear for the day.  I will definately go back.

465586579.name: Small beach, rocks in water
465586579.author: a TripAdvisor user
465586579.reviewBody: It has the clearest water for snorkeling, but only a small area at far end for good wading rock-free.  The best musicians come here.  You can walk here over the stony trail from the south end of Playa La Ropa

465420325.name: Wonderful place to walk down from Your condo!
465420325.author: a TripAdvisor user
465420325.reviewBody: A definite chill place! We enjoyed our time here again! We enjoyed taking a photo with some Canadians who had put a table and chairs in the beach, thanks to them for letting us crash their party!

464384379.name: Nice boat ride across the bay
464384379.author: a TripAdvisor user
464384379.reviewBody: Las Gatas is a pretty little beach across the bay from the small town center of Zihuatanejo.  The water is sheltered, so in theory it should be a good spot for snorkeling, but there is no coral, the water is not clear and it\'s hardly worth the bother of putting on a mask.\nHowever, there is a short boat ride of about 10 minutes from the main pier to this beach, which has many beach restaurants serving lunch and beer.  So this is a good half day out and you may see pelicans on the way.

463800018.name: Very "tranquilo." A beautiful spot, good swimming beach, great lunch and a nice boat ride over from the dock in Zihua.
463800018.author: a TripAdvisor user
463800018.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for an easy excursion from central Zihuatanejo, Las Gatas is the place to go. Buy a ticket for 50 pesos at the pier or muelle and hop on board the foot ferry. I like it because sometimes I don\'t want to deal w/ the surf when it gets a little bigger at Madera Beach.  Playa Las Gatas is protected by a reef, which blocks the breakers. I also really appreciate that the tourists there are mostly Mexican families, which is fun to watch. Gets me away from the heavy drinking crowd downtown and at Playa Madera and La Ropa.  I had a great lunch, tacos de atun or tuna. Food is a little pricier than in town but the different scene is worth it. Very friendly waiters who I enjoyed chatting with and practicing my Spanish.  Also I\'m traveling alone, and they promised (and I believed them) to watch my stuff for me. Great day at the beach. Sand mixed w/ coral is a little hard on your feet, but if it bothers you, stick to the end of the beach closest to the ferry where the kids are.  It was peak season, week day, just enough action to people watch but not too busy.

463582243.name: snorkeling at las gatas
463582243.author: a TripAdvisor user
463582243.reviewBody: Snorkeling used to be very good at Las Gatas. Unfortunately ignorant people have walked or kicked all the coral and killed it so snorkling is pretty well non existent.  Still a great ride from the Municipal Dock on a small boat and great way to laze away the day eating and swimming. I have been here many, many times over a 30 year period.  My favorite beach restaurant is "Arnoldo\'s"

463028479.name: A nice place to spend a day
463028479.author: a TripAdvisor user
463028479.reviewBody: Take the little ferry boats from the Pier in Zihaut, Playa Las Gatas has nice sandy beaches, good swimming and snorkeling and lots of places to eat, sheltered from the wind and any wave action.  Lots of families use this beach.  The ferries are the safest way to get there but you can walk along the shore from Playa La Roppa.   This will be a revisit for us.

462721059.name: Relax like in your own back yard
462721059.author: a TripAdvisor user
462721059.reviewBody: Walked to Las Gatos to see what it was like. Turned out there were at least 4 restaurants on the beach. We chose the last one Otilas. Met Franco the mesero who is very friendly. No pressure to do any thing. He just wanted to make sure we had all that we needed. The beach lounge chairs were set up in couples with umbrella and table  for drinks in between. Right behind the chairs was a lunch table and two patio chairs ready for your lunch to be served. The tables and umbrellas were in red. The water in front has a shoal so if you want to snorkel you have to walk back a way to get past the reef as well. Overall the atmosphere was very laid back and one of our most relaxing days.

462384580.name: Nice snorkelling - not great snorkelling
462384580.author: a TripAdvisor user
462384580.reviewBody: Both here and at Isla Ixtapa you can easily rent snorkel gear, toss your gear on a chair at a table and spend a pleasant day between swimming and drinking margaritas (or eating).  The fish are pretty and make snorkelling worthwhile.  But there is none of the colourful coral and weird eels and such that places like the Red Sea offer.  Beware the sea urchins (fewer of them at Isla Ixtapa)

462283950.name: Interesting little spot
462283950.author: a TripAdvisor user
462283950.reviewBody: This little area of beach is accessible by water taxi or if you can find someone with a jet ski who is willing to drop you off.  There are plenty of little restaurants along the beach and they all want you to sit in front of their business.  There is a sunken statue of Jesus you can see when snorkeling.

461985785.name: A nice day at the beach.
461985785.author: a TripAdvisor user
461985785.reviewBody: We spent a day a this beach, which is accessible only by water taxi. We brought our hammocks and set them up on the right side of the beach. I would recommend water shoes as the beach has lots of rocks and corals. There are plenty of restaurants along the beach and snorkling is available.

461451835.name: Swimming and snorkelling
461451835.author: a TripAdvisor user
461451835.reviewBody: Had a lot of fun with my cousins the water was beautiful to swim seen a lot of fish of all sizes. lots to see food service was slow but everyone was very friendly it will definitely be a return visit. You won\'t regret going

461444852.name: Great spot
461444852.author: a TripAdvisor user
461444852.reviewBody: Fantastic spot to idle away the day!  See Franco at the far end of the beach. He will make your stay even more enjoyable than it might otherwise be. Need water shoes or something on your feet here as the coral bottom is rocky quite far out. Very protected - seldom any big waves.  Kids would be happier on the sandier end of the beach closest to the water taxi pier

460545737.name: Hanging out
460545737.author: a TripAdvisor user
