460545737.reviewBody: Great place to eat, drink, and snorkel. Rode a catamaran from another beach where we are staying. Good time!

460503687.name: Always fun to visit
460503687.author: a TripAdvisor user
460503687.reviewBody: I\'ve visited this beach over a period of more than 40 years, and it\'s always wonderful to hang out for the day on the white, white sand, snorkel around the ancient man-made reef, and get a different view of Zihuatanejo town and bay. It\'s notable that the beach is only accessible via water taxi or by scaling over a rough and winding path over the rocks. The water always seems saltier on Las Gatas than in the rest of the bay, and the sun hotter, but that\'s nothing to complain about. There are plenty of simple restaurants along the short stretch of beach where you can find refreshment and food. Snorkeling and diving equipment is available for rent, and you can get a massage at a number of different massage kiosks set up between the restaurants. A great day trip if you\'re traveling with kids in particular.

459808537.name: wonderful beach
459808537.author: a TripAdvisor user
459808537.reviewBody: A visit to Zihua is never complete until you visit Playa las Gatas. Crystal clear blue water and white sand beach. On the west coast this is a rarity but Playa las Gatas delivers. The water taxi ride over is wonderful and reasonably priced. The beach bars and restaurants have cheap beer and decent food for a good price.

459440084.name: The only way here is by boat
459440084.author: a TripAdvisor user
459440084.reviewBody: But don\'t worry, boats regularly run guests to and from the beach daily starting at 8AM for only about $3 USD (round trip). The beach offers several restaurants with beachside service but no shops or other amenities.

459370181.name: Paradise,
459370181.author: a TripAdvisor user
459370181.reviewBody: These 2 beaches are the finest anywhere in the world that ihave travelled! Safe and clean with sparkling water , you can walk or swim, or just lounge an people watch,,,, many places to eat, all good, but some are better,

458667292.name: Gillian\'s island
458667292.author: a TripAdvisor user
458667292.reviewBody:
This beach visually mirrors Gillian's Island to perfection! It is such a beautiful place to see. You can either take a sketchy hike down the back side of a large hill to get there, or take a boat taxi like 99% of people do. After absorbing the breathtakingly perfect surroundings, the confusion sets in as you try to decide which restaurant you will choose from to spend the day (who's
employees are now accosting  you on your stroll, employing you to visit their establishment) It really doesn't matter which place you choose, they are all mediocre with mediocre chairs and food. Perhaps choose one that has a fresh water shower and clean toilet as not all of them do. There is no electricity to this area so I like to keep that in mind when ordering food, and just to keep my expectations in check in general. 

Enjoy a snorkel or paddle around the reef and rocks and stroll down the the eco resort owned by former dive partner of Jacque Cousteau. It's a beautiful place to let go and get away from it ALL!

458576368.name: This could be paradise
458576368.author: a TripAdvisor user
458576368.reviewBody: So for 50 pesos-about $2.50 you take a water taxi to the beach--some annoyance with kids that want to get tips for helping you on the dock.You get there and its restaurant after restaurant after bar-some easy to use and some will not let you use unless you promise to have lunch there. We stopped at one with a couple of hammocks in the back,clean bathrooms and a great host and wish i remembered his name! i was the ugly American who stupidly questioned the check--I was wrong-go figure-- and even though i was wrong he gave us all free beer and invited us to his village the next day!(ok,felt like stupid ugly American) Anyway, he was about the 5th or 6th from the pier and i am kicking myself for not remembering the name but didnt seem to care whether you ordered or not but we did---at a little over a buck a beer,how could you resist!  If you want no one to bother you ,keep walking down the beach to a lovely area with tons of shade from palm trees. You can bring your own food and beer and just enjoy. Snorkel gear is available cheap--No need to pay for tours quite frankly as a $2.50 round trip boat ride fills the bill for the day-no waves,ok snorkeling and lots of fun! Take a hike around the end of the peninsula for outstanding views of Zihua

458362991.name: Watch restaurant prices
458362991.author: a TripAdvisor user
458362991.reviewBody: The beach offers snorkeling and only average swimming as the bottom has rocks under the water.   The water is clear and nice.  Watch the prices being charged for food and drink.  It was quite expensive as they have you in a more remote location.

457947700.name: Great day beach
457947700.author: a TripAdvisor user
457947700.reviewBody: Las Gatas is a great place to spend the day.  I forget the name of the restaurant but its the last one on the beach, furthest from the boat dock area.  They had amazing food and clean bathrooms.  They took us on a fishing trip and cooked the fish for us when we arrived.  Weekends are busiest so go on a week day.  Snorkeling out to the Jesus statue is fun if the water conditions permit it.  Carful with the coral, it cuts.  Best to go out there in numbers so you are seen by boats.

457142429.name: Water taxi needed to get to beach
457142429.author: a TripAdvisor user
457142429.reviewBody: There are lots of restaurant at this beach.  It is good for family with children because of the man made breakwater. There was several instructors teaching snorkeling.

456778438.name: Crowded and a little overwhelming
456778438.author: a TripAdvisor user
456778438.reviewBody: You can take the ferry over to Las Gatas for less than $1 RT. It was very crowded the day we were there, a Saturday in early December, but it was fun to watch lots of local families enjoying the beach. The waterfront is lined with casual beach restaurants, each one sending out someone to try to drag us in as we walked by. It was a little annoying.\nOn Sunday we returned to with Captain Max after a morning of fishing and the experience was much more pleasant. The restaurant cleaned our fish (we got to watch!) and prepared the fillets five different ways. The best preparation was raw, similar to ceviche. The other preparations were nothing spectacular, mostly fried, but at least we knew the fish was fresh!\n

456559217.name: Cheap day + Fun beach
456559217.author: a TripAdvisor user
456559217.reviewBody: You can only get to Playa Las Gatas by water taxi - and it\'s cheap. Once at the beach there are plenty of places to choose from. If you order both food and drink then the waiters will watch your stuff while you\'re in the water. Otherwise you need to find a way to keep your stuff secure since there are no lockers. We rented snorkels and the snorkel place offered to watch our stuff too. We didn\'t bring anything of value and any money I did have, I kept on my person. Water shoes are a good idea because there isn\'t a lot of sand beach floor in the water. Snorkeling was ok - nothing great but the water was warm so we snorkeled for awhile. We did swim out to see Jesus in the water and he was covered in cool fish which was neat. The locals in the boats surrounding the statue told me it was good luck to swim down and touch Jesus but honestly it kind of freaked me out seeing him there arms outstretched on the floor of the ocean so I happily kept my distance. We had a lot of fun and with food, snorkel rental, 2 drinks and waters, I spent like $20 USD. Not a bad day at all.

454830526.name: Great spot if you know these 7 Tips!
454830526.author: a TripAdvisor user
454830526.reviewBody:
won't be the first to tell you Las Gatas is awesome. It has calmer waters due to the rock barrier allowing for great snorkeling, swimming, and just straight chilling in the water with your chair. Part of why it is so awesome is the adventure getting there and the whole idea that you are isolated. 

#1 - You can walk here! During lower tides you walk from the end of La Ropa beach - follow the road for as far as you can towards Las Gatas - then hop down a path to the rocks. You must have good balance & overall fitness, but it is a fun 'hike' with great photo opportunities. When staying at the Bambu Tree House  - I usually hike in the morning and then take the boat back to downtown in the afternoon. 

#2 - Walk the beach before you pick a spot (& pick one near the end of the beach). This is a good general rule of thumb, but at least you know what is available before you choose a spot. I usually end up towards the end of the beach where it is quieter. 

#3 - Carlo Scuba - best spot to rent your snorkels and flippers. Great spot for PADI dives as well. Will hold your belongings while you snorkel if you wish. 

#4 - Avoid weekends/holidays. I've seen this spot over-crowded with tourists & Mexicans alike. Like most things, it is much better with less people - so arrive on the earlier side in the morning. 

#5 - CA$H ONLY 

#6 - 5PM LAST BOAT! 

#7 - Pro tip: Find "King of Kings" Jesus statue underwater here! You exit the break towards La Ropa and it is nearby. You can usually ask a guide from a tour group /w a paddle board as they hover above it.

454783011.name: easy and cheap to get to
454783011.author: a TripAdvisor user
454783011.reviewBody: This is a easy day trip and only cost 100 pesos for two round trip.Lots of little restaurants and warm water. the only thing is the ruff coral on the feet, suggest wearing your sandals. carry a couple of coins to give the guys on the boat and the ones that try to help you off(one way to get rid of those little coins) When they say "Watch your head" when getting on boat....well...I should have listened...haha..

454558081.name: Our new place !
454558081.author: a TripAdvisor user
454558081.reviewBody: That was our 2nd time at Las Gatas and Franco, as always, takes such great care of everbody !  We love this playa so much and cannot wait to go back again !

454504816.name: Nice!
454504816.author: a TripAdvisor user
454504816.reviewBody: Took the Hobie Cat with Jaiver who is in front of Paty\'s to drop us off for the day and then come back for late afternoon. Most relaxing way to get to Playa Las Gatas. Spent a very enjoyable day. Going back this morning with Javier dropping us off again and picking us up again.

454389151.name: Swimming
454389151.author: a TripAdvisor user
454389151.reviewBody: Love that beach lots of fun. Lots of little restaurants chairs and table to sit at along with lounge chairs. Very popular beach always busy. Water is extremely warm and no waves

454305389.name: Crowded. Good food. Bring your water shoes.
454305389.author: a TripAdvisor user
454305389.reviewBody: The beach itself is fine. As soon as you hit the water, the rocky bottom takes over. It is very shallow, with a minimum gradient. Lots and lots of people, who patronize the various restaurant that line the beach. Otilla\'s is probably the best one. Take a boat, which is fun. Walking is a fool\'s errand. A change of pace from La Ropa or Madera, so probably worth a trip if you\'re staying a week or more in Zihua.

454102781.name: Only Accessed By Water Taxi
454102781.author: a TripAdvisor user
454102781.reviewBody: A very popular beach with the locals, it is an inexpensive taxi ride away from the town dock. Carlo Scuba Shop is based from this beach. Olivia\'s Restaurant is very good.

453598963.name: Cozy beach
453598963.author: a TripAdvisor user
453598963.reviewBody: We took the little shuttle boat for 50 pesos over to Las Gatas. Enjoyed a pleasurable afternoon there. Good snorkelling there, gear available for rent at 100 pesos.\nWhile in the area it\'s nice to visit the different beaches. I would not rate this beach as anything special.

453083580.name: Snorkel Galore
453083580.author: a TripAdvisor user
453083580.reviewBody:
This is the best place for snorkeling. No need to pay an organizer through the nose.
Go to the pier in Zihua, pay 50 pesos for a the Panga to Playa, Las Gatos. When you get there, pick on of the restaurants closer to the pier (We went to Angelo's or Albertos, next to 3 Palmeros)
Pick a table, rent your gear and off to the water. 
We saw all the fishes from Nemo's tank (plus the pelicans) and even a turtle.
Pangas (water taxis) leave by 5:00 so plan accordingly

452851253.name: Cost of tour versus exploring on your own
452851253.author: a TripAdvisor user
452851253.reviewBody: The package costs 800 pesos or $40 us. This includes seafood lunch. In our opinion tourists can go on their own at a cost of 200 pesos without lunch. From Park Royal go to Plya Linda by local bus (25 pesos). Water taxi from there to island costs 50 pesos return . If you want you can go directly from Park Royal beach by boat by paying 100 pesos for a couple. By bargaining one can reduce the price.. it is a beautiful island and must visit .

452835988.name: Really good for either snorkeling or diving
452835988.author: a TripAdvisor user
452835988.reviewBody: I have been there twice and loved it both times! You need to take a small boat from Zihuatanejo for 50 pesos both ways and it\'s open until 5pm.

452835727.name: Post Fishing meal
452835727.author: a TripAdvisor user
452835727.reviewBody: Great location. Restaurants cook up your local catch! Great place to hang out while they clean and cook your fish for a nominal charge!

451899379.name: Good morning walk to a little bit of paradise.
451899379.author: a TripAdvisor user
451899379.reviewBody: The walk alone is worth it!  Bit rocky and treacherous in places but only because we happened to go at a busy part of the Mexican  holidays!  Lovely little beach area with places to eat and lots of families enjoying a day out.  Walk past that first restaurant - they were very adamant that if you chose to sit in their chairs, you had to order food and drinks, "inmediatamente!" and it should not be just a coke and fries!!!

451496474.name: Out of the way, but popular destination
451496474.author: a TripAdvisor user
451496474.reviewBody: Named after the catfish that once came here, this beach is beautiful and popular. No access road so you either hike in over a rocky trail or you take a short water taxi ride from Zihuatanejo. We went on a Sunday and it was 2/3 locals and 1/3 tourists. The deal seems to be that you choose a restaurant, they set up lounge chairs for you and you spend the day in that location, paying only for your food and drink. There is a lot of jostling that goes on to try to entice you into one location or another. It occurred to me that we probably should have negotiated a little more. As it was, we got six chairs right by the water, and a table for six right behind them for lunch. The food was only ok, but the setting was wonderful. Note: the beach is sandy by there are coral and rocks lining the shore just under water. You\'ll be most comfortable if you have some kind of shoe or sandal to wear into the water.

450766450.name: Las Gatas...exotic and beautiful
450766450.author: a TripAdvisor user
450766450.reviewBody: wonderful place for a swim, snorkeling, eating or just sitting on a chair an dletting the warm waters of the bay lullabye you to sleep! the most wonderful food you will eat and very affordable too,,,if you are at Mangles restaurant, try a michelada and the ceviche tostadas...yummm!!!! water is clear and you can see hundres of fishes swimming close to you, warm waters and cold beers..,cannot get any better than this! at the restaurant Mangles, ask for Misael...great service and very attentive! Las Gatas is a very popular place due to the great snorkeling and food available...for 2.50 you can rent snorkeling gear and be on your merry way,,,word of caution...must wear water shoes, the coral will get you!!! Very enjoyable trip...Lovely relaxing place!!!

450310361.name: Overcrowded narrow beach
450310361.author: a TripAdvisor user
450310361.reviewBody: We didn\'t stay on this beach! The beach is very narrow and totally overcrowded with deckchairs. The water is teeming with people as if you were in an ant\'s nest. Playa de la Ropa isn\'t ideal but miles better than this.

449897162.name: Playa Las Gatas is crowded on the weekend
449897162.author: a TripAdvisor user
449897162.reviewBody: Playa Las Gatas is advertised as the best snorkeling beach in the bay. It used to be when I visited many years ago. However, we visited New Year\'s weekend. There were so many people thrashing about that were I a fish, I would swim a long ways away. There were few fish and many people. Oh, well. It was new years weekend. Everyone is on a holiday and and so were the fishes.

449399949.name: Local and fun.
449399949.author: a TripAdvisor user
449399949.reviewBody: Fun local beach. Water in the cove is warm and clear and good snorkeling. Fun for kids. Grab a water taxi at the pier and make a day of it. Otilios is where we enjoy going.

448953394.name: quaint
448953394.author: a TripAdvisor user
448953394.reviewBody: eat right there then snorkel or just float in the water - there is a short trail from Playa la Ropa or you can take an inexpensive boatride

448350333.name: Great for a half a day adventure
448350333.author: a TripAdvisor user
448350333.reviewBody: What\'s best about this place is how CHEAP you can have a great time there. I got to the beach and back for 40 pesos and rented snorkel equipment for onlly 80 pesos. I decided not to eat there cause it was way to crowded, but I had perfect time to snokel and eat back in Zihuatanejo.

447635530.name: Nice Beach
447635530.author: a TripAdvisor user
447635530.reviewBody:
A quick ride in the boats from the pier in Zihua. Cheap travel, make sure you keep you receipt it will get you the return trip no extra cost.
There are lots of restaurants/bars along the beach very reasonable. You do have to buy beer/beverages or food to use the chairs. Very quiet when we were there, mid week during November.
You can rent snorkeling gear and go on your own or have  guided tour. There is a statute under water just passed the reef. 
I snorkeled out to the reef with just a mask and saw lots of small fish. The closer you get to the reef the more fish you see. Water is very clear out here and not too bad waves. 
A great day trip.

446489110.name: Good day trip for snorkelling
446489110.author: a TripAdvisor user
446489110.reviewBody: Walked to the beach via the trail from Playa La Ropa and rented snorkel gear at the beach. Snorkelling was very good (better than Ixtapa Island in my opinion) and it was not necessary to hire a guide. Food was good and reasonably priced. Sand was a bit coarser than La Ropa.  Overall a great day trip, planning to head back in a few days.

446166722.name: Great destination!
446166722.author: a TripAdvisor user
446166722.reviewBody: Took water taxi from pier. Once on beach we went all the way down the beach to the last restaurant, Amado\'s where Erik and Oscar were amazing hosts. Snorkeled around and saw some amazing fish and the statue. The water was a little murky in places but a very accessible place to snorkel and hang out.

445043514.name: Great day
445043514.author: a TripAdvisor user
445043514.reviewBody: We took the water taxi and brought our own snorkel gear.  We sat on the middle - I think Oliver\'s or something like that.  We saw more fish here than on the catamaran snorkel tour to manzanilla where we got stung by jellyfish.   Did not like so many boats - worried they\'d run is over.  Morning is the best and quieter time here.  This is on our list to return to.  Loved how clear the water was.

444713031.name: Relaxing afternoon
444713031.author: a TripAdvisor user
444713031.reviewBody: Went to spend the afternoon after fishing. What a great day of relaxing by the ocean while eating your fresh fish that you\'ve just caught. Had the best day!!

444612942.name: Perfect with Safe Swimming Area
444612942.author: a TripAdvisor user
444612942.reviewBody: Lovely. Calm shallow water swimming and snorkeling. Lots of facilities. Restaurants with umbrellas and lounge chairs. \n

443173255.name: Hidden Gem
443173255.author: a TripAdvisor user
443173255.reviewBody: This beautiful beach is accessible only by water taxi or a 15 minute walk from Playa la Ropa over difficult rocks.  But what a great beach!  There is a shallow area for kids to play, as well as places for adults to eat and drink while sunning or sitting in the shade and just taking in the views.  Much more laid-back than Playa la Ropa.

442261744.name: Great place to spend the afternoon
442261744.author: a TripAdvisor user
442261744.reviewBody: We walked along the shore from our hotel on Playa La Ropa.  Only 20 minutes but very rocky, be sure to bring good shoes or sturdy sandals.  Once there we found chairs, food and drinks at Franco\'s near the far end of the beach.  Great service.  Rented snorkel masks & fins next door for a very low price.  Snorkeling was great in the chest deep water near the rocky outcropping close to the water taxi wharf.   Sand in the water is pretty course.  Bring water shoes if you have them.

442182679.name: A little hard to get to but worth it.
442182679.author: a TripAdvisor user
442182679.reviewBody: we walked over from playa ropa beach along the coast line. It\'s totally doable in flip flops if you are an able bodied person. the 70 year olds complained a little but they all made it. it\'s a great place for kids as there are no waves and the water is shallow and warm.

441447756.name: Great beach
441447756.author: a TripAdvisor user
441447756.reviewBody: Playa Las Gatas is reached by taking a boat from Zihau for about 20 pesos.  The only drawback, for me, is that the beach is super shallow - it never gets deeper than to your thighs.  But for kids it is nice, although it is also pretty rocky.  Great food, though.

441008550.name: Nice beach and good snorkeling
441008550.author: a TripAdvisor user
441008550.reviewBody: We always enjoy a trip or two to Playa las Gatas when we visit Zihua. We like to camp out at El Restaurante Arrecife. The food and service is good and "Ponno" was kind enough to watch our things while we swam or snorkeled.

440936124.name: Very Nice but Very Busy on Weekends
440936124.author: a TripAdvisor user
440936124.reviewBody: I wished that we had visited during the off days and not  on a weekend. Very nice restaurants and quint shops that don\'t charge an arm and a leg.  Not too many vendors and if you say no they leave you alone.  Bought some very nice Silver there and was much more reasonable than the shops downtown.. Food was excellent and service was great

440621997.name: The most fun beach
440621997.author: a TripAdvisor user
440621997.reviewBody: Walk on the path or take a water taxi.  This is the place to snorkle and see beautiful fish.  There is a 12 foot statue of Jesus that is profound to see

437658170.name: I saw Jesus! The statue that is!
437658170.author: a TripAdvisor user
437658170.reviewBody:
We strolled over from Playa la Ropa to spend the day at Playa Las Gatas. This is a secluded cove with calm turquoise waters. The beach is know for snorkeling and just plain relaxing. 
You can take a water taxi from Playa la Ropa, or the Centro, but we decided to take the hike along the shore at the end of Playa la Ropa. The walk is rocky, but not slippery, so flip flops are okay, but sneakers would be better. Either way if you take your time, you will be fine. 
While there we had some very inexpensive Corona's and went snorkeling to see the Jesus statue anchored just outside the breakwater about 20 meters down. This was awesome to see. My guide pointed out starfish, sea turtles and a stingray!
It's an inexpensive way to spend a day in a beautiful tropical setting. Go!

437645564.name: A must!
437645564.author: a TripAdvisor user
437645564.reviewBody: Beautiful beach!! The water was clear and the food was really good! We went to the last restaurant on the beach. I believe it is called Armando\'s the owner\'s name is Chuy. She used to sell things on the beach and after hard work for many years she was able to buy this restaurant. There are fresh flowers from their own garden in coconut pots in all the tables. Giovanni was our server and he was wonderful! We had the barracuda tacos (they can only fish barracuda once a month during full moon) delicious! This beach is a must. Great for hanging out or snorkeling.

435715605.name: Beautiful beach
435715605.author: a TripAdvisor user
435715605.reviewBody: Great for seeing the fish. We didnt snorkle but saw angelfish anyway. Clean pretty beach with friendly restaurants that freely gave us a beach chair without insisting we order anything. We got drinks anyway very affordable. The walk to it is very rocky make sure you have good shoes and water shoes also recommended.

435681709.name: Amazing
435681709.author: a TripAdvisor user
435681709.reviewBody: Fish with Temo Sportfishing Charters!  then go back to his family\'s restaurant and cook your catch.\nAmazing!  Actually travelled November 2015

434445540.name: Rocky beach
434445540.author: a TripAdvisor user
434445540.reviewBody: Spent a day at las gatas which was highly recommended.  The beach is pretty rocky which made it challenging to get in the water and it was hot!  We were at the restaurant at the far end of the beach (opposite the dock) and our waiter was Eric.  He got us snorkel gear and ensured us our things were safe while we were out there.  In fact when we returned I couldn\'t find my phone and he was very anxious, said nothing goes missing...I of course found it and all were relieved.  There is a Jesus statue underwater, we could see the top of his head but were too nervous to dive the 8 feet to see more...it\'s an interesting story to read about.  A good day, glad we went but our favorite beaches are la Ropa and Madera

433432897.name: Nice afternoon in warm blue waters
433432897.author: a TripAdvisor user
433432897.reviewBody: Playa Las Gatas is a short boat ride from Zihuatanejo. Bring your own towel and SPF, everything else is available for purchase on the beach. It\'s a great place to spend an afternoon.

433398711.name: Wonderful Beach in Zihua
433398711.author: a TripAdvisor user
433398711.reviewBody: Easy to get here. Just get a ticket at the booth at the end of the main pier in Zihua. The ticket is good for both ways and costs 40 pesos. The ride takes about 10 minutes. Once at Playa Las Gatas go to Otilia or 3 Palmas Restaurants. Sit on the beach and relax, swim and enjoy the great views and some margaritas. Wonderful place to enjoy for the day!

432385658.name: Day at Las Gatas
432385658.author: a TripAdvisor user
432385658.reviewBody: Spent the day at Las Gatas. We walked from the beach at La Ropa on a footpath to Las Gatas. Be forewarned the pathway is very rocky and jagged in places so definitely best to wear running shoes, sandals can be slippery. Went all the way to the end of the beach to Oliatos which our friends we were with had recommended from previous visits. Definitely the place to go. Franco took care of everything for us - got our snorkelling gear, cold beers and amazing coconut shrimp. He also arranged for a boat ride back that dropped us off in front of our hotel at Intrawest for only 200 pesos for the 4 of us. It was a great day and will definitely be back.

428934654.name: Nice day!
428934654.author: a TripAdvisor user
428934654.reviewBody: Nice place to spend the day. Beach is rocky under water so bring water shoes. No stores out there so bring what you need.  Good food and drinks all the places seem the same so check out menus before you sit down. Great lounge chairs with umbrellas and clean restrooms.

426517606.name: Great way to spend a day at the beach.
426517606.author: a TripAdvisor user
426517606.reviewBody: From Zihuatenejo marina go to the ticket booth and pay your 200 pesos for a round trip ticket and go out to the landing to be picked up by one of the water taxis that can hold about 8 people.  Be sure to have a few pesos in your pocket, there are men that will assist you both on and off the boats and they expect to be paid for the assistance they provide.  Playa Las Gatas is not an island, it is simply located in an area bordered by cliffs on both sides.  There is a broad white sand beach with many restaurants and the beach is fronted by a coral reef.  This isn\'t the best place to go snorkeling, but there are fish to see here if you want to rent the equipment.  If you want a better snorkeling experience there are fishermen here that will take you outside the harbor to a private lagoon called Manzanillo Beach.  From Otelia Restaurant we hired a boat to take us on a 3 hour sunset cruise and we snorkeled over at Manzanillo where we saw a sea turtle and many schools of multi-colored fish.  Since the last boats leave Las Gatas around 5pm we had our driver drop us back at Zihuatenejo marina.

423328195.name: a great place to chill for a day
423328195.author: a TripAdvisor user
423328195.reviewBody: This beach is perfect for relaxing  with all sorts of beachside bars and reataurants which are unobtrusive.The swimming and snorkeling are great.You can walk from La Ropa or take w water taxi from Z.We just took a table at a rstaurant and spent the day swimming ,drinking and eating.\nMany mexicans there as well so quite an authentic feel.

422881418.name: Ok beach
422881418.author: a TripAdvisor user
422881418.reviewBody: My advise would be to just get the 40 pesos ticket at the fisherman warft and not pay some organizer a lot more to get you there. The beach is beautiful visually but the sand is rough. Lots of restaurant  to eat. Good and cheap massage 300 pesos for 1 hour. Enjoyable afternoon.

419650044.name: Close to Zihuatanejo by boat
419650044.author: a TripAdvisor user
419650044.reviewBody: Took a tour to playa las gatas to enjoy snorkeling with my son. We had a nice short trip from the dock of Zihuatanejo to get to Playa Las Gatas. Beach was nice, a bit crowded and restaurants with loung chairs are all right at the edge of the beach/water so that makes it kind of cramped because if your at one of the first restaurants as you come off of the dock everyone will passing past will be just inches from where you are sitting so no room for sunbathing there. Water felt good and we enjoyed our snorkeling that afternoon.

415683960.name: 17th anniversary
415683960.author: a TripAdvisor user
415683960.reviewBody: Lovely beach just walk west as far as you can it\'s very romantic. Everyone piles up at spots once you get off the small boats so just keep walking north for best service with out crowd.

407414492.name: Almost didn\'t make the trip -  but now we\'re going back
407414492.author: a TripAdvisor user
407414492.reviewBody: We walked the entire beach (it\'s not that large), past about a dozen  restaurants to settle at Otilia\'s ... the second to last place.  It was worth the walk.  Great service, excellent prices.  Franco down there knows everyone and will hook you up with cervesa, drinks, food, snorkeling gear (we were not impressed to snorkel there - but may take a boat on Saturday to Playa Hermosillo)

396189493.name: So So
396189493.author: a TripAdvisor user
396189493.reviewBody:
This is a beach location opposite zihuatenejo.
It's accessible by foot path or water taxi. We took the foot path along with the locals on the way there. The path is filled with rocks, jagged edges and trees. The path is at the waters edge. I chose to wear my flip flops to walk there. This was a mistake. My feet got wet from the rising tide, my flip flops got wet and I lost my footing and fell on the rocks. I think if I had tennis shoes and socks on this would be much better. 

When we arrived to the beach it was crammed with restaraunt stands and stores and places to rent snorkel gear and do excursions. 

We rented gear for 100 pesos for the 2 of us and set about on our own. There is an underwater statue of Jesus Christ so we were looking for this. We did not find it. The reef is very long here and very shallow on top of it. Because we were not familiar with the area we took a wrong turn and ended up on top of the reef. We got a little bounced around and the life guards were whistling at us to get off the reef. Which is a challenge when it's so shallow and you should not touch it. 

We did see many multicolored fish on and around the reef. My advice to others who do this on their own is to look where the groups are and stay close to the shore because what looks like a shortcut is only the reef that will cut you up.

If you have snorkeled anywhere in the Caribbean this is nothing like it. Less diversity of fish and interesting species. 

The water taxi back to the City cost 40pesos per person.

391904110.name: Snorkeling and more
391904110.author: a TripAdvisor user
391904110.reviewBody: We stayed in Ixtapa but took a boat to playa las gatas for snorkeling and a four hour adventure. The kids loved the banana boat. The water is calm and pretty. My cheap underwater camera couldn\'t pick up all the cool creatures I saw while snorkeling. There are several restaurants but we tried Kokoy (not too sure on the name) and it was honestly the best, freshest, most authentic food I\'ve ever tasted. If I ever make it back to Mexico I\'ll definitely go here again for a longer time.

390450503.name: Pleasant Day Trip at Playa Las Gatas
390450503.author: a TripAdvisor user
390450503.reviewBody:
We purchased round-trip tickets for the water taxi at the ticket booth on the start of the Zihuatanejo Municipal Pier. The ticket cost $40 Pesos/p. person. There was very little wait time before we were on our way. When we arrived there we walked almost all the way down the beach until we came to the faded red umbrellas at Otilias. This is where Franco greeted us and totally made us feel at home. He made sure that we were all set up with padded lounge chairs, chairs, palapa/large umbrella and a cloth covered table. We enjoyed cool, bottled water, later we ordered Coconut Natural, (a large Coconut filled with refreshing coconut water). 
Franco suggested for our snorkeling that we swim out and to the left side of the area. We were able to see several different species  of colorful fish, but our favorite was all of the yellow, white, and black angelfish. 
When we were ready for lunch we ordered their famous Coconut Shrimp that came with a sweet Coconut Cream to dip it into, also rice, and lightly steamed veggies. We also ordered guacamole with Pico de Gallo and Chips. 
What a delightful day!

390448320.name: relax and snorkle
390448320.author: a TripAdvisor user
390448320.reviewBody: charming small beach accessible by water taxi from Zihuatanejo peer , one of our favorite beaches to visit when we are in Zihuateanejo, the rest are too crowded for us.

385663088.name: Party beach...
385663088.author: a TripAdvisor user
385663088.reviewBody: Gatas has clear calm warm water. Nice water taxi from Zihua pier. Looks like good snorkeling and a good surf spot when it breaks. Lots of people and every inch of the beach is taken by restaurant/bar trying to get you in to sit at their lounge chairs and buy their food and drink. OK if you don\'t mind the crowds and the partying. The pictures show the end of the beach... past the party area.

385519193.name: Take the sunscreen, and lots of it!
385519193.author: a TripAdvisor user
385519193.reviewBody: It was beautiful, and generally a fun trip. If like me, you have such badly near sighted eyes, see if you can\'t rent a prescription pair of goggles so you can snorkel. I should have though of it since I\'ve been as blind as the proverbial bat since I was 8 or 9, but didn\'t, and there were not available on the island. Couldn\'t see my own floppy feet, much less the beautifully colored fish everyone else was seeing. C\'est la vie. It was still a blast. But a word of advice, bring the strongest sunscreen you can find, and make sure you don\'t miss any odd bits as you reapply every time you get out of the water. It was 3 days before I could wear a bra again. I missed that wee little cutlet that runs between outside of your suit strap, and you underarm. Ouchy, oucy. And bring snacks!

384783987.name: Great day trip from Zihua
384783987.author: a TripAdvisor user
384783987.reviewBody: Don\'t miss a short boat ride to the best swimming beach around. You can buy tickets for the boat or just pay cash (20 pesos each way, per person) on the boat.

384136675.name: Relaxation at its best.
384136675.author: a TripAdvisor user
384136675.reviewBody: A short water taxi to Playa Las Gatas is a must do in Zihua.  Many restaurants dot the shoreline but soldiered on to Otilias ( almost to the end of the beach- pink umbrellas) which has the best coconut shrimp.  To our disappointment, Franco was on vacation but his protegee was okey-dokey-artichokey.  Getting in and out of the water takes some effort because of the wave action and rocky bottom but this beach is a great spot to dip your toes in.  The last water taxi leaves at 5:30 so make your plan and tip the guys at the dock who tell you "watch your head".

382968056.name: Great Snorkeling
382968056.author: a TripAdvisor user
382968056.reviewBody: We had the beach to ourselves because the water taxi\'s were not running due to high tides. We walked from our hotel (10 minute walk). After being approached by most waiters we settled on one in the middle and had decent food and drinks. Beautiful views. Very clean beach. The highlight was the snorkeling, incredible variety of fish with ok visibility. Twice we were in the middle of a shoal of fish that just circled around us for minutes on end. Mackerel I believe. Also enjoyed watching the surfers as there is a pretty good break at the west side.

378065451.name: beautiful beach
378065451.author: a TripAdvisor user
378065451.reviewBody: This beach is beautiful short boat ride across the bay from zihuatanejo. The snorkeling is good if you go on a week day sometimes to many people on the weekend stir the water up to much. I have been here several times and sat for the day at different restaurants always good food and services. Wear some type of beach shoe as the edge of water line is quite rocky and lots of small pieces of coral.

376295485.name: Good beach, but better options around
376295485.author: a TripAdvisor user
376295485.reviewBody: Don\'t get me wrong, it\'s a cozy and beautiful beach.  Here\'s what I don\'t like: you HAVE to take a water taxi to get here. And then you step foot onshore and you are met with 10 people asking you to snorkel or to parasail or to go fishing or to sit at their restaurant.... *sigh*  \nIt\'s 11 am and all we want is to find a quiet spot, nice chair and get food and beer in a couple hours.  After walking down a ways, we found a wonderful spot and totally enjoyed the beach.  \nGetting there can be a runaround and everyone wants a tip (if they help you out of the boat for a split second = tip), and the water taxis do a final call at 5:30 (sun doesn\'t set this time of the year until 8:15), so full relaxation and enjoyment didn\'t happen.   Good beach yet found better on our trip.

376259413.name: Small Beach with lots of rocks
376259413.author: a TripAdvisor user
376259413.reviewBody: Very small beach across the bay from Playa La Ropa which is must nicer.  Not much sand.  Very rocky so it is hard to go in the water.  The beach area is just lined with restaurants all seemingly serving the exact same food.  No way to tell them apart.\n\nYou can walk/hike from Playa La Ropa to Las Gatas and back if you want.  Takes about 30 minutes.

374337208.name: Avoid
374337208.author: a TripAdvisor user
374337208.reviewBody: Beach across the bay from Zihuatanejo. 40 pesos for a round trip boat ride from the pier. Only way to get there. Beach is about a dozen restaurants and covered with chairs and shade. As long as you eat or drink at the restaurant, chair and shade are free. Nowhere to put out a towel. Beach is coarse sand and broken sea shells. The sea bottom is a little sand a many rocks. Not worth the time or effort to get there. La Ropa is much better.

374145944.name: Beautiful, relaxing Beach
374145944.author: a TripAdvisor user
374145944.reviewBody: Go during the week when the bleach isn\'t so crowded. We got a table at the end of the beach and stayed all day enjoying the sand, water, cerveza, margaritas and coconut shrimp. We took a small cooler with a few extra beverages and they didn\'t say anything. We put our chairs in the water and relaxed to the rolling waves.  Awesome.

370302029.name: Really fun beach with beautiful sights!
370302029.author: a TripAdvisor user
370302029.reviewBody: The water in this beach is crystalline and beautiful! This is the perfect place to go snorkeling with a vast fauna of fish and great food. You can get here from Playa Madera in a boat for $40 pesos per ticket for a round trip. \n\nIf you have a GoPro, you can\'t leave it behind when you go to this place, it\'s gorgeous!

370269146.name: Best water
370269146.author: a TripAdvisor user
370269146.reviewBody: If you are in Zihuatanejo you MUST take water taxi to this beach. The water is so much cleaner. Also more private. The palm trees are beautiful

369604846.name: Short stop for lunch
369604846.author: a TripAdvisor user
369604846.reviewBody: We were on a boat ride for the day and stopped here for lunch.  It was the weekend, middle of the afternoon, and super crowded.  But we made our way to the end of the beach where it was less crowded and sat down for lunch.  While we didn\'t snorkel, water was very clear.  Where we were on the beach, the bottom was a little rocky; I don\'t know how it was on the other side.  We were going to come back again on a weekday, but didn\'t get around to it.

369225331.name: Beautiful Island
369225331.author: a TripAdvisor user
369225331.reviewBody: During our week stay in Zihuatanejo, my girlfriend and I took a boat (40pesos) to Las Gatas two out of the seven days. The Island is very beautiful and tends to seem less crowded. The beach has multiple restaurants to pick and choose from for the perfect spot to lounge. Although, the only down fall I had found was some of the beach has rocky areas. But it was easy enough to find a nice blue area to swim in the ocean without killing your feet and testing your balance. Also one must remember that the Island closes down around 5pm. So dont lose your boat slip when you purchase your ticket(s). \n\nOf course you\'re able to find the basics you would at any of the other beaches - banana boat rides, jetski rental, snorkeling, surf lessons, hair braiding & of course vendors! We really enjoyed this beach and will definitely return.

368204106.name: Wonderful place
368204106.author: a TripAdvisor user
368204106.reviewBody: What a great place, wonderful snorkeling, the statue of Christ was awe inspiring and breathtaking. The guide was fantastic, very helpful and knowledgable and wanted us to have the best possible time.\nSpring for  the guide or you will spend  ages looking for the statue and the rocks around the statue are horrendous you could get hurt. The stall for renting equipment and guide is right there when you get of the water taxi. Clean and good equipment he even helps you on with the it. Which was needed. lol.  No need to spend your hard earned money on hotel excursion save it for the great drinks and food at PLG. When can I go back?

368153126.name: Travel to the beach by water taxi
368153126.author: a TripAdvisor user
368153126.reviewBody: Laid back beach with laid back places to eat , Freshly caught fish simlpy grlled and resonably priced beers

367318409.name: Small beach
367318409.author: a TripAdvisor user
367318409.reviewBody: This is touted as a place to snorkel and you can do that, but it\'s not a great snorkeling place. Lounge chairs outside of restaurants can be rented but the price is unclear. In some cases, you pay only for the food and beverages; others there is a fee added on. Seemed fairly arbitrary. We took the water taxi. Most people walk.

364984407.name: Beautiful beach
364984407.author: a TripAdvisor user
364984407.reviewBody: This is a great place to spend the day. We took the water taxi from the pier in Zihuatenejo. They run all day back and forth. We like to go see our favorite waiter Luis (Popo).

362627055.name: Wonderful Afternoon!!
362627055.author: a TripAdvisor user
362627055.reviewBody:
Four of us took the water taxi to Las Gatas.  What a beautiful beach.  Crystal clear water with a hint of turquoise.  Calm water to swim in or pull  a chair into the water to
just relax.
There is snorkeling available: but we just relaxed.  Had lunch (coconut shrimp) and a 
few bottles of beer.  The coconut shrimp were the best we had ever eaten.  Lunch
was a little expensive (265 pesos); but well worth it.  We went to the red umbrellas
almost to the end of the beach.
We will definitely go back.

362340109.name: Snorkeling with Jesus
362340109.author: a TripAdvisor user
362340109.reviewBody: Took water taxi from Zihua to Play Las Gatas.  Go early before it gets too crowded. Small horse shoe beach with restaurants. Set up our "camp" at Restaurate Las 3 Palmas. Very friendly. Food fantastic.  Rented snorkel equipment right next store.  Fish, sea urchin, sea stars and a sunken stature of Jesus just outside the "breakwater."  Amazing.  Great to spend about half the day.  Kids loved it.

362323407.name: Fun at Playa LasGatas
362323407.author: a TripAdvisor user
362323407.reviewBody: This is the first time I have been to Playa Las Gatas.  We had a fantastic time at Otilia\'s farther down the beach from the water taxi drop off.  Franco was our waiter and he was very entertaining and a lot of fun.  We met the owner, Roberto and had a wonderful history lesson about the area.  Will definitely go back again.  Thanks, everyone at Otilia\'s

361605857.name: Bring water shoes!
361605857.author: a TripAdvisor user
361605857.reviewBody: The water taxi over from Zihua was easy and inexpensive and the beach is pretty (although cluttered with the usual touristy stands). The only issue was how rocky the ground was.  you literally couldn\'t walk out into the water without water shoes.  We ended up buying an inner tube and a raft, otherwise we couldn\'t be in the water at all.

360222782.name: Nice beach but high pressure restaurant sales.
360222782.author: a TripAdvisor user
360222782.reviewBody: A small beach that was busy with tours and boats.  The snorkelling behind the breakwater was fun and it was easy to rent equipment. The aggressive staff from the restaurants on the beach continually tried to drag us in to spend money and were really annoying.

359774839.name: Worth the trek!!
359774839.author: a TripAdvisor user
359774839.reviewBody: If you are staying closer to Playa La Ropa, it\'s definitely worth the effort to get to Las Gatas.   We were told to go to the last place on the beach called Amados,  and we weren\'t disappointed!  The shrimp tacos were outstanding and our server took care of everything from our snorkelling equipment to keeping us fed and the cervezas rolling in!  There is a submerged statue of Jesus out on the reef that we snorkeled to.  Amazing fish and an abundance of them. \nAbsolutely worth the trek. :)

359532260.name: Quietest Beach
359532260.author: a TripAdvisor user
359532260.reviewBody: Our beautiful boutique hotel was directly above Playa Las Gatas, higher up on the mountain, and one time we did take the steep, barking dogs, prickly brush path to the beach, but most of the time we walked over the rocky path from Playa la Ropa.  We read reviews and parked ourselves at Otilia and enjoyed several hours with beer and margarita\'s. Service was very good.   We did rent snorkels, but not great snorkeling.  I was told that they plant things near the coral to enhance it. Don\'t know if this is true. We walked to the point to discover what was there.  Read Owen Lee\'s "Prisoner in Paradise", that will tell you all about this place.  So sad that it is falling apart.\nWe were in Zihuatanejo the week before Easter, and it was a very quiet. I guess we lucked out. It was the most quiet beach and that\'s why we liked it, but the sandy ocean wasn\'t easy to walk in.

359155376.name: Fantastic
359155376.author: a TripAdvisor user
359155376.reviewBody: Beautiful day.  Walk over from la ropa.  We were here during Easter break.  I have never seen so many people.   Great food and drinks.  Snorkelling is sooo much fun.  Watch out for the sun rays.  You can burn very quickly

358896781.name: Great swimming and good food!
358896781.author: a TripAdvisor user
358896781.reviewBody: Stretches of beach all suitable for swimming, with a number of restaurants serving fresh seafood..very reasonably priced!

358584116.name: Fun when you finally got there
358584116.author: a TripAdvisor user
358584116.reviewBody: Traveling from the pier to the beach and back was interesting to say the least. At the pier they ask you what color tickets you have. It did not seem to matter that there were plenty of boats. They made you wait anyway. Then when they got a boat for you they rudely asked for tips. On the way back, again we were asked what color tickets. We were made to wait 45 minutes, finally get in the boat. Asked for a tip by the "pier master" again.

358523130.name: Great place to spedn the day!!
358523130.author: a TripAdvisor user
358523130.reviewBody: Great place to spend the day.  When you arrive walk to the last lounge chair area which has less people and the clearest water to enjoy.

358477830.name: Sweet Little Beach
358477830.author: a TripAdvisor user
358477830.reviewBody: I think this might be my favourite of the area beaches.  The beach is short and narrow, but the sand is soft and the vibe is laid back.  We walked to Las Gatas from the Madera area.  It`s very doable, even with a pair of flip-flops (though I`d not want to be wearing flimsy ones).  The trail is pretty self-evident once you come to the end of La Ropa.  In the future, I think I`ll walk over to Las Gatas early in the morning, claim a palapa at one of the restaurants and spend the day swimming.  We did have a snack while we were there and noticed that, at the restaurant we were at anyway, prices were about 10-15% higher than they were elsewhere.

357981822.name: Ok place. Not very good swimming
357981822.author: a TripAdvisor user
357981822.reviewBody: We went there at the beginning of the Mexican Easter. It was crowded as heck. However, the Mexicans don\'t tip their own so go to Otilia\'s. It\'s still cheap and I had my best margaritas during my whole vacation here. I think the Mexicans think it\'s expensive so they stay at the other end of the beach by the pier. Franco will entertain you at Otilia\'s. He is very kind along with the rest of his staff. I don\'t think the snorkeling is all that great and there is a ton of coral to step on. So the swimming is blah. We walked the path from Playa La Ropa. It\'s an easy walk for me along the rocks, but I don\'t recommend it for anyone with issues of mobility. Would I go back there, maybe to have an Otilia margarita. And that would be it.

357722906.name: Lazy day on the beach
357722906.author: a TripAdvisor user
357722906.reviewBody: A quick $2.25 USD panga boat ride whisked us over to this beach where we grabbed a palapa, complete with our own table/chairs/chaise loungers.  For the remainder of the day, it was beverages and food as we chose---no pressure to keep ordering.  We strolled the beach, snorkelled the reef (don\'t miss the underwater statue on the outside of the reef where you\'ll observe a nice variety of tropical fish), read our books and napped.  A relaxing day you won\'t forget.

357304167.name: Semana Santa week!
357304167.author: a TripAdvisor user
357304167.reviewBody: We had heard this was a great place to chill and hangout on the beach.  Seems like it would have been, but during Holy Week the entire beach was filled with local families enjoying the start of vacation!   Actually when we did find a restaurant to get a drink, they were out of margaritas, haha!   Anyway they do seem to have lots of things to do, but for us this time, the best thing to do was to return back to Zihua!!

357189827.name: Very cool place to spend an afternoon.
357189827.author: a TripAdvisor user
357189827.reviewBody: A water taxi ride from the muelle (municipal pier) in Zihuatanejo. Great swimming beach lined with ramada restaurants.

356680753.name: Interesting little beach if you can get there
356680753.author: a TripAdvisor user
356680753.reviewBody: My wife and I walked to the end of Playa La Ropa then down the trail to get there, although it\'s easily reached by small boats from town or other beaches. There\'s one rather rough, narrow and rocky section about halfway across, so if you\'re not in shape to tackle that, I\'d go by boat. There\'s not much there other than a few waterfront restaurant/ bars, although some people were snorkeling a small reef. The restaurants are pretty pesky about getting you to stop,  but we just said "no thanks" and kept going. At the south end of the beach is a derelict old resort that was interesting to see. No one could tell us much about it, and what we heard was contradictory at best. On the way back we stopped at the first bar we reached, primarily to use the toilet, which turned out to have no seat or paper in the ladies room (which is why we carry our own small roll). When we hadn\'t been served after nearly 10 minutes we just walked away. We were surprised by the poor service since they were very eager to seat us.

355769287.name: Gorgeous beach
355769287.author: a TripAdvisor user
355769287.reviewBody: Loved the short walk over to Las Gatas from LA Ropa beach, had to walk over some big rocks but was all good. Good pick of restaurants and bars. Great service. You can also take a water taxi ,we took a small sail boat over one day as well. I believe the last boat leaves around five.

355450069.name: Fun, Lively Beach with Lovely Snorkeling
355450069.author: a TripAdvisor user
355450069.reviewBody: This beach is absolutely beautiful. So many gorgeous colors of blue, soft sand, just a stunning place. The snorkeling was wonderful too! We even saw a puffer fish and a small octopus! Try to get there early, since the last water taxi leaves at 5 or 5:30 depending on the day and you\'ll want plenty of time there.

354570876.name: Great snorkeling but watch the strong currents
354570876.author: a TripAdvisor user
354570876.reviewBody: We took the boat from Zihuatanejo\'s pier,($40 pesos round-trip), to Playa Las Gatas.\nA wonderful sand beach with plenty of restaurants available. The young children at the beach tend to be closer to the pier because of the calm water. When you walk farther down away from the pier the water is calm to about 20 feet out. From there on I would suggest fins to snorkel. Snorkeling equipment is available for rent,(~$100 pesos). The reef is covered with sea urchins so be careful as the current pulls you in.  Beyond the reef is for the strongest of swimmers but is very manageable with fins. Be aware  of your surrounding. If you find yourself in a challenging situation take a moment and think don\'t panic. There are plenty of boats around. Grab hold of the side of the boat if you find yourself are getting tired. All and all we had a relaxing day, soaking up the sun on  Playa Las Gatas.

353719058.name: The best beach for swimming
353719058.author: a TripAdvisor user
353719058.reviewBody: Los Gatas has crystal clear water for swimming, or you can snorkel out by the reef. The reef keeps the water calm so it is very safe. You can sit under a palapa at your favorite restaurant and have food and beverage and have a very relaxing day. It is our favorite.  Go on a weekday as it gets very busy on the weekends, a lot of the beaches do not just Las Gatas. Take a water taxi from the pier for 40 peso and keep your ticket for a return trip. Also take water shoes as some parts have a lot of coral at the end of the beach if you want to walk around the point.

353434919.name: A great beach; worth a visit while in the area
353434919.author: a TripAdvisor user
353434919.reviewBody: This beach is accessible only by either boat of by foot. A lovely sandy beach with several local restaurants lining it. Lots of activity here, snorkelling, boating, swimming, surfing.. oh, and eating and drinking.. One thing.. it has coral under most of the water, so it\'s probably advisable that as a swimmer you keep that in mind.. that stuff hurts!

352681617.name: Playa Las Gatas
352681617.author: a TripAdvisor user
352681617.reviewBody: It\'s OK for a few hours, the restaurant venders can be a pain hassling you to eat at their place. But the food is generally good and lots of it. If you eat you can get a lounge and rent snorkel gear. Snorkeling isn\'t bad great for kids, but be careful of the rocky shelf close to shore, my wife stuck her foot under and got stung by a sting ray. When we first started coming to Zihau 1998, we\'d walk along the shore (be careful) from the south end of Playa la Ropa to Las Gatas (you can also take a boat from Zihau) we haven\'t bothered the last few years much better for us older folks on Playa la Ropa.

352484429.name: Gorgeous
352484429.author: a TripAdvisor user
352484429.reviewBody: It\'s beautiful.   Crystal blue water, but the bottom is very corally and rocky.  so you NEED swimming shoes to go in.   Getting there is a bit of a pain (rocky walk, or boat in) but it\'s worth it.  A bit too commercial with all the vendors, but if you can forget that part, it\'s lovely

351656887.name: Love Playa las Gatas!!  Peachy Keen!
351656887.author: a TripAdvisor user
351656887.reviewBody: After a $40peso (price is round trip) water taxi ride, you arrive at the dock.  Be sure to have small change for the young folks that help you into and out of the boat...they will get rather pointed if you ignore them.  Once past all that, you are in for a great time.\n\nOur favorite restaurant on las Gatas is Otilia\'s.  It is a long walk,nearly at the far end of the beautiful beach, but well worth it. Franco will great you with a smile, a hug if it\'s a return trip, and take care of you like family, all day long.  Pull up a lounge chair, order a drink (or two, or three...), and enjoy the lovely calm, clear water while sitting under an umbrella, the big tree, or the flag of the 12s!!  (Go Hawks!) The food is safe and delicious, the drinks strong and plentiful, and the service unbeatable.  Peachy keen!!

351157995.name: Busy beach with ok snorkelling!
351157995.author: a TripAdvisor user
351157995.reviewBody: Truly enjoyed the service, drinks & food at Otilia\'s while spending the day on the beach. We arrived early before the crowds, but as the day rolled on it became increasingly busy. We found snorkelling much better at Ixtapa Island & Playa La Ropa. Only reason to return would be Otilia\'s.

350843668.name: Small and pretty
350843668.author: a TripAdvisor user
350843668.reviewBody: I ran from la ropa across the very challenging path linking the two to Las Gatas. The beach is small and packed with food offerings.  Very pretty with Rocky protection 60 plus ft off the beach

350792129.name: 2nd Best Beach in Zihuatanejo!!
350792129.author: a TripAdvisor user
350792129.reviewBody: Very clean beach, with beautiful water!!! Great for snorkeling or just putting a chair in the water and relaxing with a beer!!!

350781637.name: Best beach in Zihuantejo
350781637.author: a TripAdvisor user
350781637.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, crystal clear water and many great spots for food and refreshments. Easy water taxi ride over to spend a day you will remember forever

350677447.name: Go Hang With Franco for a Day
350677447.author: a TripAdvisor user
350677447.reviewBody: We spent two days at Playa Las Gatas! A great spot for relaxing, swimming, eating and drinking! When you disembark from the water taxi, make your way almost to the far end of the beach where the red umbrellas are and spend the day with Franco. Super friendly and serves some great food and drinks.

350402036.name: Tourist trap
350402036.author: a TripAdvisor user
350402036.reviewBody: This beach is just a row of restaurants. When you walk the beach you are inundated by waiters wanting you to sit at their restaurant to eat and drink while enjoying the beach. They try to get you to use a guide to go snorkeling. You don\'t need a guide unless you aren\'t comfortable. I guess it is ok if your hotel is not on a beach. Not nearly as nice as Playa la Ropa.

349999902.name: best beach in Zihua...
349999902.author: a TripAdvisor user
349999902.reviewBody: best beach for wading and relaxing in the water, but bring water shoes if you want to do much walking in the water - lots of coral!   lots of fun to take the water taxi across to the beach each day and just hang out!

349950065.name: Super fun and a Bonus boat ride
349950065.author: a TripAdvisor user
349950065.reviewBody: Fun little spot that you can either access from water taxi or if your fit can walk there Get little spot for kids to play in the water Snorkelling  is great as well You can rent gear from a vendor or bring your own A great way to spend the day

349841825.name: best beach in the area
349841825.author: a TripAdvisor user
349841825.reviewBody: No vehicle access gives this beach a unique feel.  Either walk the rocks from La Ropa or talk a 20 peso water taxi from the pier in town.  Safe, clean and good snorkelling.

349423523.name: SIMPLY BEAUTIFUL !!
349423523.author: a TripAdvisor user
349423523.reviewBody: One water Taxi ride away well worth a day there. But they are developing a path from Playa La Ropa.  Snorkeling... Great food...Great Beach....WHY NOT!!\n

349293635.name: Have a visit with Jesus!
349293635.author: a TripAdvisor user
349293635.reviewBody: We went to Las Gatas for an afternoon. Had 15 peso beers at one of the local places (~$1.33 Canadian).. Snorkelling out to a statue of Jesus that is under water.. And lots of shells to look at on the beach! Before you pick a table just ask the waiter how much they charge for a cerveza.. If they tell you anything over 20 pesos just go to the next one!\n\nThe water has lots of rocks, which wasn\'t as fun for my family, but was fine for me because I had a snorkel on the whole time!

348962774.name: Good for an afternoon
348962774.author: a TripAdvisor user
348962774.reviewBody:
Spending some time at Playa las Gatos makes a fun afternoon. There are two ways to get there:

1) Walk over from Playa la Ropa - best to do this when the tide is low. Plan to climb over rocks, so be sure to wear tennis shoes. Take a back pack with water....
2) From the Marina you can take a water taxi (very reasonable), and it will take you directly over. Nice way to see the bay from a different vantage point too. Purchase a round trip ticket, and yes, the crew does appreciate a small tip.

Once there you will have many "lounge chair" options and many folks trying to get you to stay at theirs. All of them are associated with small individual restaurants, so ask what they serve if that matters to you. (Always ask for your beer in a bucket with ice)

The water is shallow - good for small children. Snorkeling is not great, but they do offer it there.

Local vendors will walk by offering their wares.... I know some folks are put off by this. I happen to love it.... and always have fun chatting with them (and ok, sometimes making a purchase!) ;-)

348613953.name: Nice beach and snorkeling
348613953.author: a TripAdvisor user
348613953.reviewBody: Not real easy to get to but once there the beach is nice and the snorkeling is good as there\'s a reef right off the beach and the water\'s not too rough and not too deep.

348033983.name: Boat to heaven
348033983.author: a TripAdvisor user
348033983.reviewBody: The island of the cat, so named were told because the king wanted a private bathing area for his kids away from "sharks" not sure if true or not but the water is always clean warm and inviting.\nThere are many restaurants along the beach but we like Otillias for friendly staff, great shrimp tacos and cold beers \nWorth the 40 peso RT boat ride anytime!

346895606.name: Beach in Zihua
346895606.author: a TripAdvisor user
346895606.reviewBody: Short inexpensive boat trip to a beautiful beach & water. Many beach restaurants/bars. Restaurants/bars employees very courteous & friendly, with good service

346859934.name: Best place to swim in Zihua (clear water)!
346859934.author: a TripAdvisor user
346859934.reviewBody:
Definitely the best place to swim in Zihua/Ixtapa area.

Get a boat ticket from any of the outlets selling them by the pier in Zihua. Depending where you purchased your ticket you will be directed to a certain boat. The boats are typically the ones you see fishing in the harbour (they fish until they get a fare to take to Las Gatas)! When you get on/off the boat, local boys come to give you a hand. They then ask for tips (don't feel compelled to tip if you don't want to, they typically do not work for the boat owner). 

The beach is great- there is clear, warm water and sand bars that go on for quite a while. Activities (Sea Doo's, boat rides) are available for those who want a bit more.

Similar to Ixtapa Island you can use a lounge chair for the day by purchasing a drink from one of the many restaurants on the beach (drinks $25MP).

There are a few vendors that are selling their wares but they all move on after you decline. 

We felt safe leaving our belongings on our chairs while we swam (only because we were in a section by ourselves and the beach wasn't too busy). In the high season you may want to limit what you bring (or bring a lock for your bag).

There are lots of people swimming so you will feel comfortable in the water. The ocean floor is sand (not rocks). It seems to be a bit of a hangout for locals (which gives it a nice authentic feel). Great place for kids to swim, it's safe and there are lots of other children so they make find some playmates for the day.

TIP: When you get to the beach go to the far end to avoid the crowds and to have a bit of space to yourself. All the restaurants sell the same food and have the same lounge chairs... most people stop in the first few and it tends to be more crowded at the beginning of the beach.

345918538.name: Another yearly favourite
345918538.author: a TripAdvisor user
345918538.reviewBody: This is one of my favourite beaches to visit when I come "home" to Zihua (I lived here and return every year for a couple weeks to visit my family). For the past five years or so I\'ve mostly walked to La Ropafadzo beach and hiked across from the end. It\'s a fairly easy hike and lots of people of all ages do it but it is quite rocky and I would not recommend for older adults. Otherwise you can take a cheap boat from the pier in Zihua all the way across. This beach is also one of the nicer beaches and great for snorkeling as well (especially earlier in the morning ).

345906952.name: Fun spot to relax on beach.
345906952.author: a TripAdvisor user
345906952.reviewBody: Take a water taxi over from pier in Zihuatanejo.  Grab a lawn chair at one of several restaurants on the beach and order a drink.  They will take great care of you.  Snorkeling not real good, there is a small reef that you can snorkel around.

344964527.name: Great snorkelling!
344964527.author: a TripAdvisor user
344964527.reviewBody: Best snorkelling around! Awesome little beach with numerous restaurants. Man-made reef makes for still water and great snorkelling...saw tons of fish!

344462219.name: Visit Fernando!
344462219.author: a TripAdvisor user
344462219.reviewBody: We stayed at a beach bar where Fernando was the host.  He "watched" our stuff while we snorkeled.  We swam out to the statue of Christ (look for the other snorkel groups and you will find it).  Great place to spend the day....we walked from playa la ropa...it is not too difficult.

344153445.name: great snorkeling and comfortable area to hang for a day
344153445.author: a TripAdvisor user
344153445.reviewBody: Many natives seem to come here to visit, and service at all restaurants is attentive and welcoming to Americans

343416077.name: The best place to hang out for the day!
343416077.author: a TripAdvisor user
343416077.reviewBody: This is the place to go to swim, eat, snorkel and relax! All of the restaurants cater to customers looking to spend hours on the beach. We arrived at 11:00 am and found not very many people there. The restaurant we chose let us have a table, umbrella and lounge chairs for as long as we wanted. Our belongings were in good hands while we swam and snorkeled. Snorkel gear ran 150 pesos for the both of us. We had delicious shrimp tacos and a bucket of beer for about $25 USD. Can\'t remember the name of the restaurant, but ask for Franco!

343143296.name: Love Mexico
343143296.author: a TripAdvisor user
343143296.reviewBody: Loved the beach and all the restaurants. Excellent service at the ones we spent time at. The food and drinks were excellent and cheap. The beach is a wonderful way to spend a relaxing day(s)

342691922.name: Beautiful blue water!
342691922.author: a TripAdvisor user
342691922.reviewBody: Nice snorkeling here & gorgeous water.  Just take water taxi from the pier downtown 40 pesos round trip

342687205.name: Quiet beach with soft sands.
342687205.author: a TripAdvisor user
342687205.reviewBody: Great beach and we walked from Villa Casa Luna on Playa Ropa, took about 15 minutes. Do not suggest going on the weekends as it gets really busy.

342412942.name: A Local Beach
342412942.author: a TripAdvisor user
342412942.reviewBody: Accessed via water taxi from town only. Few gringos go here. The best dive shop is Carlos Dive owned by third generation owner Thierry Durand. His wife Olivia runs the restaurant next door and the fish soup is devine!  Snorkelling here is good too and you can rent the gear. Look for the submerged statue of Jesus. The beach sellers are slightly more aggressive than on La Ropa.

342343351.name: Cozy relaxing beach
342343351.author: a TripAdvisor user
342343351.reviewBody: Playa Las Gatas is a must do for visitors to Zihuatanejo. If you are staying closer to Centro, the Little boat caught from the ward is a great way to get there, but for those that are closer to La Ropa and are seasoned hikers, it can be walked to from the far end of La Ropa beach. Cozy bay with snorkelling and beautiful views.

341469941.name: one of our favorite beaches
341469941.author: a TripAdvisor user
341469941.reviewBody: Great way to spend a day in Zihua; boat ride to beach gives you really nice views of city and bay; clear, blue water; can sit all day by the beach (or in the water at water\'s edge), order food, drinks, etc.

340803226.name: Popular family beach
340803226.author: a TripAdvisor user
340803226.reviewBody: This is the most popular beach in Zihuatanejo. You can technically walk there, but a $3 round-trip water taxi is much more efficient. There is a long white beach lined with seafood cafes. You basically chose a cafe which gives you a table in the shade and you can stay there all day without being bothered as long as you order drinks or food. The water was warm and the snorkling was OK, but not comparable to better sites in Hawaii or the Caribbean. (You can rent snorkling equipment there). We were there during Mexico\'s school holiday and the beach was crowded with Mexican families. It was like being in the middle of a party. If that makes you uncomfortable, then you may have a problem, but we enjoyed the entire scene.

339741377.name: Mexican Hospitality like no other.
339741377.author: a TripAdvisor user
339741377.reviewBody: Great Mexican hospitality!  Playa Las Gatas is a great way to relax on the beach and enjoy some great Mexican hospitality.

339283164.name: Excellent beach!
339283164.author: a TripAdvisor user
339283164.reviewBody: Great place to spend a day! The only way to get there is by water. You can catch a water taxi from Zihua main pier for $40 pesos return. Taxis are running every 10-15 minutes from 8 am to 5 pm. You buy your ticket at the booth right on a pier.\nThe beach is not huge, but lovely. There are 5-6 restaurants along it providing tables with chairs, umbrellas, etc. Food is fresh and prices are low.

338873588.name: Favorite beach
338873588.author: a TripAdvisor user
338873588.reviewBody: Love this beach!!!  We go to this beach several times on are visits. You can either take a boat over from he marina or you can take the hike on the rocks over from La Ropa!  We have done both and love them both.

338758501.name: Great beach
338758501.author: a TripAdvisor user
338758501.reviewBody: Eat at Otilia\'s. David or Franco will treat you like family. Food is great and service is  amazing. You can lay out all day without anyone bothering you and enjoy the beach right in front of you.

338721709.name: BUSY at holiday time
338721709.author: a TripAdvisor user
338721709.reviewBody: During the holidays this beach is way too overcrowded.  I would only go back there during non-busy times - or early before the hoards of tourists/families head over to camp out at restaurant tables.

338679063.name: Nice Beach, lots of restaurants, quite small, vendors are a little aggressive!
338679063.author: a TripAdvisor user
338679063.reviewBody: Took the taxi over, and that was good. Once there,we attempted to walk the beach to the far end where there is a small park. All along the way the restaurant venders were trying to stop you, even if you politely wished to pass for the time being. The restaurants are so close, it actually prevents you from enjoying the views and water, with all the venders "on" you! We did find the prices to be reasonably, and the food to be good. We ate at La Cabana, and were treated well, once we choose a place to sit. I would probably only go back if we tried walking from La Ropa along the shore to Las Gatas. If taking the water taxi, going for lunch has to be the plan.

337853724.name: Not what it used to be
337853724.author: a TripAdvisor user
337853724.reviewBody: First trip to Z in 2000 we loved Las Gatas.  We went faithfully several times each trip.  It used to feel like a special day.  Restaurants truly gave great service and served great food.  We had 1 bad experience-well actually let me tell you about it.  About 7 years ago, we had lunch and when we got the bill there was a marijuana cigarette under the bill!  What???? Mistake???  Turned out the waiter was trying to SELL IT TO US!!\nWe were outraged.  Tacky, dangerous, not leagle and we are not the type.  We decided to skip this beach for 5 years we were so turned off. We tried it again last year.  Crowded, tons of empty chairs, but waiters were not friendly, several said they were waiting to get a group, a couple does not spend enough.  Well okay, our instincts were right.  We will never go back.  The town and surrounding beaches are awesome, why put up with this nasty attitude? Yes, the beach is sweet, you can snorkle, but on vacation, I prefer to be treated respectfully as we are always friendly and respectfull to the locals.  So just beware, do not waste a day here!

337709573.name: Unbelievably Crowded
337709573.author: a TripAdvisor user
337709573.reviewBody: The most crowded beach I\'ve ever been to. You could not walk along the beach for all the people laying on the sand and in the water. Water was so-so clear but not great. Complete waste of time. Don\'t bother.

336925493.name: Beautiful
336925493.author: a TripAdvisor user
336925493.reviewBody: We took the little boat ride to Playa Las Gatas and really enjoyed it. The service is fantastic. They paid alot of attention to us and made sure we had all the food and drink we wanted. It was one of the most relaxing days I had at the beach in a while. Nice sand, and warm water also made the day fantastic.

336767020.name: Our favorite beach
336767020.author: a TripAdvisor user
336767020.reviewBody: The water is very warm and excellent for swimming.  There is a man made reef which protects the beach a bit.  Fish swim right next to you.  Check out Otilia\'s if you want some eats or shade from the sun,

336060427.name: Tourist trap
336060427.author: a TripAdvisor user
336060427.reviewBody: This is my second time in Zihuatanejo. Last trip I never made it over to Las Gatas so thought today\'s the day and I will take the ferry over. Should have listened to the poor experiences of others. When I got over there it was crowded and noisy as hell. It was middle of the week. They would not rent a lounge chair to me claiming they are all reserved for Mexican families. Claiming they could make more money with them. Extreme racism and left a bad taste in my mouth. I\'ve travelled the world and never had such a disappointing experience as a traveller as I did today. I immediately left the island as I was quite upset that they would not rent a lounge chair to a single travelling female. I also speaks quite a bit of Spanish and am a friendly person and so was really disappointed with the attitudes of people over here. Your loss as you would have gotten more money from me then any family. I left the island after 25 minutes and headed back to La Madeira where my money is accepted for food and a lounge chair and am not treated so rudely.

335757592.name: Wonderful day trip to relax
335757592.author: a TripAdvisor user
335757592.reviewBody: Take the water taxi from the pier in Zihuatanejo. Its 40 pesos round trip and keep a few pesos back for tipping. I walked to the second last place and found a little restaurant called Octilla. The ice cold cervesa for 20 pesos and grilled octopus were wonderful. Just hang out on the beach and wander around. It\'s a truly beautiful place and a great getaway.\n\nMy server was David and he is extremely accommodating and very friendly. His English is exceptional

335331249.name: SCUBA and restaurant
335331249.author: a TripAdvisor user
335331249.reviewBody: Great place for water based activities and the home of Carlo SCUBA - great service from the scuba guys

335217819.name: lasgatas
335217819.author: a TripAdvisor user
335217819.reviewBody: very nice beach\u2026..  don\'t walk there, although a lot of folks do.  We went to the Otilio\'s restaurant at Las Gatas---  Otilio\'s did not meet up to all of the hype but was good.

334301225.name: Overcrowded and tourist trap
334301225.author: a TripAdvisor user
334301225.reviewBody: Don\'t have anything nice to say....this is just too crowded with every thing...locals, vendors, tourists etc. \n\nAvoid

334095402.name: OMG the changes
334095402.author: a TripAdvisor user
334095402.reviewBody: We last visited Las Gatas seven years ago and the creeping chase for tourists has made a beautiful beach and snorkeling destination an appalling tourist trap.   Restaurants are elbow to elbow.   There is little, if any, space for hanging out on your own.  If you must experience it for yourself, camp out at Oliveros restaurant, next to the snorkeling / sports rental place and close the pier. ( you can hike to Playa las Gatas or take a boat trip from the Municipal Pier in ZIH for 40 pesos.)

333754071.name: Lovely calm beach
333754071.author: a TripAdvisor user
333754071.reviewBody: We enjoyed our lunch at Otilias that was served to us at a very pretty beach-front table.  However, check your bill to make sure it is correct.

333628372.name: BEAUTIFUL BEACH WITH JESUS DE CRISTO WAITING FOR YOU UNDER THE WATER
333628372.author: a TripAdvisor user
