333628372.reviewBody:
This beach is AMAZING!  I visited Las Gatas Beach a couple times on my trip to Zihuatanejo last  May.The first time, we caught a water taxi there (only about 40 pesos round trip).  BTW - do not be fooled by the guys who are taking you on a snorkel cruise for $80 or more.  You can buy water taxi tickets and do the same thing (located directly on the pier).  

Anyway, this place has the most beautiful water.  The second time I went was when I was swimming at La Madera Beach and this guy offered to take me on his jet ski (for FREE)!!  Both times I snorkled.  There is a big statue of Jesus Christ (Jesus De Cristo) there is you swim our far enough or get dropped off (in this case by jet ski).  You have to dive about 10 feet or so to see it but it is the most beautiful and magnificent thing I have ever seen.  

There are restaurants all the way down this beach and they want you to buy food from them to use the sun chairs.  Otherwise, you can walk down towards the other side of the beach where the surfers go.  Also very beautiful and cool to see the surfing up close!  There you may lay out your towel and sleep on the sand.

The water was turqouise and but the bottom has reef.  You can swim out a little bit towards the boats parked in the water and stand on sand.  

This place is your corona commercial experience!  12 beers for 10 bucks, excellent guac and ceviche...

This place is a must see if you are in or near Zihua!

333577897.name: Family friendly beach in Zihua
333577897.author: a TripAdvisor user
333577897.reviewBody: We visited Playa Las Gatas in 2010 with a 4 year old and again in 2015 with a 18 month and 9 year old. This beach is ideal for chilling with kids. The calm, clear waters and shallow beach make it a great place to sit in the shade on the comfort of beach chairs with your feet in the waves (and cold Coronas readily available) while kids can play safely on the beach (under watchful eye of course). I imagine it can get busy on weekends so best to go weekdays or early in the morning for a good spot. There are also massages available there. If you are staying on La Ropa, you can walk the short rocky trail from the south end of the beach near La Gaviota Restaurant, to Las Gatas Beach. It takes about 15 minutes. There are a couple spots where you need to use your hands to support yourself climbing over rocks, but we were able to do it with a baby in a backpack and a 9 year old, no problem. Water taxis are available from the main pier in Zihua as well.

333374881.name: WARM, CALM BUT POOR VISABILITY IF SNORKELLING IS YOUR GOAL
333374881.author: a TripAdvisor user
333374881.reviewBody: We walked the rocky path from La Ropa to Las Gatas (25 mins) 4 tough spots ( wet rocks can be dangerous).  As a woman in my late 50`s I wouldn`t do it again Second time we negotiated a boat ride from La Ropa for 50 pesos one way.  It is cheaper from Zihua pier ($4 round trip) but we were staying above La Ropa Beach.  9 years ago this place had 3 small cabanas now they are packed one after another all vieing for your business. Snorkelling gear will set you back $10 and beer $2-$2.50.  The bay is very calm and water is warm but visability for snorkelling not the best to see the King of Kings (statue under water 5 meters).  Fish so so around man made reef of rocks which is constantly stirred up by the coming and going from the boats.  If Snorkelling is not your goal, it is a great view from the beach.  Tourist prices on lunch.  Recommend Restaurant Otillia second from end - VeryVERY clean .

333034964.name: Tight beach, lots of locals.
333034964.author: a TripAdvisor user
333034964.reviewBody: Good snorkeling, lots of restaurants for food and drink, but bring cash as they do not handle credit cards!  Accessible by boat and walking over treacherous rocks.

332487851.name: Best beach in Ziha or Ixtapa
332487851.author: a TripAdvisor user
332487851.reviewBody: We took the local boat from the marina for $2.50 each and spent a day in paradise.The beach was the cleanest and calmest in the entire area.We had a choice of at least 8 restaurants and chair locations.

332139480.name: GREAT BEACH DAY
332139480.author: a TripAdvisor user
332139480.reviewBody: This is worth the walk or boat ride over no cars here . Take the bot from marina or if your on la ropa beach walk south to end of beach grab a beer take a 15 minute walk little rough for flip flops wear your runners on walk . great relaxing beach good service everywhere we liked campo juan and magican where great hosts

331785173.name: ANother great day trip
331785173.author: a TripAdvisor user
331785173.reviewBody: Snorkeling, eating and drinking. A nice beach across from the marina. it is waling distance to the marina and then a water taxi to Las Gatas. When you get there.....pick a spot and ENJOY!

329692862.name: Great Snorkelling!
329692862.author: a TripAdvisor user
329692862.reviewBody: We visited Las Gatas beach as we heard that there was great snorkelling there. The beach is relatively small (in comparison to La Ropa), it will depend on what you like to do, as to whether this beach is worth a visit. It is very much catering for tourists, with the beach lined with bars and restaurants. I imagine in high season it is full of people. You can organise snorkelling, scuba, banana boat rides etc. It was a bit busy for what we wanted, but that was purely personal. Snorkelling was enjoyable, with lots of tropic fish to see really close to the shore. You can get to the beach by boat from the Zihua pier. Buy your ticket at the ticket office at 40 Pesos out and return, per person. Be careful, as one of the men milling about offered us the same trip at 200 Pesos per person!

329171223.name: Our first stop by Kayak
329171223.author: a TripAdvisor user
329171223.reviewBody: We rented a tandem kayak through our resort, Club Intrawest, and decided to visit Las Gatas.\nWe paddled across the bay from our beach, and in about 30 minutes we arrived at the Playa. Only accessible by boat, it was a row of restaraunts, and small shops to rent waters ports items and buy souvenirs. We decided to relax in one of the many lounge chairs and enjoy a cocktail. The water was blue and clear, and gorgeous. Best part was , it was very reasonable in price.

328109837.name: Awesome beach day trip
328109837.author: a TripAdvisor user
328109837.reviewBody: I walked here along the rocky path from La Ropa beach. Wow! This is the spot to chill out on a clean, lovely beach with heaps of food & drinking establishments to chose from. The sand was white & clean & the water gets deep within a couple of metres from the shore. It reminded me of many of Thailands beaches from the past. I visited in low season & it was quite which was great. Walk to the far end, Otilas I think it\'s  called, & relax on a sunlounge while being waited on all day. Best beach in all of Zihua/Ixtapa.

327913689.name: Relaxing at its best
327913689.author: a TripAdvisor user
327913689.reviewBody: One of my favorite Zi places to kayak, boat and take a break from the hotels.  It is very cost effective and so relaxing.  Food is great and so are the people

326675166.name: Gorgeous hidden beach!
326675166.author: a TripAdvisor user
326675166.reviewBody: One of the best beaches in Mexico!  A must stop while in Zihuatanejo! Not easy to get to, but well worth the rocky trail to get to.

322178397.name: Getting away from it all.
322178397.author: a TripAdvisor user
322178397.reviewBody: Playa Las Gatas is the perfect get away from it all.  Beautiful beach dotted with local restaurants.  Clear water.  Snorkel without a snorkel.   Favorite stops are Carlos Scuba/Chef Camille, Chez Arnoldo, Otija.  When in Zihuatanejo we can be found here at least once a week.  See all of you soon!

319167023.name: Favorite beach!
319167023.author: a TripAdvisor user
319167023.reviewBody: One of our best days! Walk down to the marina and get a water taxi for 40 pesos per person both ways - take some tips for along the way too!  Once your over we went to the place with the blue roof (second to last along the beach) - David was our waiter and is attentive and helpful!  We spent almost the whole day there, relaxing under umbrellas and floating in the water with tubes we purchased for 100 pesos over there.

317838079.name: Short haul from Z
317838079.author: a TripAdvisor user
317838079.reviewBody: Overall, a great place, if you don\'t mind the hawkers constantly there.   We were directed to Arnoldo\'s by Carlos Scuba, and this was an excellent recommendation.  Ate there twice--first time a 5+, second time a solid 5.  Fun to watch the surfers, sip a beer, and spend some time with my wife. And, have a two peso coin for getting on and off the boat--they hit up the tourists, not the locals.

316321875.name: Just Check What\'s Fresh
316321875.author: a TripAdvisor user
316321875.reviewBody: I wouldn\'t return. The food wasn\'t good, especially the mushy octopus. But it\'s a pleasant boat ride out and back. Restaurants line the beach from end to end. Quieter than La Ropa.

314564575.name: Relax after fishing
314564575.author: a TripAdvisor user
314564575.reviewBody: We go Las Gatas one day each trip, been going to Zihua for 12 yrs.  After fishing we bring our catch to Arnaldos to see Chi and have them prepare our fish.  Awesome prep, great service, great views.  Great day on a beautiful beach with great food and drinks.  Not to be missed.

311715804.name: Nice swimming beach
311715804.author: a TripAdvisor user
311715804.reviewBody: Lots of locals and more primitive restaurants. Amatos was a favorite for food and fishing excursion.  You catch it, they prepare it for you that day and then relax swimming in the beach.  Accessible only by water taxi from the naval pier, a great place to experience real local culture food and recipes, while enjoying the well protected beach.

311420137.name: Not my preference, but beautiful
311420137.author: a TripAdvisor user
311420137.reviewBody: The beach itself is beautiful, mostly clear waters, calm surf, greenery surrounding, white sand(ish) but it was crowded with vendors that make it so you have to buy a drink at least at some establishment to use the beach chairs that are pretty much right up to the surf, so the beach itself feels crowded. Actually, it wasn\'t bad bc you probably want at least a bottle of water or maybe lunch and you have a table and beach chairs as long as you want. The down side is you get hassled by every.single.vendor. that you pass by, and it gets old, you can\'t even walk across the beach without trying to not be rude and brush off vendors when you first arrive. The beach is kinda rocky so I would recommend water shoes if you have them. Oh yeah, keep your ticket from the water taxi to get back to the main pier if that\'s how you got there. Snorkelling was fun, and pretty good, lots of small fish, we saw angelfish, a box fish, and a small eel, for some of the highlights. Food at the restaurant we posted up at wasn\'t terrible, but was not good in my opinion. Maybe the other places are better.

309542781.name: A fun place to go
309542781.author: a TripAdvisor user
309542781.reviewBody: Liked family type atmosphere at all beach side restaurants and going snorkeling with a guide and a group.  It is a nice beach visited by locals and Mexican tourists.  This was a very inexpensive experience since we walked there from our hotel, took a water taxi back to the main port and snorkeling with a group was also very inexpensive

309278532.name: Didn\'t live up to the hype
309278532.author: a TripAdvisor user
309278532.reviewBody:
Locals built up Playa Las Gatas as this magical snorkelling area with an excellent reef. It did not live up to this as it was mostly just a bunch of rocks piled up where the waves would break over them reducing the visibility to almost an arms length. Not only that we had to contend with getting out. Make sure you know where the shallow parts are and where the reef is when swimming back to shore, I ended up swimming over another shallower rock pile and barely managed to avoid getting dropped on the rocks by the waves. My girlfriend took a different way back and was just fine.

While the snorkelling wasn't up to par, if you are into hiking, I definitely recommend walking from the far south end of Playa La Ropa to this beach. There will be a some rock scrambling, but the trail is decent enough to get there. Watch out for high tide as sometimes the trail can be covered by the ocean. The hike alone was worth the 40 pesos you save by not taking a water taxi.

Finally the restaurants seemed pretty good given their remote location. While I didn't eat there the staff at our place seemed friendly enough when the two of us ordered beers for our post swim. 

We saw two locals surfing the point as we explored further up the beach. They were riding the waves as they wrapped around the point into the bay.

Recommended for hiking, beach walking, and exploring.

309020701.name: Best Beach in Ixtapa
309020701.author: a TripAdvisor user
309020701.reviewBody: After visiting Ixtapa Island and seeing several other beaches in Mexico, my wife and I resolved that this beach is our personal favorite in Ixtapa. It is far less crowded then Ixtapa Island, has no waves and extremely clear, warm water. Restaurants will still compete to have you sit in their location, but as long as you buy one beer, you are good to stay all day long. The best way to get to Las Gatas is by boat taxi. Make sure you purchase your tickets from the actual ticket booth and not by a private party or local offering you a "special boat". Be smart, but this secret beach is well worth the travel!

308934252.name: Gilligan\'s Island
308934252.author: a TripAdvisor user
308934252.reviewBody: We were originally told that a water taxi was 40 pesos per person to get over to Playa las Gatas, but we discovered that it is actually 75 pesos per person or 300 pesos per couple, roundtrip, so we ended up walking from Playa la Ropa over to Playa las Gatas.  At first, we thought it looked like a pretty daunting task, but it really wasn\'t that bad.  There is a walkway half way there, then the other half you have to walk/hike/climb along the rocks.  It is definitely not a walk for the elderly or children, but great for hikers.  Once we made it over there, we thought it looked like Gilligan\'s Island.  It is very remote with very clear water.  It was much easier to get in the water here than it was at Playa la Ropa.  The current and waves aren\'t as forceful.  We found that Otilia\'s was the perfect spot to spend the day.

308601783.name: Great place to visit
308601783.author: a TripAdvisor user
308601783.reviewBody: I enjoy pass a nice and calm day in this beach, we pay for the tour and they show us all the beaches and the story of each of them, and the tour with the transportation it cost 250 pesos which is not expensive and beach is awesome also the cost include the service of the boat the whole day. I really recommend to come and take this trip you would be have a lot of fun.

307856836.name: Quick boat trip from Playa La Ropa
307856836.author: a TripAdvisor user
307856836.reviewBody: Took a fishing trip and ended here to cook our blackfin tuna and snorkel. With it being the off season, the beach was practically dead but the copious beach chairs were a signal that its probably a hot place during the regular season. We were told it was the best snorkeling around but the murky water and strong current made it hard to tell. Lots of colorful fish, a Jesus statue and an anchor made it worthwhile. We werent sure if fresh running water was available because the restaurant had pipes connecting from the ocean salt water. Not really sure if it was a concern but its something to consider when thinking of prepared foods and a shower after swimming in the ocean! The snorkeling was the highlight overall and must be amazing during the regular season!

305870274.name: Great day trip!
305870274.author: a TripAdvisor user
305870274.reviewBody: We took a water taxi to Playa Las Gatas for a day trip. There are many restaurants along the beach and the waiters will come out and try to entice you to come in. My advice? Walk the entire strip and then come back and choose the one you want. All are good, we chose Otilia\'s, subject of a different review. Bring water shoes in case you chose to walk further up the beach past the restaurant. The water is cool, clean, and the surf was mild. A local vendor came by with some fresh fruits and vegetables for sale. We bought some Jicama that was awesome. A few vendors will wander by with jewelry and other wares. If you aren\'t interested just so "No, Gracias", they will move on. We spent about 5 hours here, had a great lunch, some cocktails, and had a relaxing time. Will definetly return!

302583481.name: Lovely Destination at Zihuatanejo
302583481.author: a TripAdvisor user
302583481.reviewBody: Of the several beach areas in Zihuatanejo, Playa Las Gatas should not be missed if possible.  With a man-made reef nearby, the water is calm and the snorkeling very appealing.  Apparently an ancient indigenous king had the reef built to protect the beach for his pleasure.  As with any stretch of beach like this, the bar/restaurant vendors will aggressively push for your business, but they seem to mostly all offer reasonable meals & beverages.  Las Gatas is less accessible than the other beaches but worth the effort.  If near the Centro area, a water taxi can ferry you over (and back) to the beach, which is on the opposite side of the Bahia de Zihuatanejo.  If on or near La Ropa, consider walking along the trail that is well used these days.  It\'s rocky and a bit precarious at times; not recommended for small children or anyone who may not be steady on their feet.  Weekends can be very busy, so consider Las Gatas on a weekday if you can.  You won\'t be disappointed in a day spent there.  :)

302184068.name: A bucket of beer on ice and freshly caught and prepared snapper - and a great beach experience.
302184068.author: a TripAdvisor user
302184068.reviewBody:
Take a ponga (little boat - usual capacity about 10) ride from the north end of Playa Municipal. You will buy a round-trip ticket, because the beach closes late afternoon and everyone has to go back.
Playa Las Gatas is a day beach that we always visit at least once on our trips to Zihuatanejo. The beachside consists of one restaurant after another (not sure, but there must be at least a dozen) with lounge chairs and umbrellas to use while you enjoy the water. There is a variety of water depth just off the beach, so it is easy to find a place for little ones to play and also easy access to snorkeling. This year we discovered a statue which was sunk just off the beach. (there is a story that you'll have to research, because I can't remember it, but it was interesting.)
When you're ready, they are eager to accommodate your thirst for a bucket of beer, huge margaritas, and all kinds of tasty Mexican snacks and meals. If you want, the host will find a fisherman to supply a fish fresh from the bay, which they will prepare the way you like. (grilled with lots of garlic is our choice)
The Mexicans who are there to make you comfortable do not have a great income, so be generous with tips!

299026194.name: A must
299026194.author: a TripAdvisor user
299026194.reviewBody: A lot of fun !  our first time at Playa Las Gatas.  Got there by boat and beautiful beach, gorgeous Carribean blue water Great drinks and service at Ottilio by Franco.

298522776.name: Beach escape
298522776.author: a TripAdvisor user
298522776.reviewBody: Much prettier beach then other three in Zihuatanejo. Water is much cleaner and clearer. Cheap beer on the beach, got 6 beer for 100 pesos, will take it. Lots of activities on the beach as well or just relax like we did. It can get overcrowded on the weekends, we went on weekday and it felt overcrowded, but to locals it was empty

295964344.name: Worth the trip!
295964344.author: a TripAdvisor user
295964344.reviewBody: This is always a spot we visit 2-3 times during our vacations in Zihua. We walk down to Otilla\'s and get great personalized service from David. Great food and great service. This beach has great restaurants, massages, jewelry sales, great views, and the opportunity to relax and enjoy.

295134009.name: Nice water but not worth the boat ride over.
295134009.author: a TripAdvisor user
295134009.reviewBody: The water is crystal clear but a bit dirty. Way too crowded with people and boats. Wanted to snorkel to see the Christ statue but boats were zooming all over the top. Also just way too many vendors and tourists for this small beach area.

295002831.name: Final part of our fishing day
295002831.author: a TripAdvisor user
295002831.reviewBody: Our captain, Armando on the Barracuda, brought us here after fishing all morning with him. We had caught a couple nice yellow fins, and he brought us to Mambo (?) restaurant to have them filleted/cooked and made into ceviche for us. It was a great way to end our adventure. We relaxed with a couple huge pina coladas that the owner made us. We drank them out of intricately carved pineapples! while we waited for the lunch, we took a float out in the bay. Much calmer water than in Ixtapa, so it was nice to just float. The tuna was served with some rice and salad and was amazing! We also rented some snorkel equipment from them and had Armando bring us out to the break to see some fish, urchins, and starfish. The beach did get crowded after a while, so we took our leave, but it was a great experience! We would recommend a stop here for sure and to fish with Armando on the Barracuda also!

290697320.name: Fun for a few hours
290697320.author: a TripAdvisor user
290697320.reviewBody: Good fun to go for lunch and a bit of lounging in the sun. Gets very crowded with Mexican families. Nice friendly atmosphere. I had some relaxed time and a very tasty shrimp soup (sopa de camarones) at restaurant la caba\u00f1a. Half way the beach.

288178812.name: Overcrowded Tourists Trap
288178812.author: a TripAdvisor user
288178812.reviewBody: A small beach lined with outdoor restaurants with people every five feet trying to sell you a chair and their menu to come sit down.  The water is clear, but very crowded and flooded with water taxis zooming in and out.  It seems like like a cesspool that used to be beautiful but ruined by tourists and gasoline trails floating on the water.

277868030.name: A nice way to spend the day
277868030.author: a TripAdvisor user
277868030.reviewBody:
Though, yes, the best way to reach this beach is via ferry boat (8-10 person) from the marina in the town center, for those of you who are more adventurous, there is a small and very rocky path from the south end of Playa La Ropa. It makes for an adventure!

The beach is in a small cove. You can walk from one length to the other in about 10 minutes. You could spend a few hours or the entire day. It offers a nice vista across the Bay. And, the water is pretty. If you snorkel, it is fun to bounce around in the waves here and there’s much to see on the seafloor. 

The entire cove is lined with beach bars. Once you get there, expect to be bombarded by waiters trying to get you to stop at their spot on the beach. They will all sell you on “free” lounge chairs and cold beers. (I think they are all free, at least at the times of year that we have visited – May, June, August, and September.) But, they all seem the same. So, have a plan or research here, or find a waiter that makes some connection with you.

Also, because of all of the beer selling, be careful to watch for bottle tops on the seafloor.

On the day we went, the surf was actually pretty high and the current rather strong, at least in the center part of the beach. I was disappointed to see all of the pieces (from pebble size to baseball size) of dead corral that kept washing up along the shore. For that reason, I suggest you stick to the north or south ends of the beach, which seemed to be calmer and less “rocky”.

I discourage buying the peanuts from the beach vendor. They may have pesticides and/or been handled in a manner that can cause digestion issues for travelers.

277644246.name: No, Gracias!
277644246.author: a TripAdvisor user
277644246.reviewBody: A pretty, long beach only reachable by boat but what is there is a long line of beach eateries each with its own hawker trying to pull you in to eat or drink.  If you\'re not there to eat or drink, get ready with "No, Gracias".  The water there is very clear and pretty but most folks aren\'t going in.  Just looking.  The boat ride over and back is cheap and was the highlight of the attraction.  Great views of Zihua\'s main bay and beach.  Would do it again just for the boat ride.

271553622.name: Fine end to a fishing excursion
271553622.author: a TripAdvisor user
271553622.reviewBody:
We met Marcos on the Intrawest beach and to my surprise my dear wife agreed to go fishing. This was not deep sea big fish, just a cruise down the coast, trawling a few lines, snorkeling and in the end we spent a couple of hours at Gatas. Our skipper told us which restaurant to take our fish and sure enough they did a great job at preparation and presentation. Our snapper in oil and lime and the tuna breaded with just enough spice for interest. 

We are divers, so I must say the snorkeling at Gatas is just OK but the water was calm and  the visibility perfect. 
When you go, and everybody does pick one of the first restaurants, the food and service is the same all down the beach, but the beach is better.

269232416.name: Great day trip
269232416.author: a TripAdvisor user
269232416.reviewBody: Small beach with clear, warm water though watch the rocks!  Lots of scuba divers.  The water taxi is a fun, inexpensive way to get on the water though apparently you can walk from Playa la Ropa.  Lots of dining spots on the beach.  Highly recommend Restaurant Otilia and the helpful waiter frank.  Coconut shrimp are remarkable!

265770377.name: Great beach day
265770377.author: a TripAdvisor user
265770377.reviewBody: Taking a water taxi from the pier in Zihua to Las Gatas is great vacation day for everyone.  Good swimming in the ocean with a small surf. There are several beach restaurants lined up on the beach with good Mexican food and beer, drinks etc.  They all have similar menus and lounge chairs for their customers.  We have never had any problems but check your bill before paying\nIt is a fun day

265100049.name: Calm Waters, Good Food
265100049.author: a TripAdvisor user
265100049.reviewBody: You take a little boat from the main quay to get here, there\'s no driving. It is protected by a breakwater making the beach surf very calm, perfect for little kids. The entire back of the beach is covered with restaurants, great selection of food and drinks. It all starts closing up from 5:30pm onwards and the last boat is before 6:30pm. It\'s definitely worth a day trip.

264698808.name: The water is great, but it\'s very rocky and crowded
264698808.author: a TripAdvisor user
264698808.reviewBody:
We could see Las Gatas from our house in the hills and heard it was a terrific place to visit.  We made our way by bus down to the pier and hopped on a ferry to go across.  It was a very easy on/easy off boat ride.  

The water is incredibly clear but the beach is unbelievably crowded.  I'm not sure I've ever been to a beach that had so many people.  We walked down toward the other end to find chairs at a restaurant and an area that wasn't so crowded, but that's not easy.

The other thing you need to know is you should bring water shoes with you.  You walk into the water on crushed shells, which isn't really a problem but once you start really walking into that water, it's all sharp rocks and it's like that for as far as you can go into the ocean in that area.  Please.... wear your water shoes.

Once I put my snorkel gear on, I saw some beautiful fish.  They're not the most colorful I've seen, but there's plenty in there.  We swam through really large schools of small fish.

Apparently there's a big statue of Jesus buried off this beach somewhere but I didn't have time to go look for it.  It's supposed to be pretty cool, though.

It's also fun to watch so many pelicans dive head first into the water from high above to catch a fish.  I could watch that all day.

In the end I'm glad we went but I would probably go again on a day that's not so crowded and I would definitely wear water shoes next time.  Great for families.

261702053.name: Playa Las Gatas
261702053.author: a TripAdvisor user
261702053.reviewBody: Spend one of your days at this relaxing beach area!  Take the water taxi from then Marina at Zihuat.  All of the restaurants are great!  We have becomes friends with Jose & Miquel.  Very inexpensive and easy to snorkel, paddle board.

261316332.name: Best Beach
261316332.author: a TripAdvisor user
261316332.reviewBody: Boat access only.  Lots of great restaurants.  Clean clear water for snorkeling.  The underwater statue of Jesus a must see.  Great beach protected by a breakwater for families

261252257.name: Good for kids
261252257.author: a TripAdvisor user
261252257.reviewBody: We went here the previous year on a tour but this year we took a taxi to la ropa then walked the trail to las gatas.  The trail was good, our 5 yr old walked it in flip flops and made it.  Not really a long walk and it saved money because of no taxi.  The kids loved the snorkeling here, they took limes out to attract the fish since we didn\'t have anything else and it worked.  We found the first couple restaurants had the best beach area for swimming as well as snorkeling.  Take water socks.

261055354.name: Fun excursion for great food on the beach
261055354.author: a TripAdvisor user
261055354.reviewBody: We took the water taxi over to Playa Las Gatas and strolled the beach for a day.  The beach is lined with quite a few restaurants with plenty of space for travelers to put their feet up enjoy a drink.  The food is pretty good too - we found the huge red snapper plate we ordered very tasty.  Great service at these restaurants too!  Anything you may want to rent, from snorkels to paddle boards to inflatable rafts, is available at Las Gatas.  Definitely a worthwhile day trip while in Zihuatanejo.

260912803.name: Great day well spent
260912803.author: a TripAdvisor user
260912803.reviewBody: Loved to see the clear water with some fish aroundt. Nice restaurants. Peaceful Great if you snorkel and sit by the water. Not much to do other than swim or eat at many restaurants on beach.

260633652.name: Beautiful
260633652.author: a TripAdvisor user
260633652.reviewBody: This is a wonderful beach, safer for the kids then many of the other beaches in the area. Snorkeling was just OK.

260626598.name: worth the walk
260626598.author: a TripAdvisor user
260626598.reviewBody: getting here is either by boat (for ? peso or more) or as we did a walk along the rocks. Lots of restaurants and vendors but what did you think you were going to get. This must have been something back in the 60\'s and 70\'s

260439220.name: Dirty, Poor Food, Ripoffs Abound
260439220.author: a TripAdvisor user
260439220.reviewBody: Its a bit of a boat trip, which is pleasant.  Our drinks were watery and weird, definitely not with the Don Julio that we ordered.  The beach looks terribly polluted up close; saw a diaper floating around.   Nice to look at from a distance but wont return.

259897756.name: Favourite Beach
259897756.author: a TripAdvisor user
259897756.reviewBody: Hi. We went to Playa Las Gatas for the first time in three years. Went  by water taxi with another couple from our villa. Stopped at la Cabana restaurant. They treated us very good.  Spent  about four hours  there. Our waiter Ricardo was the best. Beer was ice cold. He suggested the  pineapple fillet on the menu. All four of us ordered it and it was delicious. Do some exploring when there and bring water socks to go into the water.  Wayne and Pat K

259636563.name: Our favourite beach!!
259636563.author: a TripAdvisor user
259636563.reviewBody: This water is absolutely gorgeous! The setting was beautiful, lots of restaraunts to choose from (Cabanas was amazing!) Taking a boat is a bit of a hassle if there isnt enough people to go you have to wait awhile. Well worth the wait.

259581561.name: Unspoiled
259581561.author: a TripAdvisor user
259581561.reviewBody: Short boat ride from Zia. docks for 40pesos return you find an unspoiled beach wit incredible snorkeling and wild life. Walk from the dock to almost the end of the beach and ask for Franco and receive the best service, best food and best drinks at ridiculous prices.

259574187.name: Quieter, secluded beach with good snorkeling and waves
259574187.author: a TripAdvisor user
259574187.reviewBody: I have paddled (SUP) by this beach many early mornings and noted how pretty and quiet it is before the day tourists arrive.  This is the smallest beach within the Zihuatanejo Bay at at the far south side. We later visited the beach & one of the restaurants under palapas for a late afternoon of relaxing.  While the entire beach was filled with vacationers, it was noticeably quiet and serene.  There were gentle waves big enough to surf or to boogie board on.  There were good margaritas and the beach food seemed decent.  Definitely worth a day trip.

259433304.name: Worth The Hike (or boat ride)
259433304.author: a TripAdvisor user
259433304.reviewBody: Playa Las Gatas is still a relatively undiscovered beach across from Playa La Ropa. It\'s only a short water taxi from the Zihua harbor, or a walk along a path (and a few rocks) from the end of Playa La Ropa. The chaise lounges and umbrellas are free, the food is good, there\'s snorkeling ($5 to rent gear) that\'s worth doing, and the people are friendly.

259047786.name: A change of pace
259047786.author: a TripAdvisor user
259047786.reviewBody: The ferry ride is always enjoyable. We have tried a variety of restaurants here over the years and do not expect too much. This is not a foodies place but was a great place for my daughter\'s first snorkel. It is calm inside the reef. I recommend snorkeling at high tide, this area is shallow all the way to the reef. Beach shoes are an asset if not wearing flippers. Not much fun standing on the bottom in bare feet and there is the occasional urchin.\nThe snorkeling is not great - Ixtapa Island is much better.\nOverall it is a great beach to go and get away from the hustle and bustle and read a book.

258263495.name: Good place for snorkel without having to hire a boat.
258263495.author: a TripAdvisor user
258263495.reviewBody: A small and sometimes packed beach. The sandy area can be quite tight along certain parts of the beach but if you wander over it is a nice relaxing beach to check out. Even though there are roads up the hill at the back of the beach, they say that you can only get there by boat or by walking across the rocks from Playa la Ropa (recommended). There is also some basic accommodation offered at the beach which we would have liked to check out as it would have been a real chillout to stay there.

257351082.name: Pretty beach no surf
257351082.author: a TripAdvisor user
257351082.reviewBody: Our fishing trip ended here we were dropped of at a beach bar / Restaurant they cooked our fish and made crevice  it was allot of fun it was a Monday and there were not many people. we thought it reminded us of Ixtapa Island  nice place for a day trip  buy food and drinks and chairs are free and they have rustic toilets

256212692.name: Best beach in Zihua
256212692.author: a TripAdvisor user
256212692.reviewBody: You have to take a water taxi over to this island but so worth it.  The water is crystal blue and tons of stuff to do there as well.

255861919.name: A secret hideaway
255861919.author: a TripAdvisor user
255861919.reviewBody: Moderately good snorkelling. Great food on the beach?..can walk on a patch of rough terrain to Playa de Ropa....beautiful!

255668360.name: Playa las Gatas Snorkeling
255668360.author: a TripAdvisor user
255668360.reviewBody: Decent snorkeling  at this locations.  Underwater statue of Jesus in about 30 feet of water under an orange buoy.  Good variety of fish and better coral outside of the stone breaker.  Seen some nice eels and angel fish.  Lots of small puffer fish.  Water is quite calm and beach restaurants are good about you leaving your towels and bags on tables. We just bought a drink when we were done.\nCosts 40 pesos return to take the water taxi from the pier.  Helpers will ask for tips.  Go early to avoid the crowds.  Water taxis start between 9 and10 in the morning.

255512681.name: Don\'t forget your surf shoes
255512681.author: a TripAdvisor user
255512681.reviewBody: I liked that the restaurants are quite close to the beach and you can get a drink and sit close to the waters. Crystal clear beach. A bit rocky though so be careful. Didn\'t try snorkeling but was told by other travelers that it wasn\'t a good spot but decent enough to see some fishes.

254374332.name: Way better than Ixtapa Island
254374332.author: a TripAdvisor user
254374332.reviewBody: This is a way better place to swim, water is way calmer for snorkeling and swimming.  The restaurant people are way better not pushy and demanding like they are at ixtapa island.  Don\'t see why all the fuss about Ixtapa Island now.

253831782.name: Swimming Is Terrific
253831782.author: a TripAdvisor user
253831782.reviewBody: There is coral, fish and the swimming area is protected by a small reef.  The water is clear so snorkeling is great.  Add to that the many restaurants along the beach.  Its a great day away from it all

253731588.name: nice quiet beach...
253731588.author: a TripAdvisor user
253731588.reviewBody: Elrarific.... is a nice place to enjoy ur day ....jose is a great host... everyday had chairs and tables out for us .... nice coral reef ... beatiful

253361073.name: Lunch with Franco
253361073.author: a TripAdvisor user
253361073.reviewBody:
Our day at Las Gatas began with a quick trip by public transit to Zihua from Ixtapa, and we were  dropped at Centro near Cinco De Maya Rd. . The cost was 12 pesos each , same on the way home . A walk down the road , for a 10 minute walk at about 9 am to the pier . Cinco de Maya is where the flea market is . When you get to pier your will notice a number of shops , and they are worth a stop on your way home. Great coffee shop !  Cost to the island was 40-50 pesos ? I think, was not a lot in any case . They give you a ticket for your return ride home , don't lose that. You can walk to the island from the end of La Ropa beach  , as long as you have good foot ware and have no mobility issues.

 Arrived around 930 am, and went directly to Otila's . The ever charming Franco greeted us , and directed us to some beach front chaise lounges and a table . We did not find any of the other restaurant owners to be aggressive as we had heard in other reports .

Got in some early snorkelling , and would suggested you go out beyond the man made reef , as the sea life is far more abundant . Was not able to locate the statue , but neither was the guide who was ahead of me taking people out , so I did not feel so bad . Did several snorkelling excursions throughout the day . Water was quite warm. Met several folks from all over Canada and US , and some who had been coming for years. I always like to pick their brains for places to go and see for future trips. 

Next up was lunch of coconut shrimp and chips and guacamole . All delicious . Frank checks in on you regularly and was not pushy . 

This was Monday and it was quite quiet until about 2pm , which was not a bad thing . I had heard it was much busier , but guess we got lucky .  

We headed off the island at 4 pm, and were back at pier by 415 pm . Just enough time to stroll along the pier and shop areas .

A fun filled day , which I would highly recommend when visiting the area .

252801156.name: Nice calm water
252801156.author: a TripAdvisor user
252801156.reviewBody: If you go on a weekday and not the weekend....absolutely peaceful and quiet beach to enjoy. Weekend much more crowded because of popularity with locals...boat access only!

252793557.name: Perfect private spot to shore up and have a fresh catch cooked up.
252793557.author: a TripAdvisor user
252793557.reviewBody: Nice private cove with plenty of chairs and a decent toilet too. Walk to the end and visit the abandoned beach resort, but bring some flip flops it get a little rocky from the coral washed up.

252674222.name: Don\'t miss it!
252674222.author: a TripAdvisor user
252674222.reviewBody: This little beach and protected lagoon is a great place to swim . . . and visit . . . and eat.  You can get there by water taxi from the main pier in Zihua or walk the rocky path from Playa la Ropa.  It is worth the effort!

252149939.name: Vacation inside a vacation
252149939.author: a TripAdvisor user
252149939.reviewBody: Take the water taxi & be prepared for tipping at the other end.  Easy to rent decent snorkel gear without even signing up or leaving a deposit!  Beautiful beach with entertainment passing by.  OK snorkelling on this day.  Lots of Mexicans come here to enjoy the day.  Comfy to set up on the beach at any one of the reastaurants while you enjoy their lounge chairs, food & drink.  Fresh water showers in behind.

251682524.name: Great for Families with kids
251682524.author: a TripAdvisor user
251682524.reviewBody: Las Gatas is ideal for families with young children as the water is crystal clear and with hardly any waves. Water shoes are a plus as there is a lot of broken coral and shells.

251271440.name: Nice walk
251271440.author: a TripAdvisor user
251271440.reviewBody: We were staying at La Ropa so walked over the rocks to Los Gatos.  Tried to walk to the Lighthouse but there no longer is a way to get there from here as indicated in many of the travel books.  all the amendities are here

250854581.name: So beautiful
250854581.author: a TripAdvisor user
250854581.reviewBody: The crowds are a little less at this beach than La Ropa, and the water is just amazing - so clear and beautiful for swimming and snorkelling.

250202253.name: Not Particulary Nice
250202253.author: a TripAdvisor user
250202253.reviewBody: Took the launch to Las Gatas with a group of friends from the Bay View Grand Marina. Our plan was to stay for the day. Some of us came back after a couple of hours. The beach is very narrow. We walked to the end and around the bend a bit returned and decided to leave. Been there, done that and don\'t see any point in returinng.

249924815.name: Wonderful beach
249924815.author: a TripAdvisor user
249924815.reviewBody: Playa Ropa is a great 2 mile beach near Zihutenejo. You can walk or cab there from town  if you are not staying at a hotel on the beach. There are several hotels on the beach or within walking distance. The beach is located in a bay so it is nice for swimming. Lots of families frequent the beach. There are  some nice resturants and the vendors are not aggressive.

249620680.name: Ok
249620680.author: a TripAdvisor user
249620680.reviewBody: Go to Ixtapa Island for kayaking and snorkeling. Its much better than Gatas. You can get there from the town marina for 40 pesos each way. Careful for the sharp coral . I cut my hands and feet.

248489442.name: Playa las Gatas
248489442.author: a TripAdvisor user
248489442.reviewBody: Boat ride is 40 pesos from the marina in ZIH. We kayaked from Madera beach which took only 30 minutes and a great trip. Good snorkeling from a man made reef that protects the bay, and it has an awesome statue of Christ underwater about 100 meters out from the reef. Good restaurants and some shopping. You can walk along the shore from Playa la Ropa but good shoes required cuz it\'s rocky on the last portion, but not that hard to do!  Chairs are free but beer is 20 pesos.  We spent a lot of afternoon at Playa Las Gatos!

248196615.name: stunning piece of earth
248196615.author: a TripAdvisor user
248196615.reviewBody:
We were staying in Ixtapa at Dorado Sunscape, an awesome resort in itself.  However it is the Pacific Ocean, and given the broken arm and maimed faces on adults we saw, we decided to take our children, 4 and 8, to a beach where they could play freely.
We took a quick, inexpensive cab ride(90 pesos) to Zihua and then a taxi type boat for a few pesos more.  Although my wife had a little trepidation I did point out the bag of life vests and the drivers were obviously experienced so after a short hop across the bay we disembarked.
We walked along until we reached a restaurant that actually had open beach chairs, which to my surprise, there was no charge.  We did have a table behind it and promised to purchase lunch and drinks.  I had to talk my wife into  the Dorado but soon after people started bringing in their own, which seems to be the norm and assured her of the freshness.  I had the huachinango which was superb as was her dorado and the margueritas.  It is a crowded beach but it served the purpose excellently as the kids played among a rock/reef that was full of crabs, fish, pieces or coral and children all around.  It is definitely crowded with locals, vacationing Mexicans from other areas and other tourists but to us that was part of the charm.
An excellent adventure with very placid waters.

247043499.name: We spent the whole day... twice!
247043499.author: a TripAdvisor user
247043499.reviewBody:
We were lucky enough to enlist the help of Rodimus, the best fisherman on the beach, to take us out for deep sea fising (10 of us!) on a great boat for the whole morning, then back to Playa Las Gatas for lunch of our own fish cooked up fresh by Jose (blue awning, way down at the end of the beach). Then snorkeling and sunbathing. What a day!
So much fun we did it again, this time sent the guys out deep sea fishing, where Rodimus helped them find an eight-foot sailfish! What a thrill to reel in! And then again lunch prepared by Jose, and more snorkeling. We stayed until the very end of the day.
Water taxi (bus really) is 40 peso per person, buy return tickets at the harbour.
Hint: if you have a local guide you can sometimes jump the line for the taxi boats heading back to the Zihuat harbour, and of course the guys went back on the fishing boat.
Hint: wear water shoes - where the best snorkeing is there are a lot of rocks, which you should avoid standing on so as to preserve the ecosystem, but you may scrape your feet without protection.
Hint: best way to get around is to find a cab driver you trust, and keep using the same fellow. Our favorite is Joel Varquez Dominguez, who will take you anywhere, any time, very affordable, very knowledgeable and perfect English.
His number is 755-114-9987

246913088.name: Way too crowded
246913088.author: a TripAdvisor user
246913088.reviewBody: We took a small boat to this island, and too many people had the same idea. It\'s too small a beach to have any space to feel like your neighbors aren\'t completely on top of you. The food wasn\'t as good as at Playa Madera. The water, however, was gorgeous! The sand is light and the water is clear, and you can see small schools of fish swimming around your feet. If you have snorkel gear or feel like renting or buying on the beach, you can go out further and see more variety. Water shoes are a must. The ocean floor is rocky. I went in with my flip flops and that was fine.

246379986.name: Busy over Christmas
246379986.author: a TripAdvisor user
246379986.reviewBody: Lots of people very closer together.  Cold beers.  Service was so so.  We did not eat.  The shuttle over and back was easy and inexpensive.\n

246326227.name: Water is clear and the snorkeling is close
246326227.author: a TripAdvisor user
246326227.reviewBody: You can rent snorkeling gear and swim out to the sunken Jesus statue without any problem.  We walked over from Playa la Ropa... but you can also take the ferry from Zihua.  Otherwise... same as all the other beaches but seems more packed because it\'s smaller?

245549453.name: Truly paradise - Otilia\'s
245549453.author: a TripAdvisor user
245549453.reviewBody: The walk to otilia\'s was worth it.   Like a hike back in time, a little surreal and a very relaxing week.   Franco was a treat.  Otilia herself was on the kitchen and was very nice.  The fresh fish was cooked simply and was delicious. During our week there we kept going back.

245357909.name: Beach
245357909.author: a TripAdvisor user
245357909.reviewBody: Great beach and a little cheaper than Ixtapa island.  The water is calm because of the rocks that stop the waves.

244975054.name: Las Gatas - A Must-Do
244975054.author: a TripAdvisor user
244975054.reviewBody:
The water taxi to Las Gatas departing from the Marina in Z is easy, cheap, and reliable. Once you get to the Las Gatas dock, the beach is spread out before you with about a dozen beach restaurants; you will have to run the gauntlet of waiters all trying to convince you to stop at there restaurant, but in my opinion the best restaurants are the last two. 

Restaurant Otilia (second from the end) is managed by Franco, who looked after us for 2 consecutive days in early December. The loungers, tables, and water chairs were all clean and in good condition, and the washroom was meticulously clean. We had two complete meals at the restaurant and both were high quality with the freshest seafood at a reasonable price. Average cost for the full day including lots of bottled water, multiple drinks and full meals for two was about $35USD per person. 

Las Gatas has some of the best snorkeling in the region, including sea turtles, eels, and lots of different varieties of fish. There are also a couple of sunken monuments put in place by the government to increase the enjoyment of snorkelers. 

All in all, a great way to spend a relaxing day away from the crowds. For us it's a must-do when in the area.

244551467.name: Franco @ Otilia\'s = The Man!
244551467.author: a TripAdvisor user
244551467.reviewBody: Walk past all of the other places to Otilias. Franco will set you up. He made us fresh Tiritas from a tuna that was just handed to him from a boat. All of their food is great and reasonable. Jorge the Silver guy may stop by too. My wife is a jeweller and his prices are excellent for his quality merchandise. AND he takes plastic!

244317797.name: Great local hangout!
244317797.author: a TripAdvisor user
244317797.reviewBody:
Las Gatas is a great unpretentious little beach in Zihuatanejo. We walked over from nearby beach Playa La Ropa (instead of taking a water taxi). It helped that we wore sneakers for the 10-15 min hike over some rocks but it should be no problem for those without too. 

This is a tiny beach lined almost entirely with restaurants that have tables and chairs out front on the sand. Get there earlier in the day to get a good seat at one of them. As long as you buy food and drinks at some point, you can leave your things there and go swimming and snorkeling, which is very convenient. We arrived around 11am on a Friday and found it was no problem at all but when we headed out around 2pm it had become very busy with mostly local families and a few other tourists. 

It cost about $5 US total to rent two pairs of snorkels for an unlimited time and we had a good time wading around in the water looking at the various fish and even swam next to a small sting ray at one point (bit scary in the moment!) It is always sad to see a seabed of dead coral however and Las Gatas is far from the best snorkeling I've done. Probably a good place for beginners with low expectations.

242244140.name: Busy on Sundays...less so during week
242244140.author: a TripAdvisor user
242244140.reviewBody: We followed a marked trail from the end of Playa de Ropa (there is an abandoned funicular or inclined tramway near the end) and then scrambled over the rocks on an unmaintained trail to the water taxi pier. Looks like a number of the vendors live on site and saw lots of snorklers. Not as commercial or touristy as La Ropa or La Madera . Since we didn\'t have a return tickets on a water taxi we just paid one of the local fisherman to run us to the main pier but they will drop you at any beach wherever you want as long as you don\'t mind getting wet...the boats are larger and require a push off before they can drop the outboard and get back to sea

241751997.name: Great day at Playa Las Gatas and lunch at Otillias
241751997.author: a TripAdvisor user
241751997.reviewBody: Fun relaxing day on Playa Las Gatas and drinks and lunch at Otillias.  We had the kabobs which were tasty shrimp and Mahi Mahi.  Delicious.  The water is warm like a bathtub but a bit rocky.  Would be perfect for children as it does not keep deep and is calm.

240624985.name: Skip isla ixtapa
240624985.author: a TripAdvisor user
240624985.reviewBody: We walked from La Ropa on the rocky path. No biggy w shoes. Water taxis are a no brainer. Bring your snorkel gear. Although they do have rentals. Water is so calm and clear. More intimate then the isla. Chillin in the water on an Adirondack chair w a cerveza from Orelia\'s. A good day.

240133822.name: Enjoyed meal/drinks at Ottila\'s
240133822.author: a TripAdvisor user
240133822.reviewBody: Enjoyed relaxing on the beach after our meal at Ottila\'s.\n\n**Didn\'t enjoy the pushy, somewhat demanding waiters from the other restaurants.  We knew where we were headed and didn\'t appreciate being accosted - I understand that they all need the business - it was just uncomfortable for us.

239491923.name: Good for kids, mostly.
239491923.author: a TripAdvisor user
239491923.reviewBody: If you have kids, this is okay. If you like an adult atmosphere, go instead to Playa Ropa. This beach here is chockablock with restaurants, too many, and at high tide, the beach is narrow.

238742225.name: Clear Water.
238742225.author: a TripAdvisor user
238742225.reviewBody: This beach seems over hyped. We walked here on the path from Playa La Ropa and our hotel Club Interwest. It was a 20 minute walk. We went around 7:30am for the best snorkling conditions. Sadly the reef is very broken up. Its a nice long reef parallel to the beach but we had just as good conditions right in front of our hotel. We put our towels in a tree at the far end of the beach so we didnt get hounded by the restaurants who try to get you to be patrons.\n\nThe color of the water is far better then at playa la ropa so I would take the time to visit if you are in the area.

238606663.name: Nice diversion from La Ropa
238606663.author: a TripAdvisor user
238606663.reviewBody: Took the La Ropa road to the end of Playa La Ropa and the foot path through the rocks.  About a 20 minute walk from the end of La Ropa to Las Gatas.  Walked to the end of Las Gatas beach to Otilia\'s and sat at two palapas on the beach.  Bucket of 6 cervezas (on ice), a swim in the bay, margaritas and for lunch breaded abalone was good, chicken tacos deep fried OK, shrimp cocktail good.   Paid $20 Pesos to ride the boat back to the city Centro pier.

237472354.name: Spectacular
237472354.author: a TripAdvisor user
237472354.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful. Met so many fun people. The water is beautiful and refreshing. We will be coming back.

236568248.name: I had forgotten how awesome Las Gatas is
236568248.author: a TripAdvisor user
236568248.reviewBody: My wife and I were in Zihuatanejo for a week and it was late in the week before we made our way over to las gatas.  There\'s hiking around the point, snorkeling in the bay, and a remarkable number of bars and restaurants there.  We went to the next to last place on the beach and the waiter helped us drag our chairs in to the water so we could sit and drink beers in the surf.\n\nThe day we spent out there was probably our favorite day in Zihuatanejo this trip.

233322357.name: Beach and super view of the bay and Zihuatanejo
233322357.author: a TripAdvisor user
233322357.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for a beach with a lot of beach restaurants with a lot of small restaurants, this is the place to go around Zihua. We have always used a couple of afternoons (and some nights) at this cozy beach when we visited Zihua. The water is clear and not that deep, and surrounded by a reef so you can bring the young as well. There are as said a lot of restaurants with very polite serving. You can get everything from snacks to big dinners (needs reservation I think. We did make reservations at least) with grilled lobsters, steak, octopus, calamari, fish and fruit, all prepared to perfection. If I should recommend just one place, it would be "Chez Arnoldo", just 100 m from the pier. And one thing more; don\'t forget to try a coco loco or pi\u00f1a loco. Just as good as they are big = perfecto!!\n\nIf you want to stay after around 5 in the afternoon, you have to arrange special transportation, as the last boat leaves from the beach around then, and it is a very long walk to the city.

230766622.name: A NICE DAY ACROSS THE BAY
230766622.author: a TripAdvisor user
230766622.reviewBody: My wife & I are staying in Zihuatanejo, Mexico & today we took  the water taxi across the bay to Playa Las Gatas.  There are many restaurants right on the beach and you can get a beach lounger at any of them and stay as long as you want.  The best thing is to take one at the place where you will have lunch.  They all have fresh seafood, we ate at Chez Arnoldo and it was very good. You can swim and snorkel and it is a delightful.day.

227694501.name: Beach and Board walk.
227694501.author: a TripAdvisor user
227694501.reviewBody: This is a marvelous beach nestled amongst the hills and many hotels. You can spend the day relaxing and  then enjoy the nightlife without having to make much effort. Its all at your fingertips.

226530322.name: Narrow beach
226530322.author: a TripAdvisor user
226530322.reviewBody: Cute, narrow beach. Boats run daily to/from from Zihuatanejo\'s pier, or, you can hike there, but it\'s difficult. Many small restaurants are there and you can handpick the fish you\'d like cooked to your order. We don\'t go out there as often any more as oftentimes there are red ants in the sand under your feet. The ocean is very calm and clear, and of course, a great, warm, temperature.

223723503.name: White Fine Sand And Great Seafood!
223723503.author: a TripAdvisor user
223723503.reviewBody: stroll to the end and see the place of one of the "oldest" foreigners paradise....OWEN\'s place, local huts and a small beach bar where there are always drinks but also some food served.

221664014.name: Not how it used to be
221664014.author: a TripAdvisor user
221664014.reviewBody: I went to Playa Las Gatas years ago and remember it as very untouched and beautiful. Over the years it became too developed, there is a water taxi that goes there back and force and dumps tourists there. Too many restaurant vendors, there is only a very small part of the beach at the end free of umbrellas and harassing vendors. jut grab your towel and land there.still a beautiful place . Try to go in the morning before the crowds.

220578858.name: Restaurant Arrecife at Playa Las Gatas is muy mal!
220578858.author: a TripAdvisor user
220578858.reviewBody: Horrible service. Pushy waiter - kept telling us each person must buy a plate of food to use umbrellas and chairs. I mean, he kept coming back to tell us this, and that it will take a whole HOUR to get our food cooked. Huh? There were only 3 other tables with people, not like they were hopping or anything. But, whatever. We ordered drinks and they only had ONE bottled water available, no Coca Light at all. We also ordered nachos - and it had no cheese, just onions and tomatoes, and we also ordered guacamole - again, only had tomatoes and onions...lots of onions. At this point we didn\'t want to order food since the basics were pretty bad. We left after about an hour. The waiter came after us to ask for more tip. REally? We were about to give tip, then he said, You are here visiting my country! What? We\'re turistas spending our dolares to help tourism. Not sure what his point was, but it was the rudest treatment we\'ve ever had! Muy mal!

216827835.name: Restaurant Otilin, Good Food, Beer, and a Secret
216827835.author: a TripAdvisor user
216827835.reviewBody: If you visit Las Gatas Beach from Zihua, try to make it a half day or even full day. Of course the beach is refreshing, all the restaurant vendors are anxious for your business and the good food and beer and drinks served will add to a very relaxing time, and great views back to the town and mountains beyond. I\'d suggest walking all the way down the beach, at the end away from the pier, to Restaurant Otilin. You\'ll avoid some of the at-times-crowdedness as you get to the end, and ask for Franco, if he\'s there. He\'s a great host, their food and drinks were perfect, and if you ask, he might let you in on his secret stash of local family plantation grown, hand rolled cigars for sale!!\n\nTo get there, it\'s possible to take a somewhat rocky but do-able hike along the coast from Playa La Ropa Beach, or "shop around" for a water taxi/boat ride with one of the locals.

214576953.name: Great Beach
214576953.author: a TripAdvisor user
214576953.reviewBody: A little crowded but a fun beach with cold beers,drinks and good food, with great friendly service.Nice sand and view and yes there are other people there on vacation also, so arrive early and relax.

212881480.name: Busiest Beach in the area
212881480.author: a TripAdvisor user
212881480.reviewBody: Great spot to snorkel, but don\'t come unless you like crowds.  Beach is almost totally loaded with restaurants, all serving about the same thing.  You can find a little shade and get away from the vendors on the far end.  You also don\'t have to take an expensive water taxi ride to get there.  It\'s really a short hike from the end of Playa la Ropa if you\'re not afraid to take a little rocky hike over there.  You could also snorkel along the rocks from La Ropa if you\'re adventurous. Nice little distraction from the other beaches though.

210044706.name: Nice Sand
210044706.author: a TripAdvisor user
210044706.reviewBody: I would say the nicest beach in Zih, watch out for all the locals trying to rip your arm off to come buy their beer and food. Don\'t need to pay more than 20 pesos for beer. We ate at Arnoldo\'s, very nice, good food. Tried to find the Lighthouse, but only option was through the jungle by ourselves and that was sketchy, so we opted out to just stay at the beach. Go early in the morning if you want to snorkel. We walked from La Ropa and wore our runners just for safety over the rocks near Las Gatas.

205447712.name: Yikes~ not for me!
205447712.author: a TripAdvisor user
205447712.reviewBody: If you like sunburnt Americans drinking lots of cheap beer on a crowded beach then this is for you!\nThe boat ride is delightful so I did that and then came straight back home after having a lovely chat with a local elderly woman selling banana chips.  Support the local economy by buying snacks from the women (many mothers) walking the beaches with their children.

205274982.name: Not as relaxing as I\'d hoped
205274982.author: a TripAdvisor user
205274982.reviewBody: We were told Playa Las Gatas was remote and peaceful, and a good place to snorkel. It\'s accessible mainly by a boat shuttle from the main pier in Zihua. The boat ride was fun, but once we got to Las Gatas we were immediately harassed by people from the many beachfront restaurants. Walking along the beach was like running the gauntlet. We are used to vendors in Mexico hawking their services, but this was extreme. It left a very negative taste in my mouth for the whole experience. We finally retreated to one of the restaurants that was relatively laid back.  At each restaurant you can "set up camp" on their lounge chairs and rent snorkeling equipment, as long as you buy food and beverage. I felt like it was a little bit of a racket. It turns out the snorkeling wasn\'t that good either, and there was a lot of litter on the beach and in the water.

205116455.name: Overrun with tourists and children
205116455.author: a TripAdvisor user
205116455.reviewBody: Just went once. Jam-packed, especially with kids. Not a big kiddie fan myself. Plus, the beach sands were not expansive but narrow. Could have been that I was there at high tide, but even so.

203013318.name: Fun beach
203013318.author: a TripAdvisor user
203013318.reviewBody: Great food, fun beach, snorkeling.  Try the grilled banana, condensed milk, cinnamon dessert.  Lovely, friendly people.

201423454.name: Favorite Day Trip of the Year
201423454.author: a TripAdvisor user
201423454.reviewBody: My wife and love this place. We prefer Tres Palms to spend the day. The food and drinks are great. If you want to leave the kids with a babysitter, this is what relaxation is all about! You must have a margarita and the shrimp tacos. I\'ve met many very interesting couples over the years at Las Gatas. We look forward to next year.

201127633.name: Best beach in the area
201127633.author: a TripAdvisor user
201127633.reviewBody: Well, to be perfectly clear, this was the best beach we visited while in Zihua. Apparently you can walk down a rocky path to this beach alone the cliffs, but we opted to just hire a boat taxi from the marina. White sand, blue water, and decent snorkeling just off the beach. You can opt for the crowds closer to the boat landing or simply walk a few meters to the opposite end of the beach for total isolation. There\'s plenty of beachside cantinas offering you lounge chair rentals with food and drink service. You can\'t go wrong here.

200952337.name: Mixed
200952337.author: a TripAdvisor user
200952337.reviewBody: The plus: This is a weekend destination for Mexican folks from the region. Few tourists. \nThe minus: too many people, restaurants, etc. gave it the feeling of "Coney Island of Zihuatanejo". I would skip this next trip.

200635154.name: Fabulous Beach
200635154.author: a TripAdvisor user
200635154.reviewBody: Spent 3 days at Playa las Gatas.  Spent our time at Otilia\'s.  Delicious food and service.  I had two wonderful massages.  I had fresh seafood every day.  The owners of the restaurant are wonderful people they have become dear friends.

200587646.name: nice afternoon
200587646.author: a TripAdvisor user
200587646.reviewBody: We went about 10 am .There are a lot of little restaurant beach clubs. The water is beautiful and good place to snorkel. Get there  early and stay for lunch  and a swim. It gets crowded with boats at times.

200007746.name: Good beach for sleep!
200007746.author: a TripAdvisor user
200007746.reviewBody: The beach is clean but plenty of small rocks, not like the other beaches at Zihua, the restaurants are not good enough. Is a plece only to visit half day and recover energy!

198938699.name: Walk down to the far end to Otillo\'s
198938699.author: a TripAdvisor user
198938699.reviewBody: We always spend a couple of days here during our weeklong visits to Z.  We enjoy getting away from the crowds so always head down to the far end and go see our friend, Franco.  He will give you attentive service all day long and has a great sense of humor, promising you a "peachy keen & groovy" time.  I call him El Diablo - please tell him Gary and Lani sent you!

198814745.name: Choose your activity
198814745.author: a TripAdvisor user
198814745.reviewBody: This is a great location for doing whatever you want---snorkeling, swimming, sunbathing, eating, drinking,diving, or nothing at all.  Either way, you will enjoy it.  The water is very calm and there is a reef not far from shore than you can snorkel around.  The food is incredible.  We ate at Chez Camille which is attached to Carlo Scuba Dive Shop.  The best Guacamole EVER!!!!  Safe for little children.  there is a walking path if you want to venture around the bay a bit.  Go out to the point and enjoy the view.  It\'s only 40 pesos for the roundtrip water taxi.  If you dive with Carlo Scuba, you picked up and returned in their boat for no charge.  Only takes a few minutes to get across the bay in a boat.  You could also walk all the way around from Zihua central but some parts of the path are rocky.  Pack your bag and make a day of it.  You won\'t regret a visit to Playa Las Gatas.

198659886.name: It\'s ok but if you are in the area, go to Playa La Ropa
198659886.author: a TripAdvisor user
198659886.reviewBody: This playa (beach) is just across from Playa La Ropa. It is smaller and doesn\'t offer as much as La Ropa does. It is more of a french fries, hot dog, towel on the beach sort of place. The swimming is very good as it is on La Ropa.

198540007.name: Perfect for a midweek lunch
198540007.author: a TripAdvisor user
198540007.reviewBody: Grab a lounger at Mocambo and watch the fun. Get Aurelio to tell you what fish he has fresh and ask him to grill it with his special BBQ sauce. Happy days.

198459477.name: A New Experience
198459477.author: a TripAdvisor user
198459477.reviewBody: very busy on the weekends...plan to visit during the week & it would be way better. We visited on Saturday of a long weekend & the locals take over almost everything.

198418155.name: Best beach in Zihua
198418155.author: a TripAdvisor user
198418155.reviewBody: We spent time at each of the 4 beaches and after experiencing Las Gatas, we decided to spend the rest of our trip here.  It\'s easy to catch a water taxi from the pier (40 pesos per person round trip).  The beach is much more calm than the others, but the water is much more clear.  We were able to see multiple beautiful fish swimming from the shoreline. Bring water shoes, and you will be able to wade quite a ways.  The ocean floor is rocky, but it is fairly shallow pretty far out.  Watch for Juanita selling jewelry.  She has a bag with her name on it.  She is very friendly and kind.  After purchasing some pearls and abalone necklaces from her (hand made BY HER) she sat down and made me an anklet.  she makes beautiful jewelry at fair prices.  Jorge sells very nice silver jewelry at reasonable prices.  of course, no stop in Las Gatas is complete with out visiting Franco at Otilla\'s.  Franco made our trip feel special and luxurious.  He took care of everything we needed, our drinks were never empty and came up with a number of special meals for us.  He\'s definitely in sales, but he is low pressure and takes great pride in what he does.  Excellent Pina Coladas.

197497723.name: A family beach with decent snorkeling
197497723.author: a TripAdvisor user
197497723.reviewBody:
This beach has pretty clear water and is decent for snorkeling without leaving the Zihuat area.  The beach/surf entrance can be rocky, so watch were you walk.

There are restaurant after restaurant on this beach with lounge chairs for rent or food to eat.  Local families will bring their lunches as the pricing at the restaurants are 'tourist' prices.

Fun people watching and the salt water is clean.

197393957.name: Princess Restaurant
197393957.author: a TripAdvisor user
197393957.reviewBody: This is the 1st restaurant at Las Gatos. The food is really good, and the prices are moderate. You can also go on a snorkeling tour and see all kinds of fish. Its\' a great way to spend a day on the beach at this restaurant.

197385245.name: Fun Beach
197385245.author: a TripAdvisor user
197385245.reviewBody: The water at Las Gatas is more clear than La Ropa.  The first part of the beach has much softer sand in the water, while the further you go down you will need water shoes to walk in.  We ate at Otilia\'s.  Good, friendly service from Franco.

197264751.name: Nice place to spend a day.
197264751.author: a TripAdvisor user
197264751.reviewBody: We took a panga from the main pier which is fun by itself to Las Gatas.  All of the small restaurants want you to stop by and I\'m sure they are all fun and have great service and food.  Bring your water shoes as the bottom is a bit rough on your feet, but the water on Las Gatas is calm and very clear.  You are able to walk out quite far and the water is not deep.  It is a perfect way to spend a day relaxing and VERY fun if you are with a group of folks.  We sometimes go several times while we are in Zihua.

197107289.name: Organized tour
197107289.author: a TripAdvisor user
197107289.reviewBody: Beach was nice, meal served was surprisingly good, tasty.  Drinks were expensive 70  each, and you could not taste any alcohol at all.  They guilt you into leaving a bigger tip saying they only get paid with tips nothing else.  But still a good experience.

196766102.name: Loved this beach the best!
196766102.author: a TripAdvisor user
196766102.reviewBody: Great beach and lounge chairs are provided as part of the deal at any one of the restaurants/bars along the beach. The water was so warm we were able to use their plastic chairs to sit in the water to cool off! Some people walk to this beach though the path is not great from Zihu. The water taxi is 40 pesos each from the pier return per person.

196758472.name: Playa Las Gatas
196758472.author: a TripAdvisor user
196758472.reviewBody: Arrived at Las Gatas shortly after 9 am.  Super excited to have the place to ourselves to go snorkeling. Lovely beach..even with all the chairs.\nHowever, probably because of how early we were, we were eaten alive by bugs the instant we stepped onto the sand.  Quickly picked a spot half way down and got some advice on where to snorkel. Halfway to the manmade "reef" we started to feel uneasy with the boats leaving Las Gatas to start their day. Water clarity was poor and we decided it wasn\'t worth the risk of being run over.\nIn less than an hour we were heading back on the water taxi. Glad we saw it, but won\'t be back.

195918200.name: Walk past the pushy waiters, politely saying "Non, gracias".
195918200.author: a TripAdvisor user
195918200.reviewBody: When you first get off the boat you will be met by a bunch of pushy salesmen trying to take you to their place. Get clear of them and you will be happy. Our favorite is about 2/3rds along the beach where they have the blue umbrellas. Ask for Eddie--he\'s there most days. We had a freshly caught parrot fish between 5 of us for 500 pesos, including salad, rice and tacos. It was freshly prepared and cooked on a BBQ at the back of the kitchen.

195379038.name: don\'t bother
195379038.author: a TripAdvisor user
195379038.reviewBody: not worth the time or trip.  spend the other time at la ropa or go to bara de posi for a more secluded spot.

195262526.name: Crowded and pushy
195262526.author: a TripAdvisor user
195262526.reviewBody: Too crowded, too many chairs, too pushy, very little raw nature.  Please!  God!  Help us!  What have we done!

195141652.name: Peaceful
195141652.author: a TripAdvisor user
195141652.reviewBody: Las Gatas is a nice peaceful place to spend the day. The water is calm, and there are not too many beach vendors. Parked ourselves at Otilia\'s, and were entertained by the host, Franco. The food isn\'t great, but Franco is very entertaining.

195113736.name: An absolute must see & do
195113736.author: a TripAdvisor user
195113736.reviewBody: Not our first time to Las Gatas and it won\'t be our last. One might expect, that at a tourist destination which is accessible only by boat, that beach chairs, beer and food would be overpriced and service perhaps spotty. The panga ride will cost you 40 pesos return and beach chairs are - ready for this? - FREE! Beer and (some very good) food is very reasonably priced. Try the cevice and/or teritas - marinated raw mahi mahi. You won\'t regret it. And a tall cool Victoria or Pacifico is a mere 20 pesos. Settle back with a good book or rent a snorkel set for the day for 50 pesos and ENJOY!

195107399.name: Great Day
195107399.author: a TripAdvisor user
195107399.reviewBody: Based on a recommendation, we spent the day at Tres Palmas and were fortunate to have Octavio host our day. He arranged massages ($20 USD), was attentive without hovering, and made THE BEST margaritas of the trip. Because most food and drink comes in by boat, the menus here are more simple. Don\'t come for the food, come for a day of pampering and relaxing. We saw amazing sea life while snorkeling and the beach is clear and clean.

195105259.name: Otilia restaurant & Franco the best!
195105259.author: a TripAdvisor user
195105259.reviewBody: Our day at Las Gatas was a favorite of our trip! We spent the day at Otilia and from the moment we arrived FRANCO took care of our every need:) We enjoyed swimming, snorkeling, rafting, fabulous drinks, and AMAZING food! (The red snapper and the guacamole were especially delicious:) The water was so clear and beautiful. Quite a  bit of choral so maybe bring water shoes if you have them, but we got along without. But the best part was Franco and his fun and personalized service. He definitely makes Otilia the place to be and truly is THE BEST!\nLook for the pink umbrellas and be sure to ask for Franco!

194341385.name: Too crowded with people and boats to enjoy the snorkeling
194341385.author: a TripAdvisor user
194341385.reviewBody: Las Gatas was promoted for it\'s snorkeling and access to the lighthouse. But once there we learned that the access trail to the lighthouse has been blocked by the private developer behind the beach area. And snorkeling was too stressful with too many boats in the area. The water was not very clear and fish variety limited. The beach was very crowded and not much space to walk between restaurants and the water until you get to the farther side of the beach. Not on my list of places to return.

193913922.name: Lunch after fishing
193913922.author: a TripAdvisor user
193913922.reviewBody: I stopped in at the beach after a morning of fishing with a guide. We took our fish to Arnoldo\'s restaurant on the beach. They made three dishes for us: Ceviche, Tuna VeraCruz and Tuna grilled with garlic. It was very very good!!!!

193582274.name: good snorkelling
193582274.author: a TripAdvisor user
193582274.reviewBody: The snorkelling was pretty good and the beach food prices were reasonable.  not too far to get to from Zihuatanejo

193350065.name: We always go to this beach
193350065.author: a TripAdvisor user
193350065.reviewBody: Every vacation we make a point of going here more than once.  Total relaxation - snorkeling - fresh fish caught that day served in all the restaurants - spend all day here and see for yourself.

193298372.name: Poor swimming area
193298372.author: a TripAdvisor user
193298372.reviewBody: The beach at Las Gatas is beautiful and easy to get to.  Unfortunately, the water is very shallow.  There is a reef about 100 yards from shore.  About 20 feet from shore the sand ends and large rocks are everywhere.  The first 20 feet is sand with all manner of little stones and pieces of coral.  If you are like to snorkel, it is OK as the maximum depth is about 4 feet.  There are numerous restaurants but we went to Otilia...super good food.  I would rate swimming here at a 1 and snorkeling at a 3.  Ixtapa Island would rate 9 for swimming and 6 for snorkeling.  Would not go back and I spend 3 months here every year

193287834.name: Nice view and location\u2026food not to our liking
193287834.author: a TripAdvisor user
193287834.reviewBody: Nice beach to spend the day with drinks and sand and calm waters. Must take the boat taxi from Zihuatanejo. Only about $40 pesos round trip (about $3.50 USD).
