As others have mentioned they hassle you as you walk across their beach area restaurants to come and eat. The one we picked had awful food but the lounge chairs, umbrellas and drinks were good.  Nice place to hang out but find a better place to eat or bring a lunch. Cheers and happy travels.

193097994.name: Food and beach
193097994.author: a TripAdvisor user
193097994.reviewBody: Take the bus to Zihua and then the sea taxi to the beach. Forty pesos for two both ways. Do not take the tours from the hotel not needed. The beach is nice and calm Some snorkeling. We had a very nice day it gets very hot. Food below average for what you pay for but then they give you chairs if you have something. have a great day

192356601.name: Las Gatas
192356601.author: a TripAdvisor user
192356601.reviewBody: The characters that run the establishments at this beach are unique and fun and make your day an even better one!

192274507.name: Enjoyed our time at Las Gatas
192274507.author: a TripAdvisor user
192274507.reviewBody: We walked the rocky path from LaRopa to Las Gata\'s. If suggest you wear good sandals instead of flip flop type of footwear as some of the rocks are jagged and definitely uneven. Nice walk and the reward at the end was the lovely beach that we hung out on. Dining, drinking, swimming, snorkeling etc...

191543534.name: A must do one of your Zihua days
191543534.author: a TripAdvisor user
191543534.reviewBody: You have to take the ferry over but once there your chaise lounge chairs await while a waiter from the restaurant behind you brings you drinks and dinner. A fun day

191364983.name: It\'s OK... but Playa La Ropa is much nicer
191364983.author: a TripAdvisor user
191364983.reviewBody:
We took one of the ferry launches to Playa Las Gatas from the pier at Zihuatanejo, which was fun. Upon arrival, hawkers intercept you all along the beach to try to persuade you to come into their establishment, so the initial feeling is one of being constantly "hassled". Ultimately, you pick one and hope for the best. We got lounge chairs which were very comfortable and pleasant. Unfortunately, I don't recall the name of the establishment (there was someone shucking and selling oysters in front). Drinks and food were cheap, but the food was terrible: tasteless and poorly prepared.
I returned to Playa Las Gatas another day to go scuba diving with Carloscuba. 
Note: the snorkeling at Playa Las Gatas was disappointing: the water is quite shallow (good if you have small children, I suppose), not very clear, and there is little sea life to view. You'd need to go elsewhere to find decent snorkeling. 
We much preferred spending our time at Playa La Ropa, a much more beautiful beach, less crowded, no hawkers.

191363519.name: an afternoon of fun
191363519.author: a TripAdvisor user
191363519.reviewBody: We took a small boat across from town to go swimming. We went on a Sunday so were able to enjoy the locals with there families. The snorkeling is okay, the reef seems to not be very healthy but there are some fish.

191254966.name: It was OK
191254966.author: a TripAdvisor user
191254966.reviewBody: It sounded better than it was.  It was described as a "reef". It was more like a rock break.  The snorkelling was ok, nothing note worthy tho.  We took the bus there & brought our own lunch from our hotel so the price was right to go there at least.  10 pesos for bus, 20 pesos for water taxi (per person, per way). So for less than $3, it was a change of scenery as a minimum.

191172627.name: Beginners Snorkelling
191172627.author: a TripAdvisor user
191172627.reviewBody:
Nice sheltered bay for beginners to snorkel. Price for return ferry ticket was 40 pesos. We picked a restaurant based on recommendations of another transit passenger on the ferry. Pretty neat day for the price of lunch (170p for a whole fish to share + 25 p for a beer) at a restaurant we had a place to sit and relax all day long.  Guided Snorkel tours with rentals were priced at 50 pesos.

Highly recommend water shoes or socks for snorkelling in this bay. There are urchins there and it's so shallow that you can get a nasty surprise.  Recommend entry close to the ferry terminal side of the beach where it's sandy. Visibility was better close to the rocks. 
Spotted a couple of 'new to me' creatures that made me smile. Go in the morning during the week for a quieter experience.

190067064.name: Great snorkeling for a the beginner snorkeler!
190067064.author: a TripAdvisor user
190067064.reviewBody: This a beautiful beach with snorkeling suitable for the beginer level snorkelers. There are many restaurants along the beach to rent equipment and also offer the opportunity to have a cocktail with your feet in the sand.  A must see and do when in Zihuatanejo.

189370711.name: Good food, nice (crowded) public beach
189370711.author: a TripAdvisor user
189370711.reviewBody: If you manage to catch your own fish, you can take it to one of the restaurants and they`ll prepare it for you for a fee.

188614076.name: Less crowded & great snorkeling
188614076.author: a TripAdvisor user
188614076.reviewBody: During our visit to Zihuatenejo, we took a one day excursion to this beach.  It was much less crowed than playa La Ropa and had good restaurants.  The boat ride there and back also gave us a great view of the entire Zihauatenejo bay and coastline.  Definitely worth a day trip.

188227392.name: Loved Las Gatas
188227392.author: a TripAdvisor user
188227392.reviewBody: Very peaceful. Good snorkeling. Almost no waves. Beautiful vistas. Good food. Not as hot as in Ixtapa.

188155928.name: Great way to spend a day in Ziwat
188155928.author: a TripAdvisor user
188155928.reviewBody: Went for a day of swimming, eating, drinking and lounging with 6 traveling companions. We love the calm warm water at Gatos.\nWe took the water taxi to Gatos and walked back along the shore. A bit rocky but pleasant.

188121288.name: Don\'t go
188121288.author: a TripAdvisor user
188121288.reviewBody: We were told that Las Gatas was the most beautiful beach in the world but I assure you, it is not.  It was dirty and smelly, there was only rocks, no sand really.

187687981.name: Las Gatas- the way Mexico should be experienced.
187687981.author: a TripAdvisor user
187687981.reviewBody: I come to Mexico for the old world experience. We do not always have to visit the new and fancy. The feel of Las Gatas, the way life in Mexico was before the invasion of the big hotel chains and moderness,  Let\'s hope that Las Gatas will never change.

187329111.name: Restaurant la caba\u00f1a the best
187329111.author: a TripAdvisor user
187329111.reviewBody: Good sea food very fresh we catch a mahi mahi and they coock we went surfing all day long. This place is magic

187311639.name: Nice little beach
187311639.author: a TripAdvisor user
187311639.reviewBody: I like playa ropas better, but this beach is a nice stop.  Especially after snorkelling at manzanillas.  We had ceviche and guacamole.  Our friends has fresh oysters.\n

187262428.name: Lunch and drinks ay Otillia with Franco was the best part of our visit
187262428.author: a TripAdvisor user
187262428.reviewBody: We took a taxi down to the dock hauling our snorkeling gear.  (About 35 pesos) It was a pleasant, short ride across the bay and we enjoyed chatting with a Mexican family with the same destination.\nWe had heard and that Otillia\'s was the best spot to set up "camp".  We passed about ten small restaurants along the way; each with the proprietor politely entreating us to select their restaurant.\nFranco and Otillia\'s was everything we had read or heard: good food, drinks and pleasant surroundings.  Franco was attentive, but not intrusive.  The snorkeling was another story.  The water was murky (there was a storm the previous evening), the sand rough (ground coral) and the   Water choppy, so we returned to the beach for a pleasant afternoon.  Rather than using our return ticket to the dock, we shared a reasonably priced boat to return to Club Intrawest.  Our friends had walked over.  So, if snorkeling is your primary goal, check the water conditions first.

185883412.name: Playa Las Gatas
185883412.author: a TripAdvisor user
185883412.reviewBody: Great for all ages, restaurants are reasonable, beach is safe and calm. You can hike over  from Playa La Ropa or take the shuttle boats from downtown

185508190.name: Great food and great beach
185508190.author: a TripAdvisor user
185508190.reviewBody: We went there at the end of our fishing trip.  We ran across people from our resort who beat us there and were just loving the beach and restaurants.  We did too.

184594279.name: We snorkled this inner reef off Las Gatas Beach
184594279.author: a TripAdvisor user
184594279.reviewBody: Water was wonderful, clear, and buoyant with high salt content and around 83 degrees water temp.   No stingrays, No underwater obstructions, No Problems at All.  Bottom was smooth sand with beautiful reflections of the sun dancing upon the bottom.  I was mesmerized by the reflections on the bottom and floated way too long while snorkeling, burned my back.  Wear a rash guard.  \n\nAte at Las Gatas what we caught, sashimi style, ceviche and grilled.  The Capitano is Ernesto Salas Jr. and he\u2019s the 24 year old son of Luis Ernesto Vargas Salas, also a Capitano and fisherman.  Young Ernesto knows his Stuff.  Go Fishing with HIM.  His 8 month old Covered 30\u2019 panga is top shelf, with an enclosed head.  Ernesto\u2019s boat is powered by a new 75 hp Yamaha outboard  motor.  One of the hotels amazing staff, Fili carried down all our beer, water and limes and Ernesto\u2019s deckhand walked it all out to the boat.  30 minutes later I caught the first dorado of the day.  Felt like Ernest Hemingway. Fun moment was when a porpoise surfaced directly behind our boat and the tuna I was reeling in suddenly made a long run but I found out later it was the porpoise making the Run With MY tuna in it\u2019s mouth.  All I reeled in was the Head.  My new catch phrase is \u201cI got head from a porpoise in Zihua\u201d

184584612.name: Capitano Ernesto Salas took our catch of the day here to cook and dine on the beach
184584612.author: a TripAdvisor user
184584612.reviewBody: We took our fresh catch, tuna, bonita and dorado to a beachside shack where the proprietor prepared them THREE WAYS.  Sashimi, Civieche and Grilled Filet.  This is a restaurant that our Awesome Captain, Ernesto Salas works with and has a good relationship with.  Cost was 5 USD per person.  Amazing!  Also had fabulous rice, cabbage and guacamole on fresh home made corn tortillas.  Las Gatas is a Must See.  We were among the Very Few Non Locals that were there that day and Everyone along the beach Was Awesome.  Very Welcoming, Kind, Engaging and Happy.

183577380.name: Too Crowded!
183577380.author: a TripAdvisor user
183577380.reviewBody: This beach has really built up since our last visit 15 years ago and now is jammed with beach restaurants and the crowds they attract!

181503365.name: Nice small very touristy beach
181503365.author: a TripAdvisor user
181503365.reviewBody:
Wall-to-wall palapa restaurants along on pretty beach but not much else really.  It is touted as having excellent snorkelling but for anyone who has experienced quality diving/snorkelling you will be disappointed.  The waters are shallow and sheltered so this would be acceptable for learners or those who feel uncomfortable in more open waters.

We had lunch at Otilas which was good, albeit expensive, and enjoyed good service from and a friendly chat with Franco.

OK to fill in a morning or an afternoon but certainly not a feature destination for me.

180960803.name: A really fun way to spend a day.
180960803.author: a TripAdvisor user
180960803.reviewBody: Disregard bad reviews about Las Gatas.  It costs $3.00 for a round trip boat ride to get there and it is a very nice quiet beach.  We have been going there for years and have never been gouged or ripped off.  Fun for the inexperienced snorkler.  As far as the fish goes, they serve whatever has been caught that morning.  We have tried many wonderful different kinds of fish we would never have ordinarily ordered and have never been unhappy.

177160883.name: One hot day at Las Gats beack
177160883.author: a TripAdvisor user
177160883.reviewBody: We were a large group, half of the group were friends who happened lo be locals. And for an unexplainable reason, we chose a piece of beach that was too rocky. The food, specially the fish we ordered; Huachinango was not, and a type of ceviche, called "tiritas" was made of the wrong fish. After having an average type of food, the bill total was exorbitant. If we ever plan to go, next time we\'ll take our own food, or a pick-nick basket.

175868166.name: Playa Las Gatas is BEAUTIFUL!!
175868166.author: a TripAdvisor user
175868166.reviewBody: This beach is amazing. Plenty of fresh food options, lots of locals, and very reasonably priced. The water in the summer is like bath water. You are able to snorkel safely. A great way to spend the day!!

175489981.name: Day trip within sight of your hotel on La Ropa
175489981.author: a TripAdvisor user
175489981.reviewBody: Take a water taxi from downtown\'s Municipal Beach to Las Gatas for a leisurely beach day. Lounge chairs line the lovely little beach with chair side food and beverage service. Several restaurants are here with good food. You can wander over to Owen Lee\'s paradoxical nature center. Read about it in his book "A Prisoner in Paradise". You can reach Las Gatas by foot but it\'s not fun and the water taxi is.

170241223.name: Picture perfect!
170241223.author: a TripAdvisor user
170241223.reviewBody: Me and my friend stayed in Ixtapa but were told about a tour to Playa las Gatas. We decided to catch a local bus (which cost us about $0.90(US Dollars) and in about 20 minutes, we were at "El Centro" of Zihuatanejo. We got off the bus on the Cinco de Mayo stop and walked about 15 minutes down an aisle of multiple crafts and souvenir shops. At the end of the road, we payed $4.00 (US dollars) for a roundtrip on a water taxi over to Playa las Gatas. The water was amazingly blue. There are parts where there are rocks on ground, but for the most part the water is very smooth undisturbed by heavy waves. I will be taking my water shoes next time.

170070301.name: La Piscina -- the swimming pool
170070301.author: a TripAdvisor user
170070301.reviewBody:
my favorite beach in Zihua.  lots of great restaurants and bars right on the water.  they call this la piscina because the water is as smooth as a swimming pool.  you can float undisturbed by waves for minutes on end.  

i'm not a fan of all the recreational water craft around or the exhaust fumes that come and go, but a much nicer beach than la playa. 

we went just to check it out and ended up spending the whole day.

169821109.name: Not impressed
169821109.author: a TripAdvisor user
169821109.reviewBody: I\'ve been reading so many reviews saying that this was the best beach in Zihua..it\'s not. we went on a Monday thinking it wouldn\'t be so crowded with locals..WRONG. Plus! going into the water the sand is not soft AT ALL. The sand is pretty much broken shells and bits of coral (ouch!) The water was blue but it was also murky...the water looked like water from a pool before it\'s been cleaned. So unless you want to end up with cut up feet, I suggest you don\'t go here.

168921933.name: Perfect!
168921933.author: a TripAdvisor user
168921933.reviewBody: Definitely go here!  And go early because the beach closes around 4. If you stay on Playa Ropa then you can just walk here. its a little rocky so bring appropriate shoes, but definitely walkable.   Its a pain to go into town to catch a water taxi.  also, water shoes are good for swimming at the beach. The sand was white and the water was a beautiful clear blue.  I recommend going all the way to the end of the beach, there are alot less people. We felt like we had the beach to ourselves. Go to the pink umbrellas, restaurant Otilia.  Franco is the host/waiter.  He\'s awesome and will even take great pictures of you, posing you with the best views.   When we got home we also saw pictures on our camera of us in the water, they were such great candids and Franco had taken them while we were swimming! Oh and the pitcher of lemonade is delicious.

165712633.name: Best part of zihuatanejo
165712633.author: a TripAdvisor user
165712633.reviewBody: This was the best part of my trip in zihuatanejo.  When we arrived to the beachwe were greeted by this guy named Miguel aka El Negro. He offers a snorkeling tour that is AMAZING and inexpensive. His family own a restaurant called princessa. The tour was very personalized and u see sea creatures that u would never imagine. There is also a statue of Christ under the water and Miguel  helps u reach under the water and takes pictures of u touching the statue. Later we went to find a place to eat. If u like sea food, this is the place for you. I don\'t like sea food so I just had a piece of steak. The best part of my trip here was snorkeling. I\'ve done snorkeling in Mexico, but nothing like this.

165054033.name: cost a lot to get there, and there is nothing to doooo
165054033.author: a TripAdvisor user
165054033.reviewBody: its a far away beach,u need to take a boat over there, nothing to do,dont go!! go to the other beaches where u can get with a car o taxi. ixtapa is very simple

164027150.name: We were tricked
164027150.author: a TripAdvisor user
164027150.reviewBody: Whatever you do, don\'t get tricked into a taxi ride by the drivers inside the airport. We paid $50 for a cab ride, breakfast and a trip to Playa Las Gatas. We never made it to the beach. The whole thing was a trick to get us into a timeshare meeting at another resort. Apparently the beach is pretty nice.

162774095.name: Beach getaway - day trip
162774095.author: a TripAdvisor user
162774095.reviewBody: We took a water taxi across the bay to this lovely beach.   You\'ll pick up a water taxi at the city pier - they run from 8am to 5pm.  The ride gives you a great overview of the bay and a look at other communities on the bay.  Las Gatas has many small beach-side restaurants vying for your business.  Choose one and claim one of their beach lounge chairs for the day.  A reef protects the beach from waves so take a dip in the clear shallow water or do some snorkeling.  If you go for a walk along the shore, at the far end you\'ll find Las Gatas Beach Club which is now a nature preserve. Sitting on the beach with a margarita, enjoying the gorgeous view of  Zihua across the bay...what a perfect day!  Here\'s a photo of the strolling musicians.

162755986.name: A real gem
162755986.author: a TripAdvisor user
162755986.reviewBody: AWESOME BEACHES!! really calm and nice snorkeling tour! Also nice food, had shrimp and a beer for about 20 USD, great value.

162668630.name: Love This Beach
162668630.author: a TripAdvisor user
162668630.reviewBody: Great for relaxing and having a good meal.  Stay all day.  The boat taxi over is fun as well.  The off season is the best.  July and August there are lots of kids as it is vacation time in Mexico.  Great beach for kids and families.\n\n

158431027.name: Fun day beach
158431027.author: a TripAdvisor user
158431027.reviewBody: Las Gatas is only open 9 a.m.-4 p.m. (times approximate) and a boat trip is necessary. We took a "ponga" (small boat) from the municipal beach. They leave continuously, and the trip only takes a few minutes. On Las Gatas there are about 10 separate restaurants, and the hosts are out there trying to lure you in. We have settled at several of them, and they have all been comparable, but this time we discovered Otilia\'s at the far end,  and its host, Franco, who was a standout. He also arranged a private boat to take us from there to our hotel on la Ropa, which was much faster and saved us a taxi ride back from town.\nLots of water activities available.

158134429.name: Beautiful beach spoiled by wall to wall commercialization
158134429.author: a TripAdvisor user
158134429.reviewBody: We visited as part of a much longer fishing and snorkeling trip.  The beach is protected for the latter but we did not stay because most of the beach is crowded by chairs in front of restaurants manned by extremely aggressive vendors.  If you are part of a spring break trip and looking for a place on the beach with cheaper booze this may your thing.  The beach itself is beautiful but it is not worth the hassle when you have Playa la Ropa so close and it is certainly not worth a $20 water taxi ride.

156904385.name: Good restaurants
156904385.author: a TripAdvisor user
156904385.reviewBody: Often a bit crowded, definitely a key destination for locals from Zihuatanejo. The beach is rough and you need sandals to go in the water (very rocky!).

156559782.name: Heavenly little beach
156559782.author: a TripAdvisor user
156559782.reviewBody: We walked over the rocky path from Playa La Ropa.  Not that difficult, but there is some scrambling.  This beach is awesome, lots to look at and fun to walk.  It\'s rocky with lots of big chunks of coral, so sandals or water shoes will be very handy,  Surfers, boaters, swimmers and loungers will love this scenic little beach

156555143.name: Don\'t Waste Your Time
156555143.author: a TripAdvisor user
156555143.reviewBody: The water is so polluted with enterococci and the water is so murky, and the there\'s nothing of interest to see. That along with huge crowds made this beach a non-return for us.

155995172.name: Too many people!!
155995172.author: a TripAdvisor user
155995172.reviewBody: The beach was full of coral, rocks and stuff.  My husband stepped on a sea urchin, very painful and we had to cut our trip short.  Not good for swimming because of the rocks, you can\'t step anywhere.   After the sea urchin incident we were more skeptical of going in the water.  There are so many people at the this beach.

155838129.name: Horrible
155838129.author: a TripAdvisor user
155838129.reviewBody: Scammed by the Apple vacation rep into this bad excursion. Was told that it was a private secluded beach for snorkeling. WRONG!!! It was a common  beach that all the LOCALS hang out at. Very crowded and nothing private about it. Stray dogs everywhere and people bothering you every 5 minutes selling their trinkets. Anything but relaxing. Beach at our expensive resort is much nicer.

155755726.name: Reminds me of a small Ixtapa Island
155755726.author: a TripAdvisor user
155755726.reviewBody: It is a must see if you have never been to the beach but if you go by boat, the MUST SEE of the Jesus statue underwater that is 6 feet under.  That is insane, highlight of the trip for sure!

155753351.name: Great beach day!
155753351.author: a TripAdvisor user
155753351.reviewBody: We are staying at La Ropa and so we took at cab into al centro, where we purchased tickets for the water taxi to Las Gatas.  The tickets were 40p per person.  When we got out of the cab there was a stand nearby and they tried selling us tickets.  They said they were the same business as the more official looking ticket office.  The guy at the ticket office said they were not connected.  We opted to buy the tickets from the ticket office.\n\nThe boat ride was pleasant and quick.  Upon arriving we were "welcomed" by all the restaurant purveyors.  We opted to walk the entire length of the beach before deciding where to plant ourselves for the day.  It was busiest closest to the boat launch, so we decided to stay at the far end.  Franco, from Otilias, was a charming man who convinced that we should stay at his restaurant.  We were very happy with our decision and enjoyed a pitcher of lemonade, cold beer and lots of cokes for the kids.  The coconut shrimp was really fabulous.  I wish I\'d been more hungry, because the other options sounded pretty awesome as well.  My kids, who are pretty picky eaters, liked the chicken tacos.  Franco was the perfect host and hooked us up with a guide who took the kids snorkeling.  When my boys picked up their baseball gloves and started throwing the ball back and forth he joined in.  The cost seemed quite reasonable, although probably more expensive than on La Ropa.  Given the geographic challenges, though, is completely understandable.  I would highly recommend a trip to Las Gatas and Otilias.

154969121.name: Eating what you catch
154969121.author: a TripAdvisor user
154969121.reviewBody: Our fishing guide took us here and asked a friend to cook our just caught black tuna.  What an experience!  Prices here are more modest than most places.  Lots of local families visiting.

154698792.name: Best beach for both swimming and snorkling.
154698792.author: a TripAdvisor user
154698792.reviewBody: First time at Las Gatas and we will be back. My wife likes the snorkling here better than Ixtapa Island. The beach is softer than Coral beach on the Island. But, the island had better tacos and a better view.

154688430.name: Toes in the sand
154688430.author: a TripAdvisor user
154688430.reviewBody: Las Gates is a great place to go.  If you were out fishing, any of the restaurants will gladly cook your catch.  This year we went to K-Koy.  Cheap and good.  Great place to take a dip in the water also.

154568164.name: Princess Rebecca
154568164.author: a TripAdvisor user
154568164.reviewBody: This is the 1st enmarada as you get off the water taxi. The food is fresh and tasty, and the prices are very reasonable. Also, they have some very nice snorkeling tours. Marcos, Lorenzo, and the rest of the boys will work hard to make sure you get everything you want. In addition, since this is the 1st restaurant, you won\'t have to walk the gaunlet of all the other waiters hawking their restaurants and food. This place makes for a perfect day trip. Good food, good people, all of which makes for a memorable day.

154470697.name: Great Relaxation & Snorkeling (weekdays)
154470697.author: a TripAdvisor user
154470697.reviewBody: Several spots to eat and drink on the beach.  Snorkeling was great and very easy because the water is shallow - quite a few fish though.  Weekends seem to be busy and we enjoyed it more on Monday as opposed to Saturday.

154457845.name: great spot
154457845.author: a TripAdvisor user
154457845.reviewBody: this is a must see...grab a chair and sit in the water and the waiters will bring you an ice cold cervasa! great snorkling we had a blast

154255033.name: Otilia at Las Gatas - a treat!
154255033.author: a TripAdvisor user
154255033.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for good - go the extra mile service, beautiful delicious drinks and food, clean restrooms with soap, beach chairs brought to water\'s edge and lounge chairs in the shade, this is the place. We had a wonderful day in the sun and shade on the beach while Franco took care of us in style! Thank you, Franco!

154058839.name: My favorite place in zihuatanejo
154058839.author: a TripAdvisor user
154058839.reviewBody: I had so much fun here! First guy to ask us to sit at his restaraunt we did, took his white plastic chairs and went and sat out in the ocean with them. There is coral all around the beach, so there is no waves, it\'s very warm water, I recommend! If you are taking a boat, they do stop running fairly early (around 6) so I would ask, but don\'t worry you can still walk across the rocks around the water back to la Ropa! It\'s a fairly easy walk

153959672.name: Amazing day at Otilia
153959672.author: a TripAdvisor user
153959672.reviewBody: If you want to be pampered and have the absolute best day of your trip, this is the place to be.  Franco was an attentive and friendly host.  The drinks were cold the food was delicious.  Coconut shrimp and bacon wrapped shrimp from the barbeque....makes my mouth water just thinking about it!\nMiguel  who takes care of the life jackets took us out and gave us a private snorkel adventure, and you could tell this was his playground.  He literally had the fish eating out of my hands and we even held fish as he told us all about the underwater life.\nThis is a day that will definitely be imprinted in my mind forever.  Thank you Franco for those wonderful memories.

152632535.name: OK
152632535.author: a TripAdvisor user
152632535.reviewBody: We took a water taxi here.  I was least impressed with this beach.  Not sure why but of the many beaches I saw in Zihua these was the least likely for me to return.  Not spectacular and busy.  Possilby because it is close to Zihua.

152631751.name: OK beach
152631751.author: a TripAdvisor user
152631751.reviewBody: I went to quite a few beaches and this was the least liked of all.  It was busy and nothing spectacular.  Depends on what you like in La Playa.

152143921.name: Nothing Special
152143921.author: a TripAdvisor user
152143921.reviewBody: First time to this beach and it was just ok.  Lots of coral, so have shoes to wear in the water.  Chairs on beach not that comfortable and you have constant traffic walking in front of you. Just ok.

151697525.name: Restaurant Otilia
151697525.author: a TripAdvisor user
151697525.reviewBody: Wonderful spot to relax on the beach. Franco made us a pitcher of lemonade and managed to get us bacon and eggs not on the menu.

151434171.name: Fantastic
151434171.author: a TripAdvisor user
151434171.reviewBody: Visit Franco near the end of the beach . His place has pink umbrellas. Tell him Jeff and Tamara sent you. Have the pi\u00f1a colada and the chempechana. The best!,,

151203804.name: beautiful beach
151203804.author: a TripAdvisor user
151203804.reviewBody: we went to Amados for lunch. we had a good time but seemed the ocean washed out in front of his place and made the swimming not so good. seemed better closer to the docks.

151178984.name: Loved this beach
151178984.author: a TripAdvisor user
151178984.reviewBody:
We visited several beaches during our short stay in January 2013, but this one was my personal favorite.  It's small, so it could get pretty crowded; however, it wasn't on a Tuesday when we were there.  We took a water taxi over at around 10:30 or so.  We walked up the beach past several restaurants, enticing customers in with the promise of shade and a free lounge chair.  We finally stopped at 3 Coconuts and settled in.  As long as you buy some drinks and/or food, you use the chairs and shade for free, so that worked out fine.  

Once we were situated, we went out for a snorkel.  The Pacific coast isn't great for snorkeling, but we had a good time paddling around the rocks just off the shore.  Saw a skate and a number of bright fish - plus got some exercise!  Afterwards we had some lunch at the restaurant.  Typical beach fare - quesadillas, huachinago, tacos, and cheap beer.  

About 3 we'd had enough sun, so walked back to the taxi and rode back to town.  A very pleasant stay.

151174685.name: Nice way to spend day
151174685.author: a TripAdvisor user
151174685.reviewBody: Such a short water taxi ride away. Beautiful clear warm water. So many restaurants. We always sat and ate at chez Arnoldo which I have also reviewed. For the price of lunch you can sit in one of the lounges with umbrella all day. I believe this would be true of all restaurants. Lots of locals enjoying time with their families. We loved it.

151168233.name: Wonderful day at the beach!
151168233.author: a TripAdvisor user
151168233.reviewBody:
On our third of five glorious days in Zihuatanejo, we took the 40 peso/pp boat ride from the pier in El Centro to Playa Las Gatas. The ride is under 10 minutes, the water reasonably calm - we went around 10am to avoid whatever 'crowds' there might be. Fortunately for us (but unfortunately for businesses on the beach) there were few people on a late January Tuesday.

Based on a recommendation to 'find the place with the fuscia colored tablecloths' from another couple at our hotel, we ambled past 10 or so places (each with a guy stationed on the beach, inviting us to 'have a seat, amigos") until reaching Otilia's towards the western end. Franko (he's been mentioned in other reviews) greeted us and was a FANTASTIC host. The guy has been doing this for decades and knows how to treat customers right - there when you need him, not too pushy, great conversation at times - but still he lets you relax and soak in sun and surf all the same. 

The lunch and drinks we had were very good (coconut shrimp, fresh toptopos, salsas, cervezas, a ridiculously ornate pina colada (in pineapple)). The sun angles were lovely and the views across the bay were as well. We are not snorkelers, but we enjoyed the warm waters for occasional soaking and splashing - all in all spent about 5 hours here in the most relaxing way.

The only demerit I give (why 4 stars and not 5) is the beach itself is LOADED with coral and sharp rocks, both of which make wading with shoes or sandals a MUST. We met a group of 4 who almost turned around and left on the first boat back to town once they tried going into the water. We were OK, but only after being shown a 'clearer' path, one with alittle more sand than rock. So be prepared...

Otherwise, enjoy the sun, the gentle surf, the uncrowded beach (there were relatively few vendors strolling and hawking their wares) and look for shady palapas and good service such as we found at Otilia's.

¡Salud!

151132450.name: Great little beach, lunch at Otillia
151132450.author: a TripAdvisor user
151132450.reviewBody: Ask for Franko....great waiter.  A nice day in the shade or sun, nice for lunch at Otillia.  It is almost at the end of the strip of seafood restaurants.  Clean bathrooms, shower.  Do a little snorkeling...not great but fun.   bring water shoes and your mask.  You can sit in the water.  Very safe for kids too.  Mucho quieta!  and

151103355.name: To die for
151103355.author: a TripAdvisor user
151103355.reviewBody: A water taxi ride, a sandy beach and Arnoldo\'s Restaurant.  What more can one ask for?  Arnoldo\'s has the best food on this beach, I know because I think I\'ve sampled all of them, and Chi is the best waiter in Zihuatenejo.  The restaurant is a bit upscale for a beach place with flowers on the table and tucked in to your bucket of ice for your drinks and the quality of the food is amazing.  Add to all that the fact that you can walk a few steps down the beach and get a massage after you go for a swim....I\'m in seventh heaven.

150693925.name: a little boat ride away
150693925.author: a TripAdvisor user
150693925.reviewBody:
good place for snorkeling.
a small and secluded strip of a beach,
with a few hotels and an eco resort.

150548026.name: Great Beach Area
150548026.author: a TripAdvisor user
150548026.reviewBody: Hard to get to but well worth the effort. When there, go to the restaurant "Otilia" and ask for Franco. Franco\'s the best. Very service oriented.

150456228.name: A bit underwhelmed
150456228.author: a TripAdvisor user
150456228.reviewBody: We had heard that Las Gatas was the each to see n Zihuatanejo. On a fishing trip, the captain of the OAS took us to Las Gatas to have the fish we caught for lunch.  After getting off the boad we found the beach was wall to wall restaurants, side by side right down to the high water mark. Not much beach left for walking, swimming or hanging out.  I\'d take Playa la Ropa over Las Gatas any day.

150368216.name: Really not worth the trip
150368216.author: a TripAdvisor user
150368216.reviewBody: The boat ride over to Las Gatas is fun, but the beach itself is pretty disappointing. Las Gatas is extremely over-crowded and overwhelming, even in low season. The restaurants are charming but really not very good. The beach furniture is not so great, and the beach is rocky - so don\'t go in the water without shoes!

150292483.name: Nice beach
150292483.author: a TripAdvisor user
150292483.reviewBody: This was a very nice beach, as it was the only one you can get free shade if you walk all the way down to the palm trees.  All the other beach in Ixtapa/Zihua you have to pay for shade unless you are staying at a beach resort.  You can walk there on the trail from Playa La Ropa, or take a water taxi from Playa Principal.  The only down side is there are a lot of rocks in the water, so wear water socks or search your route out well.  Do not walk on the coral areas farther out.

150142233.name: Nice Beach for Mexico
150142233.author: a TripAdvisor user
150142233.reviewBody: Having been beat up by the surf in Mexico I would like to recommend this beach to those of you that want a gentle surf to be able to snorkel and swim.  The beach is a great place for beginners to explore the sea and also just a nice spot for a warm afternoon in the Mexican sun.  Please remember this Mexico, so it is no frills with lots of local culture.  (IE: If you want 3 star plus this is not the place for you.  But if you want to relax with and forget about home it is.)

149301221.name: Nicer than the town beaches but can be jammed.
149301221.author: a TripAdvisor user
149301221.reviewBody: Las Gatas has finer, whiter sand than the Madero (and even La Ropa) beach,  but during Mexican school holidays like New Year\'s week, it is as crowded as Coney Island in August. You basically have to pay to dine and sit as there is no room to lay out a towel. I suspect it\'s nicer when there aren\'t so many families there.

148174060.name: Relaxing Day Trip
148174060.author: a TripAdvisor user
148174060.reviewBody: If you want a relaxing day, a quick water taxi ride from Z, then this is the place for you! Super chill and cheap. I think about $4 USD round trip for the water taxi. Water is beautiful, beaches were clean and there are a ton of little beach shacks/restaurants that will set you up with chairs in the water while sipping your Corona, you\'ll feel like you\'re on the commercial. :) very affordable and great food! Of course each restaurant wanted you to eat with them, but they were not pushy or overbearing. My mom snorkeled right off the beach and loved it. We didn\'t have kids with us, but seems like a great place for families as well as those traveling without children.

146434127.name: Easy to get to
146434127.author: a TripAdvisor user
146434127.reviewBody: Very nice beach and the water nice to swim or snorkel in, but be ready to be solicted to eat at every little resturant  along the beach.\nI think which ever one you choose will be decent. You can\'t beat the fresh guacamole  and fresh seafood. We opted for fish tacos.

146020261.name: bring water shoes and cash.
146020261.author: a TripAdvisor user
146020261.reviewBody: had to walk into town, which is a ways away from intrawest resort, where we were staying, and take the water taxi over to las gatas. a couple bucks.when you get there, the stretch of beach is lined with bars and restaurants, all vying for your business. most offer free lounges and that was nice. they want you to order something, but most won\'t pressure you. the drinks are cheap and the food can be ok. just look at the restaurant part of the place before you decide to order anything. none are four star, so don\'t expect it. it\'s beach fod for cryin out loud, and it\'s cheap and quick. there is snorkeling there, and a small natural reef. pretty spot and friendly folks. a lot of local with families, no rough characters or anything like that. very very safe to be there. BRING WATER SHOES!!! the coral in the water is almost to the beach in most of the area, so watch those "city feet. we brought noodles, and floated to deeper water, but never found any over my head. on the far side of the reef it is deeper, and there is a christ statue down about 12 to 15 feet. someone can point out it\'s location if you ask. we spent about 4-5 hours relaxing, napping floating and having a few beers and bottled waters.

145978800.name: Arrive early and relax.
145978800.author: a TripAdvisor user
145978800.reviewBody: You can only get there by water taxi.  It is inexpensive and you pay for a round trip.  The last boat back is around 5pm.  The beach is fun and shallow, so a great place for families.  There are a series of restaurants and you will be invited in by each one as you pass by.  Look for fresh seafood, right off the boat, and an owner who will watch over your possessions as you swim.

145658171.name: Peaceful!
145658171.author: a TripAdvisor user
145658171.reviewBody: We went on a Thursday and there was hardly anyone there.  You can snorkle and swim in peace and the water is nice and calm.  Very relaxing break from the resort and rougher waters along Playa El Palmar.

145613088.name: Day trip
145613088.author: a TripAdvisor user
145613088.reviewBody: After a morning of fishing,our captain took us to Las Gatas where a local restaurant prepared our catch of tuna!What a meal!And how great to eat it right on the beach! As we visited on Saturday, LOTS of locals started to come just as we were leaving 2 1pm.I think an early week-end day or during a weekday would probably be the best time time visit as it would be much less populated.

144114481.name: A replica of Ixtapa Island
144114481.author: a TripAdvisor user
144114481.reviewBody: Clean water ,great ambiance and restaurants..Check Carlo\'s.The tuna and the cheviche is great.You can spend a full day there and not know where the time went

142667906.name: fun for an afternoon
142667906.author: a TripAdvisor user
142667906.reviewBody: we loved taking the water taxi over to las gatas...lots and lots of dining options for beach clubs and of course they all want you to stop at their place. We wandered to few drink here drink there but mostly hung out with Erik as our waiter at Otillas. very good food here.

142448506.name: Lovely beach, decent snorkeling
142448506.author: a TripAdvisor user
142448506.reviewBody: Still feels like Mexico, not LA or Waikiki. Easy snorkeling if you do not want to pay to go way out. Check out Otilia\'s near the end of the row for great food.

140767164.name: Tourist trap
140767164.author: a TripAdvisor user
140767164.reviewBody: For the cruise ship crowd. Probably the most Americanized beach in the bay. If you like coconut shrimp and over priced drinks with flags, umbrellas and flowers in them this is a place for you.

140262328.name: Average and Touristy
140262328.author: a TripAdvisor user
140262328.reviewBody: Definitely worth sailing over to just to see but don\'t plan on staying for more than an hour or so. But this beach doesn\'t compare to the tranqulity of Playa La Ropa. This is clearly designed as a destination for local tourists. Also DONT ASK for a song because the musicians will expect 50 pesos PER SONG!

140163678.name: Fishing Break
140163678.author: a TripAdvisor user
140163678.reviewBody: We stopped here to take a break after a few hours of spectacular fishing. The captain traded a few of our Bonita for crackers, limes, onions and a chili pepper. Then made Ceveche to have with our cold beer. Great Day, Good People, Beautiful Place

136307090.name: Fun Day at the Beach
136307090.author: a TripAdvisor user
136307090.reviewBody: Always hang at Otilia\'s beach club. When it gets hot pull a chair into the calm water and have a beer. Franco is an entertaining waiter, who won\'t let your drink sit empty. Always good to see him. The coconut shrimp are awesome

136306724.name: Fun Day at the Beach
136306724.author: a TripAdvisor user
136306724.reviewBody: Otilia\'s one of our favorite places to hang for a day at the beach. When it gets hot put a chair in the wate and have a beer. Franco the waiter is entertaining and does not let you drink sit empty. The coconut shrimp are awesome.

134429156.name: Packed
134429156.author: a TripAdvisor user
134429156.reviewBody: Restaurants are right on the beach and the waves come up to the loungers and tables that are set up which is nice.  The beach itself is jam packed with familes and hundreds of kids. There wasn\'t a spare spot in the water. Great if you have kids as the water is shallow and calm but not so great if you\'re looking for a relaxing spot to have lunch.  It\'s very noisy, there were flies all over the food, and every 5mins somebody would try and sell you something. Avoid if you\'re looking for something more tranquil.

133752008.name: Fun, local beach with nice snorkeling
133752008.author: a TripAdvisor user
133752008.reviewBody: Try to eat at Chez Arnoldo.  EXcellent service and outstanding local cuisine.  Sit back with a  beer or soft drink and enjoy what is truly delicious food and wonderful, caring service.

132769670.name: Relaxation!
132769670.author: a TripAdvisor user
132769670.reviewBody: Took the boat in the morning and spent most of the day. Beach was very nice, great place if you are new to snorkeling! As usual out standing food! Just a great day at Z.

132319632.name: by boat only
132319632.author: a TripAdvisor user
132319632.reviewBody: This was great fun.  By boat from Zi.  The swiming and snorkeling was easier here and our food and drinks were terrific.  Be prepaired to be attacke by the beach venders until you choose a place, then all is cordial and good.

132261882.name: Good Time
132261882.author: a TripAdvisor user
132261882.reviewBody: It was worth the trip over.  We got there in the morning and hung out most of the day.  A little snorkeling, a nice lunch and a lot of chilling...

132135276.name: Wonderful beach for kids
132135276.author: a TripAdvisor user
132135276.reviewBody: They have a wave breaker so it is super for kids, and adults to swim

131674604.name: Great beach for kids
131674604.author: a TripAdvisor user
131674604.reviewBody: The beach is protected from waves by a rock breakwater. Calm water with snorkeling.  Safe beach for kids

131304709.name: Great Day at Las Gatas
131304709.author: a TripAdvisor user
131304709.reviewBody: We went to Las Gatas a week ago and had a great day.  It\'s a bit touristy, but loved the sand, warm and clear water and had fun hanging out at Olivero\'s.  We like the little water taxis too that gave us a great view of Zih Bay and the pelicans on all the boats!

131269494.name: Loved our day here
131269494.author: a TripAdvisor user
131269494.reviewBody: We just went here a week ago and loved it, it\'s a bit touristy but the water was warm and clear and our beachside restaurant at Olivero\'s was great!

130975962.name: Not as good as I was expecting
130975962.author: a TripAdvisor user
130975962.reviewBody: So, I was really looking forward to going here from the reviews and I was pretty disappointed. Granted, we did go in May, but the water was dark brown/green. And it smelled.......bad. We stayed in front of Otilia\'s and our waiter Eric was great. Our drinks were ridiculously strong, but in the end the bill showed it! $12 US for a margarita! Not a great experience.

130782170.name: Not worth it
130782170.author: a TripAdvisor user
130782170.reviewBody: Playa Las Gatas is a tourist trap. It\'s basically a bunch of restaurants lined up on a little beach on Zihuatanejo Bay. If you want to enjoy a day on the beach, enjoy Playa De La Ropa. It\'s less tourist-y and free to get to.

130298967.name: go for the beach, restaurants, not so much the snorkeling
130298967.author: a TripAdvisor user
130298967.reviewBody: You get there by water taxi, which is a nice boat ride for $4 per person round trip.  You tell the driver when to pick you up and he was right there on time.\nThere are 17 restaurants along the beach.  Each has different color umbrellas and lounge chairs, they are free if you are eating.  It is very pleasant just sitting in the lounge chairs and having a nice view of Zihuatenejo and the surrounding area.\nWe went to an area fairly far from the boat dock for snorkeling and it was murky and no fish.  People had told us snorkeling was good here, so maybe we were in the wrong area.

129363558.name: Awesome beach!
129363558.author: a TripAdvisor user
129363558.reviewBody:
You have to take a little boat to the beach which costs like $3 for a trip there and back but it is worth it.

This is a pretty calm beach with lots of little restaurants which are not that over priced and are really friendly. You can just buy a drink and just sit there for as long as you want using their shades. 

If you are interested in surfing there is also surfing at that beach. Not right at the beach since it is too calm there but there are wave breakers off shore a bit that are good for surfing.

129362223.name: Otilio\'s is our Favorite
129362223.author: a TripAdvisor user
129362223.reviewBody: Walk to the end of the beach for a more tranquil spot at Otilio\'s - Franco will take good care of you there.

129299914.name: Beautiful Beach
129299914.author: a TripAdvisor user
129299914.reviewBody: We were staying on Playa La Ropa but could see Playa las Gatas. We rented a boat for the day and made a stop at Las Gatas. The water is clear and blue- much more enjoyable than La Ropa! Most of the beach is lined with restaurants and chairs so I wouldn\'t call it a private or relaxing beach. Snorkeling seemed to be ok althought we did not try it. I would recommend going there for a meal and a swim but wouldn\'t plan on spending the whole day.

129272211.name: Sandi Hengel you couldn\'t carry enough beer for the amount you drink
129272211.author: a TripAdvisor user
129272211.reviewBody: Las gatas.  Is not boat access only.  There is a road part way from la ropa that gives way o a path along the beach. Also you can drive the road high above the beach  to a path 5 minutes down.\nSandi is my sister. And she isn\'t the average traveller. Kiss kiss

129164781.name: Great local beach
129164781.author: a TripAdvisor user
129164781.reviewBody: Great local beach. We spent the day at Otilia\'s after fishing and thoroughly enjoyed it.  Very local. Nice beach.  Water activities include swimming, snorkeling, banana boat rides etc.  would definitely go back.

128679739.name: Local Fun
128679739.author: a TripAdvisor user
128679739.reviewBody: We visited Las Gatas on Good Friday and it was packed with locals.  It was a fantastic atmosphere with large families headed to the beach to enjoy the sunshine and water.  We found everyone very friendly

128170943.name: Awesome little beach
128170943.author: a TripAdvisor user
128170943.reviewBody: This beach has a reef made by an ancient ruler... you can snorkel and put your chair right up to the edge of the water!

128050126.name: Great Walk
128050126.author: a TripAdvisor user
128050126.reviewBody: The walk along the rocks on the beach from Playa La Ropa to Playa Las Gatas is a bit challenging but a very nice little hike.  We ate at Otilia\'s (2nd to last beach restaurant at the far end of Las Gatas) and the food was excellent.  I had the baked 1/2 pineapple filled with seafood.  They rent snorkle gear and the water is calm and there are lots of fish to see pretty close to shore.  The beach is sandy but turns very rocky very soon after you enter the water so wear sandals unless swimming.

127760135.name: snorkle
127760135.author: a TripAdvisor user
127760135.reviewBody: decent snorkling on the beach side of the rock reef, a bit more dicey out from the rock reef...panga drivers really pushed for tips.  Reasonalble drinking and beach dining, some visitors brought their own in coolers and were welcomed to use the umbrellas of the restaurants.

127358990.name: Go see Franco
127358990.author: a TripAdvisor user
127358990.reviewBody: This is a great day trip when you are in Zihua. Take the boat over, and when you get off walk all the way down the beach to the second to the last restaurant. Franco is the man to see. He has the pink tablecloths and umbrellas. He will take care of you! \n\nThe limonada is the best in Zihua - and it\'s very low cost for an entire pitcher. They will bring you a bucket of iced beers, and you are set to relax on one of their cushioned lounge chairs on the beach. They have food, and it\'s freshly made and delicous. They recently added a massage palapa, and it\'s less than $25usd for an hour massage while you listen to the waves crash on the beach. As Franco would say - it\'s peachy keen.

127052426.name: Don\'t go.
127052426.author: a TripAdvisor user
127052426.reviewBody: From our hotel on Playa La Ropa we were wondering what all excitement was across the bay...boats were going back and forth all day everyday to what looked like an interesting area. In our hotel activities guide it said there was decent snorkeling at Las Gatas, so my husband and I arranged a snorkeling excursion. As soon as we arrived we couldn\'t wait to leave. Las Gatas is just a sketchy beach with even sketchier restaurants. The snorkeling was disappointing. Stay happy and play on Playa la Ropa. Save the snorkeling for Hawaii or the Caribbean.

126925239.name: Great for a beginning snorkelling experience
126925239.author: a TripAdvisor user
126925239.reviewBody: Six of us aged 8-72 went to Los Gatos for the day to snorkel and had a ball.  We only had to rent some of our equipment which we did easily at Carlo Scuba and then settled in next door at Oliviera\'s for lunch and to leave our bags at the table when we went snorkelling as is the custom.  \nThis beach and lagoon behind the reef is perfect for beginner snorkellers--they can easily swim out to the reef in shallow water all the way and see enough fish to keep them interested.  Of course, the better viewing of greater numbers of a greater variety of fish is on the outside of the reef but if the water is rough, most beginners will stay on the outside.  After our first hour and a half swim, we came back to the restaurant for lunch and decided to order the platter of fish and vegetables for the six of us to share--what a feast with something for everyone.  We swam again in the afternoon, with the adults taking turns going to the outside to see the more brightly coloured fish.  All in all, it is a great excursion, even the voyage across and back in the boat.

126708191.name: FUN PLACE
126708191.author: a TripAdvisor user
126708191.reviewBody: easyier to snorkel here than Ixtapa island.. smooth getting in and smooth getting out, dont have waves crashing on you like the island. i recommend The Otilia Restaurant, very friendly and they catch their food daily so its very fresh. and very good

126679280.name: Best beach in Zihuat!
126679280.author: a TripAdvisor user
126679280.reviewBody: For only 40 pecos you can go by boat to Las Gatas Beach it is the best.

126588220.name: good to relax, but nothing to do
126588220.author: a TripAdvisor user
126588220.reviewBody: it was okay, nut the snorkling was limited and there is little else to do.

125807557.name: Touristy yes, relaxing definately
125807557.author: a TripAdvisor user
125807557.reviewBody: We have been on many occasions and knew what to expect.  Because the economy is suffering, every person is vying for your service so expect to have staff trying to get your business as soon as you arrive.  Walk the beach before deciding where you want to stay.  Check prices and ask for costs.  We stay near the end of the beach at the "pink umbrellas".  We enjoy sitting in the lounges with our own tables and having cervacas brought to us in the water.  Good food, good service.  Snorkelling was disappointing as the tide was low.  Take a book, camera, binoculars, and chill out!

125730042.name: beautiful beach
125730042.author: a TripAdvisor user
125730042.reviewBody: clear waters, lots of lounge chairs in the restaurants, cheap beers!\n

125646849.name: A Peace of Even...
125646849.author: a TripAdvisor user
125646849.reviewBody: The water is cristal clear... The restaurant Chez Camille is a very nice with a very good service and very good food. Also the Dive Shop CarloScuba is located next to the restaurant and his owner is very professional... Try it !!!

125644073.name: Beautiful commercial beach
125644073.author: a TripAdvisor user
125644073.reviewBody: The fifteen minute hike in is worth the effort if you like lounging on a white sand beach lined with 200 beach chairs. Beer cost from 17 to 25 pesos. Snorkle, fins and mask may be rented for the day for 50 pesos. Water visibility is only 10 feet inside the manmade breakwater but it improves on the ocean side. 200 pesos for a massage.

125535126.name: Great afternoon on calm beach for swimming and snorkelling
125535126.author: a TripAdvisor user
125535126.reviewBody: We found a great spot at Las Brisas rest. to spend the afternoon swimming and snorkelling. Las Gatas was quieter than past years, so many empty restaurants along the beach.........The water was nice and clear for snorkelling, lots of small stingrays, We were told that the water was cold and they come closer to shore for warmth. Cold beer and fresh grilled fish for lunch. Try the fried bananas sold by the women along the beach they were fantastic! Love this spot, it is a little commercial with all the restaurants and rentals, but great calm water and really friendly vendors and owners. Can only access by boat taxi, run from pier in town, last one leaves back to pier around 5:00pm. Cost of a ticket\nwas 40 p. Great way to spend a day.

125419834.name: What a great place to spend the day!
125419834.author: a TripAdvisor user
125419834.reviewBody: You have lots of vendors to choose from for a place to get some incredible food, play in the water, have a cold drink or get a massage.  We did all of that as well as just sit, read a book and nap.  It is easy to get there from town by boat or walk from the south end of La Ropa beach which is what we did.  Wear shoes for walking and be prepared to climb over rocks in a few places.

125187370.name: Great way to end a day of fishing.
125187370.author: a TripAdvisor user
125187370.reviewBody: Had an excellent lunch of bacon-wrapped shrimp and fish tacos at Otillas. They kept the cold Pacifico\'s coming in a bucket of ice and made us feel like we were in our own oasis.

125147535.name: Must like restaurants ...
125147535.author: a TripAdvisor user
125147535.reviewBody:
This beach has beautiful green-blue water but the only place you can sit is at the restaurants.  They line the sand starting at the water's edge.  There are plenty of lounge chairs and tables but you are expected to order something of course.  I tried to sit on my towel on the sand a little further past the restaurants and a man came to tell me to move!! He said it was his restaurant area (even though it was not set up or open yet). 

On another visit we used the lounge chairs at one of the restaurants and although the service was fine to begin with, we struggled to find staff when we needed them. 

The water and sand is a lovely colour, but when I put my head underwater I found it to be very murky (unclean?).  A local told me they did have a problem with high pollution levels in the water at Las Gatas a few years ago. 

Remember to take your reef-shoes / crocs to swim in because there's a lot of sharp coral on the sea floor.

125006070.name: Fun excursion
125006070.author: a TripAdvisor user
125006070.reviewBody: OK, so you have to take the water taxi to get there.  You buy your tickets at the beginning of the pier.  It is 40 pesos round trip.  It was a fun 10 minute ride with the locals.  At the beach you rent a chair for the day.  It was about $80USD for us for the day there.  The farther down the beach the better and cheaper.  Snorkelling was ok.  Pretty murky.

124982853.name: Nice Beach, good snorkeling
124982853.author: a TripAdvisor user
124982853.reviewBody: Very nice beach with good lunch dining options.  We snorkled while there and it was pretty good.  Breakwater tends to make it calm.  Plenty of rental, however we brought our own and the resturant people were more than happy to watch our stuff while we were out in the ocean.  We walked from La Ropa beach, which took about 15 min along a rocky path.  One comment is there is a lot of garbage strewn along the path.  Come-on Native people, show some pride in the beautiful area you have and clean up your garbage.

124882855.name: Lunch break
124882855.author: a TripAdvisor user
124882855.reviewBody: Lovely spot with lots of restaurants and nice calm water with fish - good snorkelling spot.  Most of the fishing trips end up here and have a restaurant that will cook the fish that you caught for you.  We had sashimi (not sure of spelling), raw black tuna with lime juice and spices - was pretty good.  Others come here for an afternoon etc and heard that there are good massages as well.

124873549.name: Amazing beach!
124873549.author: a TripAdvisor user
124873549.reviewBody: This beach is simply beautiful.  The water is crystal clear and very warm.  Great spot for snorkelling.

124811455.name: A Disappointment
124811455.author: a TripAdvisor user
124811455.reviewBody: If you like lounge chairs lined up for 500 yards in front of tacky food vendor shacks, then this is the place for you. The best part of this place is getting there. For four dollars US, you can sit in a boat and be whisked across Zihuatanejo Bay close to the million dollar sailboats in the harbor. The trip takes 10 minutes and is worth it for the view and the sea air despite the disappoinment when you arrive at the destination.

124810164.name: Not much to do
124810164.author: a TripAdvisor user
124810164.reviewBody: Short beach with lots of restaurants.  If you want to sit in the sun and drink, it\'s great, but if you\'re looking for more, there\'s nothing here to do.

124684564.name: Must see beach
124684564.author: a TripAdvisor user
124684564.reviewBody: Take the water taxi from Playa Principal dock.  40 Pesos each round trip.  Sand is white, clean, water is clear.  Natural reef so lots of people go snorkeling from the beach.  Many restaurants along the beach.  They have lounge chairs, tables and chairs for you to use...and they sell drinks and food.  Massages given by the girls on that beach were very good for 250 pesos.  We had two massages each.  Saw small stingrays in the water by an old cement pier on the point.  The locals said the colder water was driving them into the bay.  They recommended you shuffle your feet when in the water to scare them away as they like to be in the sand.  They can give a nasty sting with their tail.  Was quiet the first time we went...only people at the last place on the beach.  Second time, more local people were there.

124547678.name: good for walking
124547678.author: a TripAdvisor user
124547678.reviewBody: is an small beach with a walk side perfect to walk in the morning and during the sun set, we loved it!

124479092.name: Pretty, but not for us
124479092.author: a TripAdvisor user
124479092.reviewBody: I think that if you are in Zihuatenajo, you should check out this beach for yourself.  Some people absolutely love it while others like ourselves feel it is just okay.  It is a small white sand beach that you either walk along the shoreline from La Playa Beach or take a boat taxi from the marina in Zihuat to get to.  It is lined from one end to the other with restaurants that have their beach chairs out front.  It was slow when we were there so every single restaurant had their \'sales person" out front giving you their pitch to eat and drink at their place.  Drinks are reasonable, but your options for food run a bit higher than over at La Ropa.  The chairs are on a slant, so I didn\'t find that so comfortable.  It felt crowded to me and that was in low season so I can\'t imagine what it would feel like to me in the height of the season.  The water can be murky or clear depending on the day.  You have to be careful walking into the water as their is rocks in most spots.  You can snorkle at this beach (we didn\'t as we got dropped off here after being on a snorkle trip for the day) so I unfortunately can\'t tell you what it is like. We also walked over from La Ropa beach one day to check it out and didn\'t stay.  In the three weeks that we were in Zihaut, we only came to this beach twice. The rest of the time we stayed at La Ropa which we loved.

124205728.name: Las Gatas - worth the trip
124205728.author: a TripAdvisor user
124205728.reviewBody: We spent the day at Las Gatas in January. Lots of food/beverage options. The only downfall was the rude guys that forced you into letting them help you on/off the water taxi and then demanded a tip.

124108588.name: Good snorkel beach
124108588.author: a TripAdvisor user
124108588.reviewBody: We found Ixtapa island better for clarity and more fish, but las Gatos is closer, withen walking distance. But in the shade almost all day

124090611.name: Wonderful place to spend a day at the beach
124090611.author: a TripAdvisor user
124090611.reviewBody: We set out with our backpacks and flipflops on our 1st day in Zihua and started walking along the beach.  We walked up the road from Madera and then walked down a steep driveway down to Playa Ropa.  We walked along the beach without finding any empty beach loungers and before long were at the end.  So we thought we might as well continue walking!  The walk was rocky and a bit treacherous but we were very careful.  It took about 15-20 minutes to walk from Madera at a slow pace.  We got to Gatos and were pleasantly surprised to see that it was not crowded and there was a plethera of empty loungers!  We walked to the end and then started back and chose Otila\'s to lay at for the rest of the day.  For the price of drinks and food you are given comfy beach chairs, a table, umbrellas if you so desire, and great service.  Our server lived all over the US with his family so his English was perfect.  \n\nJUst as a head up I will mention that our drinks were the most expensive we had during our 3 weeks in Mexico, and not nearly as good.  They were very light on the alcohol..  Our server talked me into getting a big pineapple drink to start, and while it was entertaining it was extremely expensive ($120 pesos) and had hardly any drink in it.  I wished I liked beer like my husband!

123973766.name: good time
123973766.author: a TripAdvisor user
123973766.reviewBody: enjoyed boat trip over and snorkeling. good food and met lots of other Canadians...

123500535.name: spend an enjoyable day at Las Gatas
123500535.author: a TripAdvisor user
123500535.reviewBody: You can take the water taxi to and from Lasa Gatas from the main pier in Zihuatanejo or you can walk over the rocks at the south end of La Ropa beach. It is an easy 15 minute walk, so if you are staying on La Ropa - try the walk. There are at least 18 restaurants lining the beach at Las Gatas with comfy loungers, good seafood of all kinds and cheap beer. What more could you want? shallow sandy bay is nice for kids. Rent snorkel gear for 50 pesos or bring your own. Las Gatas is a treat - one day will not be enough.

123371555.name: Essential part of the Zihuatanejo experience
123371555.author: a TripAdvisor user
123371555.reviewBody: A visit to Playa Las Gatas is always a must during our visits to Zihuanatejo. The snorkeling here is easy and always worth the effort. The walk past all the vendors to get to our favourite establishment, Ortani, at the end of the beach is a challenge but works out well. The food and service is good and the nearby massage facility makes the day complete.

123354002.name: Day at the beach w/boat ride
123354002.author: a TripAdvisor user
123354002.reviewBody: A good day trip destination with fair snorkeling. Water shoes a must especially at the far end of the beach due to corral.\n5 minute round trip boat fare 40 pesos.

123276250.name: Water and beach nice food and boat ride...not so much
123276250.author: a TripAdvisor user
123276250.reviewBody: The people that help you onto the boat expect a tip but apparently only from Gringos.  The food was only so-so at the restaurant and though the water is clear it is filled with coral reefs and not very deep for swimming.  I would not return but don\'t regret going the one tim.

123253901.name: too pricey for the average traveller
123253901.author: a TripAdvisor user
123253901.reviewBody: beautiful beach! but too expensive now! pack your own beers and sit at the end of the beach!

123232103.name: Wonderful day
123232103.author: a TripAdvisor user
123232103.reviewBody: Chia at Arnoldo\'s has the best food!  He has wonderful suggestions for the best fresh fish.

123174064.name: Fun beach
123174064.author: a TripAdvisor user
123174064.reviewBody: Great food, nice day trip, snorkling, wear water shoes very rocky bottom

123135969.name: GOOD FOOD AT AMADO\'S
123135969.author: a TripAdvisor user
123135969.reviewBody: Enjoyed relaxing at end of beach at Amado\'s and the chicken and fries were very good.  Nice to relax for hours at inexpensive restaurant and not have to pay a lot for food.

123068919.name: Great day trip with friends
123068919.author: a TripAdvisor user
123068919.reviewBody: Go over to the pier and buy a $4.00 roundtrip boat taxi ride to Playa Las Gatas and enjoy the day looking back over the bay and into the town.  Las Gatas is lined with many restaurants that offer free beach chairs if you purchase their food and drink.  Get some lobster or shrimp taco\'s and a bucket of ice cold Dos Equis and enjoy your day.  Las Gatas is very good for snorkeling and you can see many species of fish and sea life in moderately shallow water.  You can also buy a great hand rolled cigar made in the mountains to the east of Zihuatanejo for a couple bucks, get a great one hour massage for $20 or wander over to the end of the beach to see the grounds of a resort owned by one of Jacque Cousteau\'s ship divers.  A great day....

122953660.name: Nice but crowded
122953660.author: a TripAdvisor user
122953660.reviewBody: Went on a weekday yet the beach was crowded, especially the end close to the boat pier.  Lots of restaurants and gear rentals, very clean and calm water as long as you are not close to the pier - then it\'s more like sharing a bathtub.  Rocky bottom in places so bring your surf shoes. Vendors could be a bit annoying. Wide choice of fresh seafood.  Snorkeling OK but not great.   A short water taxi ride from Zihua Pier, or a relatively easy walk from Playa La Ropa with some mild rock scramble.  Recommended.

122893509.author: a TripAdvisor user
122893509.reviewBody: Very nice beach I liked the water service was ok didn\'t like the high prices

122685566.name: eat at your own risk
122685566.author: a TripAdvisor user
122685566.reviewBody: if the little beach cafes were in the USA, the health department would close them down

122436134.name: Least favortite on all of Zihaut
122436134.author: a TripAdvisor user
122436134.reviewBody: There was a reef keeping waters calm but beach was full of people and it just wasn\'t our seen.  People working restaurants were nice but too many kids and too little water.  Ixtapa Island for snorkling was better in my opinion.

122295674.name: Great snorkling
122295674.author: a TripAdvisor user
122295674.reviewBody: Get there early. Great snorkling! Skip the food if possible, not all that good and sometimes a bit suspect.

122061518.name: Go to Otillas on Playa las Gatas
122061518.author: a TripAdvisor user
122061518.reviewBody: Franco is the man on Playa las Gatas.  Otillas is nearly the last place on the beach as you get off the pier - but it is totally worth the walk.  The service was fantastic and the lobster tacos were incredible.  Definitely worth checking out!

122013146.name: Playa Las Gatas ... hidden gem
122013146.author: a TripAdvisor user
122013146.reviewBody: A little slice of the caribbean with a hint of Thailand-esque beach thrown in.  Lotsa fun for a day !

121783088.name: Las Gatas Beach
121783088.author: a TripAdvisor user
121783088.reviewBody: A nice beach with man beach restaurants and good snorkling.

121778494.name: Look out
121778494.author: a TripAdvisor user
121778494.reviewBody: talked about as the place to go, look out, if they help you off the taxi boat they expect a tip.  It is over rated and over price, very over priced if you make the mistake of ordering drinks.

121384105.name: Crowded
121384105.author: a TripAdvisor user
121384105.reviewBody: We were there in November of 2011.  It\'s a nice place to go for a drink and a dip in the ocean but it is quite crowded.

121327174.name: worth a look
121327174.author: a TripAdvisor user
121327174.reviewBody: Not as great for swimming due to coral and rocks but the food was good and the water was calm and warm

121232063.name: No reason to go
121232063.author: a TripAdvisor user
121232063.reviewBody: While in Zihuat you can go to La Ropa, Madera and Principal beaches by walking or taxi. These are all gorgeous, sandy beaches. Among the best in the world. Las Gatas requires either a boat ride or a treacherous hike, and is crowded and rocky. Absolutely no reason to go there.

120718287.name: Not a fan of this beach!
120718287.author: a TripAdvisor user
120718287.reviewBody: The beach was deserted, and there were no umbrellas to lay under. Beach is directly on pacific ocean with huge waves, so not good for swimming. Couldn\'t even get in to cool off. Recommend Playa Ropa!!

120079809.name: See the statue "under the sea" when you snorkel
120079809.author: a TripAdvisor user
120079809.reviewBody: Went as a tour, included transport to marina, little boat tour to beach, lunch [yummy], but rented gear to snorkel and $5 banana boat ride.

119922377.name: La Cabana
119922377.author: a TripAdvisor user
119922377.reviewBody: I was in Zihuatanejo in September and thought that Las Gatas was the best beach in Zihua. You can take a water taxi or a 15 minute walk across the rocks from La Ropa, which is well worth it (I did it in flip flops because it isn\'t that arduous and I didnt feel like carrying shoes around!). Less crowded than the other beaches and has a more relaxed vibe as there are no hotels around, just small bars/restaurants. \n\nIf you do go I recommend the La Cabana bar about 3/4 of the way down the beach. I spent two days there and the staff were really friendly, english speaking, and had an array of services, good food and cheap beer! They made me feel really at home and it\'s a good spot for relaxing/swimming. I was even there at closing time and some of the staff split a cab with me to get back to the centre which was really nice of them!!

119836345.name: Beautiful Blue Water
119836345.author: a TripAdvisor user
119836345.reviewBody: Nice to spend a day at Las Gatas Beach, many restaurants for casual dinning.

119570845.name: Must stop here!
119570845.author: a TripAdvisor user
119570845.reviewBody: We caught fish and they made us great sashimi and ceviche right on the beach. Loved it!

119536089.name: Save your money ... ...
119536089.author: a TripAdvisor user
119536089.reviewBody: It\'s over crouded and it has a filthy swimming area. There are so many boats that come and go in this small area that the water is cloudy and full of gasoline ... yuk! I hope the fish that the restaurants serve here don\'t catch them in Playa Las Gatas. They really need to keep the boats out of the swimming area. If you want to swim, go to the farest end of the beach where the rocks are ... that\'s no fun. xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

118997821.name: Disappointed
118997821.author: a TripAdvisor user
118997821.reviewBody: After being told what a great place Las Gatas was, we decided to visit.  We were looking for some shopping and restaurants.\nWe opted to walk. Playa LaRopa leads to a strenuous walk along the rocks by the bay.  Stamina and very comfortable shoes are a must.  we had the stamina but not the shoes. The only thing that made it a positive experience was the beautiful beach.  Everything was closed except for a few restaurants. We had a beer and took the launch back across the bay instead of walking.\nI have to be fair, this is probably quite different in season.  The only reason to travel there now would be to use the beach.

117917798.name: Reward yourself after a long walk to Playa Las Gatas.
117917798.author: a TripAdvisor user
117917798.reviewBody: If you like to walk and climb a few rocks here and there on the way to your destination, you will not be disappointed. The walk is easy all along Playa Madera (starting from the driveway next to Casa que Canta hotel), stopping for a beer, coconut water, etc. When Playa Madera ends there is a trail which eventually turns into a path via the lava rocks along the shore. You will run into other people along the way including locals fishing from the rocks.  I\'ve always enjoyed climbing rocks, so for me is fun. When you get to Playa Las Gatas you will see the dock where the small boats come in from the other side of the bay from the main town. You can take one of these back into town and then walk back or take a taxi from the town dock to your hotel.  I opted to just go back the same way I came and it seemed shorter and easier!!  Playa Las Gatas beach is the BEST beach with clear, warm water, and almost white sands. It is an excellent beach to go for the day and have lunch and drinks while sitting under an umbrella. Plus it is the best beach for children as there are no waves. Remember to bring your sunscreen, hat, etc. It can get pretty hot there. There are umbrellas available at the restaurants by the beach. Most don\'t charge for you to sit under the umbrellas if you have something to drink. I could not believe I paid $$5 (dollars) for 2 beers and sat under the umbrella for 2 hours plus went into the beach and the waiter kept an eye on my belongings!!!  Yes, I tipped him. :-)

116287218.name: A dissapointing experience.
116287218.author: a TripAdvisor user
116287218.reviewBody: Watch out for those who wants to befriend you because they are locals and that they are very familliar with the beach.  The beach has nothing to offer and the way the food were prepared were somewhat unsanitary and very expensive.  Do not take the snorkelling adventure.  It is a total rip-off.  Dead corals and same specie of fish is all they have.  Sea urchins too by the way.  Rent a boat and go private fishing instead. Look for a double decker boat with restroom. The fish that you will catch will be prepared and cook to your delight.  The beers are free and it comes with the package.  They will take you to a lot better snorkelling area.  All for $200.00, 8-10 people boat accomodation.  The boat leaves at 8:00 a.m. and comes back at 6:00 pm. It comes with island hopping which is the best part.

114722816.name: Take a walk over to Las Gatas, you will be glad you did
114722816.author: a TripAdvisor user
114722816.reviewBody: It only takes 10 to 15 minutes to make the trek.  Wear your tennis shoes.  If you are more into a leisurely trip, take the water taxi from the pier.  When you get there, grab a table at Chez Arnoldos.  The best food, drinks and good service.  Take a dip in the water if it gets a little warm.

104201494.name: Not really worth the trip.
104201494.author: a TripAdvisor user
104201494.reviewBody:
We went to Playa Las Gatos because we heard there would be good snorkeling and a nice beach. It isn't worth the cheap water taxi ticket to get there or the effort to walk along the shore from the end of Playa Las Ropas. The water taxi ride was nice but from the moment you step off the boat you are getting the hard sell. First from the guy who grabs your arm to "help" you off the boat then from a waiter from each of the restaurants that line the beach. As someone else suggested here just mention the name of another restaurant down the beach and they will ease up a bit. It is a friendly hard sell but it makes for a long walk on a short beach.
