We ended up at Otilias towards the end of the beach. The food was ok, lobster and shrimp tacos and mahi mahi shish kebabs. Both were a little overcooked but still ok. The beer wasn't quite cold enough and was twice as much as in restaurants in town. All told 5 beers, 3 tacos, 1 kebab and some chips and guacamole ran $450 pesos plus tip. 

The beach is crowded with restaurants which put out lounges and umbrellas so there isn't a lot of space to lay out and avoid the restaurants. If you want to do that go to the far end of the beach. The water is quite shallow and the bottom is mostly a dead reef. As such there is not much to see under water so don't expect much from snorkeling. 

You will have plenty of opportunity to buy silver jewelry, beaded bracelets, banana boat rides, massages, hair braiding or to hire a band as these will be offered to you every few minutes by vendors working the beach. They are all quite friendly about their offerings though so you won't feel too pressured.

All in all it would have been a better trip to go to La Ropa where the swimming is better and the beer is cheaper.

98121719.name: Las Gatas: an easy scramble on the rocks from La Ropa
98121719.author: a TripAdvisor user
98121719.reviewBody: If you are ambulatory and can make an easy scramble on the rocky shoreline between La Ropa and Las Gata don\'t bother with the water taxis.  We found it to be a safe 10 minute hike from the south end of La Ropa.  We lounged under the umbrellas at Chez Arnoldo\'s and did a couple of snorkles.  For snorkelling it is best to go beyond the string of rocks breaking the surf by going around the right end.  The water can be murking but a 9am start helped.  One of the tuna specials at Arnoldo\'s was more than enough to satisfy both our appetites for a late lunch.  You might want to avoid Las Gatas on the weekends, lots of locals crowd the beach.

95970055.name: Otillas is worth the walk down the beach!
95970055.author: a TripAdvisor user
95970055.reviewBody: Franco is your man at Otillas.  They are under the red umbrellas toward the end of the beach, but they have padded CLOTH chairs instead of the vinyl pads.  You\'ll want to bring water shoes so that you can wade out into the water, but you cannot beat the view from this beach!  Gorgeous!  Franco treats you right.  Hubby had the Mahi Mahi shrimp cabob and it was fabulous!  Snorkeling isn\'t the Carribean, but beautiful just the same.  People next to us said it was the best coconut shrimp they ever had.  Was able to get a children\'s beach coverup for more than half of what they wanted for the same one in Ixtapa.  Massage wasn\'t as good as the ones on the beach in Ixtapa.  It is worth a day excursion!

95709762.name: tip for travelers to Playa Las Gatas
95709762.author: a TripAdvisor user
95709762.reviewBody: TIP - Do not buy the yellow tickets for the boat to Playa Las Gatas.  They are sold at the send to the right as you face down the pier.  They run fewer boats and we got stuck out on Las Gatas because the kid running the boat said he had to wait until he had a full boat until he could return.  We watched 6 or 7 other boats fill up and take people back to the pier before we could leave. \n\nbtw - we sat and ate at Otilla\'s.  It was good and Franco was a wonderful waiter/host.

94208391.name: OK, looking for better place to sit next time
94208391.author: a TripAdvisor user
94208391.reviewBody:
We went here for the snorkeling.

The far end of the beach was rocky which was okay with us since we were there for the snorkeling which was best at this end of beach. Wear water shoes to protect your feet from rocks/coral. Do not expect snorkeling comparable to Carribean - water not as clear and coral is largely damaged/trampled in the bay, However you can see some fish. 
Best snorkeling is said to be in the morning. Didn't make much difference at 10 am vs 2  pm for us.  For swimming (not snorkeling) go to the end closer to pier for sandy beach.

The beach is lined with lounge chairs associated with the small restaurants. Check before selecting one to see whether there is a charge for chair or free with purchase of food and beverage. (or if "free", if there is expectation of minimum purchase). We tried Otilio's, see restaurant review, would try another next time.

My impression from being there and reading the reviews is that people looking to drink, eat and relax with friends for a full day are happier here than those looking for a quiet spot on a beach or shorter visit. 

Would only go to Las Gatas for snorkeling or as one time excursion, our hotel patio and nearby beach were more relaxing. 

A few tips: The guys who help you on and off the boats even if you don't need the help, can be very aggressive about asking for tips. So we were made sure we had some small change handy.

If you have a destination in mind and don't want the attention of all the waiters along the way, just say the name of another restaurant or color  of umbrellas at the far end as they approach and they left us alone.

92610636.name: over-rated snorkling
92610636.author: a TripAdvisor user
92610636.reviewBody: Playa Las Gatas in a pretty beach, but I thought that the snorkling was disappointing.  Most of the coral was dead--probably from being walked on in the shallow water--and there were only a few different kinds of fish--and most of the fish were of the same species.  It seems like a more middle-class beach than Playa la ropa, and we enjoyed the people-watching very much, with lots of Mexican families enjoying their day off together.

91540015.name: relaxing, fun day
91540015.author: a TripAdvisor user
91540015.reviewBody: I was looking forward to getting to this beach and finding Estrella for my massage! Turns out no one could help me so my husband and I still chose to get a massage for 200 pesos each. That is less than $20 for each person!! We had out own private little room that looked like a tent. The massages were fantastic! I had a woman named Daisy. It was better than the massages I get back home and it didn\'t hurt that I could hear the ocean! We also had some yummy fresh fruit slices and snorkeled. The snorkeling was decent and meets everyone\'s levels. You get in right from the shore. \nGreat day overall.

87217064.name: Great way to spend the entire day!
87217064.author: a TripAdvisor user
87217064.reviewBody: We had a wonderful day at Playa Las Gatas. Went to the end of the beach and got some lounges at Amados. David, our server was very professional, efficient and spoke very good English. We ate dinner at the restaurant and it was absolutely delicious as was the cocktails! We can\'t wait to return and enjoy another day at the beach with David! ZIH is by far our favorite place in Mexico to visit!

86789220.name: too rocky for me
86789220.author: a TripAdvisor user
86789220.reviewBody: There are so many nice beaches in the area, I probably wouldn\'t go to Las Gatas again.  If you want to just sit on the beach, lounge under an umbrella and eat and drink then it is beautiful.  There are many nice restaurants along the edge to partake of.  However, if you want to spend time in the water, be prepared to encounter a rocky bottom in all but a few small cleared patches.  Not for me!

82791390.name: good to be wary
82791390.author: a TripAdvisor user
82791390.reviewBody: I first came across Playa las Gatas 30 years ago and always make a point of going there. It has never failed to provide a good time. This last trip in September 2010 only reinforced that people can\'t always be taken at face value. Be careful with Amado\'s, mentioned by another reviewer. Unfortunately how they profess to be is not the way they are and they provided us with one of the very few bad tastes in our one month trip. Charging $25 MN extra for the addition of a lime to an agua mineral? Calling this combination a "suero"? Fortunately they didn\'t charge extra for the limes in our beers. We had visited with them in February and took our daughters there, spending on drinks and food. Never again.There are many reputable places on this beach that will not rip you off, we simply moved to one of these and did not allow the experience to ruin our time.

79277198.name: Our favorite "to do" in Zihua
79277198.author: a TripAdvisor user
79277198.reviewBody: Relaxing and fun on the beach. You will get approached by each location that sells food/beer and has a chaise lounge. Just find the one that has the nicest pads. Or the cheapest beer (they are priced different). My favorite watering hole was with Elias. He has Indios for 10 pesos. That\'s less than $1 each! My wife got a message for $25/hr. You can skip Playa La Ropa and just go here. Be sure you hang on to your round trip boat ticket (35 pesos) until you are on the boat. Seemed like a scam when the "helpful" guy on the dock takes your tix before you board and somehow one vanishes from the group.

65861050.name: Great massage on the beach at Las Gatas
65861050.author: a TripAdvisor user
65861050.reviewBody: Just returned today from a week in Zihuatanejo.  On our first full day, we spent the day at Playa Las Gatas where I promptly got a massage from Estrella at El Arrecife.  Estrella was so professional and personable and the massage rivaled that of any I have received at salons in the US.  And, the massage only cost $20 US for a full hour.  What a relaxing start to our vacation!

63112154.name: Playa Las Gatas and Otilia\'s.....a PERFECT way to spend the day!!
63112154.author: a TripAdvisor user
63112154.reviewBody:
My husband and I spent 2 weeks in Zihua in December.  Early in our trip, we decided to visit Playa Las Gatas, and ended up at Otilia's restaurant on the far end of the beach.

Franco, our waiter, was attentive, and extremely entertaining!  We hadn't planned to stay long, but were enjoying ourselves so much that we decided to order some lunch.  The prices seemed very reasonable, and the food was excellent!

During our 2 weeks, we ended up back at Las Gatas and Otilia's an additonal 4 TIMES!!  We were with friends the next few times we went, and ordered a HUGE variety of items from the menu...all of which were extremely good!

Playa Las Gatas is a great place to spend the day!!

61713050.name: Playa las gatas and Otilias were great!
61713050.author: a TripAdvisor user
61713050.reviewBody: Look for Restaurant Otilia and Francowhen you go. You can rent cheap snorkel equipment and eat some great food. On this day, Franco said he had fresh caught lobster which we devoured in lobster tacos. Delicious! The pina colada was probably the largest drink I\'ve ever had.

58855077.name: Las Gatas is a little piece of paradise
58855077.author: a TripAdvisor user
58855077.reviewBody: I go to Las Gatas beach every time I visit Zihuatanejo (which is fairly often) and I love it there.  There are some great restaurants and people.  I always have my snorkel gear but there are places that rent it.  The snorkeling is available for about any skill level.  Last year I even saw a turtle while snorkeling there.  Although not all the restaurants are created equal there are great places to sit and enjoy the day and view.  Enjoy your next visit, I am looking forward to mine!

37996454.name: we loved Las Gatas
37996454.author: a TripAdvisor user
37996454.reviewBody: Our family spent two days at Las Gatas and enjoyed it very much.  We decided on Coco Loco, ask for Carlos.  Our first day we spent mostly snorkling - don\'t forget to see the Christ statue.  You can paddle out to the white markers...its a must see.  If you go during the weekend expect crowds but the beach is big enough for everyone.

36739867.name: Otilia\'s is the best!
36739867.author: a TripAdvisor user
36739867.reviewBody: My favorite place to spend the day relaxing in Zihua is at Otilia\'s at Las Gatas.  It is the second restaurant from the end of the cove.  Franco speaks excellent English and will entertain you all day.  The food and cold beer there are excellent.  You can also rent snorkel equiptment there for $4.  Just another "Day in Paradise"!

26033624.name: Fun morning at the beach
26033624.author: a TripAdvisor user
26033624.reviewBody:
We went at 9:00 am to las gatas to miss the crowds, when we got there there weren't too many people, mostly workers setting up for the day. The water is definitely bluer and clearer than at other zihua beaches. The sand is nice and in general a nice place. Of course, the beach is packed with restaurant after restaurant and several places to rent snorkel gear. 

We paid 100 pesos each for a 1 hour guided snorkel tour, we got to keep the snorkel gear for the rest of the day and use the lounge chairs / umbrellas at the accompanying restaurant. It worked out well, we enjoyed the tour, their was a good variety of fish to see and the water was nice.

We only stayed till about 1, we wanted to avoid the pricier food.

Overall we thought it was worth the boat ride out to las gatas

23203046.name: Otilia\'s at Playa Las Gatas
23203046.author: a TripAdvisor user
23203046.reviewBody: Nice, calm on-the-beach restaurant toward the end of the row. Ask for Scott, a super-friendly ex-patriot from Colorado (with a cool little dog, Jazz).  He\'s great; food is, too...

20943695.name: Good for a few hours
20943695.author: a TripAdvisor user
20943695.reviewBody:
Let me start by saying we visited Las Gatas during the off season so there were no crows to deal with or water taxi lines.  We also were not charged to sit down or use any of the lounge chases.  Once we got to the beach we were haggled to tip the kids standing by the water taxi ramp.  Just don't, simple as that.  Don't feel obligated because they are asking you.  It is NOT customary.

As we walked the beach (which is basically beach club after beach club), we were approached by someone from every single club, end to end.  This makes a casual walk along the beach very difficult to do without someone trying to sell you snorkeling, drinks, jet ski's, etc.  

The sea bed itself has a lot of coral so I would recommend some sort of water shoe.  The one thing that struck us as odd was the water being much saltier than in Playa La Ropa.  This maybe because of the man made break front that perimeters the cove (apparently built by someone of royalty to protect his wife from sharks).  Either way, we found ourselves hurrying back to our chaises to rinse our faces with fresh water as our eyes were quickly beginning to dry and redden.  

The drinks were delicious and the food was average at best.  For the experience and the views it was worth it however I wouldn't stay for more than a few hours for lunch and maybe a quick dip.

18569576.name: mixed experience
18569576.author: a TripAdvisor user
18569576.reviewBody: I have to agree with some of the other post about Las Gatas beach chair policy.  what a rip off. We took the water taxi over in the early morning, it was our last day in Ziwuat and we had yet to go over there.  We were one of the first people there.  We took a chair at the first place off the water taxi stand.  50 pesos each. OK fine,  we paid even though I though it was a bit much considering we were also ordering drinks.  My girlfiend and I have our own snorkel fins and mask as we do it often. My girlfriend asked for a life vest because she gets tired after a half hour or so of snorkeling so they gave her one, no mention of a rental charge.  The snorkeling was pretty good, saw a large variety of fish, eels, and a sea snake and the water was clear and calm.  Upon returning to our chairs we were once again offered more drinks and food, we declined as we were getting ready to leave after a few hours of snorkeling.  They charged us another 50 peso each because we didn\'t order enough for the chairs and then hit us with a 30 peso charge for the life vest.  I argued with them for a bit and just paid them.  I don\'t like getting ripped off or taken advantage of, we were pissed and did not return.  It\'s not the money is that none of this was told to us up front and we were the only people sitting at there.

14714199.name: A waste of time and money
14714199.author: a TripAdvisor user
14714199.reviewBody:
Las Gatas was by far the worst experience of our trip.  (Read trilinearmipmap's comments for additional info).
The beach is anything but a white sand (as one guide book described it) calm, quiet get away.

Currently, it costs 35 pesos (standard "street" exchange rate is 10 pesos to $1and you can pay in either dollars or Pesos) round trip to take a water taxi to Las Gatas.  Keep the second half of the ticket; you'll need to give it to the taxi "driver" on the return trip.

Having caught one of the first taxis of the day, everything was calm and quiet on the trip over and upon arrival but it was clear once the beach was in sight that we would be one of many that day.

The first thing that strikes you is the mass of colored umbrellas that occupy in the neighborhood of 80+% of the beach.  In general, each color denotes a different restaurant/snorkel gear rental/gift shop.

We initially walked over to the now closed (has been for over 1 year according to the locals) Las Gatas Beach Club (although some of the bungalows may still be available to rent, there is no club/restaurant) to watch the local surfers.  No pressure and as we found out later, no charge for the chairs.

As more tourists and locals arrived (word to the wise, the week after Easter is a traditional break week for the locals so domestic travel increases greatly during that time) we decided to find a place on the beach and enjoy the morning; we had no intention of staying all day.

We found a couple lounge chairs at the first establishment on the far end of the beach (it was something like Armandos, remember the White umbrellas and avoid) with white umbrellas and were greeted warmly.  We couldn't sit in the chairs we wanted (apparently they were reserved) but eventually settled down and ordered a couple drinks.

As it happened that day, the water had been particularly high and our host said that he felt the snorkeling wasn't going to be good that day.  I was impressed at his honesty...it wouldn't last.

We lounged for roughly a couple hours.  During that time, many, many more tourists kept piling on the beach as more water taxis arrived.  At one point, there was a line of 14 taxis waiting to unload in addition to the local boats arriving and anchoring just off the beach.  There were so many anchored boats; you had to dodge them, and keep an eye on them in case they shifted, to get to water more than waist deep.

Speaking of the water, it's not very clean and far from clear.  If you're planning on walking more than 3 feet into the water, bring some form of foot protection, the beach is very rocky under the water and it's not fun at all with bare feet.  (Yes, one of us gave a little blood).

Deciding we wanted to beat the rush off the beach and see a little of Zihuantanejo we told our host we were ready to leave.  Then came the big news, there is an "assumption" that if you occupy a chair you will also order lunch (if he mentions the lobster and tuna tacos one more time...).

If all the chairs were full and we were preventing business, I might understand, but maybe 8 out of 20 were occupied and there were still 2+ hours until "lunch" was going to be ready (we kept being told that it wouldn't be ready until around 2pm).
Needless to say, this didn't make us happy.  Had he stated it up front, that's one thing, but when only one party in this relationship knows the "assumption" and the other doesn't, it's complete BS.  Clearly, we weren't in the States, but if I ran my business like that, I'd be run out of town.

We elected to leave, any shred of an appetite was gone.
As we made our way along the little strip of sand (dodging people, rocks, etc.) between the water and the pricy lounge chairs, we licked our “tourist” wounds and vowed never to return.  Clearly, there is information out there about this lovely practice, but we only had our travel guide and the time and interestingly enough, it didn’t mention the chair fee.  Although it did described white sand, calm waters, and the great beach for kids.  All statements I would consider inaccuracies.

To add insult to injury, after we loaded into the water taxi for the return trip, the boys (who I don’t believe are staff of the water taxi organization) demanded a tip.  Fortune would somewhat smile as the taxi driver quickly pulled away from the crumbling concrete before I could react.  Besides, there would be plenty of other opportunities that day, 12 taxis were waiting to unload.

This was by far the worst experience of our time in Ixtapa/Zih.  and strongly encourage you to spend time and money elsewhere.  One recommendation would be Isla Ixtapa.  However, the snorkeling side of Isla Ixtapa has a feel just like Las Gatas with all the chairs, umbrellas and people, (not to mention a very rough coral beach) but if you wander about 20 yards behind that beach, you’ll find a much more tranquil experience next to calm water and the chairs don’t cost a Peso.

14508254.name: Playa Las Gatas: avoid at all costs
14508254.author: a TripAdvisor user
14508254.reviewBody:
My wife and I went to Playa Las Gatas last week and it was an extreme disappointment and waste of time.

We took the boat across the harbour, the boat ride was pleasant but that was the only nice part of the trip.

On arriving at Playa Las Gatas we found that the entire beach was taken up by restaurants which had set up lounge chairs for their patrons.  There was no part of the beach which you could use if you were not a patron of the restaurants.

We had intended to have a couple of cold drinks at a restaurant, then go swimming and snorkeling, then have lunch after a couple of hours.

The first place we tried demanded $45.00 (not pesos) for the privilege of sitting in their lounge chair to have a drink.  This was the red umbrella place that one of the other reviewers mentioned.  We were advised that either we order a full lunch, or pay $45.00, or leave.  We weren't hungry yet as we had just finished breakfast.  We moved on to the next restaurant which demanded $20.00 per seat.  The third restaurant was the same.

Although we are well off and can easily afford these prices I have a strong objection to being ripped off.  We passed on the restaurants and took a walk down the beach.

We noted that the water was a filthy yellow color with lots of foam pollution floating on top of the water.  There were many boats anchored along the beach blocking the potential swimming even if it weren't for the foul looking water.  To put the finishing touch on this masterpiece, a mangy smelly dog sauntered down the beach rooting into garbage.

We beat a hasty retreat back to the pier and took the boat back to Zihuatanejo.

The rest of our trip to Ixtapa/Zihuatanejo was wonderful.  All of the people we met on our trip were nice to deal with, vendors and restaurant staff were polite and treated us fairly.  Las Gatas was the only place where anyone tried to rip us off.

In summary we were absolutely disgusted with our trip to Playa Las Gatas.  Do not waste your time going there.  Instead go to Isla Ixtapa.  We had a wonderful time there including have chairs and table set up 10 feet from the water and being served lobster and drinks without any hassle or pressure and certainly no shake-down for money for a lounge chair.

Playa Las Gatas for us fit the ugly stereotype of a nightmare Mexican vacation spot.  It was a vision of hell on earth that I would never visit again.

13735242.name: Otilia @Las Gatas, too much fun!
13735242.author: a TripAdvisor user
13735242.reviewBody: I wasn\'t sure how to spell Otilia so I just retrieved Franco\'s shirt, which he litterally gave me off his back...ok I traded him some stuff.  We landed at Otilia during a cruise on the Mexican Riveria.  Got into Zihuatanego, took a lancha (water taxi)...go with the guys nearest the pier,...it takes about ten minutes more or less to get to Las Gatas.  We pretty much walked straight to Otilia on the end with the red umbrellas.  Las Gatas is a pretty cshaped beach that has restaurants all along it, as stated earlier when you eat at the restaurant you also get the lounge chairs and umbrella.  Franco is very funny and energetic, I told him he was pretty famous on the net.  We had beer, lobster tacos (unbelievable) and killer margaritas, they raised the bar on what they should taste like...I\'ll never be the same!  I swam, and yes the water is pretty shallow, but that was fine.  We pretty much spent the whole day there, hooked up with another couple on the cruise and had a second (and last) drink.  Thank goodness Francos kid knew someone with a boat, they took us back to the ship, otherwise we would still be there.....hmmmmm that woudn\'t be so bad.  I also got a massage and scrub at one of the beachside massage places.  Right on the beach, now that\'s heaven! Oh and don\'t expect to pay with plastic, that\'s how we almost missed our boat, bring efectivo.

11637394.name: Las Gatas 12/17/7 update
11637394.author: a TripAdvisor user
11637394.reviewBody:
The only safe way to get to Las Gatas is to take a lancha (water taxi) from the municipal pier. The cost is 35 pesos; keep your ticket which is collected on the return trip.
We always go to Otilio's which is the second to the last restaurant with the bright red umbrellas. Francisco is your host; he is very friendly, funny, and efficient.
Beers are 15 pesos each (we recommend the bucket of six). The snacks and seafood dishes are delicious. Make sure the number of food orders and prices are clearly understood beforehand. You may wonder why you have gotten so much.
There is no charge for the lounge chairs on the beach if you buy food and beverages.
Suggest that you bring a towel to lay on and dry yourself off. The water is fairly clear, but rocky.
The underwater Christ statute is about 150 yards out by the red buoy; it is about six feet underwater. If you swim out there, you have to negotiate a 20 yard girth of shallow, slippery, and sharp rocks. Be sure to wear swim fins or some type of footwear. Watch out for your hands.
Last lancha comes back at 5 pm.

2609819.name: Spend a day at this beach
2609819.author: a TripAdvisor user
2609819.reviewBody:
Playa Las Gatas is south of Zihuatanejo. It is very difficult to walk there, besides being a long walk, the last part of the walk involves walking on a rocky section of shoreline. The best way to get to Playa Las Gatas is to go to the municipal pier in Zihuatanejo. You can walk to the pier from Zihuatanejo or take a taxi. If you are in Ixtapa, you can take a bus to Zihuatanejo or a taxi. There is a ticket booth at the very start of the pier. Ask for a ticket to Las Gatas. It is very inexpensive. Remember to keep the stub for the return trip. Walk down the pier a bit and you will see the water taxis lined up. Board the water taxi - there will be people there to help you into the boat if needed - the steps down are a little steep. The boat (actually, the water taxi is called a "panga") will take you across a bay, around a point and drop you off at a pier at the far north end of Playa Las Gatas. You can walk south down the beach. There are a number of wonderful restaurants along the beach. You can choose one and simply spend the day there. They will make a breakfast for you, serve you snacks, appetizers and beverages all day and make a wonderful lunch for you! The fishing charter captains often take their fresh catch and bring it to the restaurants there, so if you enjoy seafood, you can have fresh mahi-mahi or whatever you desire! The prices are lower than in town for both food and beverages. The previous poster mentioned Franco and his restaurant (Otilio's). That happens to be the restaurant I go to on Las Gatas. However, you won't be disappointed in any of the other ones.  The beach is very nice, the water clarity is good. There is some snorkeling available there, however I found the best snorkeling spot has the strongest current, so I recommend snorkeling only for strong, experienced swimmers. Carlos' SCUBA is located on this beach. Carlos' shop is a PADI certified shop and offers great SCUBA diving for certified SCUBA divers. The most popular trip costs about $75 US. The shop also offers lessons for begining divers. 

Once you have selected a place to hang out for the day, just sit and relax, go swimming, have some refreshing beverages and enjoy your meal! Toward evening or perhaps even late afternoon, pack up your gear, pay your bill and head back to the pier and catch a water taxi back to the Municipal Pier in Zihuatanejo. I travel to Ixtapa/Zihuatanejo and I would never miss spending a day on Playa Las Gatas. I recommend this beach as a day trip.

1733458.name: Las Gatas with Franco!
1733458.author: a TripAdvisor user
1733458.reviewBody: We spent a day on Las Gatas beach intending to do some snorkeling..we went early in the morning and amidst all the restaurants and palapas, by luck we happened to be swayed by Franco at the Restaurant Otillia (you can\'t miss it....it\'s toward the end of the beach with all the bright red umbrellas) with the promise of a better-than-best pina colada ! I told him to prove it, and did he ever!! It came to me in a hollowed out pineapple with a face made out of the pineapple with cherries and flowers, and it had outdone all others!! He waited on us hand and foot the whole day there ! The only downfall was- after everything we had heard about going there to snorkle- was that the water was extremely shallow and made me too nervous to move around because I was inches from snagging on the coral. Hubby and I did see a few tropical fish, but this didn\'t even compare to snorkling in the Carribean. All in all, it was a great, relaxing day, and we had Franco to thank!!

654371272.name: Sit downtown and watch the boats come in
654371272.author: a TripAdvisor user
654371272.reviewBody: This is the downtown beach in Zihua. Not a lot of swimming goes on here as there are fishing boats and dingies parked there. But it\'s a great place to find a restaurant and have a couple of beers as the sun sets. Walk along the malacon and see a basketball game, the fish being brought in early in the morning, and have a good breakfast by the water. For swimming make your way over to Playa Madera, La Ropa, or Las Gatas (via boat from the pier)

647868325.name: Busy fishing village and water taxi beach
647868325.author: a TripAdvisor user
647868325.reviewBody: This is a nice place to go and walk around to see the fishing boats, locals and grab a water taxi to Palya La Gato, There is a nice stroll along the beach. Access to public park and the museum and Museo Arqueologico de la Costa Grande!\nEasy access to town also

636317322.name: Fun place to people watch.
636317322.author: a TripAdvisor user
636317322.reviewBody: The beach, myeh.  The people watching with the pangas and commercial fishermen selling their daily catch, awesome!

570830280.name: main beach close to everything
570830280.author: a TripAdvisor user
570830280.reviewBody: Beach is small but enough to get a suntan, on the other side of this is where the fisherman sell their catch but smell hardly gets to the other good side. Waves are not hard and there are not much people on it

569284263.name: Not much of a recreational beach
569284263.author: a TripAdvisor user
569284263.reviewBody: Having a beach in what amounts to the downtown area is certainly not a bad thing, but this isn\'t really a recreational beach. It\'s not as wide or as deep as other beaches in the area, and while the sand is of good quality, the limited area available makes it hard to use. Thesmaller boats for local fishing fleet are pulled up on the sand here, the fish market is on the beach, and there are beachfront restaurants using part of the beach as seating area, which is really the best way to enjoy this beach.

564404640.name: Really not a place to swim
564404640.author: a TripAdvisor user
564404640.reviewBody: If your in Zihua you will be walking by this spot Right away no will notice no one in the water This is not a swiming spot There are tons of shops and food Enjoy

561151780.name: Not that impressive
561151780.author: a TripAdvisor user
561151780.reviewBody: It might be one of the \'principal\' (main) beach area in town, close to the wharf and where all the fishing boats park, but it\'s not a good place to lay around soaking up the sun or to go swimming. The smell of gasoline put us off just walking close to it. It\'s not the cleanest kept beach. Many stray dogs and cats were wandering around here.

560090818.name: Not a good place for swiming
560090818.author: a TripAdvisor user
560090818.reviewBody: The canal feeds into the bay at the end of the beach. When it rains there is run off going into the canal and then into the Bay. We love sitting at one of the restaurants between the basketball court and the bridge over the canal. You have you r choice of restaurants and they are all good for snacks and food.

558455393.name: Dont count on golfing here
558455393.author: a TripAdvisor user
558455393.reviewBody: Very saddened by the horrible decline of this once fun golf course. Unfortunately it has fallen into a state that is clear no money is being spent to keep up the course.

481978866.name: A place to walk
481978866.author: a TripAdvisor user
481978866.reviewBody: This was a nice walk from the bungalow.  Lots of people selling things.  We did stop for a cup of coffee that was real good.

662499101.name: Educational and inexpensive
662499101.author: a TripAdvisor user
662499101.reviewBody: This little museum had history of the area with pictures and artifacts, a guide in English was provided to read about the displays. Only cost 10 pesos per person. Well worth the 1/2 hour

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de la Costa Grande

address.streetAddress: Off Paseo del Pescador

656157954.name: Museum of the local people
656157954.author: a TripAdvisor user
656157954.reviewBody: the entry fee is only 10 pesos per person, so definitely a small price to learn about the native culture. Most of the info is in Spanish, of course. You are given a small informaiton placard in english to help you understand what the displays are about. We had been to the archeological dig site and had already learned most of what was on display.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de la Costa Grande

address.streetAddress: Off Paseo del Pescador

648209646.name: Rich History
648209646.author: a TripAdvisor user
648209646.reviewBody: If you are staying in the area for awhile, check out this museum.  I have been coming to Zihuatanejo for many years and was ignorant of its pre Colombian history.  Apparently the surf break or wall at Las Gatas was constructed during this era.  Also, at the museum, I found out the anchor you see while snorkeling at Las Gatas probably belonged to an English privateer.  In the Sixteenth century, Zihuatanejo became a departure point for Spanish Galleons to the Philippines.  There is some printed English material which explains many of these things, but you may have to ask the friendly, English speaking docents a few questions.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de la Costa Grande

address.streetAddress: Off Paseo del Pescador

638843455.name: A Labour of Love
638843455.author: a TripAdvisor user
638843455.reviewBody: Clearly the community has done the best it can with limited resources to tell its story with this small six room museum. As the name (Arqueologico ) implies the focus is on the pre-Colombian civilizations that inhabited the Costa Grande region of Guerro state, including Zihuantanejo and Ixtapa. Like many costal areas it was a melting pot of different cultures and civilizations, but sometime before the Spanish conquest became a tributary province of the Aztecs. Admission is a very modest 10 pesos per person and donations are gratefully accepted. We were the only visitors at the time and the curator very kindly took the time to answer questions and fill in some details. The signage is in Spanish but at the desk you can pick up a brochure and a plasticized card that explains the exhibits in English. Ok for older children, little ones might become bored. Can be viewed in an hour or less.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de la Costa Grande

address.streetAddress: Off Paseo del Pescador

569717990.name: No English signage
569717990.author: a TripAdvisor user
569717990.reviewBody: I appreciate when people take the time and make an effort to gather information to create a museum of their area. I wish there was some English signage so we could have learned more.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de la Costa Grande

address.streetAddress: Off Paseo del Pescador

554503816.name: While in old town check out the museum
554503816.author: a TripAdvisor user
554503816.reviewBody: Lots of great history to see. They take donations to operate, very good well done. The staff can offer all kinds of information on area and history.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de la Costa Grande

address.streetAddress: Off Paseo del Pescador

483332027.name: Small but interesting
483332027.author: a TripAdvisor user
483332027.reviewBody: Something to see and learn from while in the area.  Learned the trade exchange between Zihuatanejo and the Philippines.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de la Costa Grande

address.streetAddress: Off Paseo del Pescador

459659839.name: Happy to support the local archaeological efforts
459659839.author: a TripAdvisor user
459659839.reviewBody: This is a small museum with several rooms of artifacts. It is an open-air museum housed in an old rock building. It appears to be run by volunteers and it is a voluntary donation to enter. The exhibits are in Spanish only.  There is a pamphlet written in English guiding you through the rooms. The museum is easy to get to on a nice walk along the waterfront of downtown Zihuatanejo.  We were happy to see numerous families with children also enjoying the museum.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de la Costa Grande

address.streetAddress: Off Paseo del Pescador

456186874.name: A well done small museum with heart
456186874.author: a TripAdvisor user
456186874.reviewBody: I am a museum junkie and I felt these folks did a great job telling the story of the people who had inhabited that part of Guerrero for millennia. Interpretation is simple, a chance to practice your Spanish, or take a card in English explaining the artifacts and concepts discussed in six different open air rooms.  The museum is at least partially staffed by volunteers, who have a vested interest in sharing the story of their ancestors.  Charming.  Cost is by donation.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de la Costa Grande

address.streetAddress: Off Paseo del Pescador

451998828.name: Culture of Guerrero Stzte
451998828.author: a TripAdvisor user
451998828.reviewBody: An interesting museum, script was all in Spanish, but they did have an English sheet that tried to explain the culture, but I felt it was poorly done. There were a lot of ancient artifacts that were displayed, but there was no real connect made to how the cultures evolved into the inhabitants of today or even to the Spanish conquest. \nIt as however Free. But there was a donation expected.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de la Costa Grande

address.streetAddress: Off Paseo del Pescador

668409593.name: Great beach for a family with kids
668409593.author: a TripAdvisor user
668409593.reviewBody: We stayed at playa Madera even it was Eastern weekend and a little crowded it was a lot of fun.very accessible ,many great restaurants,surf good and safe,beach was very clean,all access to the beach has been renovated ,you can walk to the city center in 15 minutes from Madera .thanks

655900220.name: Much improved, good casual vibe now--my favorite hangout beach!
655900220.author: a TripAdvisor user
655900220.reviewBody: Madera used to feel dirty and something of a poor cousin of La Ropa but now I much prefer the laid back vibe, and the waves are super fun to play in!  And with the containment of the drainage canal it\'s clean!! The beach is nice and flat for"lawn games" and kite flying or having a cold one. Not stuffy and no parasailing or jet skis. The walkways have all been rebuilt so it is a beautiful ocean side walk from downtown.

642468995.name: Nice beach with several restaurants
642468995.author: a TripAdvisor user
642468995.reviewBody: We went here several times during our stay and sampled several of the restaurants. I don\'t have all of the names memorized, but if you came from the main pier/marina, we had ceviche tostadas at the first one which were very good. For some reason they were on the Spanish but not the English menu . It was 6 bucks for three heaping tostadas; a meal for two. Next to that restaurant (or maybe one more down), there is a long row of beach umbrellas and chairs for rent, no food. Then all the way at the end of the restaurants is the one with the waiter named "Monkey". His uncle has a fishing boat for hire if I understood correctly; anyway a fountain of knowledge of what to do around Zihua and a heck of a nice guy.\nYes the beach is full of locals. If you want to be surrounded by gringos, you need to go to Ixtapa. Zihua is Mexico. It\'s a nice beach and walking distance from town, where the other beaches require a bus or cab ride. Plenty of English spoken.\nA nice local beach.

639094442.name: Great location walk or cheap cab to everything you want to do.
639094442.author: a TripAdvisor user
639094442.reviewBody: The beach is great for swimming with normally small surf.  It is very shallow for a long way out.  easy access by street or from the several hotels.  Lots of good cafes and bars. Our favorite Zihua location to stay.

636317167.name: Nice beach
636317167.author: a TripAdvisor user
636317167.reviewBody: A lot of locals here.  I view that as a good thing, not bad.  Better than Playa Municipal and definitely not as nice as Playa La Ropa.  We enjoyed our stroll there.

585207685.name: Don\u00b4t go here. Since the economic downturn, the mafia controls....
585207685.author: a TripAdvisor user
585207685.reviewBody: And this is a place it controls with an iron fist. If you go, you will be one of a few and everybody will fight over you. Especially do not go to the Rana Rene- straight up run by the mob.

569275231.name: Pretty nice beach
569275231.author: a TripAdvisor user
569275231.reviewBody: This is a decent beach but not the best in the area. The sand here is very fine, which makes for some good walking and a firm base when in the water, but it also gets stirred up easily, making the water a little murky. There\'s not a lot of room on the beach but enough when it\'s not the busy season. There are a few restaurants and shops here, and when we visited there were two women offering massage for a very reasonable price. One nice thing here is the almost complete absence of wandering beach vendors. There is a pretty nice paved beach walk at the base of the bluff the hotels are built on. The middle of the beach is nice for swimming/playing in the water, it slopes gradually and there are no obstructions. Like all the beaches on Zihuatanejo Bay, it\'s pretty well protected but there are still waves enough to play with, at times body surfing or boogie boarding are pretty good. I don\'t know if people throw more trash on this beach, or if it\'s just that this is where the waves and currents drop the trash, but I did find myself often stepping on trash, mostly crushed plastic bottles or bits and scraps of wood, but once I felt a sharper edge and found I was standing on a torn and crushed aluminum can. The ends of the beach are more rocky and you have to be careful as there are broken oyster shells stuck to the rocks, it\'s easy to step on them when walking in the shallows and they will cut your feet badly.

561153097.name: Quaint and lovely
561153097.author: a TripAdvisor user
561153097.reviewBody: We really enjoyed this area of Zihua. The shops are authentic and the people very friendly. The feel of the neighbourhood is laid back and relaxing. There are lots of eateries, restaurants and bars to satisfy your thirst and hunger. \n\nOn La Madera beach there are amazing sand artists that build and tend to their incredible sculptures. The sand, water and beach area is very nice.

544679048.name: Warm water, fun
544679048.author: a TripAdvisor user
544679048.reviewBody: We stay on this beach and spend quota but of time swimming around. Very nice in winter. Aura del Mar is a great beach hotel.

541269223.name: Pleasant, mellow beach
541269223.author: a TripAdvisor user
541269223.reviewBody: This is a nice beach to play in the water or walk along- maybe stop for a snack or beverage. The neighborhood is nice too- steep hills though! We enjoyed this area greatly- also, not too much pushy sales people - a plus in my book!

495962780.name: La Madera beach is great and very underrated, especially in low season
495962780.author: a TripAdvisor user
495962780.reviewBody:
This review only concerns Playa Madera - the neighbourhood itself we did not find especially interesting.

We went in late June which is low season and stayed at a hotel right on the beach. The beach is clean enough and great for bodysurfing. The setting in the outskirts of the bay is spectacular. The sea was not very rough for being in the Pacific, great for swimming and quite shallow so even not-so-strong swimmers can go. Prices are decent in the surrounding beach restaurants. The restaurant attached to Hotel Aura del Mar is pricey but good.

Again, note that we went in low season. The beach is small and might become unbearably crowded in high season. It is however big enough to take in some crowds - that cannot be said about Las Gatas for example that is a very narrow strip of sand that felt crowded even during our visit. 

Conclusions, a great beach to visit to relax in lounge chairs and eat well - do not fall for the idea that the further from town, the better the beach that our impression from reviews was before actually visiting Zihuatanejo.

465647159.name: Heaven- I will retire there
465647159.author: a TripAdvisor user
465647159.reviewBody: The best in town swimming beach. 10 minute walk to even better Playa Ropa. Unbeatable restaurant under the sail shade. I body surfed every day and ate there at night. The best beach to stay at for $100 a night. Cheaper but good places 3 blocks away for $35 a night at Hotel Zihua Express.

463579077.name: La Madera a wonderful neighbourhood.
463579077.author: a TripAdvisor user
463579077.reviewBody: Lots happening in La Madera neighborhood. Many Restaurants boutiques, a cooking school with Monica,  walkway to the beach of La Madera. We have stayed in this area many times and like it a lot!

462476718.name: Great little neighborhood for hotels, beach & restaurants
462476718.author: a TripAdvisor user
462476718.reviewBody: Every time we come to Zihuatanejo, we stay in a hotel in Colonia La Madera. It\'s friendly, close to the center of town with a variety of good restaurants and hotels.

458363400.name: Best beach
458363400.author: a TripAdvisor user
458363400.reviewBody: La Ropa gets all the reviews and little is said about Madera beach.  We found this beach to be the nicest beach in the bay.  Shallow, warm and very few waves.  A swimmers delight.

453060454.name: Best Spot In Zihua
453060454.author: a TripAdvisor user
453060454.reviewBody:
We come to Zihua every year and always stay in this neighborhood. There's been great improvement over the years and a few new restaurants have popped up and this year a new art gallery. There's a variety of hotel options and eateries. Best part, if your hotel is here you can easily and safely walk to it all.

The beach is really what drew us hear and one of the many reasons we come back. Every morning the beach is cleaned. The waves are small and great for children, you can get into the water pretty far and still be able to have your head above water.

There's a great cement board walk along the water to get into the main part of town.

445943720.name: Favorite Neighborhood
445943720.author: a TripAdvisor user
445943720.reviewBody: Even if we are staying on La Ropa we always spend a lot of time in this neighborhood.\nLot\'s of good restaurants on Calle Adelita. Our favorite place to pick up a few groceries without having to make a trip to Commercial Mexicana. The little Mini Super, La Rana has a great selection of almost everything we might need. If they don\'t have it Amanda will get it for you and also offered to delivery wine to our hotel on La Ropa.  Prices st her market are better than the tienda we sometimes shop at on La Ropa beach.\nSome good choices of hotels and condos in the area. Close to the downtown area of Zih. The beach is smaller than La Ropa. More locals and Mexican Nationals than tourist on the beach...more authentic. Some very nice residential homes also.

443635661.name: Stayed at a hotel here - would not go in this water
443635661.author: a TripAdvisor user
443635661.reviewBody: Lots of dogs in the water.  Just seems really dirty.  Won\'t stay by this beach again. Good place to walk along with nice sidewalk.

406705463.name: Great Local Feel
406705463.author: a TripAdvisor user
406705463.reviewBody: In the heart of Zihuatanejo is quiet Colonia la Madera where you will find some of the best restaurants in Zihua!

360212018.name: Best local neighborhood
360212018.author: a TripAdvisor user
360212018.reviewBody: We stayed in this area for our vacation. There were good local hotels, restaurants, and shops nearby. The beach was nice and the water warm with with gentle waves. We\'ll definitely stay here again.

345384655.name: our neighbourhood for the week
345384655.author: a TripAdvisor user
345384655.reviewBody: So many restaurants to choose from, however it would be a shame not to walk across the canal and also discover what Zihuatanejo centro has to offer.  As our hotel was in the neighbourhood, we ate 3 dinners & 2 breakfasts there.

344848997.name: Perfect base camp
344848997.author: a TripAdvisor user
344848997.reviewBody: Many locally owned small hotels, a few low key condo blocks and many great restaurants in this neighbourhood mixed with nice local houses.  Leafy green and fantastic views along the hillfront above the bay.  Walking distance to Playa la Ropa and Zihua Central (with a few hills).  My destination of choice.

341189679.name: My favorite neighborhood in Zihuatanejo
341189679.author: a TripAdvisor user
341189679.reviewBody: While my wife and I stayed on La Ropa during or most recent visit we missed our favorite neighborhood, Colonia La Madera, .  While staying on the beach was fun we had to go and visit our friends at Hotel Irma and our favorite restaurants along Adelita street.

339285599.name: Pleasant place
339285599.author: a TripAdvisor user
339285599.reviewBody: That is exactly what is Mexican vacation to me. Spanish style buildings, lots of flowers, small boutique style hotels on a hill overlooking a beautiful bay. Reminds me of Amalfi coast.\nIf you want a real taste of Zihua that an area to stay.

333342264.name: Love This Neighood
333342264.author: a TripAdvisor user
333342264.reviewBody: Stayed in this area on the beach for a week and loved it. Clean neighborhood, friendly people and lots of great restaurants.

324576198.name: This area is one of the best to stay and eat in my view
324576198.author: a TripAdvisor user
324576198.reviewBody: Just love this area...Small hotels more authentic than the big all-inclusive in Ixtapa and a few Inns and a boutique hotel in the area and some of the best restaurants of Zihua are located in this area mostly on Calle Adelita...

269684346.name: Unique dining experience
269684346.author: a TripAdvisor user
269684346.reviewBody: Fabulous menu, great prices, wonderful staff.  Meals prepared table side...wonderful view. Room for dancing. just a few steps from Casa Sandbar

252151524.name: Restaurant Row
252151524.author: a TripAdvisor user
252151524.reviewBody: We loved staying up on top of the hill then walking down to any of the small family run restaurants running parallel to the canal.  Isabels is here, where you can pick up a variety of freshly squeezed juices.  Rufo\'s was our main place to dine here mainly because of the quiet Mex music & subtle ambience.  All the others looked appealing too - next time!

250834128.name: Love This Neighberhood
250834128.author: a TripAdvisor user
250834128.reviewBody: I come to Zihuatanejo at least once a year, I\'ve stayed at a few hotels, but I always stay in Colonia La Madera. It\'s such a fantastic neighborhood with hotels ranging in various price ranges (but mostly affordable), lots of cute restaurants and a great beach used by locals, expats and a few tourists. The streets are safe, walkable and full of friendly locals. Easy walk to the town center where it\'s a little grittier and busier.

238918069.name: La Madera neighborhood. brief description
238918069.author: a TripAdvisor user
238918069.reviewBody: Traditional area on a hill with climbing brick style streets and various access steps down to the beach, has smaller facilities and bungalows on the ocean front row, most with stairs rather than elevators, with magnificent open ocean views to the bay. The sun rises and sets behind the hills around.  A bit difficult unless dirving for the impared, here is a highly enjoyable ocean walk trail. When you choose your accomodation i can highly reccomend larger terraces rooms even it they are a bit more expensive you may end up living in it most of your stay.  Plenty choices for coner stores, great for snaks all along Adelita st. restaurants and beach coctails one block away at the most.  All residents are tourism friendly almost everyone speaks english and are happy to give directions.  I spend a month on winters there and love the athmosphere.   I stayed at the first place on the hill, called "a room with a view",  my last great found, clean and spacious, there is everything i need for a month\u00b4s stay away.   Locals swimm in this beach and net fish by the evenings,  but tourist prefer La Ropa beach, even though it is the same it has more development and infraestructure it turns out more expensive for same things and items compared.   You  will enjoy the most and find the perfect spot here when you are prepared for things to happen in mexican time.

223724396.name: Surf With The Locals
223724396.author: a TripAdvisor user
223724396.reviewBody: a dark sandy beach , walking trail along the bay from the Village..nice little restaurants, surfing possible, rolling waves for the kids......FUN\nExcellent restaurant "RUFO\'s" on the way from the Colonia Madera, open evening with live music! Even the Boss plays the guitar!

197961846.name: Authentic
197961846.author: a TripAdvisor user
197961846.reviewBody: Small area across the canal from downtown Zihua.  Adelita is lined with family restaurants and we did not sample one we would say to avoid.   Many attractive smaller hotels in the area as well. The streets are well kept and clean. No shops  that is the preserve of downtown.  Madera beach is  not  as nice as La Ropa and I would not advise swimming there.  5 min walk from downtown and all it has to offer.

197394296.name: Gourmet Ghetto
197394296.author: a TripAdvisor user
197394296.reviewBody: The La Madera neighborhood, and the restaurants on Calle Adelita, are some of the very best!! All types of dining are available, so you will be able to find something you like within 3 or 4 blocks. This is definitely our favorite street for dining!!

197265335.name: Very nice neighborhood.
197265335.author: a TripAdvisor user
197265335.reviewBody: We enjoy staying and spending a lot of time in this neighborhood.  The new streets make it easy to navigate, especially in the evening.  Well lit, neat and really pretty with some of the nicest restaurants in town.  The owners of the restaurants become your friends when you see them everyday and some of them have very nice plants which they maintain on Adelita.\nThe beach is very nice, never overcrowded, lots of families with children having fun.  The view of the bay is outstanding.  Can\'t say enough about this pleasant peaceful area of Zihua.

159686902.name: I live fulltime in Colonia La Madera
159686902.author: a TripAdvisor user
159686902.reviewBody: This area is right next to the downtown area (El Centro) which means it has some noise with fire trucks and a loud bus now and then.  But the trade off is the great easy shopping by walking to the dozens of small markets having only the \'freshest\' of produce and fish and other meats. One special treat is Adelita street, AKA "gourmet alley" because it has a dozen small family operated restaurants with great food at very low prices.  If you come to Zihuatanejo be sure to dine on Adelita street.

155368424.name: cute
155368424.author: a TripAdvisor user
155368424.reviewBody: Nice area of Zihua. Many long stay  N Americans. Inexpensive but very nice hotels and lodgings. Cute restaurants. Easy walk into townfor shopping and the bank.  Madera beach OK but not the best around. Can be very noisy area at night if there are concerts in central Zihua

154568604.name: La Madera Improvements
154568604.author: a TripAdvisor user
154568604.reviewBody: We did not make it down to Zihua in 2012, so we missed all of the new street improvements in this neighborhood. The neighborhood looks Great, and it\'s never looked better. My wife and I have stayed in this area for the past 7 years, and it\'s never looked better. It helps that most of our favorite restaurants are located here.

150961404.name: great neighborhood, fun beach, and swimmable water
150961404.author: a TripAdvisor user
150961404.reviewBody: We\'ve stayed in this neighborhood five times and don\'t want to go anywhere else. On the upper road, there are hotels and condos, a little grocery store that has pretty much everything but meat and fish. The town is a five minute walk, either by the beach walkway or down the very steep road and over a small bridge. The lower road is very short but has at least 7 restaurants (one very fancy, Gulas; the others mid range) also Isabella\'s freshly squeezed orange and grapefruit juice. The beach is great, cleaned every morning. It\'s much shorter than La Ropa but has more of a family feel, locals playing with soccer balls, kites, etc. There are only 4 restaurants on the beach: the special dinner Brisas del Mar, and 3 places you can have a table for the whole day as long as you order lunch or a drink. The swimming is safe; usually there aren\'t huge waves but still body surfing is good too.

145609760.name: Nice warm neighbourhood
145609760.author: a TripAdvisor user
145609760.reviewBody: A real family atmosphere.  Lots of wonderful restaurants and all will welcome you warmly.  Amazing food at great prices.  Great accommodations in a very convenient location.

124457302.name: Madera - swim, surf, sail
124457302.author: a TripAdvisor user
124457302.reviewBody:
Colonia Madera has two beaches - Playa Madera (several hundred metres long) is perfect for swimming, body surfing, and sometimes surfing when the waves are higher. It has gentle slope out so is ideal for children. Rent boogie boards, floats or a banana boat ride from the activity stand.

Along the seawalk towards town, there is a smaller beach, Playa Almeja (Clam Beach) which is also ideal for children.  Roberto keeps his dinghy sailboat on the beach to rent and you can usually find him in the palapa below Casa Loma Bonita.  He is the best surfing teacher!   

I've been six years in a row - the water is perfect, the views stunning, and the people like family.       http://www.zihuatanejo.net/beaches.html

121642378.name: Wonderful people!!
121642378.author: a TripAdvisor user
121642378.reviewBody: Col. La Madera is not only the beach but also the surrounding neighborhood. The people are so caring and kind on this street. I have lived in Zihuatanejo for years and even though I do not live in this neighborhood it holds a special place in my heart.

3475144.name: Best beach cafe on Playa Madera
3475144.author: a TripAdvisor user
3475144.reviewBody: M. J.& Richies on Madera Beach has a wonderful staff, excellent food, comfortable lounges under real palapas on the most peaceful beach in Zihuatanejo. While a small beach of about 400 yards it is the best for children due to the long slope of the beach with no severe drop off. It is also very popular with the local youths often playing soccer on the beach. It is never over crowded unlike La Ropa & a great place to mingle with world wide tourists as well as locals.\n

493022574.name: Incredible Gallery, exceptional art at reasonable prices!
493022574.author: a TripAdvisor user
493022574.reviewBody: Must see gallery.  Work by Exceptional Artist Sauzo, Zihuatanejo seascapes & landscapes He also represents other artists whose work is available in the gallery.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Cuauhtemoc #16 Col. Centro

346642395.name: Up and Coming artist
346642395.author: a TripAdvisor user
346642395.reviewBody: We always stop at this gallery, as we may get lucky and find the artist on site working at a painting.  We have admired his work for several years, especially his paintings of coconut trees and those with children or fishing boats.  His wife is charming and speaks English.  He displays other artists, but his work is always what draws us in.  We know we should purchase soon, before he becomes famous.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Cuauhtemoc #16 Col. Centro

612974382.name: SUGGESTIVA
612974382.author: a TripAdvisor user
612974382.reviewBody: Anche se in centro di Zihua \u00e8 ricca di fascino. Una bella chiesa frequentata costantemente sia dai locali che dai turisti.

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia de Santa Maria de Guadalupe

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de Mayo Col. Centro

488184458.name: Moderna y peque\u00f1a Iglesia
488184458.author: a TripAdvisor user
488184458.reviewBody:
Moderna y pequeña Iglesia que se ubica en el centro de Zihuatanejo, desde el aspecto arquitectónico y artístico No causa interés para visitarla.

La fachada luce sin ornamentación en la cual destaca la Cruz ubicada al centro y en el punto de mayor altura.

En la calle 5 de mayo  puedes adquirir souvenirs y artesanías, también existen restaurantes.

Disfruta de Zihuatanejo. ¡La VIDA...es un VIAJE!

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia de Santa Maria de Guadalupe

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de Mayo Col. Centro

404633412.name: Un Lindo Templo
404633412.author: a TripAdvisor user
404633412.reviewBody: Ubicado estrategicamente en el centro de de Zihuatanejo, es un lindo lugar para visitar y dedicarle un par de minutos al culto y dar gracias a Dios por tu viaje si es que estas de paso o vacaciones.

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia de Santa Maria de Guadalupe

address.streetAddress: Av. 5 de Mayo Col. Centro

131493772.name: great natural cove
131493772.author: a TripAdvisor user
131493772.reviewBody: the tranquility of the cove and clear water make this one of the best experiences in the Bay

address.streetAddress: Paseo de La Mantarraya

128433575.name: Nice beach, not easy to get to.
128433575.author: a TripAdvisor user
128433575.reviewBody: You have to arrive by boat or walk threw a long tricky path in order to get to this small beach. It is rocky, if you have seen all the other beaches in Zihua it is worth your while to check this one out.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de La Mantarraya

124320146.name: Nice snorkeling a bit away from the other tourists
124320146.author: a TripAdvisor user
124320146.reviewBody:
We had very nice snorkeling by ourselves on this rocky beach. We saw two octopus, many moray eels, several buffer fish, and a small school of juvenile African pompanos.

It is a bit of a hassle to find and the boats in the dock charges way too much. It is a nice 45 minute walk from town center. 

Cross the bridge from the dock, take to the left and walk to some old gas station. From the gas station there are some steep stairs. Walk them and when you reach the next road take to the left again. Follow the road and next to Monte Christo hotel gate is the entrance. A path, 10 minutes or so, down to the beach. If you don't find the entrance you can ask the guys at a nice fish restaurant called Leo. The restaurant had very good food by the way.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de La Mantarraya

654772109.name: Small and inexpensive
654772109.author: a TripAdvisor user
654772109.reviewBody: Located near the beach in downtown Zihuatanejo. It is a small museum with six small rooms with a limited number of items in each. All descriptions are in Spanish but they will give you an English handout to follow. Entry fee is only 10 pesos. This place is of interest to people who have strong interest in archeological finds. But not for people with only a casual interest

itemReviewed.name: Archaeological Museum of the Great Coast

address.streetAddress: Plaza Olaf Palme Paseo del Pescador

654161680.name: A great collection right on the malecon!
654161680.author: a TripAdvisor user
654161680.reviewBody: We stumbled across this museum. We\'ve passed by many many times but went in finally. from the website: "Six exhibit rooms utensils, ceramics and weapons of the Olmec, Teotihuacan, Tarascan and Mexica, and visit is a great way to take a break from the sun."\nThere was a very friendly and knowledgeable gentleman working there. He explained many things to us. Well worth the visit. It was free but we made a donation. Check it out!

itemReviewed.name: Archaeological Museum of the Great Coast

address.streetAddress: Plaza Olaf Palme Paseo del Pescador

627059261.name: This was a nice surprise
627059261.author: a TripAdvisor user
627059261.reviewBody: We were the only ones there. It was a long trip from Zihua, but if you like history and ancient culture up close and unfiltered it was a worthy side trip. Good place to buy hand rolled cigars from the locals

itemReviewed.name: Archaeological Museum of the Great Coast

address.streetAddress: Plaza Olaf Palme Paseo del Pescador

544089264.name: Very educational small museum and gallery
544089264.author: a TripAdvisor user
544089264.reviewBody: We really enjoyed our short visit to this little museum and gallery. Though most signs are in Spanish, with the TripLingo app we were able to translate literally every sign or item description. Donations only, brochures available in English. Worth a stop if you\'re in town to learn more about Zihua!

itemReviewed.name: Archaeological Museum of the Great Coast

address.streetAddress: Plaza Olaf Palme Paseo del Pescador

471211262.name: A nice history
471211262.author: a TripAdvisor user
471211262.reviewBody: As written, it\'s small, and the placards are in Spanish, which the guide said they\'re working on, and you do get a handout in English. Some nice artifacts showing the history and settlement up to and part of the Spanish colonization. Worth a small donation and visit while you\'re in the area

itemReviewed.name: Archaeological Museum of the Great Coast

address.streetAddress: Plaza Olaf Palme Paseo del Pescador

471178512.name: Good to have a little history
471178512.author: a TripAdvisor user
471178512.reviewBody: As previous reviewer said it is small 6 rooms and they do give you a pamphlet however there really is not enough information for a self guided tour. You get the gist of what was going on during the time frames but it is not enough detail for me. There was a French tour guide with his group and although I do not speak much French the insights they were getting were much more than we got. So there you have it. It is by donation so if is well worth the time to visit there.

itemReviewed.name: Archaeological Museum of the Great Coast

address.streetAddress: Plaza Olaf Palme Paseo del Pescador

468196892.name: attractively presented little museum
468196892.author: a TripAdvisor user
468196892.reviewBody: IT is only 6 rooms but very interesting to see.  Glad we went in. nicely illustrated with murals.  It is in spanish but they give you an english translation pamphlet

itemReviewed.name: Archaeological Museum of the Great Coast

address.streetAddress: Plaza Olaf Palme Paseo del Pescador

389540361.name: Small museum with interesting local artifacts and knowledgable guides
389540361.author: a TripAdvisor user
389540361.reviewBody: Although it consists of only six rooms, this small museum contains a number of interesting local artifacts dating back to several centuries prior to Spanish arrival. It also provides some welcome cultural respite from the manic pace of the tourist shops and restaurants that surround it. The guides who work there are all knowledgeable and quite happy to talk about anything in the museum, as well as the area\'s past, more generally. \n\nThe entire visit will likely take under an hour and in my opinion, that was all time well spent.

itemReviewed.name: Archaeological Museum of the Great Coast

address.streetAddress: Plaza Olaf Palme Paseo del Pescador

362757560.name: Worth a look
362757560.author: a TripAdvisor user
362757560.reviewBody: Don\'t let the name fool you. The building itself is the museum piece. There are many interesting displays and even some odd ball items thrown in, like a whale vertabrae and an ancient movie projector. Lots of ancient artifacts to see in rooms off a beautiful courtyard. And steps off the beach. No fee, donations only.

itemReviewed.name: Archaeological Museum of the Great Coast

address.streetAddress: Plaza Olaf Palme Paseo del Pescador

357938294.name: Loved it!
357938294.author: a TripAdvisor user
357938294.reviewBody: Recent visit to Zihuatanejo, Mexico and I stopped into the six rooms of this local museum on one side of the pescadero avenue by the Municipal Beach.  A small donation of your choice is the entrance fee.  Note that all of the writing explaining what is in the rooms is in Spanish only.  I enjoyed this stop to experience artifacts of a different time and culture, and was able to adequately tour the museum in 30 minutes.

660578220.author: a TripAdvisor user
660578220.reviewBody: Just an amazing area, shopping, culture, people watching! The area has everything you could want, Pescado, produce, butcher, you name it! \n\nLoved it!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Mangos 10

131493424.name: Zihuatanejo Beach Retreat on the "King\'s Reef"
131493424.author: a TripAdvisor user
131493424.reviewBody: The legendary "King\'s Reef" spans the entire face of Las Gatas Beach -- a quater mile long palm-lined crescent of golden sand that is accessible only by a one-mile boatride from the village pier in Zihuatanejo, Thanks to the reef,  Las Gatas Beach is Zihuatanejo\'s most popular daytime excursion.  On its seaward side, the reef offers snorkelers and SCUBA divers a natural aquarium that teems with beautiful fish.  It also offers surfers one of the best point breaks in the tropical Pacific.   \n\nThe leeward side of the reef offers a reef-protected swimming lagoon that is perfect for children and older people.  Las Gatas Beach also boasts twelve of the best seafood restaurants in the entire bay, plus a dozen rustic, seaside bungalows called the Zihuatanejo Beach Retreat. The New York Times called it "a slice of pure Joseph Conrad." The Los Angeles Times said, "it\'s  too good to last." The retreat is ideal for groups and family reunions up to twenty.

612973915.name: NON MOLTO GRANDE
612973915.author: a TripAdvisor user
612973915.reviewBody: Spiaggetta incantevole, non facile da raggiungere ma con un p\u00f2 di volont\u00e0 e chiedendo qu\u00ec e la` la troverete e non ne sarete pentiti.

229434765.name: Un bel arr\u00eat pour voir la faune locale
229434765.author: a TripAdvisor user
229434765.reviewBody: Comme la marina a envahi leur habitat naturel et afin de pr\u00e9server la s\u00e9curit\u00e9 des habitants et touristes, les crocodiles les plus gros ont \u00e9t\u00e9 relocalis\u00e9 dans un enclos avec h\u00e9rons, iguanes, tortues. Un bel espace emm\u00e9nager \u00e0 voir. \n\nNous nous y sommes arr\u00eater en allant \u00e0 Ixtapa Island faire de la plong\u00e9e.

657286610.name: Cool!
657286610.author: a TripAdvisor user
657286610.reviewBody: The statue is old and slowly getting damaged, but it\u2019s still a cool quick activity to do while in Playa las Gatas. The best part is the coral and the amount of colorful fish swimming around. You can have a local guide you to it (with the snorkel gear, $150 pesos per person as of January 2019). I really enjoyed it.

471181147.reviewBody: We rented snorkel gear on the beach for 300$N and set out to find the King of Kings. It was easy to locate because of the floats on top of the water. The rope helps with descending. There are lots of fish and sea urchins there and the coral is making a comeback.

458116558.name: Jesus is in the water
458116558.author: a TripAdvisor user
458116558.reviewBody: The water is full of fish. Mostly clear, no coral. go in off the pier or wear water shoes. Rocks are covered with sea urchins.

itemReviewed.name: El Rey de Reyes (King of Kings)

454831056.name: Worth it!
454831056.author: a TripAdvisor user
454831056.reviewBody:
This is a pretty awesome feature of Las Gatas beach. This Jesus statue is just outside of the usual swimming/snorkel area. There is/used to be a buoy attached to it to help you find it.

Now you can usually just find tour groups hovering around it with their paddle board. Swim down and with good enough clarity, you can see a glimpse of the statue. I went as deep as shoulder height when my ears started to hurt and I was out of breath.

Not for weak swimmers. Ask local guides for help finding it.

We just rented a boogie board, had our own snorkeling gear and the lady pointed out to where the statue was. easy to spot, as tons of tours in that area, has a 2 rope attached to buoy and you can pull yourself down to look at it but many many people there doing same thing.

362756357.name: Busy spot
362756357.author: a TripAdvisor user
362756357.reviewBody: I was there during Mexicsn vacation time and everything was very busy! You can pay the beach hucksters 50 pesos to take you out-they load a bunch of people together hanging on to a surf board and swim them out together. Or you can ask anyone where Jesus is-there is generally a boat or two hanging out there to mark the spot-and swim/snorkel out yourself, its very close and right at the tip of the reef. It\'s kind of creepy when all of a sudden you see Jesus looking up at you with his arms stretched out as if to welcome you! Very interesting though, not something you see every day!

This is normally a free visit, but do to the Easter Holiday, some enterprising Mexicans decided to charge 100 pesos per person with snorkel gear and life jackets included.  Statue has a rope attached so once on location, you can pull yourself down the 8 feet or so to reach Jesus.  Quite an enlightening sight?

676333513.name: INCREDIBLE BEACH!
676333513.author: a TripAdvisor user
676333513.reviewBody: Playa la Ropa is the Mexican beach of your dreams. An easy walk from central Zihua, wide, clean, and a smooth beach bottom for your tootsies! There are plenty of places to eat, or just lay out your own towel and do nothing but relax. Even on a crowded day, there is plenty of room for everyone to have their own piece of paradise.

673221827.name: Playa la Ropa
673221827.author: a TripAdvisor user
673221827.reviewBody: Great beach and lots of great restaurants \nWe stayed at Embarc right on the beach and if you are visiting Zihuatanejo this is the nicest part to go

670665468.name: Great beach
670665468.author: a TripAdvisor user
670665468.reviewBody: This is a great beach. Nice smooth sand, a variety of beach restaurants, and some body surfing when the tide is right.

668853992.name: Beautiful beach
668853992.author: a TripAdvisor user
668853992.reviewBody: We are staying at Madera beach and decided to walk to la ropa beach.it was a nice walk up the hill took us 20 minutes to get there.there are combies from centro to get there.the beach is wide, very clean and lined up with all sorts of restaurants , there are all kinds of of activities as well.at end of la ropa there is a small path that leads to Las gatas.i recommend la ropa to families with kids.

668189039.name: Beach around the corner from our hotel
668189039.author: a TripAdvisor user
668189039.reviewBody: Lots of eating options, local massage facilities and a ton of water activities. The ocean is pretty calm until the late afternoon till the surf comes up. Lots of things to do and eat.

666383515.name: Calm beach
666383515.author: a TripAdvisor user
666383515.reviewBody: Calm beach bring your own chair.  close to lots of shopping and restaurants.. you can rent a fishing boat here also

666032084.name: Relax Relax
666032084.author: a TripAdvisor user
666032084.reviewBody: Wonderful spot to just relax. Good restaurants and fun vendors. Ok for snorkeling. Beautiful view of hillside village

664575725.name: Beautiful
664575725.author: a TripAdvisor user
664575725.reviewBody: We loved this beach it had some spectacular scenery. Lots to do and lots of lil shops and restaurants. Was super busy on the weekend with locals and people but would recommend a stop here.

663325276.name: Fantastic Beach
663325276.author: a TripAdvisor user
663325276.reviewBody:
This beach was a short walk from our Hotel Irma, try and know where you want to sit cause they all try and get you at thier restaurant . 
Middle is fine.
Spent a day swimming , eating, yes had a few drinks, and enjoyed.
Took bus back to Irma they are way on the south end, 20 some pesos.

663322700.name: Nice beach
663322700.author: a TripAdvisor user
663322700.reviewBody: We stayed at Las Casitas for 2 nights which was an excellent accommodation. Short walk to Playa la Ropa. This is a beautiful beach with mellow surf this time of year. The massages on the beach were out of this world and cheap (200 pesos). My only complaint about this area is that very few restaurants accept credit cards. Most are pesos only and there are no ATMs in this area at all. We travel in Mexico a lot and this was not typical in our experience. Restaurants charge close to double what you will pay in Zihuatanejo proper.

662571471.name: Nice, walkable
662571471.author: a TripAdvisor user
662571471.reviewBody: Playa la Ropa is a nice, walkable beach with soft sand.  It is not very busy during the week, but many families enjoy the beach on the weekend.  There are many restaurants and activities.  There are taxis conveniently located to make it back to town or your hotel.

662135600.name: Good food, massages and a beautiful beach!
662135600.author: a TripAdvisor user
662135600.reviewBody: You must visit this beach! Lots of activities, good food and a great place to swim in the ocean without worrying about the waves or the undertow. Lots of places offer free loungers in exchange for the purchase of a drink or some food. Stop by Rossy\'s for some good homemade food, you won\'t be dissapointed!

660032491.name: Fantastic beach
660032491.author: a TripAdvisor user
660032491.reviewBody: Stayed here many times.  A fabulous place to visit.  Great restaurants and affordable accommodations if you look.

659748030.name: Always great!
659748030.author: a TripAdvisor user
659748030.reviewBody: I love this beach. It\u2019s not too long but it\u2019s always a pleasure to walk it.\nLaRopa is a beautiful place.\nSit, relax and enjoy the fantastic Mexican weather!

659606028.name: Playa la ropa
659606028.author: a TripAdvisor user
