351180399.name: can\'t get enough of this lovely Beach
351180399.author: a TripAdvisor user
351180399.reviewBody: Sat on this beach most days it was lovely.  Can\'t wait to go back All the little beachfront diners and warm sand make it a welcome place to go

351136467.name: Best Beach in Zihua!
351136467.author: a TripAdvisor user
351136467.reviewBody: We stayed at Villa Mexicana which is a quaint hotel right on Playa la Ropa. Beach is fantastic. No undertow. Warm water. Lots of sea life such as skates, rays, turtles, & variety of fish.

351033432.name: Beautiful beach
351033432.author: a TripAdvisor user
351033432.reviewBody: Because the beach is located in a bay, the waves are not as high or strong as the ones in Ixtapa.  The people are very friendly.  All the little restaurants have typical Mexican food, and welcome their customers.   Golda M.

350922626.name: Best beach in the area, better than Ixtapa.
350922626.author: a TripAdvisor user
350922626.reviewBody: The sand is great, There are great places to get a drink or eat right on the beach. the water is seldom rough. Parasailing, seadoo\'s and other water sports are available also.\nBest of all, is the beach is never busy.

350676734.name: A Great Day at the Beach or Two or Three
350676734.author: a TripAdvisor user
350676734.reviewBody: We had a seven day vacation in Zihuatanejo in Februrary of which we spent 4 days on Playa La Ropa. A great place to spend the day with plenty to do and eat and see.

350401312.name: Best Beach
350401312.author: a TripAdvisor user
350401312.reviewBody: You\'ll be hard pressed to find a prettier beach. It\'s my favorite.  It\'s very clean, not rocky, and great snorkeling.

350354889.name: Stayed at Club Intrawest, Zihuatanejo for second time. Loved beach, accessible to all yet not overcrowded, good swimming
350354889.author: a TripAdvisor user
350354889.reviewBody: Beach is accessible to public, not ususal bubble, yet kept well and clean, good swimming and snorkeling right off the beach in front of hotel. Kayaking to town and town inlet.  Beautiful sunsets.

350285865.name: Rays playing in the surf
350285865.author: a TripAdvisor user
350285865.reviewBody: Pretty beach about 3/4 mile long with many reasonable food options (although the food in town is better). Many birds and mantra rays seem to like out too. We saw some rays playing in the waves (probably feeding but it looks like play).

350264016.name: Don\'\'t Come, please!
350264016.author: a TripAdvisor user
350264016.reviewBody: We travel extensively and we\'ve been to beaches in Europe, Australia, the Caribbean, Mexico, all of the US, Indonesia, Hawaii, the Middle East and Central America.  I\'m not prepared to say this is the best beach in the world.  But, it is in the top 10 without question.  Zihua Bay is very protected; Playa la Ropa is a wide beach, with many amenities and basically nothing to do except be at the beach.  Easy to walk, wonderful to swim in, magnificent sunsets...this is a beach!

349947077.name: Nice enough beach
349947077.author: a TripAdvisor user
349947077.reviewBody: People rave about this beach Yes it is nice and yes it is close but in my view I really do not see the need to pay 100 pecos to go sit on a beach to rent a lawn chair I would do a walk threw but sorry can not wrap my head around paying to sit on a public beach

349422849.name: BEAUTIFUL Hotel on PLAYA LA ROPA.
349422849.author: a TripAdvisor user
349422849.reviewBody: BEAUTIFUL HOTEL.....GREAT STAFF.....GREAT BREAKFAST.....Thanks to El Nino water was like bath water. For a relaxing vacation this is the Place.

349293172.name: Beautiful beach!
349293172.author: a TripAdvisor user
349293172.reviewBody: Have been down to la ropa twice, and it\'s fantastic. The little beach restaurants are a great place to order a cheap beer while you leave your stuff at the tables and go for a swim! Lots of free options on the beach like volleyball at 11 and 4.. As well as parasailing, jet skiing, boat trips... The sky is the limit.

348868507.name: Love La Ropa
348868507.author: a TripAdvisor user
348868507.reviewBody: Best beach on the bay in Zihua! A long stretch of soft sand to a walk on, shallow water for a ways out, warm after to swim in, plenty of places to eat. A delightful place to spend the day!

348622319.name: My favorite beach in Mexico!
348622319.author: a TripAdvisor user
348622319.reviewBody: I love it here.  The water is really warm and the beach is beautiful and clean.  there are a lot of restaurants that have chairs on the beach.  Our hotel was on the beach so we just lounged all day or spent time riding the waves.  You can take a really nice walk up the beach.  I saw sting rays and even an eel.  There are Pelicans diving for fish and terns.

348311582.name: Playa Ropa Beach
348311582.author: a TripAdvisor user
348311582.reviewBody: We loved this beach.  Sloping sand beach with warm water.  The waves got a little tall on our last day but still the best the best beach in town!

348268730.name: Great family vacation spot.
348268730.author: a TripAdvisor user
348268730.reviewBody: Excellent 3/4-mile beach.  Good beach side restaurants to choose from including several that rent out lounge chairs and umbrellas for a day at the beach.  Water sports available--jet ski, parasailing, banana boat, etc.  Gentle wave break is good for smaller kids.

348033630.name: A Slice of Heaven
348033630.author: a TripAdvisor user
348033630.reviewBody: I\'ve been coming here for 17 years....wow! \n \nSince there haven\'t been cruise ships coming into the bay for the last 2 years the water is cleaner and becoming the turquoise I remember from years past. Beautiful!

348033223.name: Best beach
348033223.author: a TripAdvisor user
348033223.reviewBody:
We love the beach at la ropa! 
And having happy hour at Paty's
And watching the sun set priceless!
You can have massages anywhere along the beach but we found a place named Daisy behind the restaurant Pirate that does a great job, friendly, clean and not to much oil so you feel very good when you leave.

347768797.name: We Love Zihuatenejo
347768797.author: a TripAdvisor user
347768797.reviewBody: A busy beach with accommodations for every budget. Lots of restaurants on the beach which have good food. Yoga is available along with basic massage services. Incredibly beautiful sunsets. Water that is warm and not to rough for swimming. We\'ve been returning for 20 years. Need I say more!

347759670.name: A fun day
347759670.author: a TripAdvisor user
347759670.reviewBody: We love walking LaRopa and hanging out for the day here.  We usually eat at Rosy\'s which has good food and an upstairs for a great view and breeze.  The beach is great for swimming and walking.  There are PERFECT sunsets here so plan on staying for a drink at LaPerla for sunset under a palm tree.  Most places will charge you $5 for chairs and umbrella for the day so bring your own if you don\'t want to pay.

347685804.name: Beautiful beach, local restaurant owners are too pushy
347685804.author: a TripAdvisor user
347685804.reviewBody: It was hard to enjoy with every restaurant wanting our business, with that in your face sales. We didn\'t stay long due to the locals being so pushy, which was ashamed as its one of the best beaches to swim at.

347586479.name: The best in Zihuatanejo -Ixtapa
347586479.author: a TripAdvisor user
347586479.reviewBody: A beautiful enclosed bay- great beach and restaurants- awesome sunset-ocean you can safely swim in\nPerfect weather for a "day in paradise"

347362247.name: One of the best beaches ever!
347362247.author: a TripAdvisor user
347362247.reviewBody: We have been to many beaches on the west coast, FL, TX, HI, Costa Rica and most of the Carribean islands and this one is practically flawless.   It is long,  easily accessible by everyone but not crowded and has a very relaxed vibe.  The water is delightfully perfectly warm and the bottom is consistently firm sand, very minimal rocks/shells, no stink, no litter, no foam or seaweed and waves not too strong for waders and swimmers.    The vendors,  tho many,  are friendly,  not pushy and their wares are actually quite interesting.   We stayed at Club Intrawest and had a delightful time.   My husband won\'t do pools or beaches unless the situation is just right and he says he would return here in a heartbeat\ud83d\udc95

347345497.name: Beautiful white sandy beach
347345497.author: a TripAdvisor user
347345497.reviewBody: We loved going to this beach.  Renting chairs and being served marquaritas and nachos in between swims.  The beach is long nough for a good walk and if you are adventuresome there are boats to rent, sails to fly.  The beach is just 15 minute walk from Zihuatenejo but there are many taxis available back and forth.  The water and beach are clean with sand underfoot.  The water is warm and usually pretty calm and lovely to hang out for awhile.  Many gringos here along with some Mexican families.  We liked sitting at La Pearl restaurant, great loungers and good service!

346668395.name: Pretty beach, good for walking
346668395.author: a TripAdvisor user
346668395.reviewBody: It\'s a pretty beach - water is generally bluer than on Playa Madera - but it also feels much more built up and touristy than Playa Madera.  I prefer staying by Playa Madera and walking over to Playa Ropa for a beach walk/swim

346600447.name: Shawshank Redemption
346600447.author: a TripAdvisor user
346600447.reviewBody: Absolutely pristine beach with a mountainous backdrop.  We took a cab there. This is a fun place for the day.  You can rent little boats for a paddle around the canal for bird watching.

346237871.name: Playa La Ropa beach
346237871.author: a TripAdvisor user
346237871.reviewBody: Great beach for beach lovers.  There is no private beach here, accessible to all.  There are concessions for renting umbrellas, chairs, and to receive food service.  100 pesos for the chairs plus what ever food you purchase. As a non swimmer, from the cold Pacific coast I really enjoyed the very warm water and gentle waves.  The only reason I did not give it an excellent rating was the presence of so many wave runners and boats close to the swimming area.  The water and beach are very clean.  As with anyplace, some of the restaurants are better than others.  I would highly recommend this beach.  It is also accessible to the hotels across the bay (which is where we stayed)  by walking.  It is about a 2-3 mile walk.  There are taxi\'s available everywhere in case walking is not your choice.

346023784.name: Great place to relax
346023784.author: a TripAdvisor user
346023784.reviewBody: Great beach, quiet during the week, busy on weekends with locals which added to the interest. Plenty of places for meals, cocktails, beach activities and sunsets. Only downside, things close down early. We were the late diners at 8 p.m.

345982027.name: Great beach on the bay.
345982027.author: a TripAdvisor user
345982027.reviewBody: Many good restaurants, some with rental seats and umbrellas .  The water is wavy but not too many undertows. A great place to lunch and spend the afternoon.  Also a great sundown.

345974314.name: Bird\'s Eye View
345974314.author: a TripAdvisor user
345974314.reviewBody: Lazy beach day under the umbrella at La Perla.  Cost:  100 pesos.  Perfect hang for watching people and walking the beach.  We considered a massage but didn\'t.  However, lots of people came and went with happy smiles while we lazed around.  Decided to parasail instead.  The wind conditions were perfect.  Short trip around the bay but it was beautiful to look down into the clear water and out across the lush mountains.  Love the feeling of weightlessness!  Not for everyone but if you feel a little adventuresome, then try it out!

345914844.name: Great Beach
345914844.author: a TripAdvisor user
345914844.reviewBody: This is a great beach with many restaurants and opportunities for water activities.  The surf on this beach is not rough so a great place to swim.  This is also a great beach for walking.

345888649.name: The Perfect Beach for Adults and Kids.
345888649.author: a TripAdvisor user
345888649.reviewBody:
The circular bay of Zihuatanejo has a south-west facing entrance protected by hills on both sides keeping out most weather.  Consequently, waves at the beach are rarely more than a foot or foot-and-a-half high. The beach front activities range from multiple massage services on the beach, kayak and Hobie Cat rental, beach chair rentals complete with small Palapas, multiple-person "banana boat" towed around the bay, Jet Ski rentals, and water taxis that come right up to the beach.  There are about 8 restaurants along the beach from burgers and beer to a 4-star restaurant for dinners $50-$100 looking out over the bay at beach level.

Paty's (**) on-the-beach at the main entrance is a favorite of ours especially at happy hour and their 2-for-1 deals.   La Perla (***) next to Paty's is our dinner favorite spot.  View is fantastic and some of their specials are ****.

Swimming is easy and the cerveza cold.  It's why we just celebrated our 8th anniversay of visiting Zihuatanejo and Playa la Ropa.

345824024.name: Great beach, great view!
345824024.author: a TripAdvisor user
345824024.reviewBody:
Playa la ropa is an amazing beach with soft sand and low wave action. This place is perfect for families with little kids. There are plenty of restaurants with chairs and umbrellas to use. Some are free to use if you buy food/drink from them, others charge a flat fee for the chairs around $100 pesos (about $6 usd). 

There are several ways to get there, bus ($7 pesos I think from Centro), taxi (depends where you syart) and water taxi from the pier at the port in Zihuatanejo ($40 pesos, you must buy tickets at the office on land). The last bus back to Centro runs at about 7pm, so don't stay too late and miss your cheapest ride back.

Enjoy the sun and the wonderful view of the bay!

345823591.name: Not what we are used to.
345823591.author: a TripAdvisor user
345823591.reviewBody: Coming from Europe and travel in Mediterranean Countries we are used to visit beaches where 2/3 is controlled by hotels. Therefore is quite difficult to get a sun bed and the places not owned by hotels often only have chairs and table you can sit by. Gives another and not very relaxating experience. Which is sad.

345639077.name: Beautiful!
345639077.author: a TripAdvisor user
345639077.reviewBody: Took a day trip to Playa La Ropa. Very very beautiful. Very popular with the locals. Lots of restaurants/bars along the beach.

345383584.name: 6 days of La Ropa is not enough
345383584.author: a TripAdvisor user
345383584.reviewBody: Went here everyday -  quieter end of La Ropa by Patys Marimar and Elviras.\nThe other end is much busier and lively, however there is a lot of boat activity. \nEnjoyed each visit, quiet or lively!

344963911.name: Beautiful beach!
344963911.author: a TripAdvisor user
344963911.reviewBody: Spent several great days on La Ropa tanning, reading and swimming in the ocean. Beautiful wide beach and great sunsets!

344614523.name: Perfect beach!
344614523.author: a TripAdvisor user
344614523.reviewBody: This is the perfect beach for a perfect vacation!!  The sea its really calm and you can swim really tranquil. Awesome place for family, small children and grown ups

344459614.name: Beautiful, Clean Beach!
344459614.author: a TripAdvisor user
344459614.reviewBody: Much to do... sailing, kayaking, paddle board, eat, drink at the many restaurants/clubs on the beach and on the Playa la Ropa road where the sidewalks have improved.

344152892.name: magnificent beach!
344152892.author: a TripAdvisor user
344152892.reviewBody: Several restaurants and bars on an amazing beach! Plenty of great walking beach. Very laid back with no need to dress up. Wonderful place to meet people from all over America and Canada!\n!\n

344004336.name: Awesome
344004336.author: a TripAdvisor user
344004336.reviewBody: Absolutely awesome.   Worth the $100 pesos for a day (at La Perla) to rent a spot.   Warm beautiful water.  Beautiful beach.   Good food, clean bathrooms, safe.  Just lovely.  Probably one of the nicest beaches that we visited while in Ixtapa and Zihuatanejo.

343901892.name: A one month visit
343901892.author: a TripAdvisor user
343901892.reviewBody: My husband, my six yr old and I came to escape the New England winter and found paradise. Im very pleased with the tranquility found here. Great food, lots of foreigns, enough activities to keep us busy.

343882451.name: Relaxing and walking on the beautiful Playa la Ropa Beach
343882451.author: a TripAdvisor user
343882451.reviewBody: A typical morning:  Get up and decide which bathing suit to wear - then head for a lovely 2 KM walk along the Beach before settling for a lovely relaxing Breakfast - my personal favourite of Mexican Clay Pot Eggs simply can\'t be duplicated here in my home town -if for no other reason than that it\'s winter here!  :)  Leaving the beach area one can access small shops, talk with the Mexican people, have a massage, taste a wide variety of local foods and experience the \'real people\' as they go about their daily lives. I felt \'safe\', I felt \'welcome\' and I will certainly return!  We have stayed in the Villa Mexicana on both our recent trips to Mexico - indeed, I\'m starting to feel like \'one of the family\' -  Great food - and many choices of restaurants both on Playa la Ropa and in Zihuatanejo - if your looking for a lovely peaceful get-away - consider this area:)

343669870.name: Lovely beach
343669870.author: a TripAdvisor user
343669870.reviewBody:
Great beach.  Service excellent t.  Ocean warm and safe.  No rocks 

Food reasonable   Service excellent t 

Clean washrooms 

Kind staff & safe beach 

We will be back tomorrow 

Natalie

343201512.name: Beautiful Beach!
343201512.author: a TripAdvisor user
343201512.reviewBody: Playa la Ropa is a beautiful beach with calm water, lots of water activities, and fun places to eat and drink.  This a great place to spend the day!  You will find lots of locals here on Sundays!

343178017.name: Beautiful sand,  warm water,  not crowded, paradise
343178017.author: a TripAdvisor user
343178017.reviewBody: All the beaches in Ixtapa/Zihautanejo were paradise.  I do NOT like cold water.  Even Hawaii is too cool for me.  But this trip the water was warm and clean and clear,  the beaches were not crowded, the people were friendly,  no issue of drug violence at all in the main town areas.  I highly recommend.

342688625.name: Best beach in the Zihua area
342688625.author: a TripAdvisor user
342688625.reviewBody: We were staying in a great villa close to La Ropa and made this our main beach. We would always install ourselves at the little restaurant called  La Perla were they had the most comfy chairs and the best service.

342443159.name: Beautiful beach- best around the bay
342443159.author: a TripAdvisor user
342443159.reviewBody: We love walking along the beach. There are so many different places to eat. Our hotel looks toward the beach and the view as it starts getting dark with the lights coming on and then in the morning when people come out to enjoy the bay.

342411658.name: I hate to recommend this. . .
342411658.author: a TripAdvisor user
342411658.reviewBody: Because it is one of the BEST beaches I have ever been on. With the exception of December it is not crowded. The beach sellers are pleasant, the surf is easy to swim in, the views are amazing. I strongly recommend Humberto who sells Oaxaca string cheese in the beach, Felix who rents sea doos (haggle a little) and Carlos Dive shop on the neighbouring beach Las Gatas. Also on Las Gatas is Olivia\'s restaurant next to Carlos\' run by the owner of Carlis Dive Shop.

342341309.name: Dip, relax, repeat...
342341309.author: a TripAdvisor user
342341309.reviewBody: Amazing all sand beach that is just the right size for a stroll. Many great restaurants and chairs to rent or bring your own.The water is turquoise and around 84 degrees. \nGentle surf makes for a great frolic in the water. It\'s fun to people watch and relax there.

342169836.name: Nice beach to walk along with verry few people selling items.
342169836.author: a TripAdvisor user
342169836.reviewBody: Great place to sit at a restaurant with feet in the sand to watch the sunset. At the south end of the beach is a penned in area where there are crocodiles. Nice beach to snorkel.

341526606.name: Family and friends
341526606.author: a TripAdvisor user
341526606.reviewBody: Love La Ropa beach and La Perla. It\'s tranquil and the service is great! The arracharra tacos are spectacular. There is also a restaurant further down the beach that has a lagoon with crocodiles in it that has great octopus. It\'s just a short walk on the beautiful La Ropa beach. Don\'t forget to parasail. I think we paid $200 pesos and what an experience! You just will never regret doing that.

341525973.name: Crowded and water not that clean
341525973.author: a TripAdvisor user
341525973.reviewBody: We paid for chairs and an umbrella - that\'s seems to be the only way to sit on the beach.  The food was great, service somewhat slow, but the ocean is not clean.

341200090.name: Beautiful!
341200090.author: a TripAdvisor user
341200090.reviewBody: Beautiful, clean, safe, friendly.  Lined with hotels and restaurants.  We ate at one of the restaurants on the beach and it was wonderful.  I can\'t say enough good things about our experience in this piece of paradise.

341005096.name: One of the nicest beaches in the area.
341005096.author: a TripAdvisor user
341005096.reviewBody: The beach is large and and has a nice soft sand. Bring your own chair or rent one at the beach clubs. Chairs fill up by noon so get there early.

340972099.name: Beautiful, Small Beach
340972099.author: a TripAdvisor user
340972099.reviewBody: Playa la Ropa is easily accessed by many hotels and vacation rentals in the area.  Although it is a small beach it has everything you may need.  There are plenty of full-service restaurants, many of which have umbrellas and lounge chairs where you can sit for hours, as long as you eat & drink.  There are a number of activities at the ready - para-sailing, paddle boarding, jet skis, massages on the beach and more.  Be prepared, you will receive numerous requests to buy locally made items from vendors walking up and down the beach.  You may want to take advantage of their wares because they have some interesting items.  Or, if you\'re not interested, a simple "no gracias" will suffice.

340774482.name: Don\'t pay for loungers
340774482.author: a TripAdvisor user
340774482.reviewBody: We found the beach wonderful and figured out if you spend the day at rosssy , or at el pirate restaurant s you have a lounger for the day! La perla. charges  100 peso per person  if you eat or not, so why pay especially for us Canadians  that\'s an extra 20 bucks a a day!    El cheapos that we are,

339124886.name: New Years 2016
339124886.author: a TripAdvisor user
339124886.reviewBody: The beach is really really busy the week of New Years. We will not come for New Years again but once the children are back in school there is hardly anyone on the beach, which is how we like it. The restaurants are great and provide umbrellas and lounge chairs, sometimes for a small fee for the day. Well worth paying for. \n\nThe waves are small so this beach is ideal for all ages. There are lots of activities right from the beach and plenty of buses and taxis within the vicinity.

339035319.name: WARM  & FAIRLY CALM
339035319.author: a TripAdvisor user
339035319.reviewBody: Zihua swelled by 45K people between Christmas and New Years according to the local paper and I think they were all at La Ropa Beach.  The water is very warm and the surf very mild and makes it good to play in (too warm and to much activity for sharks).  It is much calmer than Playa Palmar in Ixtapa and very good for swimming.  It is surprising clean ( no more cruise ships) for past two years. Many umbrellas and lounge chairs to rent for 100 pesos/day

338721261.name: Beautiful beach!
338721261.author: a TripAdvisor user
338721261.reviewBody: Playa la Ropa is a beautiful, long, smooth sand beach.  It is quite busy around Christmas and New Years.  Would love to go back when it is not as busy!

338681257.name: Beautiful beach for walking, good eats available,
338681257.author: a TripAdvisor user
338681257.reviewBody: Walked to La Ropa from Maderia beach, and enjoyed our time on Playa La Ropa. Although beach isn\'t real long, it was long enough to walk a couple of times, and enjoy all it had to offer. Restaurants, and places for drinks are everywhere. When we went it wasn\'t crowded at all, and the drinks were cold, and refreshing. Lots of beach to walk on unlike Playa Las Gatas. We will definitely walk it many times while here! Definitely worth seeing

338444621.name: Beautiful beach
338444621.author: a TripAdvisor user
338444621.reviewBody: Nice beach, and very warm water, with all the sand snorkelling is low visibility but the beaches and swimming was great, worth the trip up the hill for sure

337971414.name: Pretty beach.. Crowded on weekends
337971414.author: a TripAdvisor user
337971414.reviewBody: This is a great beach to relax on in Zihuatanejo. The waves are calm so it\'s really family friendly.  There\'s lots of restaurant options and a great little michealada stand at the end of the beach behind the store.  The down side is you have to pay for a chair if you want to sit down and their are a few vendors walking up and down the beach harassing you. (but they aren\'t too invasive)

337756628.name: Beautiful beach for walking and eating
337756628.author: a TripAdvisor user
337756628.reviewBody: This beach is great to stroll on. It can get crowded on the weekends in the middle of the beach, but there are always more open areas especially on the north end. There are fun restaurants where you can enjoy a meal right on the water. Paty\'s is the best! You can also get a parasail ride or rent water equipment from the beach.

337685192.name: The view everyday!
337685192.author: a TripAdvisor user
337685192.reviewBody: Awesome place - been coming for 15 years! The beach is great and you can walk and run and burn off all of that extra food and drink.

337518038.name: Day on the baech
337518038.author: a TripAdvisor user
337518038.reviewBody: If you have small kids this is an excellent beach to spend a day. Low tide, soft sand and wide beach. 3-4 restaurants along the beach. \nToo many vendors selling stuff though.

336768019.name: Crowded
336768019.author: a TripAdvisor user
336768019.reviewBody: This is a crowded area with lots of restaurants.  We came here three times during our stay.  The water is warm.  It is fun to watch the parasailers and banana boats take off.  We sat twice at Le Perla.  They had internet but the service was pretty slow.

336533521.name: Fantastic Beach !
336533521.author: a TripAdvisor user
336533521.reviewBody: Excellent beach with many great restaurants and watering holes. Love the La Ropa end of the beach where most of the people are Mexican.

336455256.name: Tour
336455256.author: a TripAdvisor user
336455256.reviewBody: Enjoyable walk around and accessible. The people are friendly the food is great with so many different types from Asian to local foods.

335331090.name: Busy beach attraction of over load
335331090.author: a TripAdvisor user
335331090.reviewBody: What fun to walk along the beach to see all manner of activities - paragliding snorkeling massage and great restaurants to eat feet in sand

335330977.name: A beach for everything
335330977.author: a TripAdvisor user
335330977.reviewBody: Just a wonderful family beach with every activity you might every want from dining to para gliding, swimming, sailing or fishing. All is available here.

335216199.name: beautiful
335216199.author: a TripAdvisor user
335216199.reviewBody: this is a nice long beach.  the water is much clearer than other beaches close to town.  Wonderful food at first palapa/restaurant nearest the big rock.

335087178.name: Best family beach anywhere.
335087178.author: a TripAdvisor user
335087178.reviewBody: It very busy this time of year but the sand is good the water is clear and clean and watching the Mexican families enjoy themselves is delightful.

334670377.name: A little bit of "Paradise"!
334670377.author: a TripAdvisor user
334670377.reviewBody: This is our 6 th time here to Club Intrawest and it never fails in being one of the most relaxing and fun places to visit.  The weather has been perfect... The sand and gentle beach  a perfect place to build sand castles for a youngster... As well as to experience the ocean.  Have been to most places on the beach for lunch or dinner... All have more than met our expectation especially if having fish or Mexican fare. And ... The price is right.  There are some good Italian restaurants just outside the gate a short walk away.  As well as many others.  Check trip advisor!!Enjoy ... It is fabulous\ud83c\udf84\ud83c\udf84\ud83c\udf84

334122014.name: Relaxing Birch
334122014.author: a TripAdvisor user
334122014.reviewBody: This birch is sandy, good for swimming and snorkeling . Good for kayaking , boating and fishing.  If you like massage then you have much selections.  Many ocean front hotels to select from, so relax and enjoy.

334076909.name: Great Mexico area
334076909.author: a TripAdvisor user
334076909.reviewBody: Beautiful beach and ocean, lovely people, great weather.  The Villa Mexicana hotel and their staff were delightful.

333782740.name: Two days at the beach
333782740.author: a TripAdvisor user
333782740.reviewBody: Lots to do just have to talk to the locals and make a deal.  We fell in love with the 200 peso 1 hour professional massage.  No kidding.  We thought that was a joke so one off us tried it.  It was like spending $100 back home.  So all of us paid 200 pesos for 1 hour each.  Went back second day for the full body massage.  9 of us would have paid them all day for it.  200 pesos was like 16 Canadians.  Beach is great for food, swimming and other water sports.  Took a tour for snorkelling away from beach as it is not good for snorkelling directly.  Restaurants were very reasonable as we are and drank all day for under 2000 pesos for 9.  Highly advise just relaxing and enjoying the sun.

333629564.name: Nice beach for surfing
333629564.author: a TripAdvisor user
333629564.reviewBody: This is a nice beach to watch the sunset and also get some surfing in.  The waves can get quite big but not so much as Trojcones.  Most days it is great for beginners to intermediate levels.  The beach is nice and long but beware of crocs at the end crossing over from the fresh water swamp into the sea!

333373568.name: Soft Sand
333373568.author: a TripAdvisor user
333373568.reviewBody: Wonderful long beach for walking. Not crowded in Dec. Lots of great restaurants along this coconut palm lined beach. Good for swimming.

333044375.name: Still perfect
333044375.author: a TripAdvisor user
333044375.reviewBody: Mrs. B and I have been staying at the Villa Mexicana and Club Intrawest for 11 years and still enjoy every moment. It is not overdeveloped, in fact none of the buildings are taller than the trees.You can sit or lay on the white sandy beach and forget everything except relaxation. there are many restaurants along the La Ropa Beach and you will mingle with the wonderful people of Zihuatanejo. the ocean is delightfully warm and clean. There are many water activities for every interest, Come, relax, enjoy a trip back in time without the hustle and bustle.

333033610.name: Wonderful area with real local flavor!
333033610.author: a TripAdvisor user
333033610.reviewBody: We keep coming back since it feels like a locals area, not a raucous touristy location like Ixtapa. Families with their children, enjoying a fun day at the beach.

332732607.name: Great day at the beach
332732607.author: a TripAdvisor user
332732607.reviewBody: Playa La Ropa is a great place to enjoy the beach. Lots of places to hang, but we spent our day at the South end a Rossy beach restaurant. They had lounge chairs right at waters edge (with shade) and they kept the food and brews coming.\n\n5 stars

332548725.name: One of the worlds greatest beaches
332548725.author: a TripAdvisor user
332548725.reviewBody: An amazing beach. Not too long and not too short to walk. Many spots to have a drink. Best of all I was surprised at how warm and clean the water was. My new favourite beach vacation spot. The view of Zihuatanejo from here is nice as well. Life is good. Enjoy it!

332491139.name: Stayed at Villa Mexicana on this fine beach
332491139.author: a TripAdvisor user
332491139.reviewBody: We enjoyed Playa La Ropa with all the dining options within walking distance.The beach was good and you were not disturbed all day with vendors hawking goods.

331899046.name: Like your home bath
331899046.author: a TripAdvisor user
331899046.reviewBody: got to do some quality family friendly swimming this thanks giving. Worth paying for a room in a hotel with direct access

331783960.name: Love our stay above La Ropa
331783960.author: a TripAdvisor user
331783960.reviewBody: A very friendly area of Zihua above La Ropa and easy to get to downtown either by walking, van or taxi.

331719091.name: Vacation
331719091.author: a TripAdvisor user
331719091.reviewBody: We are at La Casa Que Ve Al Mar on Playa La Ropa.... There are numerous restaurants and bars to vidit, all very nice and accommodating... Awesome views and food and drinks

331044813.name: Needs some TLC
331044813.author: a TripAdvisor user
331044813.reviewBody: This is a long stretch of beautiful beach that just needs a little TLC. Too many people are leaving garbage laying around,partly because there are no public garbage cans,but mostly just laziness.the municipality needs to step up and clean this area on a regular basis,as they do in Ixtapa

330776930.name: Beautiful Beach
330776930.author: a TripAdvisor user
330776930.reviewBody: Warm, friendly, traditional Mexico Beach! Just awesome awesome!  Great restaurants, great drinks, great service!

329793684.name: Amazing beach
329793684.author: a TripAdvisor user
329793684.reviewBody: Wonderful spot. Clean, safe and friendly. the beach is great for walks and the water is a great temperature with pleasant waves

329726897.name: Clean
329726897.author: a TripAdvisor user
329726897.reviewBody: The Beach was a pleasure\nThey have done a great job at keeping it clean as compared to last year \nKeep it up

329707355.name: Lovey beach, great view!
329707355.author: a TripAdvisor user
329707355.reviewBody: We didn\'t spend much time on this beach as it is busier than we like (only personal taste). Some of the larger tourist hotels front onto the beach and have little private seating/ sun bathing areas. The beach itself is very clean and well maintained. You can hire jet skis, do parasailing, kayak or just swim and relax on the beach. We were told that there is decent snorkelling here, but when we went, the sea was a little rough and churning up the sand so visibility wasn\'t great. I imagine this could get very busy in high season. Lovely view out towards the open ocean. Walkable from downtown Zihua, however it is a little steep walking up the road.

329630437.name: Muy bonita, con comida deliciosa.   Really nice and with delicious food.
329630437.author: a TripAdvisor user
329630437.reviewBody: Muy bonita, ideal para vacaciones de relajaci\u00f3n y descanso. La bah\u00eda es realmente bella y mantiene su identidad r\u00fastica y tradicional\n\nReally nice, great for quiet vacations.  The bay is awesome and keeps a rustic and traditional Mexican identity.

329562773.name: Nice Clean Beach
329562773.author: a TripAdvisor user
329562773.reviewBody: This is one of Zihua\'s nicer beaches easily accessible by taxi or combi. Very clean, vendors are really laid back and it is home to one of the best fine dining restaurants in the area.

329405682.name: Tortugas!!!!
329405682.author: a TripAdvisor user
329405682.reviewBody: It really doesn\'t get much than this beach! Tortugas, watersports and pure bliss. This is all made possible by Victor and his crew on the beach. We stayed at the Viceroy but opted to do most activities through Victor. I paddle boarded for the first time, got to release a turtle, wave runner and much more! Last year Victor\'s cousin took us on a boat ride to Xtapa Island which was great to see but I wanted to go back to Playa la Ropa as soon as we got there. The boat ride was spectacular though! We checked out Playa Las Gatos this time and again came back to our Oasis on Playa la Ropa :-)

328559327.name: Wow! Can\'t be beat, great beach walking!
328559327.author: a TripAdvisor user
328559327.reviewBody: My second time here. We just Love, Love, Love, this place!\nAnd what everyone else said to! We rented a casa high up on the hill and have a great 180\u00b0 view. The beach walks are wonderful and relaxing.

328107810.name: Good swimming beach
328107810.author: a TripAdvisor user
328107810.reviewBody: Good swimming beach with plenty of restaurants/bars to stop at & sunloungers to relax in. There were also some massage huts to the north end that we used on 2 occassions.

327912697.name: Great beach
327912697.author: a TripAdvisor user
327912697.reviewBody: I have been here now two times and will keep coming back.  Many acidifier on the beach, go to Los Gatos beach for a different point of view.

327450324.name: Great beach
327450324.author: a TripAdvisor user
327450324.reviewBody:
Go to El Marlins
Parasail from the beach.
Get a massage from Lily and Oscars
Lay back and enjoy the locals having fun with their families
The ocean is so warm you will love to swim in it.
Very relaxing and fun to hang out.
Tip the musicians who stroll the beach and entertain you.

327341013.name: 5 stars all the way
327341013.author: a TripAdvisor user
327341013.reviewBody: I consider myself a beach expert after living in Hawaii for 25 years. Mexico has incredible beaches and this is one of them.

327259138.name: beautiful beach
327259138.author: a TripAdvisor user
327259138.reviewBody: it\'s a beautiful beach but we preferred la madera as it seemed there was more activity.  la ropa is quickly becoming a mini ixtapa full of all inclusive hotels.

327127204.name: Best beach in Mexico
327127204.author: a TripAdvisor user
327127204.reviewBody: Great beach, clean and full of many good restaurants all at a good price. Make sure you buy some cheese from the La Ropa cheese man.\n\n

327006144.name: Playa La Ropa is an ideal place to get immersed in Mexican culture.
327006144.author: a TripAdvisor user
327006144.reviewBody: We stayed near here for 12 days & went to the beach every day. There are the typical vendors & restaurants. There are also local families & couples enjoying this peaceful beach in Zihuatanejo.

324020658.name: Waouhhh
324020658.author: a TripAdvisor user
324020658.reviewBody: One of the best beach I ever been. Waves to play in the water (but not too big so not dangerous), not crowded, nice weather (almost all year long) and his restaurants closed to there. \nReally a nice place to discover for a long weekend.

321035462.name: Fabulous!!!
321035462.author: a TripAdvisor user
321035462.reviewBody: Calm, relax, beautiful, awesome, the best beach in Zihuatanejo!!! \ud83d\ude0d\ud83d\ude0d\ud83d\ude0d\ud83d\ude0d\ud83d\ude0d\ud83d\ude0d\ud83d\ude0d\ud83d\ude0d\ud83d\ude0d\ud83d\ude0dI fell in love with this beach!!

320659719.name: Soft white sandy beach
320659719.author: a TripAdvisor user
320659719.reviewBody: Gentle waves, soft white sand, Lots of activity with a big choice of restaurants and bars, parasailing, kayak rental, wave runners and sail boats.

320403092.name: Hobie cats available for rent & reasonably priced massages on the beach!  Overall quite, but with enough activities
320403092.author: a TripAdvisor user
320403092.reviewBody: Hobie cats available for rent, inexpensive massages on the beach, good food: local, cozy beach restaurants, parasailing...but all on a laid back level. This is for those who don\'t need disco\u2764\ufe0f

316570178.name: Playa La Ropa is the best beach!!
316570178.author: a TripAdvisor user
316570178.reviewBody: Wonderful, fun beach for swimming, water play, parasailing, catamaran sailing, and lots of places to eat at a leisurely pace. Also, lots of beachside massage and reflexology tents - amazingly inexpensive and good!\nWe swim here every day we are in Zihua.

315873699.name: Zihuatanejo Beach
315873699.author: a TripAdvisor user
315873699.reviewBody: Awesome unspoiled beach with a beautiful view and not crowed.  There are vendors all around to purchase food and beverages and a perfect place to watch the sunset.

314635182.name: Just call it heaven
314635182.author: a TripAdvisor user
314635182.reviewBody: Love love love....dream home...amazing people, the beach one only dreams of, food to weep over, sunsets to only imagine, warm ocean water to soak in..float on, close your eyes and be at peace...

309541548.name: Beautiful!
309541548.author: a TripAdvisor user
309541548.reviewBody: Liked the view.  Beach was very nice but very strong currents when we were there Sept 6th, 7th, 8th.   Seeing the turtles almost every night was an amazing an unexpected experience.

309000002.name: Best beach in Zihua
309000002.author: a TripAdvisor user
309000002.reviewBody: Great clean sandy beach for sunbathing, boogie boarding with some snorkeling. We enjoy sitting under a plapas, getting a massage and taking long walks (about 3 miles) along this beach. The beach provides many outdoor restaurants. Patty\'s and Villa Mexicana offer the best value.

308709000.name: Best Beach in Zihua Area!
308709000.author: a TripAdvisor user
308709000.reviewBody: Best beach in Zihuatanejo! Large walkable beach. Water is usually clean. Water temparature is very comfortable. We travel to this area four times a year. Waves are bigger during hurricane season! But stronger on La Madera Beach, closer to the marina. Some sea life, such as small sting rays.

308644069.name: Paradise
308644069.author: a TripAdvisor user
308644069.reviewBody: We had one of the most wonderful vacations we ever had. The beauty, authenticity of the Mexican experience combined with perfect weather made this a place to return to year after year!

308379851.name: excellent beach for pass a whole day
308379851.author: a TripAdvisor user
308379851.reviewBody: this beach is awesome the sand is nice the sea here is really calm and if you go to La Perla for something to eat you can have a great food and service. this is a must if you come to zihuatanejo

307868640.name: Tops: warm water, soft sand, turtles; Bottoms: venders, and pushy fishing boats
307868640.author: a TripAdvisor user
307868640.reviewBody: Amazing access from the Intrawest. One of the top hotels on the beach. Beautiful and quiet in the off season (Sept) but weather can be unpredictable with rain and crazy/cool thunderstorms. We watched a turtle lay 105 eggs one night and were told that up to seven turtles may lay eggs at once, definitely an experience! Quite typical to Mexican beaches are the vendors so you will see those but I would say to be cautious of Mario (Amando\'s) on the beach. We booked a fishing trip and scheduled to have seven people on a bigger boat for 250. American. Without contact info, we were unable change our reservation when we only had three people. Although the trip was well worth the time, with beautiful views, fishing and snorkeling on Las Gatas, but we were upset that they wouldnt give us a reduced price (prequoted 180. for 3-4 people on a small boat) and that they found a way to call our room to get more money from us! If you do decide to book make sure your reservation doesnt change otherwise you will suffer!

304217791.name: Gorgeousness at your feet
304217791.author: a TripAdvisor user
304217791.reviewBody: Simply beautiful... We walked every morning along the shores and enjoyed every moment.  So relaxing and pristine

302914393.name: Great beach
302914393.author: a TripAdvisor user
302914393.reviewBody: Always a great beach to walk, relax and have a drink. Stop at La Rana Rene and Rossy.  You can walk all along Playa La Ropa and enjoy the beautiful view of Zihua

302166987.name: Wonderful beaches and water activities.
302166987.author: a TripAdvisor user
302166987.reviewBody: We found the best snorkeling around the stack of rocks in front of Club Intrawest, where we stayed. We love Playa la Ropa because it in a bay, protected from Ocean extremes. \nAcross the bay from  la Ropa is a day beach, Playa las Gatas, which is also good snorkeling and fun to get to in the little "ponga" boats that leave from Playa Municipal area. Lots of water activities available!

302153185.name: Beautiful Beach
302153185.author: a TripAdvisor user
302153185.reviewBody: Enjoyed walking on the beach and you can have a massage on beach for 200 pesos (1 hr).  Lots of activities available on the beach.

301487697.name: Festive and clean beach!
301487697.author: a TripAdvisor user
301487697.reviewBody: This is the cleanest beach in Zihua that we went to.  Good food nearby and you can rent all of your beach fun right off of the beach (parasailing, jet skis, boats).  People walking around playing the guitar and families everywhere having the time of their lives!\n\n

298521197.name: Beach escape
298521197.author: a TripAdvisor user
298521197.reviewBody: Good beach to take a stroll, have a lunch and get a cheap massage on the beach. Water is ok, bit dirty in certain spots,

297040361.name: beautifal day at the beach
297040361.author: a TripAdvisor user
297040361.reviewBody: Great place to spend the day. Beautiful beach and very nice vendors. Skip the boat taxi and enjoy the walk

296065347.name: Beach side
296065347.author: a TripAdvisor user
296065347.reviewBody: This is a lovely long beach that makes for a  great morning or evening walk. There are many hotels and restaurants along the beach. During the day the beach was very crowded but was lovely in the mornings and evenings

295430254.name: Loved It
295430254.author: a TripAdvisor user
295430254.reviewBody: Loved it! Very very beautiful! Loved the restaurants on the beach! Weather was warm, but it really is a gorgeous place to visit. I would love to go again!

294693202.name: This Beach is so much fun
294693202.author: a TripAdvisor user
294693202.reviewBody: Walking distance from most hotels, Has many restaurants and amenities. We had a great time, had food, there are activities and restrooms.

293173548.name: Strolling is ok wouldn\'t recommend swimming
293173548.author: a TripAdvisor user
293173548.reviewBody: My husband and I walked here from up in the mountain. The beach was very crowded and over run by vendors. Many locals come here to vacation and looked like they were having a good time. The sand was velvety soft but water near shore was not all that clear looking.

293154012.name: Beautiful beach with nice restaurants
293154012.author: a TripAdvisor user
293154012.reviewBody: This crescent shaped beach is clean and safe. You can walk the whole length in your bare feet. The sand is white, the water is warm and there are tropical fish in the water and birds on the shore. You can wade or swim and float in the calm sea. There are waves but no dangers undertow like at the Ixtapa Beach were they surf. There are restaurants, bars, resorts, and shops along the length. If you keep to the shoreline you won\'t be tempted to have a massage, para-sail or dine until you are ready. There is a yoga studio in the middle of the beach which is on the second floor overlooking the beach. If you walk to the end of Playa La Ropa and continue along the road and rocky shoreline you will reach Playa Los Gatos another beautiful beach to spend the day at. If you walk in the evening you may be lucky and see a huge sea turtle come out of the water and lay her eggs.

292058525.name: Honeymoon June-July 2015
292058525.author: a TripAdvisor user
292058525.reviewBody: Great beach! Very clean and not too crowded. Very beautiful from sunrise to sunset. Good mix of locals and tourists. Vendors weren\'t too pushy at all - very friendly.

284870187.name: close to hotels
284870187.author: a TripAdvisor user
284870187.reviewBody: this beach was withing walking distance of our hotel, good restaurants along the beach, the water is not quite so calm and the undertow a little strong there...just be careful!  A good way to spend and afternoon!!

284042563.name: Perfect!
284042563.author: a TripAdvisor user
284042563.reviewBody: Nice short soft beach, tons to do and see. Explore the restaurants and shops, relax, or find an exciting water sport. Very fun place to visit.

283258876.name: Beautiful, active Playa la Ropa.
283258876.author: a TripAdvisor user
283258876.reviewBody: Playa la Ropa is Zihuatanejo\'s premier beach offering a variety of tourist services and good fresh seafood restaurants.   Everyone I encountered at the establishments that line the beach were welcoming and helpful. This beach was a perfect day trip from Playa Blanca which is a bit more remote.

282704274.name: Great place to visit even if you aren\'t staying directly in this location
282704274.author: a TripAdvisor user
282704274.reviewBody: We were staying in Ixtapa but took a cab to Playa la Ropa on a couple of different days.  There are many restaurants/bars to visit and enjoy local food and drinks on the beach.  The beach is very clean and beautiful.  All of the staff at local establishments were very friendly and welcoming.  Would definitely suggest including this location if you are in the area.

282232272.name: A beautiful relaxing place
282232272.author: a TripAdvisor user
282232272.reviewBody: There are many places to sit, enjoy the beach and eat delicious seafood. There are lots of options for renting chairs and eating.

280503982.name: Good not Great
280503982.author: a TripAdvisor user
280503982.reviewBody: I would give this beach an average score. For a city beach, it is above average but you can find much better 15 miles north of Zihuatanejo. If you are looking to be in the city, this is the best beach, although I have not seen them all.

279718327.name: Nice place to relax
279718327.author: a TripAdvisor user
279718327.reviewBody: Playa la Ropa is a very pretty beach with golden sand and plenty of waves to keep the kids happy. While we were there (stayed at Viceroy hotel), the waves were very strong. However, still a very nice beach for walking and sunbathing:)

279614048.name: Home  for thirty years
279614048.author: a TripAdvisor user
279614048.reviewBody: ZIHUA especially Playa la Ropa, has been a part of my life for over 30 years. My kids and practically grown up here.. Our property, with a view similar to this,  is located in La Ropa so we all have a love for this wonderful place. We have been blessed to spend several months each year at our property.The beach is beautiful, restaurants wonderful,  people delightful. The waves can be big in the summer, flat in the winter and the water can be up to 91\u00b0. I\'ve seen it grow so much over the years . There\'s nothing bad to say. It will always have a big place in my heart.

279366357.name: Clean and peacefully beach
279366357.author: a TripAdvisor user
279366357.reviewBody: During the week, it was extraordinary calm and only i few locals and travellers were enjoying the beach and restaurants.

278077735.name: Food
278077735.author: a TripAdvisor user
278077735.reviewBody: There are several places to grab a bite to eat on La Ropa, I highly recommend La Perla Resturant at the south end of the beach.\nthey have the Best Pescado a la talla.

277304272.name: Relaxing place with a bite of adventure
277304272.author: a TripAdvisor user
277304272.reviewBody: It is the beach with calm sea and relaved atmosphere (very beautifull place not like Ixtapa or Acapilco; much more Mexican). There are many smaller and bigger restaurants at the beach. Generally breakfasts and dinners are amazing (grilled fish with garlic and tomato/shrimp/coriander cocktails with great views). it is easy to find a boat and go snorkeling in one of the coral reefs nearby (some of them are amazing). In the the small lagoon there are wild crocodilles which makes the place even more atractive. I\'ve heard that they are not dangerous (there is only 30 cm net between the beach and lagoon); but still it gives a thrill.

275817246.name: Nice Beach
275817246.author: a TripAdvisor user
275817246.reviewBody: Nice but trying to find a place to setup and leave your stuff wasn\'t easy.  Luckily we found a couple that had reserved a spot at the Viceroy hotel and allowed us to join them.

274879446.name: Charming and Fun Beach
274879446.author: a TripAdvisor user
274879446.reviewBody: La Ropa is a lovely beach in a beautiful protected bay.  Restaurants with Palapas line the beach offering great seafood dishes and refreshing cocktails.  The waves gently break on the shore, inviting even the most timid to take a dip.  There are enough people for it to be a lively experience, but not so many that you feel crowded.  This is a great beach for families, yet also has a romantic feel to it as well especially in the evening where you must take a stroll along the beach and stop in for a drink and a bit to eat at any of the restaurants that line the beach.  La Perla doesn\'t disappoint.  The sun sets depending on the time of year either on the ocean between the two land points or behind the mountain.  Every sunset from La Ropa is a beautiful experience.

274236130.name: Romantic and beautiful beach
274236130.author: a TripAdvisor user
274236130.reviewBody: Playa la Ropa became one of my favourite beaches on earth \nWhite and fine sand, clean water, excellent restaurants, fabulous people and staff. \nLove it

273903629.name: Among our top 3 beaches
273903629.author: a TripAdvisor user
273903629.reviewBody: Beautiful beach - We ate at La Perla on the beach [at a table in the sand with good Mexican beer and margaritas]

273883965.name: #1 Beach
273883965.author: a TripAdvisor user
273883965.reviewBody: La Ropa Beach is now in our top 2 or 3 beaches in the world.  Go to the La Perla restaurant and have lunch or a snack with your toes in the sand.

273494655.name: Decent beach reflecting authentic Mexico
273494655.author: a TripAdvisor user
273494655.reviewBody: We walked Playa la Ropa Beach and enjoyed it very much.  The locals were the majority of beachgoers when we visited, and that was enlightening.  We were able to observe and appreciate the culture of Zihuatanejo and it visitors and thought the beach scene was a model of the best of families and fun!

272881394.name: Great beach
272881394.author: a TripAdvisor user
272881394.reviewBody: Very nice beach very pretty clean beautiful boats. A little out of the way .so that was  inconvenient but was well worth the ride

271429515.name: Playa la Ropa
271429515.author: a TripAdvisor user
271429515.reviewBody:
In my opinion ,best beach in Zihuatanejo or anywhere else in Mexico.

Viva Mexico
Thomas Harris
Houston,Texas
U.S.A.

269604316.name: Quiet, Perfect reflection
269604316.author: a TripAdvisor user
269604316.reviewBody: Just after the slow down of Holy Week. The Beach was clean, it was tranquil, and I was able to use my day reflecting on my thoughts and a bit of meditation.

268172717.name: Great beach
268172717.author: a TripAdvisor user
268172717.reviewBody: Playa Ropa is a beautiful beach with fine sand, warm water and small surf. This is where you\'ll see a lot of the local people come with their famlies. We stayed 2-weeks in a beautiful condo at Punta Marina (available through VRBO)

265758945.name: Perfectly beautiful
265758945.author: a TripAdvisor user
265758945.reviewBody: mellow, unpretentious relaxing environment . Perfect for relaxation.  No high-rise, very quaint and beautiful area.

265685275.name: Great beach
265685275.author: a TripAdvisor user
265685275.reviewBody: Great beach and close to condo. Plenty of eateries to choose from. Local vendors with the items for purchase are pleasant and non aggressive.

265532887.name: Tranquility
265532887.author: a TripAdvisor user
265532887.reviewBody: Would you like a place to just enjoy water sports, the sun, beachfront restaurants, a wonderful beach, and total relaxation, check it out. There are various resorts to choose from.

265344418.name: Great Beach
265344418.author: a TripAdvisor user
265344418.reviewBody: We love this beach.  Lots of places to eat like our favorite La Perla, Paty\'s and Rossy.   Lots of beach toys.  The beach is great.

265100754.name: A very good beach overall
265100754.author: a TripAdvisor user
265100754.reviewBody: We were staying in a hotel above the Playa de la Ropa and it\'s a very nice beach. The surf is reasonably calm, thanks to it being in a bay, though the water\'s a little green. The hotel provided palapas on the beach so that was fine. It wasn\'t crazily crowded even though this was Easter weekend. Negotiating for speedboat trips on the banana or bouncy seat was not so pleasant, the folks in charge put 4 larger parties in front of us even though they booked after us because they could charge more. That\'s probably the only negative about the place.

264960077.name: Beautiful, must see
264960077.author: a TripAdvisor user
264960077.reviewBody: Although it is a little out of town and a bit of a drive up the mountain to get down to the beach it is well worth it! We couldn\'t believe how beautiful this beach was compared to our area over by the azul ixtapa. Water is so blue and clear, the beach is so big with beautiful sand, and the view is spectacular. There are a lot of restaurants and activities vendors on the beach here, only one way in and out if you are catching a cab here. Must see this beach! ... on a side note we were looking for the bathrooms and followed the sign to see nothing there!

264908328.name: best beach
264908328.author: a TripAdvisor user
264908328.reviewBody: wonderful quiet waves safe for everyone to go in water nice temperature of water and great beach and beach restaurants

264096185.name: Nice
264096185.author: a TripAdvisor user
264096185.reviewBody: The beach is good so is the food and drinks. Everything seemed to be clean. You can stay as long as you like until the water taxis shut down\ud83d\ude0e\ud83d\ude1c

263421254.name: Best Beach in the area for swimming
263421254.author: a TripAdvisor user
263421254.reviewBody: We were staying in Ixtapa where the waves were too huge for swimming so we went to Playa la Ropa for lunch and a swim.  Absolutely beautiful beach for walking & swimming.  Not too busy at all.  Friendly people.  Very expensive place to lunch.

262976482.name: Beautiful beach
262976482.author: a TripAdvisor user
262976482.reviewBody: The sand is nice and white and you can walk for a long ways. There are a lot of activities on this beach such as seadoos, paddle boards, parachutes etc. You can just pick a restaurant to sit at and use their beach chairs all day as long as you order something, even just pop. Its not great for swimming because of the waves but you can dip in to stay cool. Walk down to the end to see the crocodiles in the canal. I can\'t remember the name of the restaurant but it is clearly marked.

262769014.name: Lydiawaterson
262769014.author: a TripAdvisor user
262769014.reviewBody: Great beach!!! Long stretches of lovely golden sand and so clean! Clean turquoise water! Minimum of hawkers but they are all friendly and won\'t harrass you!

262364075.name: Wonderful Beach But Contaminated Ocean Water
262364075.author: a TripAdvisor user
262364075.reviewBody: My wife and I are dedicated ocean swimmers and scuba divers and have been in oceans around they world. We were in Zihuatanejo the latter part of March when a strong low pressure system couped with high tides created a lot of shoreline wash off. The water was so toxic that the end of my tongue became numb after only 15  minutes in the water. This was a first for us.\nWe abandoned our daily swim for the  rest of the week. So sad this beautiful bay is being destroyed  by the lack off Proper  sanitation controls by the City health department.

261968506.name: a Playa of many activities
261968506.author: a TripAdvisor user
261968506.reviewBody: So many things to do along the beach - bars, restaurants, massages, parachute rides, Hobie Cats, etc.  A very clean beach with clean water and small waves perfect for boogie boarding.

261803001.name: Best Beach in ZIH
261803001.author: a TripAdvisor user
261803001.reviewBody: Nice sandy swim area, can rent kayak, hoby cat, paddle boards, parasailing, etc.  Beautiful place to walk up and down the beach plus gorgeous sunsets.

261728228.name: Que Rico
261728228.author: a TripAdvisor user
261728228.reviewBody:
LOVE: 
Safe Fun Warm Beautiful Fresh Seafood Many Great Locals
Water Sports Vistas Massage
DISLIKE: 
Being Cheated by Snake Charmers

261704811.name: Beautiful Beach
261704811.author: a TripAdvisor user
261704811.reviewBody: The beach is beautiful and the views equally as wonderful.  A great place to enjoy the sun and get a tan!

260913259.name: Lotsa beach
260913259.author: a TripAdvisor user
260913259.reviewBody: A quiet area that is mostly empty beach though there are crowded?? days. Godd restaurants and remember to bargin is good.

260885176.name: Wonderful beach that hasn\'t been over developed
260885176.author: a TripAdvisor user
260885176.reviewBody: We stayed recently at Club Intrawest which has a frontage on to this beach. Whilst there is a fair bit of development along it, it has just about managed to keep it\'s beautiful basic character. It\'s also a public beach so there is a mixture of local people and hotel guests which is so much better than situations where hotels dominate. Plenty of beach front restaurants to choose from. We tried 3 and they were all good. Paty\'s seems to have a particular reputation and we had wonderful quesadillas there.\n\nYou see quite a few beach traders selling a variety of things. They are extremely polite and a gentle "no gracias" is all that is required for them to move on. Well worth looking at what they have to offer though. We bought a had made straw/grass bag from a lovely man who\'s family hand make them. The guys offering water sports, sailing (Hobie Cats) and fishing trips also strike the right balance between trying to make a few pesos and being intrusive and . Well worth considering what they have to offer. I did a fishing trip with a Canadian which was great. We caught our quota of black fin tuna (our hotel restaurant cooked it for us) and saw dolphins, turtles and a whale with a baby.

260626284.name: great beach
260626284.author: a TripAdvisor user
260626284.reviewBody: you could easily spend your whole vacation on this beach.\nFood, sand, and a great sunset. Lot of great hotels, and a short walk to playa las gatas.

260555040.name: Best beach activities guys on the beach!
260555040.author: a TripAdvisor user
260555040.reviewBody:
We recently spent two weeks on Playa Ropa in Zihautenejou. Here the beach is beautiful, golden sand and crystal clear water. The beach here is quite protected with a good surf, not too rough but great for beach activities like boogie boarding, snorkelling, paddle boarding, kayaking, etc. 

There are a lot of vendors on the beach that rent equipment but I would strongly recommend JoseLuiz and Jorge. They are located at the North end of the strip, next to the Intrawest Club. They have single and double kayaks. We rented a double and spent a wonderful afternoon out around the bay. 

They have snorkel equipment that is good quality and affordable (40 pesos). Our teenage kids spent hours out around the rocks. The fish are plentiful and colourful. 

We wanted to go over to Los Gatas Beach and wanted more than just a water taxi experience so JoseLuiz outfitted the girls with snorkelling equipment, and took us over on a Hobie 16 Cat. Just the four of us. He showed the kids where the best snorkelling was and gave them pointers on how to go and see "Jesus", a submerged bronze statue of Jesus 50 metres off Los Gatas Beach. 
At the end of a great afternoon he came back and got us.

JoseLuiz and Jorge are good guys, honest, hardworking family men making a living for their families. They are fair and friendly. And they love Canadians! Jorge speaks good English so it is easy to deal with them.

260308206.name: LOVE THIS PLACE!
260308206.author: a TripAdvisor user
260308206.reviewBody: We had the most relaxing time at Residences del Sol in Playa le Ropa, right above the Viceroy Hotel.  Stunning Bay, sunsets every night and perfect location to get in and out of town easily.  Water in the bay was beautiful and warm.  Go to LOOT for breakfast/at night for Music, La Perla for Lobster on the Beach and Tentaciones for an amazing sunset dinner!

260240254.name: Lots going on
260240254.author: a TripAdvisor user
260240254.reviewBody: This is a fun beach to visit .numerous restaurants to choose from. Plenty of activities to watch. Great mix of locals and tourist . Always a full day

260188327.name: Great beach!
260188327.author: a TripAdvisor user
260188327.reviewBody: We spent a ton of time at this beach in February. It was nice sand, warm water and nice clear water. There are a ton of places to eat right there to have a drink or eat. There were some vendors that came along selling stuff but if you say no they keep going.

259820724.name: Excellent beach!
259820724.author: a TripAdvisor user
259820724.reviewBody: The beach was beautiful, clean and relaxing. There are very few vendors (which in itself is delightful compared to other beaches)walking around and the few that we saw are very polite and really have great wares at excellent prices. For example there is a lady who sells beautiful cover ups at very good prices. In fact she told me that she has regular customers every year who wait until they arrive at the beach to buy cover ups from her. I understood why when I\'d spent 45 dollars sale price on one in my city she had the same piece for less than 20 dollars USA. I forgot her name but she is the only cover up vendor I saw on the beach (sadly she is not there everyday) while we were there. She also has sticker prices on her garments. There was also a very nice older man playing songs for 30 pesos.  There are massage tents that offer excellent, professional one hour massages at a great price which we took full advantage of (200 pesos). There are a few activities offered such as fishing boats and parasailing but we were looking to relax and play in the water. Also there are boats that will take you to other islands and snorkeling if you want (prices were between 250- 300 pesos when we were there).  Look for Jorge he works for one such outfit positioned on the beach that can take you to Los Gatos for a good price (although you can walk there too) as well as help you with other water activities.  Most restaurants will let you rent a lounge chair some for around 100 pesos for the day. If you eat at Patys you can use their lounge chairs in the morning as they are available. That is what we did.  The sand is so soft and clean that most people were walking and jogging bare feet. A great relaxing beach vacation that we are planning to return to very soon.

259636004.name: Long sandy beach, clear and blue
259636004.author: a TripAdvisor user
259636004.reviewBody: Loved the cleanliness of the water and the warmth.\nGreat long beach to walk. Great food choices nearby. Loots of activities for young people.\nThere was nothing to dislike!

259500417.name: Incredible beach, much to see and do
259500417.author: a TripAdvisor user
259500417.reviewBody: Only spent a day at this beach but wish I had spent more!  Calm water, beautiful rock formations, boat rentals, parasailing, hotels, restaurants, bars, shade.  Busy but not too crowded, easy enough to find some space for yourself. I will definitely spend more time in Playa del Ropa on my next trip.

259325329.name: Best Beach Ever
259325329.author: a TripAdvisor user
259325329.reviewBody: loved this beach. Very long, good shade, never crowded. We spent a month sitting on this beach everyday and never got tired of it. Saw same vendors over & over who as we got browner, left us alone. Actually had my favorite vendors come and tell me good bye on our last day on the beach. Great beach for kids.

258844904.name: The fun of Ixtapa without the hassle
258844904.author: a TripAdvisor user
258844904.reviewBody: this little beach is adjacent to Zihuat and has all the benefits of Ixtapa, without the hassle. jet skis, sail boats, parasailing, snorkeling, and lots of good sand for frisbee - enjoy!

258379934.name: Beautiful resort-style beach
258379934.author: a TripAdvisor user
258379934.reviewBody: This was the most beautiful beach in Zihuatanejo, much nicer than Playa Madera. There are a number of restaurants located directly on the beach and is the place to go for long walk or jog. Gorgeous sunsets at night.

258295622.name: Great beach plus the Rosario\'s spa
258295622.author: a TripAdvisor user
258295622.reviewBody: So the spa at the hotel offered a 50 message for 2000 pesos. At Rosario\'s spa its 1hour for 200 pesos plus tip. And the messages were amazing. it\'s on a message table in a tent. Best deal in Zihuatanejo. And for all you one percenters stay at the hotel spa.

258271036.name: Relaxing
258271036.author: a TripAdvisor user
258271036.reviewBody: I love that it was not super busy, there were people to watch but it wasn\'t over crowded.  A nice atmosphere, great beach to walk.

258263294.name: One of Zihaus nicest sunbathing spots.
258263294.author: a TripAdvisor user
258263294.reviewBody: Playa la Ropa was 150 metres from hour hotel, and we really enjoyed this being our local beach during our 5-6 night stay in Zihua. If you do happen to be staying the area, go for a walk on the beach at night when all the lights are out and you may be lucky enough to see the flourescence in the waves as they crash from the plankton. Plenty space on a nice sandy beach with several activities on offer. Long enough to go for a lengthy swim if you want, I did a 1km swim one day across the shoreline. I wished the water was slightly cleaner but there are supposed to be issues with the increase in tourism in the area. I would also recommend an nice walk over to Playa las Gatas across the rocks between the beaches and if you are lazy you can get a boat back again.\n

257588097.name: Nice Beach
257588097.author: a TripAdvisor user
257588097.reviewBody: Nice beach.  Plenty of restaurants on beach.  Some allow you use lounge chairs during day if you purchase beverages or food.\nAlso lots of activities to purchase.  \nOpen air massages are also available

257364411.name: I Love the Beach Again!
257364411.author: a TripAdvisor user
257364411.reviewBody: Last time I enjoyed a beach was on Waikiki in 1976! In all my travels, since...have been a pool person. Loved the water temperature, walking experience, bar availability and vibe. Next time I visit I want to experience La Ropa...in all it\'s glory. Requiring less and less luxury and more love in my travel destinations.

257338409.name: Best Beach
257338409.author: a TripAdvisor user
257338409.reviewBody: Beach was amazing and well kept. Great area to soak up the rays and swim. All sorts of activities to do.

256852964.name: Best beach
256852964.author: a TripAdvisor user
256852964.reviewBody: Not too many people, but enough to enjoy. Surf is not too heavy as it\'s protected. Lots of places to eat and get drinks. Also lots of places to sit and sunbathe.

256378984.name: La Ropa Rules!
256378984.author: a TripAdvisor user
256378984.reviewBody:
Have yet to try Playa Las Gatas, but Playa la Ropa seems to me to be a nicer beach than the adjacent beaches Playa La Madera or Playa Principal.  It's cleaner and has more variety of restaurants & lounges... most with either umbrellas, palapas, and/or beach service.  Many of the venues have been around for decades and are well-known to regular travellers here.

The waves are mild and safe for children to frolic in.  (This is NOT the case on the out-lying beach areas such as Playa Larga, Playa Blanca, or over at Playa Ixtapa. The surf at those beaches is much bigger and riptides can be risky for adults, much less children!)

Aside from the beach itself and calm swimming waters, there are para-sailing rides and stand-up paddle-boards to rent.  You can also rent small Hobie catamarans (16ft) to sail around the Bay.  

Things to watch for in the water include sting rays (about 2 ft across) who occasionally come into shallow water, and Puffer Fish who puff up when scared.  This causes them to 'roll' up onto the beach and you don't want to step on those sharp spines.

Otherwise a lovely way to spend a day or afternoon!

256280124.name: Nice walking beach
256280124.author: a TripAdvisor user
256280124.reviewBody: Wander this beach daily and stop at some of the places offering food or refreshments.  There are all the tourist things to do like para-sailing, jet-skiing but more importantly, it is so uncontrived.  Stop at the south end food places to relax in a lounge chair and umbrella, have a drink with great food and watch the sun set later that evening.  Excellent bus service to Zihua and cheap cabs to Ixtapa.  Don\'t miss this beach if you are in a resort and fed up with the hussle and bustle.  Mex locals enjoy this beach on weekends.

256068141.name: Hands down. Best Beach in Zihua.
256068141.author: a TripAdvisor user
256068141.reviewBody: Love this beach. Each time we travel to Zihuatenejo we may choose a different hotel, but we always plan to be on La Ropa Beach!!  Sunsets are truly amazing. Looking unto the surf from beach, it looks like the big Pacific blue is an infiniti pool. And when the sun sets... WOW!! Just like a fiery inferno sinking off the edge of nowhere! Come experience creation at it\'s best yourself. You won\'t regret it!!!

255888036.name: A Smorgasbord  of Life
255888036.author: a TripAdvisor user
255888036.reviewBody: Artisan markets, authentic Mexican cuisine, Mexican family life, sea turtles young and old (at the right time), paragliding, snorkelling, beach bathing, swimming, spa services, cool accommodations...delicioso!

254585252.name: Favourite beach in Zi
254585252.author: a TripAdvisor user
254585252.reviewBody: There are several great restaurants on this beach. We ate beachside at The Viceroy and it was fresh and fantastic. We had a fresh coconut at Elvira another day and really enjoyed the seafood night at Club Intrawest as well. The water is clean and its a great walking beach as well.

254572402.name: Best beach for sunsets
254572402.author: a TripAdvisor user
254572402.reviewBody: We have been here many times in the six weeks to have lunch at patty\'s and watch the sunsets"BEAUTIFUL,we walk from Porto mio about 30 minutes uphill but worth ever minute.\nAnd party\'s have the best Marquita on the beach for happy hour

254566428.name: A Mexican beach with plenty of tradition
254566428.author: a TripAdvisor user
254566428.reviewBody: Still not jammed by mega hotel corporations; it still is a beautiful visit to a typical Mexican pacific beach. Was sorry to learn that the ocean pollution level in the area is high.

254538127.name: Paradisio
254538127.author: a TripAdvisor user
254538127.reviewBody: Playa LaRopa is what you hoped Mexico would be, instead os a ma as produced copy of Cancun. It is close to town, but you can spend the whole week right here

254128900.name: Very nice area.
254128900.author: a TripAdvisor user
254128900.reviewBody: Lots of options for activities and restaurants. Water is nice and restaurant options range from casual street food to nicer sit down.

254009385.name: It has everything you need and is close to town
254009385.author: a TripAdvisor user
254009385.reviewBody: We love lying around on a chaise at Aura del Mar and walking over to Valencia for lunch as the aerobic break. Water is terrific.

253993475.name: Beach with Lots of Options!
253993475.author: a TripAdvisor user
253993475.reviewBody: Playa La Ropa is a fun beach!  When we stay at a hotel or villa on the beach, it is a great beach to walk in the morning.  There are lots of water activities, bars and restaurants.  When we stay in Ixtapa, we visit LaRopa at least two or three times!  If you get far enough down the beach (La Perla Restaurant), you can watch the sun set right into the ocean.

253832046.name: Water Can Be A Little Rough
253832046.author: a TripAdvisor user
253832046.reviewBody: Along the beach are several small restaurants, you can sit in the sand or on a patio under the shade of an umbrella.  The food varies from good to very good.  El Manglar is a great stop and if you\'re luck you can watch the monkeys in the trees or the crocodiles in the river.

253731091.name: great beach
253731091.author: a TripAdvisor user
253731091.reviewBody: Long beatiful beach... nice people elviras is a good place to relax... super view of the bay .. sun filled days ahead

253704744.name: Endless sand and swimming
253704744.author: a TripAdvisor user
253704744.reviewBody: Lovely, beautiful majestic - all superlatives apply.\nOne can walk for ages with sandpipers running all around you.\nMorning is best for swimming as a surf comes up in afternoon

253574411.name: Busy, but nice
253574411.author: a TripAdvisor user
253574411.reviewBody: I typically like white-sand, quiet beaches with clear water (I\'m afraid of sea critters, so I like to see what\'s under my feet). Playa la Ropa didn\'t appeal to me for swimming, but it has a nice, wide beach and the water is plenty gentle for swimming. There are lots of hotels, restaurants, and vendors on the beach, and the vendors are pretty persistent, which I thought was annoying. Not my favorite beach.

253016421.name: Beautiful Beach
253016421.author: a TripAdvisor user
253016421.reviewBody: The beach is beautiful.  Clean.  The sand is very fine and will heat up during the afternoon for sure.  You can walk for ages. There are lots of places to stop and grab a bite and a beverage at very reasonable prices.

252973182.name: Lovely
252973182.author: a TripAdvisor user
252973182.reviewBody: We are staying on Playa la Ropa.  It is spectacular. We are enjoying morning walks (before it gets too hot) and evening walks (after the heat of the sun has gone) with stunning sunsets. There are lots of bars and restaurants with live music in the evening and lots of places to rent water sports equipment. Also lots of opportunities to have massages, pedicures, etc.

252972267.name: One awesome beach
252972267.author: a TripAdvisor user
252972267.reviewBody: This beautiful sandy beach is just the right length for a great walk and a wonderful place to people watch.  If you\'re lucky, you might see whales or dolphins out in the bay having a great time.  There are several good restaurants and more than one good massage place.  It\'s the primo beach in Zihua.

252946690.name: The BEST Beach in Zihuatanejo
252946690.author: a TripAdvisor user
252946690.reviewBody: When we first set foot on this beach it reminded us of where we grew up on the east coast of Canada , but just a bit warmer ! No undertow , gentle waves .... and we just sat and bobbed for hours ! If you don\'t want to eat at the beach restaurants it is easy to stop by the Mercado while en route to the beach and grab supplies to munch on thru the day .... and if so inclined could walk back to the beach from there .
