146227406.author: a TripAdvisor user
146227406.reviewBody: The beach is quite nice and there are no rocks going out to the water; we sat all day enjoying lunch and drinks at one of the restaurants.  We enjoyed that there were very little vendor interruptions.

146090360.name: great beach
146090360.author: a TripAdvisor user
146090360.reviewBody: Saw a lot of stingrays near the beach.  Beware of some undertows.  Walk to many restaurants. Overall the best beach in Zihuat.

145612815.name: Days at the beach
145612815.author: a TripAdvisor user
145612815.reviewBody: If you are not actually staying at a hotel on this beach, it is easy to secure lounge chairs just by ordering drinks. We ended up ordering lunch of freshly caught fish,which was delicious.Hobie Cat and jet ski rentals are available.Lots of restaurants on this beach...

145088786.name: Solid beach experience.
145088786.author: a TripAdvisor user
145088786.reviewBody: Clean, lots of things to do (jet ski, parasail, Hobi Cats). Many restaurants right on the beach.  Lawn chairs available for rent. Surf big enough to body surf or boogie board but still safe for kids. Overall a good beach experience.

145036206.name: nice beach
145036206.author: a TripAdvisor user
145036206.reviewBody: It\u00b4s simply a nice beach! Lots of place, no big waves, no dangerous current, good for children. Pretty close to the citycore.

142820672.name: Good food on the best beach in zihuantinejo?
142820672.author: a TripAdvisor user
142820672.reviewBody: We arrived in zijuan in oct.  Note to self, never go to z in oct.  Humidity is paralyzing and too hot to go outside. We were staying at las brissas  The cab driver suggested to go to la perla at playa la ropa.  He was so right. Beautiful ocean breeze, cool palapa.  Best margaritas in Z.  I was a very happy camper.  The food was just what I had come to z for. Fresh guacamole homemade chips, homade tortillas.  I had garlic shrimp, fabulous.  My husband had the mahi mahi Veracruz which is what he loves.  He loved his as much as I loved mine.  Then to top it off we shared a banana split.  Highly recommend.  We might come here every night for the rest of our stay.  The view was beautiful and it was much cooler than z.  Very short cab ride well worth it. 2 margaritas, 2 beers, chips salsa, guacamole and banana split all for under 50bucks.  This is a winner.

142667812.name: go hang out for the day
142667812.author: a TripAdvisor user
142667812.reviewBody: soft sand and lots of sun await you. lots of dining options and we loved the beach waiters and cold drinks at a variety of places. loved the happy hour at the hotel catalina

141380443.name: Beautiful Beach
141380443.author: a TripAdvisor user
141380443.reviewBody: Beautiful long beach used by local and tourists alike.   Many restaurants choices on the walk . If you are interested in a tour, look  for Fernando near Club Intrawest.  Great tour guide

140767310.name: Wonderful
140767310.author: a TripAdvisor user
140767310.reviewBody: Awesome restaurants, delicious food and great hotels that let you lounge in their chairs without even being a guest. Soft sand and great surf, the water is welcoming and gentle. A definite must when visiting Ziahu.

140451807.name: Fantastic Beach
140451807.author: a TripAdvisor user
140451807.reviewBody: Amazing long beach with beautiful clear warm water A few people selling things but the don\'t pester you at all.

140262203.name: Wonderful Beach
140262203.author: a TripAdvisor user
140262203.reviewBody: So tranquil. Grab a bite at La Perla, get a massage in the hut in front of the hotel "Villa Mexicana" and go sailing with Jose Luis (he\'s the sailboat closest to Casa Que Canta).

138941234.name: Great place!!
138941234.author: a TripAdvisor user
138941234.reviewBody: Very beautiful beach, the water was nice and warm, we had lunch at rossi\'s restaurant  right by end of the beach the the food was great service was nice and friendly, we had couple of massages next door at  Deisy massage the best massage I had so far I got my by Deisy and my wife by Carolina this girls are good.. I would go back but were out of time.we went to bandidos on Saturday night nice place for dinner and a little bit of salsa  Over all my trip to zihua was great I enjoy every day I stay.   Hope to be back next year.

137365303.name: Pristine and all yours
137365303.author: a TripAdvisor user
137365303.reviewBody: This beach was beautiful and deserted.  Just the way we like our beaches.  Easy 3 minute walk from La Casa Que Canta.

135888867.name: Average beach, beautiful views
135888867.author: a TripAdvisor user
135888867.reviewBody:
While the bay is beautiful, I give Playa la Ropa and average rating in that is is a typical Mexican beach.  The sand is somewhat rocky and coarse.  

There are several hotels and restaurants lining the beach.  As is typical on most Mexican beaches, there are folks hawking parasailing, hobie cat, tubing, and wave runner rentals.  You also have several folks selling stuff on the beach.  Everyone is friendly and walks away when you say no, but it does get old after a while. 

Additionally, this beach is not huge and draws a lot of locals (which is nice to see), but it can get crowded.

135778541.name: Beautiful sand and Great for people watching
135778541.author: a TripAdvisor user
135778541.reviewBody: We rented a couple of chairs and an umbrella at Il Mare and enjoyed the beautiful ocean views. Recommend the fish tacos and mango margarita\'s.

135093336.name: Catamaran trip with Juan
135093336.author: a TripAdvisor user
135093336.reviewBody: We enjoyed our relaxing, low-key catamaran sailing trip with Juan from Playa La Ropa (at the far end of the beach, with a red, white, and blue sail). He took us snorkeling at Las Gatas (nothing spectacular if you\'ve been to Hawaii) and around the whole bay. He knows enough English to give a tour of the different sights, and there\'s no nasty gas exhaust. We picked him after we saw him picking up trash off the beach -- it turns out he was born here and just loves the water. He did not hassle us for more tips or other activities. He provided life jackets for everyone. We recommend his trip!

133944282.name: Massage on the beach
133944282.author: a TripAdvisor user
133944282.reviewBody: Great beach massages, $15 per hour. Worth every cent.

133844153.name: Beautiful beach!
133844153.author: a TripAdvisor user
133844153.reviewBody: Water was amazing, around 80 degrees.  Good place to swim.

133751928.name: Nice beach but a bit dirty
133751928.author: a TripAdvisor user
133751928.reviewBody: Rent a kayak and paddle to Playa Las Gatas.  Much more charming and lots of locals to share a drink or lunch with!

132319394.name: on the beach
132319394.author: a TripAdvisor user
132319394.reviewBody: Good surf to swim in and play.  We had a wonderful cooling breeze 95% of the time making the warm weather just fine.  By the way we had NO rain.

131521404.name: La Perla is the place to go
131521404.author: a TripAdvisor user
131521404.reviewBody: Always hang out at La Perla when on Playa La Ropa.  You can rent an umbrella, two beach chairs, and a lounger and table for less than $5 per day.  The La Perla waiters will bring your drinks to you beachside and you can walk back 20 yards to have lunch.

131451249.name: Great morning walk
131451249.author: a TripAdvisor user
131451249.reviewBody: A nice beach for a walk, but the restaurants along the way are no big deal, really. Still, it\'s worth buying a beer or two with some light lunch to sit under a palapa on a sunny day. Not a lot to do if you aren\'t into jet skis or \'dope on a rope\'. The swimming is safe and the waves not too crazy.

131303863.name: really enjoyed Rossy\'s
131303863.author: a TripAdvisor user
131303863.reviewBody: We went to visit La Ropa beach today and ended up hanging out at Rossy\u00b4s. At first I wasn\u00b4t to happy that the taxi driver dropped us off there and kind of felt like I had to stick around and order food. However, we had a good day. The waiters were not pushy at all. We ordered when we were ready. We ordered a guacamole with chips and the grilled red snapper. both were very good. I\u00b4m glad we ended up here, would definetly go back.

130975509.name: A very nice stroll to this small beach
130975509.author: a TripAdvisor user
130975509.reviewBody: The beach itself is very rocky, but fun to see the opposite side of the bay and to watch the few local surfers. Very picturesque.

130781955.name: Beautiful little beach
130781955.author: a TripAdvisor user
130781955.reviewBody: Beautiful little beach right on a bay. Great for walking, jogging. If you follow the south end (wearing tennis shoes) you can walk on a trail for about 10 minutes and also get to Las Gatas beach (without paying for a boat right). Gentle waves great for playing in. Only negative is people trying to sell you stuff. Sometimes persistently.

129363458.name: Crowded
129363458.author: a TripAdvisor user
129363458.reviewBody: I have not gone to this beach very much but it is the most popular beach in Zihua I think. My problem with it is that it is too crowded.

129362173.name: Always a pleasure at La Perla
129362173.author: a TripAdvisor user
129362173.reviewBody: We really enjoying hanging out here on a particularly nice spot on the beach, with good food (sometimes you just need a hot dog and fries) and clean restrooms.

129313739.name: Favorite beach
129313739.author: a TripAdvisor user
129313739.reviewBody: For a few dollars rent a lounge and umbrella from La Perla, plus their Mojitos are fantastic!

129300737.name: Beautiful beach
129300737.author: a TripAdvisor user
129300737.reviewBody: We stayed along Playa la Ropa for 10 days. The beach was pretty clean. Was surprised to see how cold the water was in April but after laying under the hot sun it was refreshing! There are many restaurants along the beach that want your business. Many offer 2 for 1 drinks, happy hour, special prices. There are many people trying to rent you their jetski\'s, snorkelling and fishing trips, parasailing, silver and necklaces, all the usual you find on a touristy beach. Would go back to this beach again!

128972416.name: Best beach
128972416.author: a TripAdvisor user
128972416.reviewBody: Beautiful beach! There are plenty of activities to keep you entertained or you can simply enjoy the sun and sea:-) We chose the later. There are a few restaurants along the beach and they offer great food and drinks at a good price.

128528448.name: Best beach, view, and food
128528448.author: a TripAdvisor user
128528448.reviewBody: Skip Ixtapa and head here instead if you want a romantic and relaxing vacation.  This is a much more intimate beach with great places to eat and enjoy the view of the bay.

128122145.name: Beautiful
128122145.author: a TripAdvisor user
128122145.reviewBody: It is the most beautiful beach in all of Zihuatanejo. Very clean and lovely.

128050495.name: Best swimming beach
128050495.author: a TripAdvisor user
128050495.reviewBody: Playa la Ropa is the best swimming beach anywhere in Ixtapa/Zihuatanejo.  There are many beachside restaurants with recliners under palapas.  Paty\'s, La Perla, and La Gaviota are three of my favorites.  If you plan to walk to Playa las Gatas, start at the far end of La Ropa next to La Gaviota restaurant. There is a safe parking area a short distance to the left up the dirt road at the end of the paved road by the restaurant.  They charge 40 pesos/day.

127886967.name: Busy bay-beach with lots to do
127886967.author: a TripAdvisor user
127886967.reviewBody: Its a tourist beach with lots of good beach restaurants and lots to do (inexpensive parasailing, etc)

127838856.name: the most social beach
127838856.author: a TripAdvisor user
127838856.reviewBody:
great beach, takes about 45 minutes to walk 2 ways, unless you stop to chat to people on the way.
Good food and drinks at many restaurants scattered along the beach.
try rosies for a good experience.

127778430.name: Beautiful beach
127778430.author: a TripAdvisor user
127778430.reviewBody: Beautiful beach.  Not too crowded.  Safe.  Variety of accommodations, from very expensive to very reasonable.

127755976.name: Don\' be afraid to come to Zihua!
127755976.author: a TripAdvisor user
127755976.reviewBody: This was our 2nd trip to Club Intrawest... Love it here!  Playa la Ropa is amazing (and we are from San Diego where there are lots of beaches).  Beautiful, long beach... Perfect for walking.  Love Paty\'s for breakfast and Rossy\'s for dinner.  Best Margaritas on the planet!  Everything is so fresh and tasty!

127601661.name: Great beach
127601661.author: a TripAdvisor user
127601661.reviewBody: Great beach to walk and enjoy Zihuatanejo Bay.  Numerous restaurants along the beach, great views, ok food.  Locals enjoy the beach as well, limited vendors selling goods (compared to other beaches in Mexico).

127500281.name: Beautiful beach
127500281.author: a TripAdvisor user
127500281.reviewBody: Excellent beach with lots of local families.  Beautiful views of the bay and wonderful breezes.

127095378.name: A lovely beach
127095378.author: a TripAdvisor user
127095378.reviewBody: Clean sand and water, great views, interesting beach restaurants

126946774.name: Soft sand and a nice surf!
126946774.author: a TripAdvisor user
126946774.reviewBody: Try Paty\'s to eat on the north end, Villas Mexicana to stay at, just check out the sailboats closely if you rent! Mine had a gash in it found 200 yds off the beach!

126922341.name: Great beach with excellent restaurants
126922341.author: a TripAdvisor user
126922341.reviewBody: Going to Playa la Ropa with lunch at a restaurant on the beach is always a pleasure although this time there was a green algae in the water which I\'m sure was just seasonal but made swimming there a little less attractive.  However, the beach is long and very clean making for great walking and lunch at Paty\'s restaurant was as good as ever.

126566243.name: The prettiest beach ever!
126566243.author: a TripAdvisor user
126566243.reviewBody: Perfect beach - clean water, white sand. Great walking beach!

126364011.name: Loved the sand and water
126364011.author: a TripAdvisor user
126364011.reviewBody: Sand texture made walking a joy !!  Water clean and warm and just the right amount of wave action.

126205347.name: great beach
126205347.author: a TripAdvisor user
126205347.reviewBody: closest beach i have seen to playa del carmen on the pacific coast.

126194089.name: What fun!!!!
126194089.author: a TripAdvisor user
126194089.reviewBody: This beach is kept very clean at all times.  The vendors and the businesses on the beach are all very friendly.  I see several of the same people each year and have become friends with many of them.  Wouldn\'t miss it!

125960864.name: Nice
125960864.author: a TripAdvisor user

124914056.name: We loved this beach and plan to return often
124914056.author: a TripAdvisor user
124914056.reviewBody:
My wife and I live in Mexico, but we just made our first visit to this beach. We have often gone to a nearby beach called Troncones, but we'd heard so much about Zihuatanejo we decided to check it out. We are glad we did, and expect to return. 

We like a peaceful beach visit with lots of opportunity to lie near the water, read, and not be bothered by endless vendors, loud music, or noisy water craft. This beach ranks well on all those fronts. Unlike our prior preferred beach, though, this one has many more choices of restaurants, all within an easy walk. 

There's nothing more to say--a lovely place to vacation.

124771928.name: La Perla Restaurant
124771928.author: a TripAdvisor user
124771928.reviewBody: We rented 2 chairs and umbrella for only $5 on the beach for the day.  Fantastic food, drinks and views.

124766921.name: We live in Mexico and this is our beach of choice
124766921.author: a TripAdvisor user
124766921.reviewBody: Playa la Ropa is a lovely beach, wide enough for walking, good for swimming, very few jet skis, a couple of parasailing outfits are available but not disruptive to the ambience.  It is just a short 20 minutes ride from the airport. The beach is populated by North American retirees and young couples with babies.  Very quiet - nothing for teenagers to do.  Lots of restaurants on the beach.  A range of hotels from modest to very luxurious, but they all share the same beach!

124686505.name: Long beach walks
124686505.author: a TripAdvisor user
124686505.reviewBody: This is a long beach which is great to walk on.  Sometimes water just laps at the beach with waves or it can have more curling boogie board types waves.  Lots of places to stop to each and sit on their chairs.  La Perla or Rossys were great places to stop for a beer and snack.

124547644.name: pacific place

124539358.name: Nice beach, not crowded, safe waters

124534552.name: Sooo relaxing

124478510.name: Best Beach on the Pacific Coast
124478510.author: a TripAdvisor user
124478510.reviewBody:
I loved this beach. I have been to Cabo, Puerto Vallarta, Bucerias, Sayulita, and Desaladera on the Pacific Coast.  It is long enough and flat enough to walk on.  The water is crystal clear (except when the waves churn up the sand), there is lots of green background.  It is not ruined by overdevelopment (not yet anyways). There is some beach activity such as parasailing, banana boat rides, kayak rentals, catamaran rentals, and sea dos (sp?) but not so much to ruin the quiet. After years of going to Mexico, my husband and I finally tried parasailing.  We went with the guys that are right next to Rossy's (prenounced Rosie's). Very safe, reasonable and so much fun. 

There is no blaring music.  There are some people selling their wares, but not too many.  In fact, we were intrigued by some of what was on offer and did buy some food stuff.  Would have bought the purses and hats if we were in need of some.  If the little man in a white shirt comes along with his peanuts, buy some. They are good. We also tried his pistachios.  We tried the churros from another vendor.  Not as good as when they are made fresh on the spot, but that didn't seem to stop us from devouring them. We also tried the peanut brittle from a young man and it was the best I have ever eaten. Most vendors don't speak english and my spanish is not so good, so we went with the point and smile method which worked very well.

There are several restaurants to choose from.  The great thing is that if you buy some food and beverage from them, you can use their lounge chairs, table and umbrellas. Our two favorites were Patty's and Rossy's.  So many places in Mexico, you have to rent your chairs and then pay for food and drinks on top of that.  Only one restaurant charges for chair rental, but it is only 50 pesos for the day, for two chairs, a table and an umbrella.  

I hate writing about this beach as I don't want it to become ruined, but I think it is a long way off from that yet so enjoy!

124250674.name: La Ropa
124250674.author: a TripAdvisor user
124250674.reviewBody: La Gatas beach is exquisite.  There was no downside.

124203035.name: Great beach etc
124203035.author: a TripAdvisor user

124172044.name: La Ropa Beach
124172044.author: a TripAdvisor user
124172044.reviewBody: I really love the Zihuatanejo area.  There should be no travel warnings on this part of Mexico.  We feel entirely safe when we visit yearly for the whole month of February.  There\'s good beach food and our trips to town yield good shopping, great food.  It\'s a good vacation area!  Do not be afraid!

I\'d give it a five, but some of the restaurants do a great job of keeping their beach clean and beautiful and some do not.  Either way, you will find it\'s a great way to spend a day.

It\'s a place where you meet old and new friends (Americans and Mexicans). And, let\'s not forget the 3 S\'s ... 115267330.name: Zihuatanejo is just what the doctor ordered
115267330.author: a TripAdvisor user
115267330.reviewBody: Can\'t say enough good things about this town and the beautiful beach area of Playa La Ropa.  We felt that we found paradise.  A very happy and authentic and very safe town, beatiful beaches, fantastic condos and at prices that made us very content.  Can\'t wait to go back and spend a couple weeks next time.  Surely, one of Mexico\'s best kept secrets.

70092647.name: update on Playa La Ropa
70092647.author: a TripAdvisor user
70092647.reviewBody: I see the previous posts are all from awhile ago.  I live on Playa La Ropa. The beach is one of the cleanest.  The colony of La Ropa is planning to apply to have La Ropa certified as a "clean beach".  Just this last week the colony was successful at placing many trash cans along the beach. A "keep the beach clean" education program is also underway.  Restaurants clean their area every morning and litterally rake the sand. The water is clear- in 20 feet of water you can see your feet below you.\n\nJust thought I would post something current.

36025265.name: The dirty beach comments surprise me.
36025265.author: a TripAdvisor user
36025265.reviewBody: We have stayed in Ixtapa many times but last Feb we decided to stay in Zihua instead since we spend so much time there anyway.  The beach was extremely clean, the only trash was at the restaurants.  The beaches in Ixtapa are clean too, but not so much better that you should avoid La Ropa and stay in Ixtapa.  Perhaps it\'s a difference from the high season to the low season; maybe there is more attention paid to the beach during the high season.  I don\'t know, I\'m just surprised by the dirty beach comments.

34774548.name: La Ropa Beach is very dirty!
34774548.author: a TripAdvisor user

But we found a very dirty beach, full of garbage. Unless you want to stay at one of the 3 resorts I mentioned earlier or you want to have lunch at La Perla, it isn\'t a good idea to go to this beach, you better go to the beaches on Ixtapa Bay Hotel Area, which are pretty clean.

32233176.name: Playa La Ropa, Best Day Of Our Cruise
32233176.author: a TripAdvisor user
32233176.reviewBody: In January of \'08 we opted to spend our cruise stop at Playa La Ropa based on reviews and recommendations from Fodor\'s.\u00a0 So glad we did.\u00a0 We enjoyed our walk there from the pier, just took our time but it is hilly and some would want to take the bus or a taxi.\u00a0 Part of the walk was on the beach, the other was the pictoresque hillside so took lots of neat photos on the way.\u00a0 Once there we found a perfect table at La Perla where we had probably our best meal of the week.\u00a0 My husband had the seafood brochette and for me, crawfish.\u00a0 You get to order them by how many ounces you want.\u00a0 The meals came with rice, vegetables and a bit of salad.\u00a0 While we waited for our entrees, which took quite a while, they served us chips, guac and salsa.\u00a0 Drink service was fast, though and our waiter was pleasant.\u00a0\u00a0 After lunch we sat at La Perla\'s beach chairs with a super view.\u00a0\u00a0 We were not charged for this and there was never any mention, either verbally, or on the menu to use the chairs.\u00a0 I was pleasantly surprised at the bathrooms - nicely decorated\u00a0 and very clean.\u00a0 I think that the whole lunch, including five beers and tip was about $60 but considering we spent about 5 hours there, we felt it was worth it to get away from the hoards on the cruise ship, excursions, etc.\u00a0 We ended up taking a taxi back to the pier for $3.00.

8361579.name: Gorgeous bay, incredible beach
8361579.author: a TripAdvisor user
8361579.reviewBody: This beach is on one of the most beautiful bays in Mexico.... small in scale and giving good, protected swimming. I\'m not much into the beach and water sports, but for those who are, there\'s parasailing, water skiing, snorkeling, banana boats, catamarans, kayaks... and a whole kilometer of wide sandy beach lined with palm trees to just hang out on, soak up the sun and read. Early morning beach walks are great. My favorite restaurants: La Perla and Paty\'s Mar y Mar.\n

6898585.name: Best Beach, Few Crowds
6898585.author: a TripAdvisor user
6898585.reviewBody: In January my wife and I had one-day from a Carnival Cruise in Zihuat (as the locals call it) and instead of following the cruiseship crowd to Ixtapa we took our own tour. A local shop keeper suggested heading out to La Ropa beach which is about 15-20 minutes from town on the far side of the bay.  We found our way to the bus stop and for .50 cents rode out to the beach.  The end of the line for the bus is the beach so you can\'t get lost.  There we found excellent food, cold beverages, clean sand, parasailing, snorkel gear, jet skis and very few beach vendors.  The ones we did see walked away if you were not interested, no hassles!  The best part of the day was the 1-hour $15 massage (no hanky-panky) in a very clean room behind the eatery we found.  You can\'t miss the Massage Sign.  A visit to this beach is well worth your time and was a fabulous way to spend a day.\n

5068558.name: La Ropa Rip Off
5068558.author: a TripAdvisor user
5068558.reviewBody: Actually the previous postere is wrong on one aspect. Only One Caf\u00e9 (La Perla) charges for beach lounges & umbrellas/palapas. All others are no charge. They also have a minimum purchase requirement of 100 peso per person on top of the 30 peso per person Chair charge. I find this a real rip off for mediocre food, poor service & higher than average prices. Lots of other excellent places to hang out.\n

2609651.name: Good Swimming
2609651.author: a TripAdvisor user
2609651.reviewBody: Playa La Ropa is near Zihuatanejo. You can walk there, however it is quite a hike. There is bus service and taxi service from Zihuatanejo. The beach is sandy and clean. The water is protected and there aren\'t any strong undertows or currents to endanger swimmers. It is a great, safe place to bring children to play in the water. The beach offers many restaurants and places to lounge. Toward the south end of the beach is a restaurant El Manglar. There is a small outlet from a lagoon next to the restaurant where Zihuatanejo\'s "most-photographed" resident lives. The resident is a 10 foot crocodile. There is a sign which "warns" about crocodiles being present. The staff at El Manglar feed the crocodile during the day, and the event has become quite an attraction. The crocodile does not endanger the swimmers, you will understand what I mean when you visit the area. There are many other very nice restaurants along the beach. If you are inclined to spend the day on the beach, most restaurants will allow use of their chairs and palm-thatched "umbrellas" (or palapas). The restaurants will charge a small fee and expect you to order food and beverages from them during the day. You will find the meal prices reasonable, the prices of the drinks are comparable to prices you would pay at a restaurant in the US. There are also several hotels along the beach. Masseuses have small canopies erected at several places on the beach, and you can have a wonderful hour-long massage for about $15-$20 US. Vendors are not plentiful on this beach, however there are some available. The vendors sell everything from little kites to woven blankets. They are polite and are not intrusive - if you are not interested in what they may be selling, simply say "no, gracias", and they will not bother you. They are polite and attentive.  The view of the bay is wonderful. I recommend this beach.\n
